Reviews.Title: “Not too big, not too small”
Reviews.Author: TACustomer
Reviews.Content: Privately-owned by the Sultan of Brunei, this hotel just off Orchard Road is not one of the big impersonal giants, but is big enough to have a range of facilities. The Executive Club is pleasant and staffed by very friendly people. the situation is excellent for shopping and access to the MRT system is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Ian D
Reviews.Content: Long time since I have visited Singapore so chose this hotel from the internet. Great choice. Location great. Close to MTR rail. Orchard Road at your doorstep. Non smoking hotel, (Great) Staff from porters to reception, to wait staff very warm and friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Anita in Conceirge who never stopped smiling and could not do enough to help. We were on the 5th floor and while we looked out onto a car park this did not worry us as we went to Singapore to get out and look aroun d not to stay in a hotel room. The mini bar was a nice touch as was the free wi fi. Would I stay again and I always feel this is the true test? You bet I would. It has a nice feel. Felt the food was a little expensive but you don't have to eat there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimmy009
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had a 'Ladies holiday' and paid for the club level in our package. This allowed us snacks and drinks each night, which made our holiday very special. The service, atmosphere and standard of the hotel was high. On the final day, my mother fell over and hurt her knee...the people were so helpful and caring it was very heartwarming. We will be staying there again. Fabulous venue as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location w nice pool n gym”
Reviews.Author: Nycazn
Reviews.Content: The room is nice n clean. The hotel is on scotts rd close to all mtr n shopping malls. Great food around.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for quick stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: braapz
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying at his hotel for a quick Singapore eat, shop and go fix. I can shop on Orchard Rd which is just around the corner and enjoy the restaurants and bars at the neighbouring (and sister hotel) Grand Hyatt. The rate is almost half the Grand Hyatt too! The Royal Plaza provides everything one needs from a room when prepaid in full. 1. Free wifi / cable - check 2. Free minibar - 2 beers, soft drinks, oreos, juice and water - check 3. Free nespresso coffee machine - check 4 Rainshower with good wate pressure - check 5. Large work station / writing desk I never eat at the hotel and opt for a prepaid rate so I can check out quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Once again a Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wendy F
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Royal Plaza On Scotts now for the 4th time and I will say it is a great place to stay when in Singapore. We stayed in a Deluxe club suite 1526 on the same floor as the club room here breakfast, afternoon tea and supper and cocktails are served every day. This is well worth the extra money. All the staff in the Club are fantastic and very helpful and friendly. Eve was great and always so interested in my daily purchases of shoes and handbags, not that I got too many. The singapore slings in the afternoon are a great starter for a big night and coffee is served in the club up to 11pm. The rooms are very comfortable and toiletries great quality. Check in and check out was quick and easy in the club not downstairs with the crowds. All the facilities at the hotel and 1st class and quality. Free mini bar replenished daily is also a bonus. Close to Orchard rd and all the main shops, bus-stop at the doors step and SMRT 5 min walk and taxis at the door. Will be staying here again next year....

Reviews.Title: “One of the cheapest 5 star hotels near Orchard & Scotts road”
Reviews.Author: Varad_G
Reviews.Content: Best value for money at this location which has some of the big brand hotels in Singapore. The property is right in the middle of the shopping paradise of Singapore - Orchard road & Scotts road. The rooms are quite comfy & spacious and the mini bar comes with the price of the room. The restaurant & bar serves really good food & wine but is certainly expensive. Orchard road & Scotts road are also nice places to hang around and spend time with friends. Overall, it's a nice place to stay if you are looking for shopping destinations within walking distance and if you have deep pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for this first time visitor”
Reviews.Author: jacnmok
Reviews.Content: Room Great. Loved th coffee machine and th buffet breakfast. The pool was just average. Location is perfect for shopping etc. For cheaper prices and great food go to Chinatown or Far East Plaza. "the queue is the clue "

Reviews.Title: “Loveliest anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: Azranan
Reviews.Content: In my travels, this is the first hotel that offered me a real upgrade to its Club Deluxe Room. Earlier I had indicated that we would be celebrating both my husband's birthday and anniversary at the same time, and we were surprised with a lovely (and the most delicious) orange cake in our room. I cannot stop singing praises about this hotel... everything was lovely, from the service to the staff, to the ambience and the rooms, and the cleanliness and the surroundings, everything was really 5 star. I had such a good experience that I am now using L'occitane shower products at home to remind me of the good time I had at the hotel. Although it is a really luxurious and pricey for my husband and me, we would definitely be saving up again to have another rendezvous at this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: alicia18
Reviews.Content: Good hotel that is in a central location - rooms are fine but bathroom was tight. Staff helpful and friendly would recommend this hotel . The pool is great and breakfast is varied and of a high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Plaza - nice room and easy location”
Reviews.Author: Crafty_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Royal Plaza on Scotts is in the heart of the high end shopping and close to the light rail. It's also a short taxi ride to the Botanical Gardens which are spectacular. We booked a Club Deluxe room which is on a floor with it's own private lounge. The afternoon drinks and appetizers were included in the price and were fantastic. We really didn't need dinner. Breakfas was included as well and was great. Service was over the top - superb!

Reviews.Title: “A Business Hotel in a Busy Shopping Area”
Reviews.Author: Vat S
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel. The standard room is comfortable but not much on luxury or style. The rooms are likely set up for a minimalist traveler. I found the hairdryer in the writing desk drawer. With the very short cord and having to come out of the bathroom with wet hair to dry my hair just made it quite an inconvenience. Nice perks on the free internet and the mini bar—which is not restocked. The hotel staffs are efficient but inflexible. They vetoed my request for a late check out (even for just a couple hours) but they politely offered an un-air conditioned sauna/change room on the 5th floor for showering which I accepted. I was dripping with sweat again after the shower inside the 90F+ room. I appreciate the gesture but think I’ll pass on it next time. There are lots of shopping malls around the hotel if you like that sort of thing and a plethora of breakfast or other meal time options in the vicinity, so no need to feel like you are limited to the restaurants on the premises. I got the best exchange rate tip on a recommendation from a local, the Lucky Plaza, a sort of bargain basement venue. You’ll get a better than posted currency exchange rate if you bargain with the shop sellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel with top class service”
Reviews.Author: Blackjacknz
Reviews.Content: Only had four nights at the Royal Plaza but was very impressed. Stayed at the recommendation of a friend who always stays here...and very happy with our decision. Rooms are modern and very clean. Mini bar was restocked each day..there are only a few items in the fridge...but handy to take when you go out for the day. The nespresso machine was brilliant...saved me going to Starbucks which is right outside each morning. The staff are very helpful and seem to go out of their way to make the stay special. Orchard road was very busy as we stayed Fri - Tuesday...but with the MRT about a 5 minute walk we could travel all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ng_reggie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully located! It is so close to the Orchard shopping area and yet far enough to be away from the busy-ness and noise of it! Of course, the wonderful thing about this area is the connectivity - you can either underground or take the overhead bridge to get to the shopping complex that you want to. The rooms in the hotel is a bit small. I guess it ok for the business traveller - which I am. Everything in the room is in order - the drinks and snacks in the mini bar are free! So eat and drink all you want and of course there is a great coffee making machine there as well! Service is great and the food at the coffeehouse is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great showers and inroom coffee machines!”
Reviews.Author: mytimenow
Reviews.Content: Recent weekend trip to Singapore and we were lucky enough to be booked into the Royal Plaza on Scotts. Great location - could not get any closer to the shopping if you tried!! Our room was very quiet even though it was the first one closest to the lifts which is always a no no for me....but very quiet we never heard any other guests at all and no street noise. Room was very comfortable - Nespresso machine, free mini bar, robes, great rainwater shower head, good pillows and comfortable beds. What more can you want? We did not eat at the hotel but the buffet lunch and dinner looked very nice and fresh with heaps of seafood and yummy desserts! Would definitely stay here again if we wanted to be right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: elsielin1009
Reviews.Content: The buffet on the ground floor actually was a good idea to have lunch. Great services, would like to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great and excellent”
Reviews.Author: JulesTokiran
Reviews.Content: Great and excellent hotel! Our trip to Singapore June 2011 was started with one hour queue to check-in in the hotel. But, that 'bad' experience was compensated with the room upgrade and late check out. We were so thrilled with the bedroom conditions and facilities. It was a great stay. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is great, Mc Donalds is just at the next door, walking distance to shopping malls and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Back 'home'...”
Reviews.Author: SandManBrunei
Reviews.Content: Royal Plaza on Scotts (RP for short) has always been like second home to me. I have always tried to stay there every time I am in Singapore. Be it for business or leisure, there is no place like RP. Check in was as usual very quick. Though there were quite a few patrons checking in, but being a member of RP's loyalty programme (Royal Touch) has it's advantages. I had a separate check in lane all to myself. Opted for the Twin Deluxe Room for the 1st night (cousin on transit from Taiwan) and Double Deluxe on the 2nd (wife joining me from Brunei). The interest thing was when I changed room, RP was able to 'absent transfer' me from the previous to the latter. All I needed to do was pack my bags and RP did the room transfer for me. All I know was I had a whole new room when I came back from picking up the wife from Changi Airport. Breakfast (waffles to be precise) is always delicious. No wonder RP's Carousel won numerous back to back awards recently. Another thing I love are the hotel greeters. Uncle Syed has been there for several decades and he always treats everyone like his long lost family member every time they return to RP. From room reservations (Thanks Julia) to check out, RP has always impressed me with their high level of standards and comfort. I will be back soon not just for the shopping but also to be back "home" amongst friends in Singapore. Well done RP!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: 17Dec1903
Reviews.Content: Royal Plaza is conveniently located to Orchard Rd. I stayed there on business in a "Club Level" room, but the room itself was a bit sparse and outdated. One thing I liked was the free minibar -- even though the selection was limited, having a bottle of water and cookies (Oreos) waiting for me when I got back to the hotel in the evening was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Plaza”
Reviews.Author: PerthShane57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a business trip in March 2012. Very well located hotel, next to Orchard Road MRT and lots of good shopping. We were in the Club section on the 15th floor which allowed you to take advantage of complimentary drinks and canapes every evening. You could also have breakfast up there, so was a little less chaotic than downstairs. Staff were very friendly and professional. If you wanted to criticise anything, the rooms are a little small. Hard to find a spot for 2 suitcases. Pillows from the Pillow Menu had a strange musty odour to them. Hotel perhaps a little tired but all in all worth staying at. Good gym and pool too.

Reviews.Title: “great central location”
Reviews.Author: mariondp
Reviews.Content: hotel is very close to orchard road and mrt station. hotel is very clean and rooms are spacious. the staff are friendly. the hotel has free wifi in rooms and free mini bar which contains water coca cola and beer. the buffet breakfast is very comprehensive but if not included in your room rate costs 33 sin dollars. The outdoor swimming pool is not large and is overlooked by the gym on one side There is no attendant on duty and no towels provided. Ensure you leave plenty of time for your bags to be collected from your room as when we called there was no one on duty in early evening. for 9 sin dollars per person there is ground transport from the singapore hotels to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit overvalued.”
Reviews.Author: SydneySamantha
Reviews.Content: As a five stars hotel, Royal Plaza is clean with friendly service. The room is clean and in good size. The drinks in the fridge are free. The coffee machine is very considerated, but the milk provided by the hotel is below average. Suggest buying your own milk if you are a coffee lover. The swimming pool is a little bit disappointed. It is small and strangely design, the water is rather dep, at least 2.5 meter on one side. The outdoor pool is very small. The buffet restaurant at the ground floor must be very good, since there is a long queue everyday. The hotel is about 700 meter to the Orchard MRT. But the Orchard MRT is like a maze, we almost got lost at the underground pass. And if you are thinking about going carry your laugggages to the MRT, FORGET ABOUT IT! You need ot carry your luggages and climb many steps.

Reviews.Title: “Another stay, another terrific experience”
Reviews.Author: Trup
Reviews.Content: I just returned to the US from Singapore; once again the staff at the Royal Plaza met and exceeded my expectations (and I admit that I have high expectations of any hotel where I stay for more than 2-3 nights). They live up to their motto of "what else can we do for you?" Whether we speak of the staff at the reception desk, the concierge desk, the guys at the front door who welcome guests back -- usually by name -- the housekeeping staff and certainly those who staff the Royal Club on the top floor, there is no question but that they fully "get" the importance of service. Yes, the location is excellent, the beds are comfortable, the room rates are reasonable, yada, yada, yada, but it is the staff that makes staying at the Royal Plaza an absolute pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: wassenas
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just that - fine, but not great. Location is v good if you are into shopping. Hotel itself could be anywhere - not much is distinctive. Like the free minibar. 10 min walk to the subway not recommended if you have luggage

Reviews.Title: “The best location at an affordable price!”
Reviews.Author: HannTi_Tan
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore with the wife and in-laws just last weekend for a family event, from March 9-12. For this 4D3N stay, we went for our first choice since a long time ago, i.e. the Royal Plaza on Scotts. We left KL rather late (lunchtime) and only reached Singapore at 1700 hrs. After leaving the luggage with the bellboy and parking the car in the adjacent garage, we did our check-in at the reception. Unfortunately, the two rooms we booked were not ready at the time and the male receptionist recommended us to proceed to one of the nearby cafes for a drink while waiting. He also told me that he would send a text once the rooms were ready. Eventually, after sitting down for a cuppa at McCafe, just next door, we headed for our two rooms at 1750 hrs, both of which were adjacent to each other on a rather low Level 4 (no connecting door though). The room my wife and I stayed in (no. 404) was quite nicely done up, with a queen-sized bed as well as LCD TV stuck on the wall. Next to the window + single-seater sofa was an elongated table, which can double up as both a workstation as well as dressing table. There was also a cupboard (not built-in, btw) where the hangers as well as iron, kettle + tea, and safe box were kept. The toilet was spacious enough but unlike the bigger Premier and Club Rooms, there was no attached bathtub and only a shower was provided (with a combo rain + hand shower). Also, we should not forget the hotel's famous minibar, where everything is free (hotel-branded mineral water, one packet of Oreo biscuits, two cans each of Coca-Cola and Tiger beer, and a Minute Maid orange juice) and refilled daily! No other hotel offers such a convenient feature, whether it is a budget or 5-star type, throughout my various holidays in Malaysia, Singapore, and overseas. And as expected the view is a disappointment, since we were only on Level 4 of a 15-floor building, and faced the rear of the Pacific Plaza next door. Interestingly, the RP's room was the first one which has no coffee packets bundled together with the kettle. Instead, this was made available by a Nespresso machine, which was the first time I've seen in a room. I had to ensure there is sufficient water and after placing a capsule (three variants are available, including espresso), I just needed to press a button and voila, the coffee is churned out automatically! Such a convenient feature, which renders boiling of hot water for making coffee no longer necessary but to make tea (there is Japanese green tea and the usual English one), we still have to boil water in the kettle, like usual. Unlike my previous stay in another hotel in Singapore last November, the RP is very generous with its Internet access. There is no charge to access the Web in our room and I could either use WiFi or connect a broadband cable to the notebook. What makes things better is when I went for a swim and took the iPod touch along, there was also some Internet connection at the poolside, which is such a great convenience to check Twitter or online news, on-the-go! Speaking of the pool, since it's located on Level 5 and atop the podium block housing the DFS store, it was a small-looking square type and adjacent to a 24-hour gym and the Balmoral meeting room. However, once in the water, the pool is actually bigger than expected and doing a 30-lap swim can take around 15-20 minutes, which is quite sufficient for a morning workout. We have also heard loads of good reviews about the buffet offered at the RP's Carousel Restaurant and there were four sessions daily (Breakfast, Lunch, Hi-Tea, Dinner). Unfortunately, we were not able to sample the offerings there due to lack of time and furthermore, our rooms do not come with breakfast (we went for the promo price for Malaysian travelers). This is something for me to seriously look at, during a future return trip to Singapore! However, what made us go for the RP is its excellent location and super-affordable price, a combo not found anywhere in Singapore! For a price of SGD168 net per night, we are able to stay right in the middle of the Orchard Road shopping precinct and to get anywhere else, there is also the MRT at the RP's doorstep, although we drove down to SG from Malaysia. In addition to the popular nearby malls like ION Orchard, Ngee Ann City, Tangs Plaza, and Paragon, the famous Isetan was just next door and the store was having a sale period during our stay, what perfect timing! As for food, in addition to the cafes next door (Starbucks, McD's + McCafe), there was a myriad of sit-down options as well, including the Food Opera in ION Orchard as well as Wisma Atria's Food Republic and various restaurants in Ngee Ann. In conclusion, the RP is indeed one of the better hotels in town and with a very affordable price, coupled with a superb location in Orchard precinct, we will surely be making it our preferred accommodation option for any trip to Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place...”
Reviews.Author: yuszry
Reviews.Content: Been staying here since I was a small boy and that was about 18 years ago and it never disappoint me. The bellman, Mr Syed have always been there to give me a smile and now he have given my daughter the same smiles too! Room is cosy, great bathroom and powerful shower head. The buffet breakfast is the best that I've had in Singapore and to my Muslim friends, this hotel is 100 percent Halal. Location is perfect and you can get Mcdonald and Starbucks fixes in less than 1 min away (and it is 24 hours too!). Across the pedestrian bridge, you can get a nice, cheap home cooked meal at Far East Plaza @ Level 4 Food court (they served complete meal for less than SGD 5.00!). You want to indulges shopping, there's a Duty Free Shoppebeside the hotel, and Orchard Rd is like 3 min walking away where u can go to Ion, Isetan, Tangs, Takashimaya and many2 more! Staff are3 friendly, concierge are helpful and taxis are abundant! What else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jc w
Reviews.Content: As part of our honeymoon we stayed here , in one of the "window bathroom" that I heard of from previous reviews howerver there is a blind that you can shut so no real problem there. The room we had was small for what I am use to having in Singapore. Especially as you see the lobby you expect a little more. In the room we had a bottle of champagne (from a relative that ordered it for us before we arrived ,as we got to the room at the time we indicated we would check in In our room the ice bucked had turned to water so champagne was room temp). We had really noisy people next door (door bell ringing at 2 am etc doors slamming) as our room had a connecting door with theres it was not very romantic.... The breakfast buffet makes up for the small room , they even have really good coffee! The club lounge is per say better than the norm, the canapés are more refined , and they have a wider selection of champagnes than most club rooms I have been to. The bar is also very good (you wait a long time for food so get there early) the drinks are nice and refreshing and in the corner of the bar, a little smokers balcony. (as this being a non smoking hotel the balcony is great for those of us that do not wish to stand next to Starbucks to smoke). The big disappointment was at checking out I waited for about 15 minutes to sort out payment ,the receptionist said all was payed and have a safe trip home. HOWEVER I received an email 3 days later saying as I didn't check out at reception (when I did) they have had to charge my card for a certain amount that was higher than what was originally quoted. They charged my card before my acceptance (not very professional ) . I feel kinda cheated as this was part of our honeymoon , and we only get married once. I can't recommend this hotel ,and am disapointed that I do not wish to stay there again, as the location is just fab.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Christopher D
Reviews.Content: While a little pricey, the hotel was well worth it. The restaurant was fantastic including the free breakfast (although, it is very expensive otherwise). Very close to great shopping and easy access to tours, etc. Room was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the centre of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Azmi-Travel
Reviews.Content: Well situated in the main street of Singapore (Orchard Road). Good size rooms and very clean. for Nespresso lovers, the hotel provides a machine and 6 free refills per day. There is a free refill for the minibar (water/softdrinks/Oreo) on daily basis. The breakfast is very good. Being on Orchard road, there are many shopping places around, and one large metro station is few meters away from the hotel. That metro station comprises a large number of shops / restaurants that are open till 10pm or later. on the 15th floor, the hotel has a club that serves snacks/drinks. Ensure you get those freely with your subscription as you may end paying about SGD60 per day to get such access. This was not available on my booking via booking.com In general, the stay was very good and the hotel is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: hobbyturisten
Reviews.Content: Stayed my second visit at this hotel earlier this year and again came home completely satisfied. The rooms are good with comfortable beds, good bathrooms and of course they are very clean. There is also a coffee machine in room and a mini bar with non-alcoholic beverages that is refilled each day. Wifi is free. All the staff I have interacted with, reception or club or doormen, have been very helpful. The location is also very good as it is close to Orchard MRT station and the shopping malls on Orchard Road are within walking distance. In short I will recommend Royal Plaza on Scotts to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelwarri0r
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off Orchard Road so it's in close proximity to the shops. There is a bus stop right outside if you need to take public transport. The hotel itself is excellent. We were given a free upgrade upon arrival. The staff were always happy to help in any requests we had. Free internet and business services is always a very useful added bonus. Overall I was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: tweetypie888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights last week. We were upgraded to an executive suite. The room was huge, clean and had a very comfortable bed. Free mini bar, nespresso machine and wifi as stated in all the other reviews. We also had access to the club lounge and had afternoon tea there a few times. My daughter enjoyed the sandwiches. Good selection was available for breakfast at the Carousel. The location of the hotel is great...very convenient and close to the mrt. What I really want to highlight is the excellent service provided by all the staff there. My daughter fell and bumped her head on the coffee table and needed to go to hospital for stitches. The lady at reception (sorry cannot remember her name) quickly got us a taxi and directed us to the nearest hospital. When we got back she came and checked to see if our daughter was ok and helped to move the table to the side to avoid a repeat fall. Housekeeping (our new friend Poh Ling) put rubber guards on the coffee table and low lying furniture as well. Such a thoughtful gesture which we really appreciated. We will definitely return to this hotel and would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisj28
Reviews.Content: Receptionist on checking in was impressive. He was efficient n welcoming. Room was as expected of a good hotel in Singapore. Bonus was the coffee machine in the room. Clean room and very comfy bed. Only minus was that my room faced out to a multistory parking lot! I needed to get late checkout but although the guy attending the counter was polite n professional, his attitude was just that n nothing more. Oh, the free wireless Internet in the room was sporadic. Very irritating if you were halfway on a task n it dropped off.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcrewebrown
Reviews.Content: The royal plaza is centrally located so nothing is very far. We were upgraded to a suite on the 5th floor which was very spacious. The staff are pleasant , rooms are clean & comfortable. It is great that the wi fi and mini bar is all inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “Lotta buck, not much bang”
Reviews.Author: justsayhey55
Reviews.Content: The first room we got was on the 4th floor and close to the street. Very dark and extremely noisy. Could not sleep past 5 a.m. Hotel nicely changed our room to 5th floor in back. Much quieter. Unfortunately, there was a small child crying that kept us up one night. It happens. What was remarkable was this child was in a room 5 doors down and across the hall. We know this because we ran into the apologetic parents. Rooms are clean, but hey, this is singapore. breakfast is NOT included as with most Asian hotels. This will cost S$34 each for buffet. Internet is "free" but this is a misnomer. If you have a computer that can plug into an Ethernet cable you'll probably be okay. However, if you have a tablet, such as an iPad, or smart phone, beware. The bars on the device are actually a decoy and do not reflect are actually getting service. And bonus, service changes in different parts do the room. You may show 2-3 bars and your device will say unable to connect. This happened repeatedly. Lighting in the bathroom is terrible. Putting make up on in there can be scary business unless a clown is what you're going for. Use the mirrors in the room. Most of the photos show the rooms at considerably higher prices. A lot seems to be made of the entrance. I did enjoy the beautiful stairway, half of which goes to nowhere. Kinda funny. The upper rooms im sure are much better and the photos that are shown mostly reflect these rooms. Lower rooms feel more like steerage. We paid $268/ night. That really shouldn't feel like steerage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravellers264
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Plaza on Scotts for two nights at the end of our holiday - it was our first trip to Singapore. It is not far from the airport (perhaps 20 mins at most) and is very close to the Orchard Road shopping strip. The room we had, whilst smallish was well appointed, clean and very well attended to. The bed and pillows were super comfy! For a small boutique hotel, it is very impressive when you first walk in, reception staff are immaculately groomed and very friendly. The free wifi was a bonus and was working most of the time. We booked our room on Wotif and overall found it very good value for money. It was only $7 in a cab to get to Mount Faber to catch the cable car across to Sentosa Island, which we thought was very cheap. We didn't eat at the hotel at all as the meals seemed pricey, but then again, everything is in Singapore! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In the centre of things”
Reviews.Author: neese01
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are keen on shopping. I found the room rather dark, no view from window and a bit dusty, but the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was nice with a window looking info the main part of the room. I got free internet and included drinks in the mini-bar (I think this deal is pretty standard). Not sure if I would stay again, unless it was a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location. Splurge on the Club Lounge.”
Reviews.Author: Justine28
Reviews.Content: Myself and husband stayed in Royal Plaza on Scotts back in July for 5 nights and were really happy with our choice of accommodation. Decided to splurge on a club room and again it was a good decision, saved us a lot of time and money. Guests staying on the club floors have access to lounge with breakfast, snacks and drinks (including alcohol beverages) included in the rate. The afternoon snacks and drinks are served between 5 and 7pm and turned out to be really impressive and delicious, a lot of them gourmet-style, with veggie options, desserts and a new set of dishes every day - we were really impressed, probably the best “club” deal we’ve ever tried in a hotel. Initially we thought we wouldn’t visit the lounge too often as at 5-7pm we would be normally still out sightseeing, however with the heat/ weather conditions in Singapore, the timings were actually perfect for a bit of rest & snack/light dinner. We love eating out in the evenings when on holiday, but we enjoyed the club food so much that we didn’t need big dinners afterwards - saved us a fortune! All in all would highly recommend the club level when booking. The room we had may look a bit plain and small on photos, but it’s actually very comfortable and has all you need, the pics simply don’t do it justice. The free water & drinks in the mini-bar and free internet in the room also adds a lot of value for the travellers. The location of the hotel is great and would recommend to stay in the area if this is your first time in Singapore and don’t know where to stay. It is in the middle of the shopping district, but it’s great for sightseeing too as metro/subway is just round the corner (2 mins) and will take you everywhere in the city and to the outskirts. We only took taxi to get to the Zoo to save the time -it cost us approx. 20S$ and used the bus to get to the Botanic Gardens (few bus stops from the hotel), other than that it was the subway all the way, very quick and convenient. The staff at the hotel are very professional yet friendly and helpful, a real asset to the hotel! They even got us a little gift (cute lollipops) when they heard it’s our honeymoon. Also the buffet breakfast served at the hotel was really nice with great options and loads of space for everybody (they even have a separate Indian food counter!). I would recommend the downstairs restaurant over the club lounge for breakfast actually, as the choice in the club was limited, especially for vegetarians. The staff got me some veggie food from downstairs in no time which was fantastic and again a superb service, but after that we just preferred to eat downstairs. So my only suggestion to the hotel management would be provide more options, including veggie ones, to the club lounge breakfast menu. All in all we had a fantastic stay in Royal Plaza on Scotts, wouldn’t hesitate for a minute to book them again when in the amazing Singapore! A big thank you to our room attendant and staff in the club lounge for the amazing service we were given!

Reviews.Title: “Royal plaza at Scotts (by Ion/Orchard), Singapore is a stylish hotel, with spacious, modernized plush room and many amenities an”
Reviews.Author: Peterskis
Reviews.Content: Royal plaza at Scotts (by Ion/Orchard), Singapore - A stylish hotel with impressive, large lobby; free business center, a large pool with a small café nearby, and a fitness center; very friendly and helpful staff. Most importantly, it is conveniently located in the famous Ion-Orchard district; only a couple of minutes walk to high-end malls, restsurants, bars, and the MRT station. My wife and I spent 2 nights in this 4-star hotel and found it a delightful place to stay.  We booked it via hotwire for US$178 (plus tax) a night for a very nice room.  It was CHEAPER than most others in the same class this time.  Our room comes with free mini bar, free in-room internet (wired/wireless); free Nespresso machine; a shower with handheld and sky shower heads. Our room has no view, however.  One drawback for the handicapped: hotel front entrance is NOT handicapped friendly, although it does have an electric operated lift chair; but no ramp, only stairs! Inside the hotel, however, it has no problem for wheelchairs to get around.  Peterskis, Feb 2012

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy and convenient Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bakasyonista
Reviews.Content: We love the free internet, free minibar, and that it is near the MRT love our stay with royal plaza on scotts hotel. check in and check out is fast. requested for a late check out and was granted the request, no hassle. all staff are friendly and accommodating. Lobby and corridors has a slight smell but it is manageable, not really bad at all. clean rooms, average size, rain shower in the bathroom, cold and hot water works well; just great. mattress is comfortable, soft pillows provided in the room but may request for firm pillows at no extra cost. complete toiletries,and minibar, even have a nespresso machine. minibar refilled everyday. given oreos, 2 tiger beer, 1 coke light, 1 coke regular, 1 minute maid and 2 bottles of water. we used up everything. quiet and peaceful place, aircon can be adjusted to your comfort. various selection of english channel. breakfast is also great, lots of food selection. just a few minutes walk from the orchard station. even if it is raining shade provided by nearby buildings to the underpass going to mrt or back to hotel. near shopping malls too. Mc Donalds, and Starbucks just a few steps away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: Steve h
Reviews.Content: I checked in early, initially just to drop off my bags so that I could go and explore the shops. The service staff were excellent to deal with and very friendly. To my surprise the room was mad eavilible to me and my bags arrived in the room about a minute after I did. The staff were great showing me the features of the room including the great espresso coffee machine, the tv and reminding me about the free items in the fridge which included 2 tiger beers, some Oreos, a coke, a coke light, water and some orange juice. I stayed for 3 nights and am very impressed with the hotel, vey comfortable huge king size bed, kept very clean by the staff and so close to the shops and orchard road itself. I will certainly stay the again

Reviews.Title: “Free wi fi”
Reviews.Author: hyura
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, IF you are: -come to singapore for business (because the room is very small, i stayed at club lounge room and pay around sgd 400++, but i Got the standard room at other hotel in orchard. So it doest matter if you spend almost of your Time outside the hotel) -addicted to Wi fi ( its free all the time) -love shopping ( this hotel located at the centre of duty free shop and isetan shopping mal, the opposite is scotts square, and of course near ION, TangS, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay, and Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: misfitman
Reviews.Content: Nice room, helpful and friendly staff,great location, easy access to the MRT half a block away.Great hotel bar and nice dessert shop in the lobby. We did not try the restaurant as it looked like it was a buffet.Liked the free beer and water and the bed was confortable but a little hard . Would stay here again but not overly memorable. If you are a shopper this location will more than meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: “2nd chance... And the experience was magical!”
Reviews.Author: Cryscrys82
Reviews.Content: Previously I uploaded a review stating the drop in standards of the hotel staff at Royal Plaza Scotts. The customer relations manager Rocel personally contacted me and sincerely apologised for the incidents. That was superb service and she has certainly went out of the way to rectify the situation. Hence, this month being our anniversary, Hubby and I decided to give the hotel another chance. And indeed, we saw excellent hotel service standard! We reached the hotel around 12 plus and wanted to register for check in. We knew it was too early for check in, so we only wanted to get the payment procedure settled. Upon knowing we had booked the club room, we were swiftly shown to the club lounge on the highest floor and check in was done there. The hotel staff even wished us happy anniversary! Then, we were told our room was ready. That was at 1pm. Efficient and thoughtful of the staff! We settled down in our nicely-made room With 2 beautiful swans made of towels laid on the bed, and were surprised to find a hand-written card by Rocel herself. On the desk, there were also lollipops with our names on it and even a cd collection of love songs. So sweet of them! Afterwhich, we proceed to the club lounge for afternoon tea (perks for club room). Then we knew of the dress code of the club lounge. Hubby in his beach wear was not appropriately dress for the lounge. The hotel staff gladly told us that they will send the afternoon tea to our room instead. Isn't that nice of them! At least we can enjoy the pastries and tea in the comfort of our room. :) This is just day 1 of our weekend staycation, but I have to say, it has been magical for us! Thank you for the effort! Really appreciate the little details! :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel positioned in the heart of the action!”
Reviews.Author: Hung_La
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, staff were extremely helpful and perfectly located for those wanting to experience everything Singapore has to offer in shopping and food. Located right near Orchard MRT and some of the best shopping malls in town i.e. ION Orchard and Wisma Atria, which both happen to have fantastic food halls!!! Must try Ding Tai Fung dumpling house in Wisma Atria. Nice pool with adequate gym, and free mini bar, although it was quite limited.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - but pricey”
Reviews.Author: fivelaws
Reviews.Content: Top-notch hotel in a buzzing district of Singapore, near to Orchard Road. The room was really nice with the only grumble being that I had a view of another building rather than of the city scape. The outdoor swimming pool was brilliant. The adjacent gym was well equipped, but not air conditioned, so caution required when exercising in 90% humidity. I didn't eat in any of the restaurants so can't comment. There are plenty of VERY cheap local places to eat with authentic local food. For the less adventurous - there is also a branch of the well-known Scottish "restaurant" literally out front. It is also only a short walk to the metro/subway system and city buses stop outside. Internet access was included and high speed. No complaints on that score. The bathroom was ultra-modern with an excellent 'rainfall' shower as well as a deep bath for added luxury. Towels were extra-large and fluffy. A bathrobe was also provided. It wasn't my money, so no complaints, but this isn't a cheap place to stay. I would definitely stay again (if somebody else paid!).

Reviews.Title: “Everything is immaculate and just works”
Reviews.Author: Beebs11
Reviews.Content: Another excellent stay at RP on Scotts, where everything just works very effectively and the hotel offers genuinely good value for money, most of the time. Complimentary mini bar and internet access is good, though wifi signal around the hotel can be poor at times. Great location for business travellers and holiday travellers alike. There are better standard 4 and 5 star hotels in Singapore but at the rate RP normally charge there are few that are better. Highlights include, great buffet restaurant and lounge bar and the close proximity to shops and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Asia-Pacific's Best Independent Hotel 4 years in a row! I now know why.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts the week of Chinese New Year. On this occasion, I was traveling for work. Having stayed at this hotel a few years ago, I was impressed with the changes made. Firstly, I have to say that all the staff I encountered were very helpful and friendly. The concierge/porters were very efficient and promptly took my luggage out of the taxi's boot upon arrival. Upon check-in, I was informed that I was upgraded, which was a pleasant surprise! The rooms have been refurbished since my last stay. My room was comfortable and clean. The neutral tones used to furnish the room were very soothing and the work space and lighting were excellent! I also loved that the hotel gives you a choice of pillows! The free WiFi was a huge benefit for me as I needed to connect and email during my stay. Many of the Singapore hotels still charge a (sometimes hefty) fee for an internet connection. The hotel also offers free local calls. The free minibar was also a plus and the Nespresso machine was a great bonus when I needed an afternoon caffeine hit! The hotel is conveniently located on Scotts Road (as the name indicates), which is about 100 metres from the Orchard Road intersection. It is a short walk to Wheelock Place, ION Orchard, Isetan and Tang's department store. There is a 24 hours Starbucks and McDonalds located just outside the hotel and if you enjoy eating at local food courts, there are lots nearby. This hotel is the 1st 100% non-smoking hotel in Singapore, which I think is fabulous! With all the points mentioned above, it's no wonder this hotel has been awarded "Asia-Pacific's Best Independent Hotel" 4 years in a row! Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for The Offer”
Reviews.Author: Ramirame
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a very good value for SGD 199 and free internet access and minibar. The room is pretty spacious equipped with many unique amenities like coffee machines, ironing table, large wardrobe, and great selection of toiletries. Specially love the coffee machine and the roof shower. The location is just as superb. The only complaint is the slow staff response during the check in and check out, the receptionist area definitely needs more staffing. Overall, it is worth coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Plaza on Scotts”
Reviews.Author: Hornbill007
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the shopper type of tourist, hotel right where the action is, at the junction of Scotts Road and Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Arabpiter
Reviews.Content: During our stay in Royal Plaza in December, 3 nights we had wonderful time. This very modern hotel is located in city centre on Orchand Road next to ION shopping centre and subway station. This is perfect location for shopping and for sightseeing as well. If you are planning to do bus tour, there are plenty bus stops next to ION. Our room came with complimentary internet access and mini-bar that is replenished every day. Also we had an espresso machine to make the coffee. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Closed To Action”
Reviews.Author: AugustChan
Reviews.Content: My favourite hotel on Orhard. Closed to shopping & dining. Starbuck & McDonald just around the corner. Room come with complimentary mini bar & free WIFI, a great combination.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay, never again”
Reviews.Author: jenjenrossco
Reviews.Content: Travel agent recommended Royal Plaza, but from the moment I walked into the lounge. I knew it was a mistake. Hostess was wearing badly stained uniform, furniture was shabby and carpet frayed. IT was afternoon tea time, and I was so surprised to see them unpacking cakes and pastries from catering boxes. The following morning I observed more unpacking in the restaurant downstairs where the quality of the breakfast was poor. The air con in the room does not absorb the moisture, so we had wet uncomfortable nights. Quality of cakes was really poor and coffee awful, so we brought in take away from a bakery outside. Hotel advised that we were not permitted to take outside food into the business lounge, so we stopped using the facility. Tea provided by hotel was cheapest tea bags possible, really awful. We became defacto guests at the Marriott across the road, and seriously considered changing hotel. The door boys were not particularly friendly, and they do not manage the cab rank very well, infect delays can be unreasonably long, so we started ordering our own limo to ensure we were at work on time. The room was small, and overlooked another building, and there was just one good feature about the hotel. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. You get what you pay for in Singapore, so it is important to weigh up one's priorities before choosing a hotel, but we travel a lot, and the sort of people who seem to enthuse about this hotel are not people we would sit next to in business class.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hely51
Reviews.Content: In December 2011 we stayed this hotel during New Years Eve 2011 and the News Years Day. We stayed in Singapore as a stopover for 3 nights on our way back home from London. Our room was very nice and spacious. The beds were comfortable although a bit short. The bathroom was good and had a great shower head! There was free wifi. We dined at the hotel restaurant for our New Years Eve dinner which was great. The buffet selection was amazing. Breakfast was totally different! For the price of $35 per person we expected a full continental breakfast. As it turned out the breakfast was very limited and not continental at all. The wait to obtain two fried eggs was in excess of 5 minutes, only to find out that we were in the queue for scrambled eggs and got totally ignored by the rude Egg chef! For a hotel of this standard, this kind of behaviour towards guests, is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Orchard Road & affordable”
Reviews.Author: baronessanna
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times now on business trips. Staff is always very friendly, free internet & complimentary mini bar. The door men are always in such a good mood ! It is so close to Orchard Road & the ION shopping centre, if you get the chance to finish work early you can just run over the road for some retail therapy ! Good breakfasts in the morning, except I have never found them to serve bacon even though it's Singapore (?). I stayed in the Club Deluxe Room which is fine for a business trip. I found it a little small as I had previously stayed in the Executive suite & that's what I was expecting. The Executive suite is very luxurious, & has a more modern feel than the Club Deluxe room, and OH so much room ! I find this hotel to be well worth the money, especially when you compare it to the larger chains - I highly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly average”
Reviews.Author: theluds
Reviews.Content: Hmm, had big expectations of this hotel based on other reviews but was sadly let down! Things got off to a bad start when we tried to book in. Although we arrived later than the scheduled check-in time no rooms were ready for us and we were told to "have a look around the shops and come back in an hour and a half". This is not what I'd expect from a hotel of this standard and price and I would think that the least they should do in these circumstances is offer us some complimentary drinks whilst we waited. Having just arrived from Penang we were not jet lagged so it wasn't a major problem but they weren't to know that. The rooms when we got into them were nothing special and, infact, were a bit tired and in need of an overhaul. We had a window between the bedroom and the bathroom - for what purpose i have no idea! On the plus side everything was clean. There is a small pool and fitness suite - again nothing to write home about. The hotel seems to sell itself on it's location and indeed it is very close to the main shopping street. If that's what you're after this may be the hotel for you. However, there are nicer areas to stay in and a very clean and efficient underground system to get you to them quickly and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: freesiahl
Reviews.Content: Went on 15th Jan to 18th Jan with my family.Service was excellent at the door and reception staff. Our room was quite spacious and there was a closet for bags and clothes. Amenities were complete but there was no bathtub. The Nespresso machine was a surprise as we were not expecting that. The gym was complete with 2 treadmills, 2 stationary bicycles and a few others. The sauna felt authentic as it was heated by hot stones. Location is good as there are quite a few shopping malls within walking distance. There is a bus stand right outside the doors and on request, they will hail a taxi for you. Be careful of the white and black Mercedes as they charge S$ 4.20 and S$ 5.00 respectively for an automatic flag down charge while the rest cost S$ 3.20

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonn1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights during new year Our room was EXTREMELY spacious with 5-star hotel amenities. Great attentive staff, even the doormen at the side entrance were super cheerful. BIG windows with great view outside.. Food was good

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Romina Silvia G
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on a business trip. Excellent food both for breakfast and dinner, free internet and complimentary minibar. Staff was very friendly and really prepared. Nice pool and gym. Located downtown Singapore close to Orchard Road. Really very confortable and at the end not so expensive as you could imagine. It's worth to go without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjwals
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Singapore early morning after a long flight from Amsterdam. We were travelling on to Perth the following morning so we only needed the room for some rest and recouperation I had booked a room in the hotel for one night and advised them of my probable early arrival - they said that they could not guarantee room availability as normal check-in time is much later. Fair enough. When we got to the hotel, staff on reception were so nice - our bags were taken from us and securly stored behind reception until our room was ready. We were offered use of the swimming pool if we wished. There were no rooms available when we arrived but within 2 hours, they had booked us in without fuss. The room we got was pure quality and definitely five star. Staff at the hotel were all so professional, obliging and friendly. Our stay at this hotel was a delightful experience and I would highly recommend it. I rate this hotel as

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: adamz75
Reviews.Content: Went here on buisness. Very clean, staff are very friendly, execllent position by the ION Orchard shopping center. The buffert breakfast and the buffet lunch are amazing with a massive selection. The manager Sarah was incredible and even went out to the next door starbuck to bring back coffee for a member of my party- as i said amazing service. The bell boys did manage to break one of the cases however and tried to pretend it was all ready broken but not the end of the world. All in all i would recommend this hotel. The bar is also great and does fantastic bar food with live music.Room service is a little slow. the box of choccies in the room is a nice touch and so is the huge shower . Rooms have both huge shower cubilcle and bath ( with a glass window from bed roon to bathroom ( see image)

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Yasmin S
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, rather small room, though having paid for a club delux. Rooms are clean, but not impressive. Best of all was the free tea and cocktails available to all guests staying in delux accommodations or exclusive suites. You've got starbucks and mcdonalds just around the corner. Staff are super nice and helpful. A nice touch was the l'occitane toiletries (something that most ladies would appeciate). Overall was a pleasant stay, moreover if you're looking for luxury, book something like the Marriott just across the road

Reviews.Title: “Returned here and enjoyed another magical experience”
Reviews.Author: OL1981
Reviews.Content: I returned to the Royal Plaza on Scotts one month after my previous experience with this hotel -the subject of an earlier Trip Advisor review -wondering whether this hotel would continue to live up to the high standards and fond The upgraded room they gave me was absolutely amazing and really blew me away. It was so spacious, beautifully decorated and luxurious -with every amenity and comfort imaginable and more -that it really took upmarket hotel accommodation to a whole new unprecedented level. The bathroom had a lovely shower and a seperate bath and was nice and spacious with a glass window (with a blind you could pull down) seperating it from the main room. Everything about this room was just totally breathtaking and stunning and it totally exceeded my expectations, even given the fact that I already knew the very high standards that this hotel delivered. I have stayed in some amazingly beautiful hotel rooms both before and since but this one is really up there with the very best and possibly even takes the cake in terms of ambience, comfort, enjoyment and luxury. The complimentary wi-fi and the free mini-bar was another thing I cherished during my stay here. It was a privilege to stay in that room and an experience that left me with many fond memories that I continue to cherish until this day The staff were as warm, friendly, hospitable and professional and helpful to a fault as they were on my last visit. More than a few remembered me from last time and were very welcoming and friendly on my return visit, almost in the same way they would greet a long lost friend. Those whom I didn't know also treated me like a friend and took a personal interest in my well-being. I think the staff here are some of the best I've ever encountered in my lifetime I had already dined at the Carousel so I knew it was a great restaurant but I took high tea there and was again absolutely blown away by the variety of savory and sweet treats they had on offer. I think this would have to be one of the most comprehensive buffets I have ever seen anywhere in the world and it was all delicious. Having a Starbucks just outside that seems to be open all hours a day -I once got a drink past midnight -also helps!! The only slight downside was the door staff seemed a bit slow in getting me a taxi on my final exit from the hotel to go to the airport and this probably made me a bit later than I would have been for my flight (although I was running late anyway). But even this was an exception to the rule -all the other times I have very impressed by the speed and efficiency of the door staff in booking a taxi and instructing them where to go and the service has been second to none. And in all fairness, I do wonder whether the mishap on my final departure from this hotel was their fault. I am inclined to suspect that it may have been some problem with the taxi service since it had never happened before I immensely enjoyed my second time in this hotel -it was an absolute pleasure and privilege to stay here and the rooms, the staff and the whole hotel itself is really second to none. I didn't think it could exceed the enjoyment and pleasure of my first visit here but it did. I always hate leaving this place and am profoundly sad when I do and can't wait to return. It is truly a magical, once-in-a-lifetime experience and I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: EllisGl
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides the most friendly staff i have come across in my world travels. From the receptionist to the concierge, nothing was too much trouble and all done with a smile. Hotel rooms were bang up to date, with free minibar and nespresso machine a welcome touch. Breakfast is a fantastic world buffet selection and the cakes are to die for from the bar. Location is spot on, right by all the major Orchard road malls and subways links and you are in the middle of more restuatrants you could shake a stick at. A perfect Singapore stop-off location.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money & location”
Reviews.Author: Sharon J
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Agoda website - we were a family of three and had two rooms on third floor - view was of a carpark but did not worry us and we slept soundly on the comfortable beds. We opted for a hotel transfer at $S120 and were met at the aero bridge and quickly escorted through customs and immigration and into an air conditioned minivan for a quick trip to the hotel. The hotel is very well situated and for ladies who like to shop ( we were no exception) as out of the front door of the hotel, turn left for 15 metres and then up by escalator to the over bridge right into the front door of the famous Lucky Plaza Shopping Precinct where there were shoes, handbags etc at about one sixth of the Australian price. On the third floor is also the cheap local eating restaurants for duck and noodles etc for around A$10. A money changer is also at the entrance in the Plaza for all currencies. The breakfasts at around $S30 were just amazing - all the usual Western fare plus many great local selections - we were captivated!!! Staff are very efficient, friendly and well versed with advice to getting around - although Singapore is in the main expensive the taxis are not and great for getting around if time is short - we did not pay any more than $10. Highly recommend the Singapore Flyer, Cable Car and Marina Sands ( boat and infinity pool) hotel tour at $S20 for something different. We chose to take a taxi back to airport and cost was around $S40. Highly recommend this hotel to singles, couples and families. Would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Package”
Reviews.Author: CWKB2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights/4 days and had 2 interconnecting rooms as travelling with children. From the time of research the staff at reservation were very friendly that I chose the hotel over the others. We arrived at the hotel around 9am from the airport. Eventhough check in time was many hours later, after taking one look at our bedraggled family (we have been on the road for 14 hours) the Manager asked the receptionist to arrange one of the interconnecting room straight away. Which was a God Send as we needed to freshen the kids and us and rest. The second room was provided to us within an hour. The Hotel lobby was beautiful. The rooms were spacious and beautiful. The down side was our rooms looked out onto a neighbouring car parking building.The bathrooms were great. The Free WiFi was very much appreciated not to mention the free nespresso and free mini bar. Even though it was just an Oreo cookie and some drinks it really help to know you can have those without paying an arm and a leg for them. We had breakfast at Carousel restaurant downstairs and it was the best I have had. The variety of food was amazing. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The Location you can't get better. The hotel is right next door to DFS and Isetama. The hotel is located in the corner of Orchard road and Scott road so you are in the middle of everything. All the major shopping centres like Wisma Atria, Ion, Takashimaya are only a few minutes away and you could either walk to them under ground or above ground.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: happywatraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in September and would thoroughly recommend this hotel . Such friendly, helpful and efficient staff, nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were very comfortable and very clean. The location was amazing, everything on your doorstep and Orchard road a few feet away. We would love to stay there again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Room service was expensive”
Reviews.Author: Varuna F
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but room service was quite expensive. Staff were wonderful. Definitely stay there again. Lovely lobby area, much more inviting than Mandarin Orchard's lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: wudam
Reviews.Content: It is close to the shopping malls and good value for money. The rooms are smaller than my expectation. Breakfast buffet is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here during peak times -- they can't handle it”
Reviews.Author: thornerm
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a room at this hotel after spending over 3 weeks traveling throughout Southeast Asia. We thought it would be a nice way to end our trip, particularly in light of the positive reviews received by this hotel in the past. We arrived slightly after noon on New Year's Day and found ourselves in a lobby more chaotic than the Chinatown market. Every desk at reception (more than 5) was several people deep. We waited in line for about 20-30 minutes and was told our room was not ready yet but that they would be happy to call us when it was available, sometime after 2pm. As the hotel's check-in time is 2pm, this was not an issue for us, so we left our bags and took advantage of the hotel's great location near Orchard Road to find some good places to eat and shop. We never received a call telling us that our room was ready, but headed back to the hotel after 2pm. We waited in line again for 20-30 minutes. When we reached someone at Reception, we were told our room was ready and made our way there. Despite my request for two twin beds, we found ourselves in a room with a double bed instead. I tried calling reception and could not get through -- no one even answered the phone the three times I called. The bellman suggested we go down to the lobby and talk in person to someone at the Reception desk as it was very busy. We went downstairs and waited in line again for another 20-30 minutes. We were informed that our request for 2 twin beds was a request only and was subject to availability. Therefore, the hotel was not required to provide us with two beds. As much as I love my friend, after more than 3 weeks of traveling together, I was not in the mood for some extra closeness. We pushed back a bit and were told that they could make a 2-bed room available for us, but not for at least another 2 hours. Even though it was past check-in time, that was all they could do, but they would be happy to send a text when the room was available. I then asked if we could have extended check out to enjoy our stay a bit longer the following day, as our plans to relax around the hotel were clearly not going to be realized if we were forced to check in to our hotel room hours after check in time. We were told no, as they were very busy, we had to be sure to be out of the room before noon. I thought it was very inconsiderate of them to not have our room ready for our arrival but insist that we leave them enough time to make it ready for the guests who arrived after our departure. We came back to the hotel again around 4:30pm (we had still not received a text or phone call letting us know that our room was ready but were done with shopping at this point), waitied in line again for about 30 minutes, and was told our room was indeed ready. We went to the room only to find ourselves in another room with only one bed. After notifying the hotel staff of this, we were informed that the double bed could be separated into 2 twin beds. I'm not sure why they didn't do this for our first room, but at least it was better than switching rooms again. We waited for housekeeping to arrive and called the concierge to make reservations that evening for the night safari. There was no answer the first time we called. The second time we called, we got through to someone and thought we had made our reservations. No information was provided volunarily by the concierge; useful information such as when to meet our tour, where to meet our tour, etc., was only provided after I asked the relevant questions. Once our bed situation was resolved, we decided to go sit by the pool. It's not a very exciting pool but it is perfectly acceptable. We returned to the room in time to prepare for our evening tour and headed to the lobby to meet the bus. When we arrived in the lobby and informed the concierge that we were ready, he told us that he had not booked our tour because it was full. We had no message in our room and were not told that there had been any problem booking our tour until we thought the tour was going to depart. Normally, you would think we would be out of luck. But after asking many questions, we discovered we did not need to do the night safari via the tour and could instead travel there ourselves via taxi for less than it cost for us to take the tour. I really wish the concierge had volunteered this information; it would have been a proactive and service-oriented way to mitigate our disappointment in not getting on the tour we thought we would be taking. The rest of our stay went without further incident, except that the lines were again very long for check-out. When I asked about express check-out, I was told that this would not be possible unless I had completed a form for it during check in. Why didn't they offer the form during check in then? It was, needless to say, all a bit frustrating. The hotel is in a great location and the shower was great. And maybe the service at the hotel would be ok if they had not been so busy during the holiday. But the service we received was terribly disappointing, and I doubt I would ever stay here again, particularly given the cost of the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy69Brisbane
Reviews.Content: I have just spent two nights at the Royal Plaza on Scotts here in Singapore. I stayed in Club Room on the 15th Floor. The first thing you notice is that each and every staff member is polite and efficent in their duties. I had dealings with front desk, doormen, concierge and staff in club lounge - All excellent. Foyer is a hive of activity and people but once past that you are in a quiet and peacefull place.My room was very nice and appeared recently refurbished. It had everythng that a business person needed. At $270 SGD per night ex Taxes was very good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Super”
Reviews.Author: JohnGH
Reviews.Content: One of the older hotels on or near the Orchard Road strip. The decorations for Christmas were nice.Singapore does this so well. Service at the hotel was first class and the rooms were large and clean. The wait for taxis at the front of the hotel can be a bit long and no preference seems to be given to hotel guests. My collegue checked in late at night and was told he room type was no longer available and that he would have a single bed. Not a major inconvenience but a little frustrating. It doesn't have the feel of a new and vibrant hotel but with the location and price it is still a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Aussie6
Reviews.Content: We recently had three nights at this hotel over the Christmas period after completing a cruise from India. The staff were very helpful. The rooms were very clean. The Christmas decorations were gorgeous. Sadly all of this meant nothing when you couldn't sleep because of the noise caused by the other guests. The other guests at the hotel all seemed to have small children and none of them went to sleep before midnight. They all ran up and down the passageway outside our room. We changed rooms after one night but it was just as bad as before. Not the hotels fault but if you are looking for a quiet hotel this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, clean hotel. Recommended”
Reviews.Author: 456ZulG456
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms and stayed there with family last week. Best location @ orchard road with 24-hour cafe a minute walk away. Very clean and being a non-smoking hotel, free of tobacco smell. Deluxe room is not very big but would accommodate 3 ( with extra bed) comfortably. Good & friendly service including that by the housekeepers. Definitely recommendable, especially if travelling with family. i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location but aged room”
Reviews.Author: aobk84
Reviews.Content: Both my partner and I stayed at this hotel for three nights over Christmas. We were quickly and efficiently checked in and noticed a slight aged furniture. However please don't get it wrong, because the service in this hotel is impeccable. All the staff from concierge, restaurant including house keeping are all polite and friendly. The food at Carousel is generous and lives up to the qualitythat made it an award winning buffet restaurant. We were given Christmas cookies in our room. If there are any shortcomings I'm sure it has all been forgiven with top notch service.

Reviews.Title: “Royal plaza on Scotts”
Reviews.Author: Rafflesia
Reviews.Content: As others before me has mentioned, the hotel is right at the doorstep of the action of Orchard road, the MRT and shopping. I was actually booked into their lowest room category size (superior) with no meal privilleges. Although the hotel could have done a little better in remembering my preferences like having ice in my bucket and not having any evening turn down service ( i am a member of their royal touch program), these seem to pale in comprision to other perks the hotel has thown in which includes free mini bar, free wifi, free local telehphone calls and free Nepresso type coffee (where you have to insert a capsule) for your caffine kick. At S$260+++ per night, this hotel offers excellent value for money. As i checked in during Christmas day and during a time when festivity was in full swing, some members of the staff (front desk) were still able to offer a warm personalised check-in experience. Its obvious that the hotel has invested in some staff development course for its employes in key positions. The staff are young, eager to please and if management does the right thing by identifying and retaining the services of these individuals, in time, they would rival the quality of service offered by the likes of Ritz Carlton, St Regis and the Shangri-la. Little areas such as sweeping the supposed cobwebs off the ceiling or dry mopping the floor at the foyer area should perhaps be done at a time when guest traffic is at a minimum. if they do have to proceed, then perhaps they could be more mindful of guest who happen to be passing by. Other than these minor observations, you cannot do wrong in staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Tony Y
Reviews.Content: Good location. 1 minute walk to the famous Orchard Road. The reception area is always full of people. When I first checked-in, at 2pm, I had to wait for another hour to get my room. They gave a room facing the side building so the view is the roof top of the next building!!!! :-( Room is reasonably clean. The good thing is that it provides free Wi-Fi and free use of the mini-bar (stocked 2 beers, 2 mineral water, 2 cola and 1 juice) and xpresso coffee. The bed is not very good because I can feel the soft spring in the mattress. You can have a selection of pillow from soft, medium to hard. For the price SGD230/night ++, it should be considered average for Singapore standard as other hotels around the area are even higher.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: elle88England
Reviews.Content: i had just one night in this hotel and was very impressed i have stayed in a few in singapore but the location of this one is excellent. The staff where great and i even had free mini bar and wifi! which is just amazing! As it is christmas the hotel was decorated lovely and as i was on my own the hotel really looked after me. Orchard road is very close and i was very happy with a 24 hours starbucks right outside! Singapore is a very easy place to get around but as its christmas it does become hard to get a cab and the subway gets busy so being a walk away was a luxury! The food looked great even though i didnt get a chance to eat there it was busy in there. so yes very happy costumer!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JULIEIOW
Reviews.Content: this hotel is fantastic.the staff are friendly and helpful,lovely comfy beds,free internet was a real plus and the free mini bar.Pool are a great place to relax after a hot a sticky day sightseeing.Good breakfast with a wide range of food,we didnt have any other meals in the hotel,lots of cheap places to eat in the food court across the road in the shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value and service”
Reviews.Author: mancboomerang
Reviews.Content: If you need to be around the Orchard area, this hotel is ideally located. The rooms are a decent size and the Nespresso machine in each room is a welcome novelty. Staff are invariably helpful and courteous. The restaurant is OK without being great, but there are heaps of options very close by. The only real weakness of this hotel for me is that the pool area is rather small and often in shadow, so it makes it a bit hard to get sunshine for jet lag adjustment. The decor in the bar and the rooms is a bit dated, but it's all very clean and everything works.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, good value, no surprises”
Reviews.Author: keithuk
Reviews.Content: If you're stopping off in Singapore for a few days this big city hotel is well priced compared with some of the newer places and in a good location at Scotts and Orchard Roads. It has the bustling big lobby feel of a city hotel and good facilities including a sizeable pool, though the deck is shaded by large flanking walls - so not for sunworshippers (suits me though!) Rooms are spacious and well maintained if not in the latest hotel fashion, with in the twins 2 big, comfortable beds, and big, powerful, walk in shower. Business centre comfortable and well provided, with free coffee. In a word - hassle free rather than stylish - but I'd go again if I'm on a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Shelinds
Reviews.Content: I recently had a few days in Singapore and stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts hotel. I had done my homework (including reading up on Tripadvisor) and this hotel provided the central location I was after. What I didn't expect was the the daily replenishment of the minibar (free), the outstanding service and the "can do" attitude of all the staff. The hotel is within a block or two of great shopping malls, the iconic Orchard Road and is well serviced with public transport; there is also an unending supply of taxis to the front door (taxis are cheap in Singapore). Avoid the hotel restaurant if the budget is an issue - there are a plentiful supply of "cheap eats" just across the road in the malls. The hotel room may have been a little 'tired', but very clean and the bed was comfortable. Another highlight was the Starbucks within a few steps of the hotel entry! Love that Starbucks! What else could you ask for from a hotel? Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
