Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for 7 nights to coincide with Singapore Marathon - Stayed in Club Room and room was spacious and service in Club Lounge fantastic - all staff the most courteous have met at any hotel - the location is fantastic on Scotts Rd Magnificent Buffet breakfast with menu changing every day - mini bar is complimentary and replenished every day (includes beer, coke, diet coke, orange juice and oreo biscuits and bottled water) Nespresso machine in room with coffee capsules replenished every day - free wifi also The pool area is probably the only thing that could do with an upgrade as staff are forced to use the pool deck as a thoroughfare to get to function rooms - something that could be looked at. Otherwise I highly recommend this hotel and will definately stay there on future trips

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Mediko A
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times for business or personal purpose and always get more than satisfactory experience. This is mostly due to excellent food and great location. The service has been always great and the staffs have been very nice and helpful. It's always in my top list of hotel whenever I come to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value for money at the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: tokaik
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at premier room on a business trip and did not find anything to complain. Breakfast was really good and the room spacious and well equipped, and location was excellent if you're into shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: lisasplaces
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights here on the first leg of my SE Asia trip. I couldn't fault the hotel in any way. The staff were incredibly friendly and efficient. Special thanks to the concierge desk for helping tp sort out my broken suitcase. The concierge desk also gave me great directions for walking and were happy to book a trip that wasn't theirs. It is in a wonderful location - 2 minutes to Orchard Road and the MRT station. It did take me a while to work out which exit to use when coming out of the MRT! By the way it's Wheelock Place! I think it is at the better part of Orchard Road and the Ion Mall is great for food and shopping. You can also walk to the Botanic Gardens in 20 minutes. The shower was great and the included mini bar in the room is a nice extra,as is the free wifi and the Nespresso machine. I didn't include breakfast. There is a Starbucks outside, or if not got a few goodies and keep them in the fridge like I did. For the price, I don't think you would find better in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “The best location!”
Reviews.Author: Sophiebelle04
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot in Asia and I try to write as honestly as I can. I live in Bali so travel to Singapore quite frequently. The location of this hotel is just the best! Right off Orchard Rd.and within walking distance of the major Malls...if shopping is your thing! Checking in was OK although the room was not ready and I had to wait. Since it was close to lunchtime, I was thinking lunch but the only thing available was the buffet which looked amazing, but just too much for me. Instead they suggested I go "upstairs" to a lounge area which really turned out to be the Bar area...a little weird for eating your lunch, but it was Ok and they really did try their best to make me happy. I noticed that they had upgraded my room to Premier floor which was fantastic ( I originally booked through Agoda) and the room was quite satisfactory. My only comment would be that it needed upgrading and freshening, including the linen. Had some issues with the TV but nothing major. I cannot say enough about the hotel staff. Genuinely warm and friendly and helpful. Five star for the hotel staff. I will most definitely stay here again on my next visit....u cannot beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: She22wong
Reviews.Content: Nice staff especially front desk Tony he is very professional, warm greeting and explained to me all the facilities. I will return to your hotel because of the special attention of him.Thank you Mr Tony Khoo! You are the star! I like free minibar and buffet breakfast, excellent room assign by Tony. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: faith_w16
Reviews.Content: the rooms are a little small but the service makes up for it! we loved this hotel. the brunch was fabulous! so delicious! free internet in the internet lounge.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star hotel with 6 star service”
Reviews.Author: jjy88sm
Reviews.Content: I could not add more to what has already been said about the 'software' of this hotel. They are helpful, courteous and smiling. The hardware, although not the latest OS, does its job, and the location is amazing. Steps from Orchard Road. We stayed for six nights. Not much of a view from the 9th floor. We over looked a multi story car park but really no sweat. I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: macatcat
Reviews.Content: There are numbers of 4-5 stars hotel in Singapore you can choose. This hotel, in its prime location, is great for business. i stayed on a business trip just for overnight, they gave me a little surprised by remembering my last name. i think this is ahead of others because of this, they won my heart and i will choose this hotel again when i go to Singapore next time.

Reviews.Title: “As per expectations”
Reviews.Author: firmanhadi
Reviews.Content: Every one in the hotel is very courteous and helpful, I think this is the strongest suit of this hotel. Location is amazing: walking distance to Orchard shopping district and express underground station; a bus stop is located in front of the hotel. I'm not happy with the free wireless connection, the whole time I was there connection is quite poor. The free mini bar is also a bit of a joke. View from my bedroom is depressing, although I suspect all rooms have the same view considering how the building is laid out.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff best hotel breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tracy084
Reviews.Content: We just only have some words to say the hotel was fantastic,staff were incredibly helpful and friendly,rooms are beautiful and buffet breakfast was excellent.This is a well appointed and modern hotel in the heart of the city.The service was impeccable and we found our stay here very comfortable and we were well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Polki1981
Reviews.Content: Singapore was the third destination on our vacation. The Royal plaza although a bit expensive (around £162/night) was totally worth the money as the location made it possible for us to visit most places without hassle. The room was kept clean and the fridge was stocked everyday by housekeeping which was awesome as it was very hot while we were there and being able to get some cool water was absolutely wonderful. The hotel is close to the ION and there is tons of shopping options thanks for being so close to Orchard Road (Singapore's retail and entertainment hub) The Far East plaza is right across the road and had cheap eats and some shopping options. There is a Starbucks right outside the hotel and a patisserie and noodle/fast food restaurant opposite Starbucks the building next to the hotel also houses a Supermarket in the basement which can be very useful sometimes. If you really want to try the local flare (food) the Newton Hawker Center (really famous) is only a ten minute walk from the hotel (walk on Scotts street away from Orchard Road). My husband truly enjoyed all the food there and one of the stall owners was really nice to amend a dish which is cooked with egg to omit it so that I too could enjoy the food. The entire meal for the two of us with drinks came to about £5. Getting to the Singapore Zoo from the hotel is a breeze. The Singapore Attractions Express has a stop on Scotts Road. The hotel staff is more than happy to direct you in this matter. Also if not interested in taking a bus, taxis seem to be another great alternative as the fares are not high and (from what we experienced) the drivers friendly. The only complaint I have in this respect is that since you cannot hail a taxi as you would in New York or London most hotel taxi stands are crowded during rush hours and late night and you may have to wait to get a taxi. Also another great way to get around Singapore is the MRT (subway) and the Orchard Road station is right at your door step. Be advised the station can get crowded although the trains were not. It is very easy to get to all the tourist destinations with very few changes and a great way to see Singapore. The hotel also has a decent gym and a pool. Nothing to write home about but does the job. The only place I would advise people to stay away from when it comes to the hotel is the Heat UltraLounge (a lounge in the hotel). Although ver chic it left a lot to be desired specially with the price tag. We ordered Nachos and I kid you not when we got them there were a total of 8 chips on the plate. The plate in front of me looked exactly like the picture on their ultra chic iPad menu. I was a little shocked to say the least but hey it wasn't like I was lied to so I quietly paid the bill. The hotel also has a restaurant named the Carousel. It was always busy while we were there and therefore decided to skip it. All in all it was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Travelerr07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent!! Although it is a 4-star hotel, however I would easily give it a 5-star! We went to other 5-star hotel in Singapore, however this was much much better!! The location is perfect in the center of the shopping! We went by end of November, and the hotel reception was very beautifully decorated with Christmas decorations, and looked amazing... When we entered our room, we were surprised to find on our bed a teddy bear with a hat that was my son's name on it, and they brought 2 chocolate sticks which has my name and my wife's on them. It was a cosy and amazing touch from the hotel! I would definitely return back to this hotel when I am back to Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “royal plaza on Scotts”
Reviews.Author: kathleen g
Reviews.Content: Absolutely would recommend this hotel to friends and family. Location is fantastic, and the staff are so attentive, and provide excellent customer service. The buffet breakfast is amazing so many choices and the buffet evening meal was also fantastic, make sure you book or you could have a long wait as its so popular. On the downside I would have liked to have been informed by reception about the Club Lounge to have had the opportunity to upgrade. Great having both Nespresso machine and tea making facilities in room. The free mini bar provided beer, coke, water and orange as well a a biscuit. On the downside, the hairdryer was annoying, the cord did not stretch very much and as a result kept coming out of the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ahmad_F_Y
Reviews.Content: I drove to Singapore from Malaysia for the school Holiday on 26-28 Nov 2011, all 7 of us... me, my wife, my 4 sons ages 12, 7, 4 and 1 and my niece) since my kids really wanted to visit the Universal Studio. Since I drove, the complementary parking is definitely a plus. We took the superior rooms with 2 single beds. A first I was not really sure whether we could fit all in one room. But it turns out that the 32 meter square room was large enough. What we did was that we split the matress and the divan. The divan is as soft as the bed. And I can say that the matress is the best I have slept in. And the room was so lovely and squeaky clean with ample of toiletries. The desktop was definitely a plus because me, my 12 and 7 year old brought along their own notebooks. The internet was free and blazing fast. My sons downloaded tons of movies.... within minutes. It says the check in time is 2.00pm but we arrived at 12.00 and they actually let us in. And the amazing thing is that our luggage was already sent to our room before us. Phuh.. talk about service. TV channels are ok. If I not mistaken at least there are 32 of them. All the channels in Malaysia, Indonesia and Singapore itself plus the usual movie, news, sports and documentary channels. The staffs are simply wonderful. Just head over to the concierge counter and ask them just about anything. They are ever willing to help. Overall.. thank you for the wonderful time. My son even said the next time we were in Singapore let stay at this hotel. I know why... he wanted to download more movies.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cajuncouple50
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Singapore, this hotel is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: PickyMrsT
Reviews.Content: Over the last 3 years we stayed in Royal Plaza on Scotts a number of times and it is always a pleasure to come back. Many of the staff are still the same after 3 years, which tells you that people not only love staying in this hotel, but also like working there. We usually stay in Executive Suite, which gives me, my husband and our two small kids enough room. The suites have been renovated recently and are just great now: lots of room, nice furniture and tasteful design. Free mini-bar and coffee/tea station are a nice touch. The only one thing I always wished was better is the hair dryer (its incredibly short cord drives me insane). The Club Lounge is one of the best I've ever been to. Afternoon tea treats and evening cocktail snacks are always delicious. The staff is super professional, very attentive and personable. Speaking about staff, every single employee of Royal Plaza is a pleasure to deal with. Always professional, friendly and eager to help. Special thanks goes to bell boys, maids, concierges, front desk and club lounge staff. Well, everyone, really! Thank you for making our stay so pleasant! Breakfast buffet (served in Carousel restaurant) is definitely the best in Singapore. Locals come to Carousel to celebrate special occasions, that's how good lunch and dinner buffets are! We are always out and about in Singapore, so I never had a chance to check out the gym and the pool. Another great thing about Royal Plaza is its very central location. Absolutely everything you need is within walking distance - from movies to supermarkets to hospitals to kids' playgrounds. And all the shopping, of course :) Have I mentioned this hotel is 100% smoke-free? Yes! Huge plus! We will come back, no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “A SIngapore Treat”
Reviews.Author: Huw J
Reviews.Content: I live in Dubai, a place where 5* hotels are ten a penny, and the most of them lack any character, charm or human touch. In November 2011 I managed to escape my home in La La Land and visited the Royal Plaza Hotel on Scotts, from the very warm welcome on our arrival my wife and I were taken to check in upstairs in the Club Lounge, pay the extra to be a club guest it is worth it! Our room was a reasonable size, not huge but very comfortable with a super 'rain shower' to freshen you up in the morning or relax you before bed. The room comes with a free mini bar, perfect for a cold beer (which in Singapore is quite expensive) and a Nespresso coffee machine, perfect coffee every time. The Club Lounge provides a good breakfast, a free 'high tea' in the afternoon and complimentary cocktails (or a cold beer) at sundown, this is your chance to try the famous Singapore Sling. All in all the week long stay was too short at this superb hotel, the location is great smack bang in the Orchard area, 2 minute walk to the Metro, taxis are readily available and the buses are great if you fancy an even cheaper mode of transport. My last point to mention about the hotel, the stay would not have been half as good if it was not for the wonderfully attentive staff who work there. They are all extremely polite and professional and really make your stay even more enjoyable. I will return very soon! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “What can we do for you?”
Reviews.Author: Gerhard K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first time since the comprehensive renovation. The location on Scotts Road is unbeatable. I was given room 909, a suite. Very comfortable with generous living room space, flat screen TV, a well-appointed desk with good lighting and fittings for lap-top etc. FREE internet is provided. The room had a NESPRESSO coffee maker and FREE MINIBAR with water, soft drinks and beer. The bedroom was spacious as well with a king-size bed. Choice of pillows was a very nice touch. Another flat screen TV is provided. Plenty of wardrobe space, iron/board and safe in convenient location. Soft bathrobes available. The bathroom is well-appointed with separate shower and CHOPARD amenities. One is encouraged to re-use towels and the entire hotel is non-smoking, a great GREEN effort. With the suite comes the use of the CLUB floor(15th), a well-layed-out facility with great and attentive staff. The food and beverage offer, such as breakfast and evening cocktails is superb in variety and taste/presentation. The view over the American Club and Tanglin Club is very pleasing. The all-day-dining restaurant has a very large offer on international dishes, presented fresh and cooked in front the guests. The latest offering a a section with MOLECULAR food items, which were really tasty and creative.Again, the staff are outstanding and eager to serve and please. As it is Christmas season, the Lobby decor is again something very special and creative as it depicts a toy fair theme with moving parts, going away from the traditional Christmas tree(which are present at other places in this hotel though). It was over-all a fantastic stay and true to their slogan 'WHAT CAN WE DO FOR YOU?" and I do look forward to return end of December.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Ymint
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice before, this is my third time. What can I say? This hotel ALWAYS feels like home away from home, this is why I always keep going back. Apart from the great service, wonderful hotel facilities, fantastic location (a stone's throw from Orchard MRT and shopping centre), the hotel offers complimentary high speed internet and mini-bar which is stocked daily. We got a special rate because we booked at least 90 days in advance, you can do this from their website. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, this would always be my first choice in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very customer-oriented General Manager”
Reviews.Author: DutchAlfred
Reviews.Content: First time here, had booked a room on the executive floor, including use of the executive lounge. Check-in was a bit slow, but room was o.k.. There was no fruit in the room (which you might expect on an executive floor), but it was brought quickly after asking. Breakfast was great, various kinds of fresh bread, fresh pastries, great selection of cheese and meat, fruits etc. Even better than we experienced in Pan Pacific Singapore. And then the biggest surprise: in the breakfast room there was a table with apparently the general manager behind it, reading his newspaper, with a sign in front of him 'I'am the general manager, feel free to address me'. Also in the business lounge the service was very good, we had some meetings there and the staff understood perfectly when to come by or not. Especially a staff member with a Newby button (why does a hotel do these things to employees) did more than his best.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: Yas007
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in this hotel with my husband and daughter, the location was really good near to every thing(Cinema,shopping centers ,restaurants,...),Staffs were so kind specially with kids, our room was in club floor so we could use club facilities(free tea ,coffee, snacks, cakes,..) also free internet in room.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was the highlight”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelML8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near the corner of Scotts and Orchard Roads, making it close to where the action is. The rooms are best described as basic, however they are functional and clean. The highlight for me was the buffet breaky, which is mighty impressive (and I've dined out a lot). Overall it's a good value hotel, in a prime spot, I'm happy to recommend this hotel to anyone as I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Points for espresso machine in room...”
Reviews.Author: roxipod
Reviews.Content: Royal Plaza on Scotts is also in a good location and has decent-sized rooms, comfortable bed, and great service. The maintenance of the hotel needs to constantly be maintained due to humidity in Singapore plus endless 'traffic' through this hotel. Upstairs bar could have more of a community feel and we would have stayed longer (too bright with the lobby down below, perhaps shade that off). Also, the lobby, although nice, felt a bit "disney-ish" the weekend we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: Derbala
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in royal plaza hotel at Scotts, Singapore. Location is fine but considering that many hotels are around, this might not be significant. We were offered a room in the 12th floor but we decided to change it to another one in the 11th because we could not stand the unpleasant smell of the first one. The room seemed to be recently renovated. Decor was just average. Bed was far from comfortable. The free minibar was fine; just one coke, one juice, 2 small bottles of water in addition to 2 cans of beer (we don't drink alcoholic beverages). There was no street view, just high buildings around, but some birds had soiled the window glass which made even that view quite annoying! The staff was kind and helpful. The free internet is another good side. We thought of checking in another hotel because of the great discrepancy between this one and the previous two (Mandarin Oriental and Shangrila Sentosa), but we had already paid full charge and the time of booking. It would have been better if we started our trip in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and food”
Reviews.Author: Jelbrew
Reviews.Content: Overall very good hotel close to Orchard Road shopping and easy access to all locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service exceed expectation for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: Whybear
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location within 5 mins to Orchard MRT and the best shopping and food on Orchard Road. We paid SGD 200 for a night booked through the hotel website, considering the price for a 4.5-5 star hotel in Singapore, the value far exceeds our expectation. All staff in hotel were friendly and efficient. Free wifi and minbar were good to have. Room was a bit dated but fine, recently renovated bathroom was fantastic. Being someone regular stay in 4-5 star hotel and recently stayed at Regent Singapore and Pan Pacific Singapore, I would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking good service and a great location for a excellent value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoking hotel in Singapore and handy to everything”
Reviews.Author: PeterAustralia
Reviews.Content: Quite often the Hotel is discounted and it is exceptional value. Situated on Scotts Road right next to Orchard Rd which is in the heart of Singapore. Shopping is fantastic all around the area. Royal Plaza has a gym, rooftop pool and a selection of bars and restaurants. It is one of the few smoke-free hotels in Singapore. It is one minute walk to the Orchard MRT station and the hotel offers free internet in all the rooms. The rooms are amazingly spacious with king size beds and very modern. A great location to stay when staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: QKiwi
Reviews.Content: We booked this through wotif not knowing what hotel we would get. It's a great location and well appointed rooms, free wifi.. and comfortable bed! The shower was the most awesome I've seen with this massive rose to create a typhoon in the bathroom! Be careful if shopping at the far east plaza over the road they will take more dollars more that you probably need to spend! Know your prices and negotiate well!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: singpon
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights on Royal Plaza in november 2010. It's great with you traveling for business as it's in the heart of Singapore cbd. The hotel itself is not impressive,staff is ok. Pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Grand Prix plus a few extra nights (9 nights, 10 days) , got it as a mystery deal in WOTIF.com.. probably one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at in a long time, the mini bar is free, the wireless is free.. room service was round the clock.. food was nice and typically in a hotel a little over priced... The the room service was nice and was done every day unless you put a sign up on the door.. the rooms aren't really that big but for 2 people it was perfect, I really don't see what people are complaining about space? maybe because they need to complain about something. The staff was really nice, they knew what they were doing. The only gripe was the laundry service it was quite expensive per ITEM but i think that if you are travelling and paying people to do your laundry its not going to be cheap and its a holiday.. :) definitely recommend it to anyone going there for trip away, and will be a returning customer sometime soon! The VALET was very helpful, we were running late to the GP and we told the valet if we can order a taxi.. he did all he can to help us and we managed to get there on time!! But they definitley are up there with the best hotels i have stayed at. GREAT LOCATION! walking distance to everything.... :)

Reviews.Title: “100% halal food, great hotel and fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: 2C_is_2know
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for halal food in a hotel , this is it! 100% Smoke free too!! The food was super good, the breakfast buffet wonderful....we had a buffet dinner here once and I cannot say how fantastic it was- the presentation and the taste was great! I wish there were more hotels like this one in Thailand , China and other places where there is no assurance if there is any lard used in cooking. For those who want to have alcohol , the hotel does have it in the minibar too. Btw, minibar is replenished for free every day- wifi throughout the hotel is for free including all rooms! If you can afford to then pls take the club room as it gives you the perks of free snacks and drinks thru different times of hte day. Now for the service- Ihave to give this hotel full marks- my husband has soy milk and after the first day when the hotel was informed , every single day the Carousel staff ensured that he could have the soy milk without asking again- they even remembered our family members and our room numbers! Oh yes- the location!! on Scotts road which is connected to orchard road stone throw away- couldn't be any better!! If there was a little something that bothered me - it would be the view-there was none from any rooms in the hotel! Gym could have been bigger and better equipped too! The rooms were great but I feel that the hotel designer could have done a better job by using more up to date designs instead of traditional ones. The staff outside the room could also be a little more careful about their voices. Late check out was not possible even though we had two club rooms. However, they were nice enough to let us use the club lounge facility till our departure time including the high tea. Will stay there again and again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Didier
Reviews.Content: This Business Hotel is nicely located on Scotts road within 2 mins walk to Ion shopping mall and all surrounding attractions. The room was quite spacious, standard and clean. Wifi worked well and was free.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: hateswork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with 2 young children and we were all able share the one standard room. We were able to use a baby cot at no extra charge. The rooms are not overly large though the bed was comfortable. The pool was never busy. Conveniently there is well stocked supermarket on the corner with Orchard road. The only problem for us was that the front entrance had steps with no ramp which is a bit of a hassle for prams. This was our first time staying near Orchard road as we normally stay in the Marina Bay area which I must say I still prefer, though at the time of booking this hotel was significantly cheaper. I would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: McPegasus74
Reviews.Content: The room was dingey (our room in a local hospital was better!). The facilities were average. The atmosphere non-existent The food very average too. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lindy004
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Club Room for 4 nights. The room was refurbished, comfortable and a good size. I would thoroughly recommend a Club Room. The staff in the Club Lounge were very friendly and extremely helpful. At no time did we feel like just a room number. I cannot say enough about the manager of the Lounge. She was there to welcome guests from 8:00am to 8:00pm every day - always with a welcome chat and smile. The Netspresso machine and Mini-bar in the room are a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location with efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: millhouze
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Hotwire so didn't actually know which hotel until after the booking just the area, did mean our price was a bit lower than the advertised rates. There it's rated 4.5 stars, bit of an odd rating. Due to flight delays we arrived 12 hours late at 5am, so taxi from airport was pretty quick. Door people and reception were efficient and friendly helping with bags and getting us booked in quickly which was great as by that time we were pretty exhausted. We were warned a couple of times about the no smoking policy, not a problem for us but if you're a smoker then I would avoid this hotel as the excess charges are very steep - however, for a non-smoker it's great,. Room was clean and a good size, decent bathroom and free mini bar and free WiFi. The mini bar is pretty basic but it's a couple of cans of beer, a couple of soft drinks and some crisps each day which is good to pack for the trips around the city. I can't comment on restaurant as we didn't use (there's so many other places to eat in Asia) but there were plenty of people in there each day. Hotel is a very short walk from the MRT station at Orchard (which can be used as an underpass to get across the busy streets) and the bus stops on Orchard road so it's really easy to get around by public transport. There's a few big Malls within walking distance and also the big Newton Hawker centre is within walking distance, however, it's a pretty mediocre place compared to say the Maxwell centre in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “more than expectation”
Reviews.Author: adytrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed Royal plaza on scott in march 2011 for 2 nights, before arrival I was in pan pacific ranked #2/255 for 2 nights, and shangri la rasa sentosa for another 2 nights, All were Ok, but royal plaza was another thing: Friendly staff , superb location, large comfortable room(Club Lounge) highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: fred d
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. That's it! It looks tired, the outlooks from the rooms we saw were not terrific and the front desk staff were unhelpful. The first room we were assigned looked like they had stuck a bed in a corridor. Our complaint took ages to resolve and the resolution was due to our persistence rather than the front desk's assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and brilliantly located”
Reviews.Author: Robsmodern
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights, coming for business but staying for the weekend for leisure. There were numerous high points: warm and friendly staff (who were willing to clean the room around my schedule, after I had to spend most of the morning and early afternoon working in the room), a very comfortable bed, free wifi, dual-nozzle shower (rain and handheld), iron + ironing board in every room, and all the usual comforts. The location was also great, being directly on Orchard Road, only a short walk from the MRT stop and lots of shopping. I'm hard pressed to think of anything wrong. I guess that, being a five-star hotel, its advertised prices are a bit steep, but if you look online at some travel aggregator websites, you should be able to find a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Orchard”
Reviews.Author: AV_Surrey
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel for short stay in Singapore. Handy location for shoppers as its in the heart of Singapore's shopping belt. They offered free wi-fi and free minibar but with limited selection. Its funny that mini bars are well stocked in the room when they paid for but when it comes to free then they contain the most basic drinks (water, coke and beer maybe) !! The staff are nice and polite but a little stingy when it comes to late check out. I was only offered an extra 30 minute when asked for 3 hour extra due to late evening flight. Fully non smoking hotel a big plus !!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish stay on Scotts”
Reviews.Author: cplu
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by a friend. Great location. Mini bar did not have a lot of choice but very nice to have for free. Very comfortable bed. Nice pool and lounge bar. Would definitely stay again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, maintanance of rooms should be much better”
Reviews.Author: Mikkelmann
Reviews.Content: the hotel was recommended by a colleague. The location is very good. The rooms are actually modern but not good maintained. The shower head was broken, but even after three days it was not noted by the service. Free Wifi and minibar included in the booked rate was a plus. But the refill after the first day was only working after asking the reception.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: iamsita
Reviews.Content: In my opinion Royal Plaza on Scotts is one the best hotels in Singapore. Certainly best location (intersection Orchard-Scotts Rd).One of the several (few?) hotels that offer free internet access in hotel and free minibar. Coffee tea maker available. The superior rooms are roomy enough and if you're lucky some rooms position the wardrobe in the corner creating a dressing space. No bathtub in the superiorroom but the shower is great with complete bathroom amenities. The Carousel restaurant offer big buffet. One big plus for my family is the fact that it is a no smoking hotel. Pricewise, they seem to increase every year, but compared to other hotels, and the facilities that they offer, I believe it is worth it. Do use online booking sites like booking.com, wotif or agoda, you will likely find a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but Dated”
Reviews.Author: Estaban46
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Royal Plaza for 2 weeks. Usually I stay at the Marriott across the street but because of the F1 I had to book another hotel. I upgraded to the club level and enjoyed the lounge. Service in the lounge is excellent! The rooms are a little dated and the pool / gym are not even worth a visit. I will probably go back to the Marriott across the street on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Chloe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the centre of Singapore. Price per night is vey reasonable for Singapore standards and the quality of the hotel is fantastic. Will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good deals available”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: booked this through a deal on wotif at S$203 a night with the free mini bar (2 beers, 3 soft drinks per day) and free internet (free expresso maker in your room as well). Location to Orchard Rd and MRT is good. Rooms are partly dated, partly renovated but overall not problem. I would prefer to give this 3 and a half instead of a 3 - for $200 a night its a deal Check-in staff are great

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: JJReid1030
Reviews.Content: My husband and I landed in Singapore after a 24 hour journey from Africa at 0600 and unfortunately, our room wasn't ready. We knew this might happen but the staff were accommodating and gave us access to the business lounge. The rooms are an adequate size, not overly big but not too crammed. The bathroom was fabulous as we loved the separate shower and bath. We also were so thankful for the complimentary mini bar and internet. Both were great perks and it's those things that set a hotel apart. The best part of the hotel was its fabulous location - if you want to be in the heart of the shopping district, this is it! Endless shopping and restaurants are right out the front door.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Fassa_10
Reviews.Content: What can I say..the hotel is fantastic. My husband & I stayed there once before and enjoyed it so much that we look forward to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversay in April. There's alot of nice hotels nearby but we love this hotel much more. Staff are very nice & very accomodating

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CENTRAL POSITION”
Reviews.Author: guliver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RP for 2 days from the UK on way to Bali it was a great 2 days spent the second day at Universal Studios as shopping for us is not important and what we saw was very expensive as we live so near London and cheaper prices, We payed the extra to stay club and thats well worth the extra cost for the luxury of the club lounge and all its extras ( beleive me the cocktails top shelf, wines etc is well worth it to us as i said all these things were so expensive in Singapore for us, here in the UK good bottle of Australian wine £5.00 $10 SD ) My only dissapointment with the hotel was that i had e mailed before i left UK that it was my wifes big birthday we were celebrating this trip i had celebrated my trip in Mar by going to Aus ( so we know the prices are good or even in Singapore for Australians but with the pound being so low people never tell about the cost of living in Australia or singapore for us Brits and exchange rates ) i was e mailed back from RP that something would be done for my wife but on arrival and latter nothing was apparent that anything was done so i asked at reception and reception said it was in the system so i emailed again from my note book and told of my dissapointment we left on the Mon at 10.00 for the airport and never got the suprise for my wife i am sure that this is a fault of the staff in not recognising when i brought it to their attention , I would still reccomend this hotel and would sugest the Club upgrade as excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great service”
Reviews.Author: Glennie01
Reviews.Content: We normally stay 5* in the Marina area, so was good to stay back on Orchard again purely for the buzz of the city. I initially was disappointed with the hotel entrance, and as we arrived people nearly jumped into our taxi before we had time to alight,which gave me the impression that taxis were a little hard to get. However that said, the lobby was pleasant and we were met by a staff member and directed to reception. We had booked a club room so was then taken to the designated checkin which was handled very efficiently. The first room they gave us was overlooking the car park, but changed without fuss to one with a better outlook. The room was pleasant and the bathroom rather nice I thought. We loved the club lounge with afternoon tea and evening drinks. The lounge food was very good and replenished frequently, with drink service being very efficient as well. The atmosphere in the lounge was very very nice and the staff there particularly pleasant. If you can afford it, I would recommend upgrading to the Club level as it was certainly worth the extra. We did not have breakfast in the lounge as people had said the selection was better downstairs in the general restaurant and we found it to be excellent. The seafood buffet is also great and has won awards. The key thing with this hotel is the friendly, efficient staff, good breakfast and a very convenient location. I was happy that we had stayed here this time. Yes I would stay here again. It is not 5* but is certainly 5* hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid independent hotel”
Reviews.Author: choo-choodaz
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in the heart of Singapores shopping district of orchard.O n arrival was upgraded to premier room,nice room with good bathroom and a free minibar and nespresso machine.Was able to extend our checkout to 6 pm thanks to the very helpfull Jessica on the front desk,staff very polite and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite stop in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: mpmilestogo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel a number of times on business travel. Enjoyed the hotel, its character, the hotel staff, the cold beer. The location is simply fantastic. Walking to malls, shopping, other restaurants is so easy. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Teddies
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Hotel is in prime location - Singapore's shopping strip, food is available everywhere you turn (from cheap to premium), surrounded by malls after malls, easy access to various public transport options - the train, the bus - hotel room is fantastic and food at Carousel is just exceptional. If you decide to stay here when in Singapore (and i'd recommend that you try at least once), check out their swanky espresso machine in the rooms :) Pretty awesome. Views from the rooms are not fantastic though - but hey, who's staying in the entire time when the world outside is dying for your company right! Staffs are friendly too! From doorman, to restaurant, to concierge and front desk - A+ standard! Good stay. I had a good time. Not cheap, but value for money :)

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoonjunkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 3 nights of our 17 day holiday at the Royal Plaza On Scotts in Singapore. I could have stayed a year. This hotel is one of the finest I have ever stayed in. It is in the best location to all the high end shopping on Orchard Rd that Singapore in known for. Ion center is less than a block away and thus starts the endless march of the malls. The MRT station is right there and will take you anywhere in Singapore, buses run regularly and there is always a cab at the lobby door waiting to take you to your next sight. The hotel is clean as can be and the bed was so comfortable! The mini bar was free. We had tea and treats in the lounge overlooking the city every afternoon and were served like royalty! The restaurant had the best variety of food and I couldn't wait for breakfast every morning. The staff were friendly, professional and knowledgeable about the city and its tourist sights. What great hotel and check out the wonder tea shop right next door! If you are planning a trip to Singapore this hotel will give you great value for your money and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: spike2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed in RP on Scotts for 2 x 3 night visits. Staff were extremely nice and no one passed you without a hello. Great service in the executive lounge,,we were lucky enough to get upgraded to the Emerald suite on our second three night visit and it was amazing. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, great location, great staff, good food and service second to none. Again thanks to all the staff in RP on Scotts for a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “great for my business trip.”
Reviews.Author: benijones
Reviews.Content: I used this amazing hotel for my business trip and loved its location. the staff were great and friendly and helped in my every need. i will be returning in a couple months to stay again. room was great size and air con very strong. a great trip all round.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MrCents
Reviews.Content: I stayed here upon recommendation and I was not disappointed. The hotel was in a great location, just off Orchard Rd and very close to the MRT. It was a clean and tidy hotel. I room I had was great- free broadband (wired), mini bar (a couple of beers and some soft drinks/juice) and a Nespresso machine. The buffet breakfast had a good selection and was nice. The staff were also very friendly, which always makes a stay more pleasant. Anyone wanting to stay on Orchard Rd would do well to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Fasted09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend with my partner and we love the location of the hotel. It is in the heart of Orchard road and and you in the heart of the city. You must go for the Buffett breakfast...great selection of breakfast and we love it. Enjoy a great breakfast and then walk it off by shopping in Singapore. Staff service was also a plus. Overall no complaints from us and yes, we will come back again as we enjoy shopping in Singapore as it is also one of the safest city in the world where you can walk back to your hotel at 3 or 4 in the morning, and feel perfectly safe.

Reviews.Title: “If you fancy a treat, upgrade to the club rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy_Mango
Reviews.Content: Five of us went on holiday to celebrate a milestone birthday and upgraded to the club rooms. Have stayed in many hotels before with Club Rooms, but the RP on Scotts was great. Singapore Slings a plenty and lots of nice treats. The high tea was excellent too. Well worth the extra money as the drinks, and food kept cming. Staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual”
Reviews.Author: bodpa
Reviews.Content: I stay in the Royal Plaza each time I am in Singapore. Second time this year ; this time I stayed nights. Confortable, good location, nice people ... What else ? :). The buffet is also very good, and a large choice for breakfast. The hotel is at the corner of Scotts and Orchard, the main avenue for shopping. Taxis and metro are available just from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle..if there is a middle (!) of Singapore, near various malls.”
Reviews.Author: HongKongCallisto
Reviews.Content: Voted best independent hotel, the Royal is good (I couldn't rate it that so it comes as an average) for many things - except the gym (tiny, grubby with a smell of sweat!), the pool (small)and the fact that it is a completely non-smoking hotel (which I totally understand would be a bonus to non smokers) On the plus, the rooms are good sizes, free wifi, nice rainbath showers, nespresso coffee machines, free beer and diet coke in the minibar - which is an unusual touch and the restaurant - although fairly cafe-like has a great selection for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Sasa803
Reviews.Content: It's right next to Orchard Station which is very convenient. You have easy access to many malls such as ION. Everything is complementary in their mini bar. It is great to have a netspresso in the morning. They also offer free wireless internet for their guests. The price is friendly. It's totally worth it. I would recommend this hotel to my friends if they go to Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, thoughtful & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tdav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few nights at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary. To our pleasant surprise, we were given a complimentary upgrade for our special occasion along with access to the Club Lounge! The hotel also thoughtfully left a cake for us in our room. The hotel is conveniently located and the nearest MRT station is a short walk away. We found the staff to be friendly and extremely helpful, and we really loved our room! Sure, the view wasn't the greatest, but we aren't the sort of folks who spend ages staring out of our hotel room window. :-) We had a fantastic stay at Royal Plaza on Scotts and definitely hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mayshalws
Reviews.Content: Check-in done in few minutes and smooth. Staffs are fine and friendly. The deluxe room size is considered fine but the view is facing car park. The bed is comfortable but not fancy the pillows at all. The air-con is not strong enough and 1 of the lighting condition was not working well but we never asked for room changing as we stayed 1 night only. Our room came with breakfast. Overall the breakfast was not bad. Love the fresh squeeze orange juice and must try noodle soup.

Reviews.Title: “Thts not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ratinghotels
Reviews.Content: entrance ok... reception ok....rooms are like a 2 star hotel...why? small no matter standard room or deluxe...tv screen must be the 1st ones made as plasma(tv control was no working), carpet old fashion and too old, decoration ungly, wallapapers must be there since 1900, bathroom ungly with minimum light, showher dirty, but the most intersting was the view from the 5th, 8th and even higher .....instead of having nice view of th city u have th view of parking building!!!!!!!!!! i ll never stay there again....unfo i ve prepaid all days due to f1 ....if i havent i would have left on the 1st day....realy dont get how this hotel has overall 8.4 when others much better than this have 8 or 7.5....only location was good since orchrd road( not only) is 3 min away....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynda k
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, although the man at reception upon our arrival could have been more helpful, I just asked for a small jug of milk for our room as I dislike powdered creamer and he refused to get this for me, said I had to go to the room and call room service and refused to do this for me, I was most displeased by his response, however the room service men were excellent and couldn`t do enough for us. Apart from that, pool and room were good ! Although, we paid way too much for this room as it was supposed to be a superior room. It was NOT, simply an ordinary room and paid the most for this hotel over our 5 week holiday period. It was certainly overpriced for an ordinary room athough I was assured it was a superior room !!! Ask for a room high up as we heard a lot of traffic noise even on the 5th Floor, windows were not double glazed !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable in great location”
Reviews.Author: Macloo
Reviews.Content: Great access to the MRT and taxis here. I got a good deal on the lowest class room through Hotels.com. Asked about an upgrade but it was $60/night, so I declined. The room was spacious w/ two full-size beds, a nice desk and a decent-size flat-screen TV. Breakfast was not included, and I did not add it (I wouldn't eat $30 worth of breakfast). However, the free in-room wi-fi WAS included, and the free mini-bar WAS included. I quickly found my way to the Food Republic food court at the nearby Wisma Atria shopping mall, and between the wide selection there and the Starbucks immediately outside the front door of the RP, I was all set. I was completely satisfied with this hotel and would recommend it. And it's all non-smoking too!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel in good location but doesn't try very hard”
Reviews.Author: 2DSEIS
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location in downtown Singapore. Probably a good place to stay if on vacation, but not the best place to be if on business travel. There is no wireless at reception, in the lobby or restaurant and the wireless connection in the room is sporatic at best. No ATM in the hotel. Unlike most good hotels, laundry service here takes a full day at best (I suspect they take the laundry to a third party vendor outside the hotel) so not a good idea to expect routine laundry service if you are just staying overnight. The internet connection in the "business center" is strange with firewalls interfering with the most basic of websites. The gym is lame, with only a few cardio machines and no free weights. The hotel does offer 24 gym access though. The pool is medium sized and not bad. The rooms are clean, and the staff are very courteous, helpful and responsive. The food in the restauarant is especially good, I would suggest having breakfast here in the morning prior to the day's events. I would suggest this hotel if on vacation to Singapore with most time spent outside the hotel. If on business travel with a need for in-house services I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it high enough!”
Reviews.Author: NMahendran
Reviews.Content: Great experience. 3rd time I've stayed here both with family and alone. Personalised service. Friendly, attentive staff who can't do enough for you. Great with children. Great location. Rooms well equipped including coffee machines using individual pods. Is pricey but well worth the money. No more expensive than comparable hotels Down side! Poor views and rooms can be overlooked. Breakfast very good and to suit all tastes I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service!”
Reviews.Author: adonthemove
Reviews.Content: Located right off the famous Orchard road, RP is a good hotel for business travelers. First about the hotel: The checkin was quick and easy. I got a nice deal at booking.com and I just had to show up. The room was comfy and spacious. It was nice to keep the minibar and internet complimentary. The speed was good. Service - excellent. The location - just perfect. Taxi stand at the entrance, Train station - 2 minutes walk, shopping - all around, great restaurants and bar, even a movie theatre - all within 2-5 minutes walk. This was my second stay and will definitely stay at RP again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sharon H
Reviews.Content: We love the fact that the Royal Plaza is completely non-smoking, that it is so close to the shopping and culinary delights of Orchard road, that it is handy to public transport (MRT within a few minutes walk, bus stop and a plentiful supply of taxis near the front entrance), that you can walk to the gorgeous botanic gardens in about 15 minutes if you are feeling energetic. The hotel itself is comfortable and understated. Our room was quiet, pristine and quite spacious; the rain shower in the bathroom and the complimentary drinks in the mini bar were most welcome at the end of a day's sightseeing. The general amenities are excellent with free, fast internet access on the second floor, and a well-equiped gym and very pleasant swimming pool (OK, not huge, but still big enough) on the fifth floor. We did not have any meals in the hotel as they are rather expensive for our budget, but there are plenty of good, inexpensive eateries in the vicinity. What impressed us most, though, was the uniformly courteous and resposive attitude of the friendly staff in all areas of customer service. The hotel can be proud of its staff. We certainly hope to stay at the Royal Plaza again on our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nespresso !! yes !! hotel not luxury”
Reviews.Author: LadyC77
Reviews.Content: Lovely and helpful staff and very good location. Hotel is muslim owned so no pork products are served. If you can not start the day without real bacon with your breakfast in the morning ( as opposed to the turkey bacon they serve.....) you will be disappointed. However the very large breakfast buffet has so much choice you will not miss the bacon and ham at all. Huge selection of breads, cakes, someone will make you a fresh fruitjuice in any flavour combination you would want. I travel a lot and this is one of the best breakfast buffets I have experienced. The promised free minibar is slightly disappointed as it does not get refilled every day and contains water, a bottle of beer and some coca-cola and should be re-named as free soft drinks!. The nespresso coffee machine in the room makes up for the disappointment of the minibar though, very very nice, although again the nespresso cups with the coffee in it do not get refilled every day. Really great location just off Orchard road and I want to specially mention the guys at the concierge desk who were extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to ensure that even at the busiest of times they would get us me taxi to take to me the office and explain the address to the non english speaking drivers. The pool area is disappointing as it small and does not catch much sun. The hotel itself and the rooms look a bit dated, however compared to the global chain hotels in the same area the hotel is good value for money, just don't expect this to be a luxury 5 star hotel, it is more 4 star plus than true luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Many Indonesians/Malaysians stay here”
Reviews.Author: applecart3355
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Great service, excellent location (there is a bus stop in front of the hotel that takes you to the main attractions in SG, MRT station is 5 minutes walk away, and Orchard!), and very good for value. Surprisingly many Indonesians/Malaysians stay here. The only downside is the tiny pool--if that really matters.

Reviews.Title: “Huge drop in service standard!”
Reviews.Author: Cryscrys82
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here a few times celebrating birthdays and anniversary, where I really enjoyed my stay, I am appalled by the drop in standard by the service staff and the hotel environment in general. (My stay has not ended yet! Currently typing out this review on the sofa in the hotel room.) Firstly, driving into the driveway to get to the carpark was a headache! A few tour buses were waiting for the tourists, which was perfectly fine. But a JB car was parked in the only lane left, with the hazard light switched on. A line of 8 -9 cars were formed just because of this car. Not only did the hotel staff not advice the driver to shift his car, the hotel staff simply walked away even after seeing the jam it has caused. After waiting for 20 mins, the tour buses drove off, then we could finally make our way to the car park. Next, Check-in was fast and the concierge was nice enough to upgrade us to a Club room as it was our anniversary. :) After a rest, we went down to purchase a cake for our friend's birthday party in the evening. Walked into Carousel (cafe) and was mesmerized by their wide selection of exquisite cakes. We decided on a salted caramel with toffee cake (looked superb and yummy) and informed the cafe staff that we would like to purchase it. Upon knowing we are hotel guests, she asked us for our room number and told us to collect it later when we are going out in the evening. We thought that was a great gesture as we need not place the cake in our room or fear that it will melt before the party. However, when we went down in the evening to pick up the cake for the party, the lady told us the cake we chose was sold. We asked if she had kept the cake aside knowing that we wanted it, she simply walked away to talk to another colleague. Then that colleague came over and said:" What's done is done. Your cake is not available. You can choose from the remaining cakes (only 4 left, as compared to the previous 12)." Without even apologising, the lady went to attend to other guests. Such great service!!!!!!! The next morning, we went down to the cafe for our buffet breakfast. It was rather crowded. Had to wait for about 15 mins, amidst a crowd asking for the price of the buffet and etc., we were taken to our seats. The waiter asked us for our preference of hot drinks and we ordered tea. After which, he laid out the napkins (to indicate the seat was taken), and we went to the buffet line. After getting some omelette and lovely sausages, we came back and realised our seats were taken. Walked over to the hotel staff to inform him that our seats were taken. He (looked super tired at 9.30 in the morning) looked into the air and walked away. Repeated the question a few times, and he still did not seem to respond. Another staff came over and got us a new seat. Apparently, the "sleepy, blur, tired" staff had gave our seats away. We looked at the japanese ladies seated at our seats, and I guess they must be wondering why they had tea even before they ordered and napkins all unfolded. GREAT service once again!!!!!!!!! Customer service is very important in the hotel industry! Since there are many 5-star hotels in Singapore offering top service, why should we pay and stay in a place that does not treat their guests well. This will DEFINITELY be my last time staying here. Choosing Hyatt, Goodwoodpark and Marriott is way better than Royal Plaza on scotts!

Reviews.Title: “Well kept rooms in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Manolo_Asia
Reviews.Content: If you go to Singapore for shopping spree and you want to rest after a long day out, this is a great choice in the Orchad Road area. No signs of wear and tear in the room and lot of amenities included.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice close to Orchard”
Reviews.Author: AustG
Reviews.Content: We decided on RP on Scotts because of it location close to Orchard Rd and we had our 2 teenage daughters in tow. The rooms were nice and comfortable with plenty of space for luggage and to store all the shopping of course. Location wise just around the corner to Orchard and across the road from the Far East Plaza great place for teenagers to shop. The room we had included a free mini bar with orange juice, soft drinks, water and beer that was restocked every day and came in handy after a day of sightseeing and shopping in the heat. Pool area was small but nice with areas both in the sun but also plenty of shade but don't know if it would be that great for those with small children as it was quite deep. We didn't take the breakfast option so I cannot comment on that but others there said it was very good and the restaurant always seems very busy. Staff were helpful and as I said locality was great for those who want easy access to Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Orchard Road area..”
Reviews.Author: billyaztec
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice recently during August 2011. The service from staff was very welcoming and efficient. No problems at all. I wasn't happy at first, being given the card key to the room, and heading off to the lift only to find I couldn't get the lift to operate. Nobody told me I needed to use my card key each time in the lift before it would move. Never experienced that before. The rooms were very well attended to, and all the facilities were good The beds were OK, but not as comfortable as I had hoped. Breakfast wasn't included in the deal, and although costing around $30 each, I would highly recommend it, just for the excellent variety of foods on offer. The Orchard road district is right next door, and there are plenty of taxis calling in constantly. Be careful with the cabs (as usual). I was asked for $30 for a trip from the airport.. the taxi had a meter showing $22 and another screen showing $30 which the driver argued was the correct amount..was tired from the flight and gave in to him, when most times I wouldn't and probably taken his number to complain. All in all, I think the Royal Plaza on Scotts is worth considering if you are coming to Singapore..I know that's where I will be next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Little known treasure of Orchard Road area”
Reviews.Author: la_speranza
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the good reviews of trip advisor (despite some bad ones), I was pleasantly surprised by everything. From the friendly and efficient check in, free upgrade to premiere room (with bath). A reliable free wifi which works perfectly everyday during my stay. A nespresso machine which works finel. A small selection of free drinks and snacks in the room which was a nice touch. An ultra comfortable king bed. Excellent bathroom facilities in clean working condition (rain shower included!). Very quiet at night which gives good sleep. i just could't fault this wonderful hotel, which was hardly mentioned in any tourist books in the market. I booked this hotel with Agoda at a very special market rate of around SGD200 per night, it's even cheaper than some of the fancier boutique hotels dotted around Singapore, often with small rooms and sometimes not even with windows. I am really happy with my choice, and will choose to stay here again next time without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Quality @ Royal Plaza On Scotts”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth, arrive really late (close to midnight); the hotel was so fully booked so we weren't able to get the room we wanted (on a high floor) but they compensated us by upgrading us to a suite... Thank you to Anita at the reception for being so considerate. The room is very nice. We love the comfy beds, a nice touch of nespresso machine, plus the big LCD in the living room. However, if you care for the hotel with the view, this surely isn't your type of a hotel since the view from both sides are overlooking parking structures. Nothing to brag about it. The location of the hotel is flawless. Close to MRT station, cinema, and Orchard shopping district. We're really having a great time staying there. Will come back for sure and hopefully they will upgrade us again next time. Thanks Royal Plaza on Scotts! David

Reviews.Title: “Really must do better”
Reviews.Author: AlLeGrand
Reviews.Content: Overall my room was good. It was clean, fresh and very comfortable. The bathroom was fine and the shower hot and of decent pressure. But that's where it ends. Check-in was terrible and checkout was no better, very slow and very disorganised. At check-in , the receptionist loudly announced to my colleague that she required another credit card as his had been declined. It had not been declined, she had failed to swipe it properly but did not seem to know the difference between a failed transaction and a declined one. This was embarassing for my co-worker but she could not care less and seemed to think it was funny. I have written before about the crowded buffet and its poor menu, no improvement there and in fact I think it has gotten just a little bit worse. Some tables were so close together that you rubbed elbows with the person next to you. Check-out took over 20 minutes for a one-night room charge with no extras! Stay at the RP for a comfortable room and a good location but forget decent service, its way too busy for that and the staff don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Most central location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Nick T
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around for decades under various names. It is located on Scotts Road near the corner of Orchard road and is therefore very central to all main shopping areas, Orchard MRT station and all the night life is walking distance away. Rooms are in good order for a hotel of this vintage and it has all the ambience and sophistication of a good upmarket Asian hotel. The lobby bar (level 2) is great for a met and greet drink before heading out for dinner. Did not check out the gym or pool on this trip but it was always above par on past trips. Internet was complimentary and worked well. Breakfast was satisfactory and included Roti Canai which is a must for any visit to Singapore/Malaysia. This is definitely my preferred hotel for both business and leisure trips to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, breakfast & services”
Reviews.Author: BZmum
Reviews.Content: Excellent services from time of reservation, made a few booking changes, had specific requests including early check in, all taken care of upon check in which was quick. Room minibar was not replenished yet but housekeeping came quickly when highlighted. When told we don't want beer, the staff offered to exchange the beer for another bottle of juice & water for my children. They remembered this the next day and had the extra juice & water ready for us, which was a nice gesture. This is one of the few 5* hotel which doesnt make a fuss about 2 young children rooming in with parents with existing bedding at no extra charge, or taking breakfast together with parents. Breakfast was one of the best i've come across. Beds were very comfy, room was clean and quiet, free wifi is a big bonus. Pool and gym a bit small but understandable for a predominantly business hotel. Those complaining about the pool/gym size should really have gone to beach resorts instead. To me best part about the hotel is the strategic location - I could walk back to drop off my shopping bags before heading for more shoppings or to catch the mrt. Will come back again if rate stays reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Poor service & Reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Yogesh J
Reviews.Content: The rooms are OK, Internet & Mini bar is free. Speed is good. Bar meets single person's requirement. Nespresso in room is nice touch for fresh coffee. However the services at front desk sucks! If you need even 1 hr extension, they charge you for 1/2 day and Dont consider any request. So if you plan to leave the hotel before noon then it is worth looking at, else do not consider them. Almost all the other compareable hotels in Orchard area always offer extension till 2 pm and if you request them, normally the manager obliges you till 3 pm. But here, Mr. Rendi is very tough! He will not let you stay longer if you dont pay for 1/2 day which i felt diluted the entire good experience of my stay! Such arrogance is ensures that guests dont come again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Houston2HCMC
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Singapore for a long weekend and all of our hotels we usually stay at didn't have any specials running, so we decided to try something new. We chose Royal Plaza on Scotts because we like being near Orchard road. This hotel could not be in a better location. We got a terrific rate that included free internet and the minibar (just a few drinks, really, but very nice). But the thing that really won us over was the service. It was truly unbelievable. From check-in, Jessica at the front desk made sure we had connecting rooms as we had our 4 children with us. At breakfast, our waiter got special drinks for our kids and hunted down some plain rice for my son since there wasn't any on the buffet. My other son has very severe food allergies, the cook made him a dish that we were sure was free form any of the foods he can't eat, no questions asked. The doorman was helpful with the taxis (we have had trouble in the past with such a big family, but he made sure the taxis always took us). And at checkout, the bellman came to our door within minutes of calling to pick up our luggage. By the time we checked out, it was all put into the cab for us ready to head to the airport. While this hotel wasn't our first choice for this trip, it will be in the future. Thank you Royal Plaza on Scotts for such a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Reception Sneer when asked when can we have the room at Check Inn”
Reviews.Author: Tsa_RyszardMom
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate at hotel web at 246 sgd ++ but I suspect it lead to hotel misstreatment to me.if i only knew,I will definately stay elsewhere. The hotel recieved intensive award as independent hotel i south asia,mind you its not their award winning service! Several downside Id experiencing during my stay at room 1144: 1.my room ready around 17:30 in afternoon,which having 2 kids quiet irritating & also had urgent appointment to see a doctor at 15:15,which I though the room ready at 14:00. Reception sneer when ask when the room ready,no apologize to me at all. When given room premiere like what my reservation was,but I was puzzle because reception told me i was given complimentary upgrade but no explainaton why they "cancel" the upgrade?? 2.No standardize service in room service,Yesterday didnt give milk for cereal,today they gived,???if we ordered cereal I expected should be given milk?? 3.Housekeeping maybe understaff or dont know,because my sons bolster missing in my room.Weve searched several hours couldnt find it,we enquire to housekeeping & in minute delivered my sons bolster.If we didnt ask,they took it for keeps I suppose.Weird and annoying,again no appologize.

Reviews.Title: “Standards have slipped”
Reviews.Author: Skylark9
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel many times but were disappointed this time. The room looked 'tired'. The coffee shop breakfast was not up to what we have seen before. An extended checkout was refused unless we paid, and the 'hospitality room' was the changing room at the pool which was in a non-AC area. Considering the high room-rate, we got a poor impression.

Reviews.Title: “A top place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Larryaustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the 70,s when it was the Holiday Inn it was great then and still is ,we used the deal to include use of Club Lounge which was handy because we came from Paris early and waited till our room was ready ,also included use of mini-bar and free Wi-Fi the room was excellent and all the staff friendly one nite was not enough we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jodi N
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for four days. The hotel is in a central location in Orchard. Close to MRT and and lots of designer shops. It would mostly appeal to those who would like to experience the excitement of lodging in the posh shopping hub of Singapore. There is also an affordable shopping centre with foodcourt across the road for those with a more restricted budget. Rooms are large with nice working desk and provides you with some free drinks and free internet. Hotel could improve with a bit of renovation. Despite this, the hotel offers excellent value for money considering that this is an up-market area of Singapore. Staff are also extremely helpful. Would highly recommend to those who wish to stay in the Orchard area at an affordable price provided that you have a good deal (around 200 Singaporean dollars per day).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but no late checkouts!..”
Reviews.Author: Triturator
Reviews.Content: This is a well positioned hotel for those who are after shopping in Orchard Road. The property is old but the rooms were renovated and the current style is simple, functional and no-nonsense. The carpet is too heavy to my taste and I felt some allergic reactions, however. The free wifi just works. There is a very good breakfast buffet. It's not cheap, of course: hotels in Singapore are now double the price of a similar property in Bangkok. It seems that there is zero tolerance for late check-outs, however: I asked to leave at 13h00 as opposed to 12h00 and was told that there would be a charge of SGD 150 for that. This is ridiculous, especially considering that in the previous day my room was only cleaned well after 13h00 despite the 'please make up my room' sign being lit the entire morning. Every hotel around the world allows one more hour free, but not here!..

Reviews.Title: “nice ambiance, location”
Reviews.Author: roopeshk
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, nice ambiance, the rooms were spacious with all amenities. the free internet access is a good option for the business travelers. the front desk staff were very helpful the same with all other staffs are gives you a very warm welcome and all at smiles ... a complementary breakfast should have been included in the basic package ... the location is good, accessible to public transports, shopping malls. The Starbucks outside the hotel is good for an evening coffee. If you are travelling in the evening back home, then you can checkout in the morning and keep the bags in the locker and collect them on the way to airport. Overall its a very nice hotel and comfortable for both business travelers and tourists....

Reviews.Title: “A Singapore Gem”
Reviews.Author: Coastersretreat
Reviews.Content: I stop-over at this hotel every now and again and each time I do I am reminded how good and great value it is. It is in the heart of the shopping district. The rooms are spacious, the air conditioner is neither too cold or hot; the bathroom is functional and private, and the bed so comfortable(perfect after a 12 hour flight). The bar fridge has free beer and sodas and there's a Nespresso machine. What more do you need for a 24 hour stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: michwong
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for just a couple of nights for a family vacation in Singapore and definitely can't fault its location! It's conveniently situated just opposite Far East Plaza, next to Isetan and opposite Tangs at Orchard Rd, and a few minutes walk from the Orchard MRT. Rooms are small, a little dated but compact and clean. They even have a Nespresso machine! We asked for a quiet room and was given one at the end - no complaints about that. Breakfast was great - good variety and food was generally quite good at their inhouse coffee house - Carousel. Staff were also friendly. One complaint is the main entrance of the hotel lobby does not have a ramp - only stairs. This makes it very inconvenient for guests with baby strollers, big luggages etc. I hope the hotel takes into account is to provide/ build a ramp in future. We were lucky that there were two of us to carry the stroller up and down the stairs and there was also a very friendly and helpful doorman (an old Indian/ Indian Muslim man - forgot his name though) who will help us out if he happens to be on duty and saw us struggling. However, we will consider being back, as we definitely can't fault the hotel's location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended for Famly”
Reviews.Author: PonsBLR
Reviews.Content: We had gone for a family short vacation to Singapore, three of us. I spent almost one week long browsing to figure out what hotel to book for stay. I had few specs... next to any MRT, in a safe and shopping area, 3 adult should be able to stay in a room, breadfast inclusion and flexibility in change of dates. With much research I booked on this hotel (reviews in tripadvisor also encouraging) and we did not get let down at all. We felt very comfortable right from check in and upto check out after 5 days. The pricing could have been better is the only negative(!) feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly and helpful staff, comfortable rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Bercilak
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights as part of a family holiday, the rooms were clean and well laid out, the location is absolutely fantastic, the internet connection was good and reliable, the free mini bar is a great addition and it is surprisingly quiet inside considering that it is in such a busy location. All of the staff are extremely friendly and will help you with anything. It was a good experience overall, and I would definitely return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Generally very good, let down by small but important touches.”
Reviews.Author: Darkheart
Reviews.Content: The problem this hotel has is that it is setting itself up against some the very best, most luxurious hotels in the world and compared to them it does not quite measure up.
