I stayed in a Club Deluxe room for 5 nights and in a 5* hotel I expect excellence, which isn't quite what you get. The room while being well laid out and adequately furnished had some rough edges, e.g. a mark on the ceiling left from a previous fitting that had not been properly finished and painted over. The bathroom sink would not hold water properly, continuously leaking into the drain, making it hard to shave. There was not always hot water available in the room, requiring me to boil a kettle occasionally, again something I don't expect to have to do in a 5*, particularly on an upgrade package! The hotel does not have a decent bar to speak of. There is only the "Ultra Lounge" which has a loud, annoying music combo in there most of the time and a few drunken tourists or the "Club Lounge" which was expensive and only opens occasionally. The onsite restaurant the "Carousel" is disappointing but not bad. So, the good stuff: It's a great location. The staff are very helpful and polite (this is however almost standard for Singapore). The beds are comfortable and the maid service is thorough and effective, so the rooms are clean and sheets fresh. The rooms are a decent size, the internet connection is reliable and fast, the decor is a bit bland but not offensive. Finally make sure you book through a "deal site", via Tripadvisor/Expedia or some other site as the hotels own website just charges full price and there are free upgrades and discount available via the portals. Overall I would have to say "should do better" unless it wants to slip to being merely average. If this were not a 5* hotel in Singapore I would definately have given it a "Good" rating but it is and so I think "average" is fair.

Reviews.Title: “The best Orchard location, 4 star with personal touches”
Reviews.Author: Andy7P
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - if you want Orchard area this is right on the intersection of Scotts/Orchard - couldn't be better 4 star - RP is not 5 star top of the line for Singapore (eg Shangri-La, etc), but the nicest of my recent 4 star stays here. My company pays in the 200-350 range, and for this price I really recommend the RP. Personal touches - staff go out of their way to talk to you, more than just a good morning. It sounds like a small thing, but it did make it feel very friendly Overall - It has been renovated with some modern but subtle touches. There is a great espresso maker in the room, plus a nice mini-bar. The pool area is classy and private with nice wooden decking and a cafe. 24 hour gym with brand new runners and stairs. Breakfast buffet is extensive, typical of local standards for this hotel type. Put together these make it less bland than the typical hotel of this type, I'll look here first next trip. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Delicious Breakfast, Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: NPaulPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on transit. Loved the location and the service. Breakfast @ carousal was the best I ever had. If you can afford book the Club room. Well worth it. We have stayed in a few hotels in singapore. This was really the best.

Reviews.Title: “When I think 5 star, I think top of their game...disappointing really.”
Reviews.Author: ooElektraoo
Reviews.Content: For a hotel to be 5 star I believe it should be exceptional. This was not a value for money hotel for me. In a city where you can take your pick of 5 star hotels, I found this one a bit old and weathered and by no means exceptional. There was also a strange smell that was quite strong lingering in the corridors. We got a superior room with free wifi and internet plus minibar. Breakfast was not included and for the price I think it should have been.Breakfast was an additional $33SGD per person.The room was ok in size for 2 nights.There was no view. We were on the 7th floor.The free mini bar consisted of i diet coke, i coke, i pack of oreos, I OJ & 2 bottles of water. There were 2 of us staying in the room. Although the hotel staff were pleasant enough they didn't ask any additional questions or volunteer any additional information such as where the tour desk was or whether we had any other requirements.We waited quite a while to check in even though there wasn't a crowd of people in front of us.They did ask us if we wanted to upgrade our room though and what that would cost. For those staying longer the upgrade deal included breakfast and a late checkout in the Club Room so perhaps that's worth considering.The great thing about this hotel is its location which is fantastic. It's 2 mins walk to the Orchard MRT and many shopping centres are near by including ION a large shopping complex. Across the road from Far East Plaza and next door to Pacific Plaza.When we asked for a late check out the price was really exhorbitant so we didn't proceed and end up hanging around the lobby.In essence this hotel isn't anything flash and I am sure there are better value for money hotels in Singapore.The hotel does have really good beds and noise wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “A truly business class hotel that offers excellent service in a centralised location.”
Reviews.Author: k9920105
Reviews.Content: Royal Plaza on Scotts is a hotel that shows its grandeur as you enter the lobby and the amazing service doesn't just stop there. Nice decor, personalable and efficient staff, free WiFi, free mini bar all contributes to its on going achievement as a 4* hotel. This is exactly the place to go if you want comfort but yet being able to enjoy its close distance to the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road and its surroundings. Highly recommended and well done to all its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Comfy”
Reviews.Author: ktine203
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on Scotts Road, near the shopping centre of Orchard Road. I booked my visiting Aunt and friend at this hotel and checked out out the place. This is really convenient if you shop. Not as expensive as typical hotels in the area. The rooms are large enough to be restful after a day of windowshopping. Very clean and quiet despite being near a crowded place. Downside is rather a busy hotel and amenities are not much. Internet is free, mini-bar is inclusive too and staffs are efficient. The breakfast buffet is overrated so skip it and just have go around orchard for a good restaurant or cafe. If i have some visiting friends, i will certainly recommend this place if they are here in SG for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Amenities. Free Internet!”
Reviews.Author: thelondonway
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago when it was first reopened. Doesn't look like much has changed (rooms could do with a bit of love). Housekeeping not so great, hair in bathroom and rubbish in drawer but I think this was a once off, the rest of the staff seemed great. Fantastic location. The Carousel Buffet is a must try when staying. Free Internet is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: monikatanu
Reviews.Content: The location is great, only steps away to malls in Orchard. The room is very much comfortable, especially the bed, and I love the mini bath-tub they have in the deluxe room - my toddler was very excited to take a bath there (we usually had trouble with take-a-bath routine in hotels with ceiling shower). The room size is perfect, not too big or too small. The staffs were very helpful when we arrived, and very friendly. Will be back, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: gavnasia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week. I got a package online which upgraded my room to a Premier room which I believe is the same as deluxe but has a bath tub included. The hotel is located right in the heart or Orchard Road shopping district which is pretty lively and if shopping is your thing then this is a great base. The hotel itself is probably 10-15 years old and is in very good condition. Overall it is kept to a high standard, both public and private rooms. Most of the staff are very helpful and room service was good. Rooms were cleaned quickly too. The only thing I can complain is the view wasn't fantastic. But if you were on the Scotts road side it is probably better. No matter anyway as all you have to do is take a stroll outside for some sweet city-scapes. Clarke Quay is a S$10 cab ride away. Overall this hotel is good value for money in Singapore. PS I highly recommend Muddy Murphys bar which is a ten minute walk away. A great spot to meet people and enjoy a few drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: AussieFem27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago with my mother. The hotel staff are the friendliest people I ever met ANC we didn't have to wait for anything as there were always concierges ready to help with anything. The buffet at their Carousel restaurant is just amazing. Any type of food you can think of. The lobby is very palatial. The main thing I love this hotel for, is because they really care about guests. We went to an Indonesian island for the day and were robbed. When we got room service that night, I casually mentioned it to the receptionist and they apologized and brought our dinner for free, with the manager bringing it to the room to see if we were ok. Then, in the morning, a surprise free breakfast in bed which was a fruit platter fit for a king! We felt very cared for and really appreciate this gesture. Next time I go to Singapore I will definitely stay here and I tell everyone I know how lovely this place is.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maridel0716
Reviews.Content: We checked in at Royal Plaza on Scotts last month and were totally amazed at how efficient checking in was. Everything was a breeze - from the time I made the booking online, they sent me reminder emails prior to my check in date, up to the actual check in date. I was anxious on our way to SG knowing that we will be arrving at night and based on previous experiences, we tend to wait and ended up not getting the kind of room that we've requested. But I was suprised when we got the hotel, our room was ready - no waiting involved. I got the kind of bed I specified on my reservation. I was offered their loyalty program which I joined, of course. The location of the hotel was perfect for our need. There's a 24 hour coffee shop and fast food place. I liked the Nespresso machine on our room and the fact that everything on the mini bar comes with the hotel rate. The bed was comfortable and I liked the furnitures in our room. Bathroom was decent and roomy. The staff were very warm and accomodating, always greeting us with their warm smiles. Needless to say, we are definitely coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - everything else mediocre”
Reviews.Author: thehoneymooner87
Reviews.Content: I booked RPS on the basis that it had received many good reviews and also because there was a deal on WOTIF. We had previously stayed at Mandarin Oriental the 2 nights before, so moving to RPS was a little bit of a shock. The lobby was chaotic - everyone was talking in extremely loud voices, the staff weren't as well-dressed, and I just found it rather annoying how many of the guests would use the lobby for their catching up session. Many times, we have walked down to the lobby only to find the equivalent of a marketplace going on there. The room was very ordinary - we booked the Deluxe room. The bathroom was also very ordinary. Nice enough but there was no WOW factor. However, the free wi-fi was a VERY nice touch as even Mandarin Oriental did not offer this service free of charge. Also, there was a Nespresso machine in our room AND the mini-bar was complimentary (one of the staff came up and explained this to us). I think it was these small touches that ultimately saved RPS and made the hotel memorable. The location was fantastic - it was brilliant to be able to walk straight home after a long day out shopping on Orchard Road. But other than that, I doubt we would come back and stay at RPS when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Will return. Clean, handy to MRT and polite staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bundyburt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and we were very happy with it's location, hotel cleanliness and courteous & polite staff. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer servce to applaud”
Reviews.Author: PeterJef
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean hotel, with excellent and friendly staff, and a well-considered approach to assisting customers. Price was also very keen and good value for money. Booking was easy - no problems and instantly confirmed. Through our error, my wife left her handbag (containing money, cards, passport and many valuables) in the taxi. The staff at check-in and the concierge had located the taxi, and had the bag returned in fifteen minutes - what an excellent welcome to the hotel, Singapore and the taxi driver. All the while they were extremely considerate toward her and did their utmost to ensure she was supported. My personal thanks for a great stay. You will never know how grateful we both were for your assistance in helping us with our needs when the bag was left in the cab. Your staff were magnificent (and the rest of the stay was too)

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Ask For Much More”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: Pretty much all you could want from a top four-star hotel -- central location, five-star staff, and comfortable, quiet and functional rooms. Speaking of the rooms, while not particularly large, they are smartly outfitted with: -- Free internet -- Complimentary mini-bar (water, orange juice, Tiger beer, Oreos, Coke, and Diet Coke), replenished daily -- Large work space/desk with an adjustable desk chair -- Nespresso coffee maker and L'Occitane bathroom amenities My only (minor) complaints would be about the gym (small and under-equipped), the club floor lounge (boring and minimal food selections at both breakfast and the evening cocktail hour), and exorbitant room service prices (eg, club sandwich = S$25, fish & chips = S$34). Overall, I would definitely return given the value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Travellingbeaver
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel, the last one being a year ago. It is very convenient to the Orchard Road shopping precinct and the MRT (underground train system). The service at checkin and checkout was fantastic - friendly faces eager to serve you. The concierge Ibrahim is a legend. He knows his stuff but also is provides friendly, helpful service - nothing is too much trouble. The breakfast spread is enormous - if you cant find something special amongst the wide selection on offer, you must have a problem! We stayed in the club room which had free minbar restocked daily and free wi-fi and the room rate included daily breakfast. The rooms are very comfortable and modern but don't expect any rooms with a view given the way the building faces. But no one going to Singapore does much more than sleep in their room surely! The e-concierge service is fantastic. I used it to book transport to/from airport/Changi and I also used it to get a recommendation for a special dinner with my wife. The system works really well. I also booked direct with the hotel rather than through an agent and found the deal was no different except that I could access the e-concierge service. Hotels in Singapore are not cheap (we stopped in Singapore on the way back from Cambodia and there was a marked difference in the costs - try 3-5 times dearer!!) but relatively speaking, RP on Scotts is pretty good value. I will stay there again when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: lb2007
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers spent 2 nights at the Royal Plaza on our way to Europe and we here very happy with the hotel. We had a bicycle (packed in a bike bag) with us which we thought we would have to squash into our room. Mr Razali, our concierge, saw the bike immediately and offered to store it during out stay. He was very pleasant and helpful and certainly an asset to the Hotel. Our rooms were clean, comfortable and interconnecting as requested. We had access to a free minibar, with complimentary water, coke, juice and oreo cookies. This was refilled daily. The location was fabulous, just off Orchard Road. We even walked to Newton Circus for dinner! MRT is near by and very easy to use. We didn't eat at the hotel at all, so can't comment on the food. However, there are plenty of places to eat in the area. We would definately consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Singapore hotel - Great Location, service and staff!”
Reviews.Author: OneInaMillion50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Plaza for one night on a stop-over in Singapore before moving on to Sydney. Great location, wonderful and friendly staff, automatically upgraded to deluxe room (because they had the room available), perfect bed, free internet and wireless, free water, soda and beer in the room mini-bar each day, and very quiet for it's location on Scots Road and Orchard Road. I would not hesitate for one moment to stay here again and recommend to all my friends and business colleagues. Well done Royal Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Just like coming home”
Reviews.Author: thebrews10
Reviews.Content: This was the fifth time we have stayed at this hotel and are not tempted to stay anywhere else. The rooms are spacious and comfortable but what makes the hotel special is the care and attention of the staff. I have never stayed in a hotel which makes me feel as welcome as the Royal Plaza. The hotel is in a good location, close to Orchard Road and Ion.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel will definetly come back”
Reviews.Author: neece_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, received a free upgrade on our room and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The free mini-bar is a great feature and we also had our own coffee maker. Location was great with bus stops out the front and a short walk to orchard road. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: shelley_75
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily because of it's location and the very good feedback from this site and other travel sites. Our booking was made through ratestogo but direct communication with the hotel was nothing but excellent. Even before our arrival, we were already convinced of the great service. Upon arrival, we were warmly received by hotel ambassador Rizhali (I think that's his name). He waited for us throughout check-in (which was a breeze) and took us to our room where he showed us the room features. I believe we were upgraded from a Superior room to a Deluxe room because there's a bath tub in our toilet. The free minibar (2 sodas, 2 beers, 2 bottled water, 1 juice and a pack of cookies) was replenished everyday, except on departure day. The Nespresso machine was just divine! There is a choice of 3 types of pillows and we opted for the non-feather pillow since we're allergic to down pillows. The room we got came with a power adaptor which was very helpful. If you look around, there are sockets all over the room -- by the work table, under the bed side table, by the tv, the walls, etc. I think this is a very generous feature of the room. Only part we were disappointed with is the dinner buffet. It is much raved and even got an accolade from Tatler Singapore. SO I guess we had high expectations. While the spread is quite impressive, the quality was not up to international standard. I noticed that the soy used for the sushi/sashimi is the local thick, dark soy sauce, when it shouldn't be. There were other dishes too that I feel were "localised" and not cooked based on it's international origin. Will skip the dinner buffet next time, but will definitely, definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - Get a deal though, very very expensive!”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeAussieExpat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as was in transit for one night and stayed once before years ago. Was pleasantly surprised by the smiles I received at reception - rare in asia. Received a compimentary upgrade, was delighted with my room (club suite), very impressed with the facilities. If I had to put my company executives up for business, this would be the place. Club suites have an adjoining boardroom. Nespresso machine. Free mini bar. Bed was great, bathroom was great, amenities were great. Will be back (if I can get a great deal or if the company pays!!) Very expensive otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Economical 5 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tryme
Reviews.Content: I got last minute good deal from Asiatravel which is quite Economical for 5 star hotel that is situated on Orchard Road. We booked on Royal Club floor and still found room quite compact . Breakfast on the club floor is best to be avoided as it is quite small, limited choice and crowded. Breakfast at the lobby is better choice and better variety including Indian menu. Hotel is crowded and bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ventosa7
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, fast check-in. Room comfortable but just a bit small. Cleaned efficiently. Location fantastic, a few minutes walk to shopping centres, restaurants, MRT and buses. Buffet breakfast both in restaurant and club room excellent with a wide variety. Service could not be faulted. Good value with free WiFi, minibar, afternoon tea, and cocktails in lounge room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: goodfoodfanOZ
Reviews.Content: Spacious, elegant and clean rooms with reasonably sized bathrooms. Nice big shower, comfortable bed and beautiful linen. Free Wi-fi and mini bar. Friendly and efficient staff. Hotels in Singapore are getting more and more expensive and this hotel truly is value for money. Accross the road is the new Ion Shopping Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Popopo1976
Reviews.Content: First thing first, compared to the Royal Plaza few years ago, the rooms now are much smaller. The location of RP is very convenient. A Mc Donalds along the same road, few one minute walk away. An iSetan, ION Orchard and a basement walk to MRT. What else can we ask for? Check in was uneventful, staff was attentive. I was given a room on a floor where there was carpet work being carried out and hence a bit noisy. Tired from a long trip, I was not able to rest with the constant banging sound. I approached the staff and asked for a room on a floor where work had been completed. After a 20min walk, I went into a another room. At last, I could get my well deserved sleep. Thumbs up to the hotel staff. Free wifi in the lobby and the rooms. Good one there. Free minibar, with soft drink, water, beer, orange juice. Espresso machine inside the room with refill was a nice touch. Would stay there again definitely. Only problem is the lobby seemed to very crowded and noisy with kids running around. But kids are kids.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, functional.”
Reviews.Author: extralite
Reviews.Content: We were in a hurry and chose this hotel as it was close to the main part Orchard Rd, had Free Internet and good reviews. (note to other hotels...why charge for internet? For work travel where we need to keep in contact we avoid hotels with internet charges out of prinicpal). Some of the reviews here seem different to the hotel we stayed in. The location is great. Check in went smoothly. Lobby was crowded. The room we had, which was supposedly an upgrade to premium room due to an Agoda deal, was average. The deal included free access to the minibar. The minibar however consists of 2 beers and some soft drinks so don't get the idea of some champagne fueled party. The view was to a multistory carpark. Average size roo (good shower though). The internet kept dropping out and required re-login (every few minutes). Pool very small but uncrowded. We would certainly suggest this as a place to stay when someone is looking for a comfortable room, close to orchard road, with no hassles on check in and reasonable price. To describe it as "fabulous" though might be going a bit overboard, unless there was a seperate part of the hotel we did not see.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NBB58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great Hotel for 5 nights. It has to be one the best Hotels in Asia, as far as service, rooms, breakfast and location. Right in the heart of the City and easy access by train, bus or taxi to all surrounding areas such as Sentosa Island, Chinatown, Little India, Raffles to name but a few.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: bilkoa
Reviews.Content: Singapore has many excellent hotels and this is one of them. The staff are helpful - the only problem was the bed is a bit hard. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “We've already booked our return..”
Reviews.Author: tungaroa
Reviews.Content: The reception has been renovated and when you enter the lobby, you will be stunned. It is very impressive. The front staff are very helpful and Sarah had us settled within 10 minutes of us arriving. We received a free upgrade to a Premier and were very thankful for this. BTW, the difference between the Superior/Deluxe and the Premiere is that the Premiere has a bathtub...does that really matter?? The carpets in the halls look a bit old but the rooms are immaculate. Clean, spacious and well appointed. The pool is great to swim in although I'm not sure it's chlorinated/salted it may just be fresh water. The buffet (for breakfast and dinner) is not cheap (SGD 75 ++) but comprehensive doesn't even begin to describe it! Yummmm....All the staff are so friendly, we had everyone congratulate us on being newlyweds. Only two detractions from our stay here, 1: The free WIFI in the rooms requires constant resetting every 15 minutes and 2: We weren't able to stay longer.....luckily we've booked to stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “My 1st Choice... DEFINITELY!”
Reviews.Author: Purrpearl
Reviews.Content: My second time went to RPS was excellent. Front desk was friendly. If you have any problems, do not hesitate to ask any questions to them. Price wise was excellent too. Worth it. And if you are a very morning person, please do get your breakfast downstairs @ the Carousel. It's totally scrumptious! We didn't get the chance to try out RPS did give me a surprise cup cake on my birthday! Thanks for the treat RPS! I was flabbergasted! Thank you to all the STAFFS (24 June to 29 June) especially to MR SYED! One of the super friendly, kind staff. Please don't treat him as a staff instead as one of your family. We miss you, Mr SYED. I hope to see RPS & Mr SYED again next in a near future! Thanks RPS for making our stay such memorable ones!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, upgrade made it even better”
Reviews.Author: BoulderTravelers5
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a room on the club level and was upgraded to the biggest suite I have ever stayed in, which included a 10 person conference table! The room was very nice with lots of amenities (free sodas, espresso machine, WII console) but I will say for a suite catering to business travelers, the work desk was cramped ( I guess I could have sat at the 10 person table). The lounge associated with the Club Level was OK, nothing special for this sort of amenity. Service was fine when someone had to come show me how to make the shower use hot water (yes it was that confusing). Location is good with other Western Hotels and shopping malls in the area. One complaint is the workout room/gym. Incredibly small. I used it early in the morning and it was very stuffy and cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: CJD-469
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed, arrived at quarter past midnight, checkin was pleasant an painless within 10 minutes we were in our rooms and the bags delivered. Staff in club lounge were great nothing was a problem. Breakfast never seen such a choice with very attentive staff. Can see why they have won the best independent hotel in SE Asia for the last 4 years. Close yo all forms of transport. Did I mention magnificent staff, always polite and all request taken care of promptly

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Missy601
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel for a holiday in the last 18 months and was every bit as good as the first time. Only minutes from the MRT and Orchard Rd shopping, excellent service, friendly staff and a great location. Make sure you include breakfast in your package. Free mini bar (yes free!) and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: BlancaParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the club delux room. Originally got a room on the 15th floor but moved to a room on the 13th floor, as there was a deep humming noise that really bothered me (but not my husband). The very nice guy at the reception who helped us told me that they do get complaints occasionally, since the 15th floor is the top floor and all the air vents/conditioner etc are on the roof, that's where the humming sound originates from. Anyway after we moved I slept really well, the bed was super-comfortable. The room was a bit smallish--32m2 isn't that small but they have huge and rather awkwardly-placed furniture that make the room feel smaller than it is. As others have written the breakfast buffet is excellent (though not much vegetables, except for salad greens) though I thought the service was better during the week (on Sat morning we didn't get served coffee). The Club facility was also good, they let us hang out in the lounge after check-out (waiting for our evening flight) which we benefitted from. The location of the hotel is great--close to all the shops on Orchard. One thing I didn't like was that they made us give a "deposit" of the full payment of the rooms + 50 $ per night, right at check-in. This is because we didn't have a credit card (only debit card) and we were paying in cash. This was a major inconvenience and I'd never had to pay so much "deposit"!!! I am not sure if I would stay at this hotel again on my next trip to Singapore--this hotel like other hotels in the area are terribly overpriced! But all in all I had a very good stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone considering this hotel, esp if money isn't a concern!

Reviews.Title: “Buffet is best thing about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chantman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few years ago, and although the foyer has since been refurbished, the hotel itself could do with an update. The corridors feel souless although the room are comfortabel enough. You have to use your room key to access the lift but I had to get mine replaced about three times during my 2 day stay because it wouldn't activate. The staff are very helpful. The one bar is very dimly lit and not comfy, more like a night club. The best thing about the hote,l apart from the central location, is the incredible buffet lunch and dinner. Enormous choice from sushi to lobster to oysters in the seafood section, barbecued meats and roasts, salads and vegetables. It is very hard to resist eating too much. The restaurant itself is huge and caters to hundreds at a time, so it definitely is not intimate, more like a banquet hall. So, in summary, there are many good points about the hotel, but I think with the same budget, you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: ashafie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the club floor, excellent breakfast buffet, you get your mini bar refilled everyday for free !!, MRT right next door and botanic gardens also very near.

Reviews.Title: “I am staying here right now and just loving it!”
Reviews.Author: Asif1490
Reviews.Content: I am really amazed the way RP staffs have been taking care of each and everything related to my stay here. My wife and daughter are with me this time and they are simply loving the hotel and its staffs. Fantastic location, awsome breakfast, neat, spacious and tidy room. I am sure I have found a place where I will surely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hardware but software needs to be improved”
Reviews.Author: Hburn10
Reviews.Content: This was a staycation choice for a farewell for a close friend who was going overseas for a while, plus a good 60 days advance purchase deal. The room reservation was also kind enough to grant me an upgrade due to my iPrefer membership. The 2 Executive Suites I had were well maintained, very clean, and very roomy at 64 square metre, although some of the furniture looked worn out. A long couch big enough for an adult to sleep on in the living room was a luxurious touch. The bed was super comfy too! And mini bar was free - the issue with this i will address later. There's also complimentary wifi in the rooms, and I was given a complimentary fruit platter plus some chocolates, nice! There is also the cute nespresso machine in the suite which came in handy. Breakfast at Carousel was excellent in terms of quality and quantity, eat here! The C;ub Lounge on the 15th floor serves TWG teas and machine coffee but you get complimentary high tea from 3-5pm - British high tea but refillable. Come 5:30pm - 8pm you get alcoholic drinks plus a small variety of tapas-like bites. Quality was just alright for me. Didnt try the pool but popped by to have a look - it was rather empty although on a weekend and also small-ish in size. The following are issues to me though: Rude attitude at lobby area – one of my guests was waiting for me at the lobby couch when he was approached by a staff member who asked me if he was a hotel guest. When he replied he was waiting from some friends to check in together, he was told he was not allowed to wait there if he is not a guest. I think he didn’t quite get the idea that my friend was not a guest YET but GOING to be one. When asked why, the staff member said they encounter some members of the public sleeping at the couches but my friend was obviously not sleeping at that time. I suspect the staff member realized at some point thereafter and came back to apologize to my friend but I feel it should not have happened in the first place, as it would have been a rude shock to anyone. In any case, it didn’t seem logical in the first place that members of the public were not allowed to be at the lobby. L'Occitane toiletries / housekeeping issues – when I was granted the upgrade, I was given a list of entitlement for Suite guests which included my favorite - L'Occitane toiletries. But when I saw there were only the hotel’s in-house toiletries in both rooms, I made a call to housekeeping to ask and was told some checks would be made. Half an hour later I was still waiting in the room and decided to call again and this time spoke to a different person who told me the same thing, that checks would be made. 10mins later, my doorbell rang and a lady from the housekeeping brought up this pack of Chopard toiletries and asked if this was what I was asking for. I said no and showed her the print-out of the email – she said the hotel does not have such brands. I was planning to visit the Club Lounge after that and brought up the toiletries to see if anyone can help. The staff at the lounge said that all suites are given the Chopard toiletries now and the hotel doesn’t hold the brand, but said he will check for me and someone will call me back at my room. About half an hour later, the housekeeping brought me the packs of L'Occitane toiletries. I find it very odd that what the hotel apparently did not have could magically appear after making some calls. I am really fine with having house-brand toiletries, but if it is stated that that is one of the perks of the suites then I look forward to the extra treat. If the hotel cannot commit to having that particular brand of toiletries available, then it is better not to state the brand and just say ‘luxury toiletries’. Otherwise the above incident will make me wonder if hotel is trying to hold on to the toiletries for some reason and not provide unless the guests repeatedly asks for it. The ipod dock was also missing in my room but I did not ask about that since I had no use for it. But again, for someone who was expecting it, it would have been a disappointment. Bottled water – I called to ask for 4 more bottled water (on top of whatever is in the mini bar) for my room as I get thirsty quite often. Shortly, a staff brought me the 4 bottles and told me it would be chargeable at $5 per bottle, and I thought he was kidding from the way he said it. I later called the housekeeping only to be told that yes, it is indeed $5 per bottle. I know the min-bar is free and I would understand if the hotel wants to charge for any additional soft drinks etc but I have never heard of anyone charging $5 per bottle, it is ridiculous. And why was it that I was not told when I requested for it? Plus there is no signage in the room anywhere to inform guests about it. Ultimately, the housekeeping agreed to waive the charges and let me have them at no charge when I expressed my displeasure and asked for someone to collect the 4 bottles back. But this also means that a guest who did not know because there was no way they could have known will get a rude shock upon check out. I seriously think the hotel should review this. If not, the hotel should just simply revert to the good old standard of charging for everything except bottled water. And in fact, I was informed that the mini bar is replenished once a day and I had assumed it meant it will be topped up maximum once a day AFTER I have consumed the first round of the contents. The word ‘replenished’ is misleading and should be rephrased. A minor issue was that there was supposed to be a personalised check in at Royal Club Lounge for Suite guests / Royal Touch member but I never got that, nor was I ever acknowledged for being a member throughout my stay. Again, I would have been fine except that I was expecting it as it was listed all in the same email. The hotel has to improve on its member acknowledgement. The conclusion is that while the hardware is perfectly okay, it is the software i had issues with. They need to buck up on it, given its reputation as a 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would come back”
Reviews.Author: UrviB
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great room, great service. Room service not the best but ok. One small complaint - I checked out at 2pm. I called at 3pm saying i have left my adaptor in my room and could they hang on to it for me to pick up, and they "couldn't find it". Disappointing from what was otherwise a great experience. Free internet and mini bar definitely a plus.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it!”
Reviews.Author: khails
Reviews.Content: the check-in counter was fast and the reception staff was warm and friendly. even the coianage staff is very friendly and willing to help me even though i did make a last minute request for a transportation. well done to them. the only thing i regret is that my coffee maker is not working properly but it is not a big deal for me since i dont drink coffee and also the room floor carpet.i think it is new so that's chemical smells really make me feel uncomfortable and my mistake not to inform them for a room change because i seldom stay in the hotel except at night. overall it is a good hotel, friendly staff and the best part it is located in the shopping heaven - Orachard Road!

Reviews.Title: “amazing service in the club room well worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: wanty_11
Reviews.Content: Had wonderful time at hotel, could not fault anything, well worth the extra dollars for the CLUB ROOM. The service they provided was exceptional, just lovely people who would do anything to help possible.It was our anniversay and our friends birthday and they gave us a lovely present on the days which we thought was very thoughtful, didn't even tell them who knows how they knew. Have been to Singapore many times and this was our 5th stay here and will be back next time in Singapore, THANK YOU.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and fiendly serviceminded staff”
Reviews.Author: Lipee
Reviews.Content: Royal Plaza on Scotts is a really nice hotel in Singapore. Breakfast is excellent and offers something for everyone. The location, 150 m from Orchard Road, is a eldorado for shopping and have nice restaurants. I´ve been travelling a lot and lived in hotels all over the world and this hotel ends up in the top.

Reviews.Title: “service is the key”
Reviews.Author: jojo1er
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in 6 months that I am lucky enough to call the Royal Plaza my home during my stay in the island state. The experience, on both occasions, was memorable. No need to write long stories about it: 1. the service: friendly, smiley, attentive, respectful, not overboard. Just what you need when you travel to a foreign place. That sense that somebody really cares. 2. the breakfast: for the demanding traveller that I am, it is a marvel of creativity: japanese, chinese, malay, western, you name it, they have it there! What a pleasant way to start the day (or go back to bed). Well done Royal Plaza. Hasta la vista! Michel Roure, Sydney, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and service”
Reviews.Author: Wendy F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts 3 times now the first time in 1982 then 2007 and then 2011. This hotel has always been a great place to stay the Location is right off Orchard Rd, directly opposite Far East Plaza Shopping Centre which is great for ladies shoes and budget fashions. The MRT is only a short walk 3 min away from the hotel and buses are right out the front. Taxis are also in abundance. The restaurants are really nice but a bit pricy but the food is exceptional. The bars are well stocked and are reasonable for Singapore alcohol prices. The ambience in the hotel is classy yet all guest are treated the same regardless of status. The rooms are small but comfortable, the beds are great and the pillows are clean and always fresh. Free internet and mini bar are a bonus. Gym and pool area are very good. All up a great hotel and the club lounge is worth the extra you pay.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a great attitude”
Reviews.Author: Slewmy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel during the Christmas holidays and it was truly a wonderful experience for us. Check-in was fast and the staff were truly courteous and efficient. Records of my previous visits were stored in their database and this allowed the check-in staff to know what my preferences were in terms of the type of room I stayed in previously and even the mattress and pillows I liked. I thought that was a nice touch as it showed that the hotel cared enough to treat me like a valued guest. It also ensured that the room I got was just as I liked it down to my preferred pillows. The hotel is located right smack in the Orchard Road shopping area which made it a natural choice for those who love shopping and sight seeing. The Orchard MRT station is located right across the road and could be accessed through underground pedestrian walkways, so you need not worry about getting there even when it rained. Location wise, it cannot be more convenient. The rooms were cozy and bright with free broadband and complimentary drinks in the minibar that were replenished daily. There was even a coffee machine in our room which was indeed a very nice touch. The double bed we had was huge and comfortable and provided welcome respite after a hard day of shopping and sight seeing. During our stay, we were provided with complimentary breakfast. Food available ranged from local delights to Western and American staples. My family especially liked the local breakfast fare which was fresh, well prepared and delicious. The variety of food ensured there was something for everyone. Overall, this hotel is a delight to stay in with its friendly and courteous staff, comfortable and clean rooms with its free offerings in the minibar and a location which is second to none. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location. Nice & Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doogiehowser_md
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location which is paramount in Singapore. With the humidity you dont want to walk around much short walk to MTR and right in the middle of Orchard Rd shopping! Nice clean and modern rooms. Furnishings can make room feel a bit dark. Impressive Lobby with friendly staff. Buffet breakfast is HUGE! But a lot of good and cheap eateries in close proximity to hotel. Hard to fault Hotel other than that the pool is a bit so so. Great value, will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: pumpkinpie52
Reviews.Content: The Royal Plaza provides comfort in a good location, at a good rate (if you can get a room on special). We were relegated to the fourth floor, probably because we were on a special rate, so the view was of a brick wall, but the room itself was a decent size, was very clean and had speedy free internet service. The bathroom was well appointed and had a marvelous shower. It was extremely quiet, and with the comfortable beds and fine linens, we enjoyed a good nights sleep after long days of shopping and sightseeing. The location near the corner of Scott and Orchard is excellent for shopping and for hopping onto a bus, MRT or taxi to get to a tourist attraction. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant or use room service because the prices were outrageous, especially considering the enormous range of better priced fare within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Giving my secrets away....”
Reviews.Author: SadTravellingOnMyOwn
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed at the Royal Plaza and this time on the Club floor. Only one word for it all.... excellent. Location, free internet, club lounge, breakfast (amazing buffet downstairs), L'Occitane soap, fantastic shower, big room for Singapore. Only two things I wish they would improve on... the appalling 'air freshner' that hits you as you walk in... so overpowering it makes my head hurt, and the fact that the restaurant offers the buffet or nothing. No al a carte so if you want to eat in the hotel you eat buffet or room service. Or, go out which isn;t a problem as its so central but when you are travelling alone, sometimes its just more comfortable to eat alone in the hotel rather than a restaurant where you just look sad!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms with service that was one of a kind!”
Reviews.Author: Divya77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here just over three days (short but sweet) and the staff were amazing. Fara in particular, one of the concierges definitely went over and above the call of duty - so thank you Fara for looking after us. Rooms are very comfortable and the beds are a dream to sleep on. In terms of proximity to shopping heaven such as Orchard St, well it is a mere 5-10mins walk away. Didn't opt for the breakfast downstairs as that was expensive, $30+ per person, why bother when there is the most wonderful bakery just one block away. Cheers!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay as great as the first”
Reviews.Author: Ausroamer
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Royal Plaza on Scotts. Having stayed at a few other hotels in Singapore this is now my preferred hotel in Singapore to stay at. The staff, the service, the greeting on arrival is faultless. The room was clean and comfortable with free mini bar of soft drinks, juice and water refilled daily and cookies to have with coffee. There was a coffee machine in the room with decaf, espresso etc as well as the usual tea and coffee making facilities. Also high speed internet. This is a busy area almost on the corner of Orchard Road, so really good for shopping, but the MRT station is also very close so getting around Singapore is really easy. The Singapore Hop On Bus stops across the road. Our flight home is always around midnight, so instead of taking an offered late check out we lounged around by the pool late in the afternoon, had a shower etc. This area is a quiet and relaxing break from the bustle of the streets. I haven't found anything very much to fault with this hotel and I'm looking forward to going back on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service and central”
Reviews.Author: dukkkman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2007 ,and this stay was far better than our first,but in saying that our stay this time was the club ,and perhaps this was why. The check in was very slow,but given that we checked in on a f riday afternoon on the eve of school holidays,well thats life.It was our anniversary and the Royal Plaza did not forget this. These guys went the extra mile to make us feel special The rooms are clean , very modern and comfortable. Toiletries provided are first class First morning at the club breakfast we were not impressed at being told we could not wear our Haviaianas footwear if we chose to attend the next day in the same footwear. What a rubbish rule as similar footwear was being worn by several people...the only difference being that their thongs were leather....Err... Hello we are having breakfast,not attending a nightclub. This annoyed us so much we did not go back the next day but had our breakfast downstairs. This floor had a much larger variety of food ,but one toaster for up to 90 customers at one time is very bad. So we went back up to the club for the rest of our stay. This is the only things that I didn't like about our stay,which perhaps is a little petty ,but needed to be said. The positives are,great hotel, good location .exceptional service and not bad for price for this standard. Would I stay again....Yes this is a good hotel and the staff are top notch

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Great Location, Perfect Rooms, Awesome Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LiveCanggu
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautifully appointed and extremely clean. The breakfast was second to none. Location is fantastic. I will definitely be back here. Great value compared with other hotels charging similar prices. Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Experience was mixed...”
Reviews.Author: Nemissa123
Reviews.Content: I had recently spent a night at Royal Plaza on Scotts, a hotel that I have stayed several times. I have to say that I have had a good experience for all of my previous visits, but my most recent experience was a mixture of good and bad. Just to recount my experience… The check-in took a while but I did not really mind, since I was not in a hurry. But, even though I had already indicated in my online reservation that I would like to have a king size bed, the staff at the front desk asked me the same question again. I suppose she might have just wanted to be certain, but it made me think whether she is even aware of what I had requested for in my online reservation. When I entered into the hotel room, I realised that the room had two single beds rather than one king-sized bed. So I called room service (as I did not know what number I should call for the front desk) and had my call transferred to the front desk, but after waiting for several minutes, no one picked up my call. So I called room service again and was advised to return to the front desk to resolve the matter in person. When I informed the staff at the front desk of the mistake, she informed me that the two single beds should have been combined together to form a king-sized bed. I am not certain if that is the norm (combining two beds together to form a king-sized bed), for I have always requested for a king size bed in my previous visits and was not aware of any instance where the king size bed was actually two single beds combined into one. As I prefer to have an actual king-sized bed, I was provided with another room at level 4. I was not overly concerned about having to move from a room at level 8 to level 4, since the hotel is not exactly known for its view. Having finally settled in the room, I tried to turn on the television with the remote, but the television would not turn on as the power was switched off. I tried to locate the switch on my own, but couldn't find it, so I had no choice but to call room service again and an technical engineer (I believe that is what they were called) promptly came and turned on the power for me. Feeling silly, I apologised to the technical engineer for being a bother and he explained to me that the power should not have been switched off in the first place. Then, as I was moving around the room, I stepped on something and when I took a closer look, I was a tad horrified to find that it was the dried-up body of a bug of some sort. Needless to say, I wore slippers in the room from that point on. Besides the bug, one of the power switch near the floor was left turned on (perhaps by the cleaning crew who neglected to turn it off after their cleaning). It is not a issue for me, but it could be rather dangerous if the power switch is left on in a room with young children. Lastly, when I had my breakfast at Carousel the next morning, the staff was kind enough to inform me that the buffet will close in about 15 minutes (it was my fault for coming for breakfast only around 10 am). The variety in the buffet was good and the food was not bad (although the omelette was a tad bland for my taste). But, it was rather hard to get a refill for my tea, as it seemed the staff members in the Carousal were otherwise occupied with clearing items and preparing for the lunch crowd. Overall, my recent experience in the hotel was mixed. Although the hotel is in a very good location and its staff are generally helpful and polite, I think there are still areas for improvement. I think I will likely try another hotel the next time.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'll stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Escape_to_sun
Reviews.Content: Over the last 3 years we have stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scott's 4 times, each trip has been 1 ½ to 2 ½ weeks in duration. Each time has been better than the last. The rooms are small by American standards, but they are adequate and well maintained. The housekeeping staff is friendly and they obviously take pride in their work. We stay in a club room which gives us access to the lounge with breakfast, high tea, happy hour and a place other than our room to take a break during the day. The service is superb. Each host/hostess goes out of their way to make us feel not only welcome, but pampered. My morning latte arrives at my table almost as soon as I sit down! It has been six months since my last visit and I am starting to miss my Singapore “friends” at the Royal Plaza. Hello to you all!

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault hotel or staff”
Reviews.Author: dunholme
Reviews.Content: Had a club room for a few days and the performance of the staff, particularly in the club lounge, was outstanding. It is always difficult to single out one member of a team but I have to mention Tony whose cheerful helpfulness hit just the right note. He is an asset to the hotel. The only niggle about the hotel was that it had only one form of dining - the international buffet. It is an excellent buffet, very popular with locals, but still a buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, friendly staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: neilgbautista
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect especially if you're into shopping as it is situated in the heart of the shopping district. The closest MRT station is Orchard, which is few minutes walk from the hotel. Hard Rock Cafe is also nearby (about 900meter). The hotel service and staff were really great on the duration of our stay. They have been very helpful and approachable. We had a nice room at the 14th floor which gave us the privelege to use the Royal Club Lounge. The staff there are very friendly and accomodating. Although the food seemed to be tasteless, atleast the coziness of the place and friendliness of the staff make up for that. The good thing is the endless drinks being served at your table. The Royal Club Lounge is intended for the people who are checked in floors 13th, 14th and 15th. It is worth staying! Our room is decently SPACIOUS. I think that's the regular size of room I have ever observed, I'm just wondering why I read one review complaining about the size of the room. Anyhow, the room is excellent. Nice bathroom with L'occitane shampoo, conditioner, lotion and shower gel. Everyday the minibar is supplied with complimentary 2 bottles of water, 1 bottle orange juice, 2 cans Tiger beer, 1 can Coke regular, 1 can Coke light, 2 Oreo. There's a coffee machine by Nespresso, 6 free capsules of coffee being supplied everyday (2-strong, 2-mild, 2-decaf). Aside from that, teabags and Milo are supplied. Aren't we pampered? There's a security SAFE that u can use, easy to operate. TV has variety of channels, though there's no Sports channel, where I was longing to watch the French Open but to no avail. Beware: at night the AIR-CON could be a bit noisy. FREE WIFI available! Very important. The room also has iron and ironing board and blow drier. They also have gym, though not so big, it is functional. They have Sauna and swimmingpool but no lifeguard, so you swim at your own risk. Children below 12 are not allowed to use the pool. Towels available at the pool area. As we were checked in floor 14, we can have breakfast at Carousel or Royal CLub Lounge. But we never tried having breakfast at Carousel as we expect there would be alot of people. We opted for the Royal Club Lounge where life is peaceful with friendly smiling staff, though the menu has limited selection, nice presentation but poor taste. At night you can go to the bar where a very nice Filipino band plays all music from different genre. You can also make request but dont ecpect that it will be played. We ordered cheese platter but was a little disappointed that the one showed in the picture (menu) is different from what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; value-for-money!”
Reviews.Author: ManilaSoulMates
Reviews.Content: On our way back to Manila from Melbourne, we stayed 4 days in Singapore so that my teenage nephew and niece (both 1st-timers in Singapore) could explore the city and enjoy the new Universal Studios theme park in Sentosa. My wife and I, familiar with the city, decided to pre-book with the Royal Plaza Hotel on Scotts Road. We were not disappointed. The location's perfect; just a short walk to the MTR lines, and the kids loved being so close to the Borders bookstore in Wheelock Place and to several "must go" places along Orchard Road. We had 2 very clean, very comfortable and spacious rooms - with a connecting doorway. The beds were delightful to sleep in, the minibars were free, and the high-speed wireless internet (also free) were much appreciated by our teenagers for their social networking needs (Facebook, others). Noteworthy are the spacious and clean bathrooms with HUGE shower heads! In hot, humid Singapore, the combination of nice showers and reliable cool conditioned air in our rooms were most appreciated as we start and end our days. Lastly, I appreciated the comforting visible security arrangements of the hotel and the attentive respectful service of the concierge and the cleaning staff. All these made us feel safe, comfortable, and truly welcome. We hope to return and stay with the Royal Plaza Hotel on Scotts Road soon!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & helpful service,clean facilities”
Reviews.Author: Phil99_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 days in Singapore staying @ Royal Plaza we had a very pleasant stay finding the extra for the club facilities well worthwhile,the staff very friendly & helpful & cleanliness very good. The only thing which i found unsatisfactory was noise from the air conditioning particularly at night.

Reviews.Title: “Complete disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Choroni94
Reviews.Content: Attracted by the good Tripadvisor ranking and reviews I decided to book the Royal Plaza on Scotts this time, particularly for its very central location. However, the disappointment couldn't have been bigger: - Small room with furniture from the 80-ies without breakfast - Absolutely smelly: The entire floor and the Room itself have a bad Small, probably from the 80-ies carpet, which has absorbed the entire humidity over years - absolutely inacceptable! - Air condition not properly working: The air condition is cooling, but at the same time is distributing even more humidity in the room - with the result that everything, including the bed linnen, feels a bit humid! - Room service: Despite a generous they didn't leave fresh shower gel and All in all a huge disappointment: Should have taken the usual hotels and taken the cab to get to Orchard road. Not at all living up to ecpectations! Hotels I can absolutely recommend in Singapore are the Fullerton, the Shangri-La and for smaller budgets the Quincy!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: donamiel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay or very average for a 5 star, the location was good, disapointed about the service, like the very slow check in. The room was just a little bit on the small size. Also expensive but that's because of the location. So it's okay for max. 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: banzai0
Reviews.Content: The biggest plus for staying in the hotel is the friendliness and quality service of the people. You will notice this as soon as you step out your car or cab when you receive a welcome greeting and assistance from the bellhop. Check in and check out were quick since I am also Royal Touch member. I was upgraded to a Club Deluxe room with complimentary access to Royal Club lounge. As others have mentioned, complimentary minibar, free wifi, nespresso machine, and good breakfast buffet selection are some of the reasons my I come back to this hotel. The location is just right, near Orchard road, subway, malls and shops everywhere. There is also an internet lounge at the 2/F which guests can use for free. This is where i normally print my boarding pass after checking in online.

Reviews.Title: “dated”
Reviews.Author: DevonHare
Reviews.Content: great location, off orchard road and metro system but building works, which carried on much longer than advised, noisy, rooms a bit dingy. breakfast quite nice though, a good effort with turkey and chicken sausages/ bacon as alternative to pork. Plus cold buffet

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: luvmegila
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for seven nights and had a really great experience. Even after a long hour waiting to check in because of overbooked eastern season, we got the room beyond our expectations. The bathroom was quite big and well stocked with quality lotions and soaps. The addition of the FREE mini-bar & Wifi were a great bonuses. Location could not be better - near Orchard Road shopping opportunities and near MTR-train station. HIGHLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel and it's location, LOVED the friendly staff there.”
Reviews.Author: LilaAngel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed, the room is nicely furnished with the usual furniture, large study desk, complimentary mini fridge which is restocked daily, armchair and also a nespresso machine. Very clean and nice and peaceful. They think of everything, even to the type of pillow you perfer, which can be requested. The bathroom is very clean with a good sized shower area. I really appreciated the friendly staff there, from the reception desk to the waiters during the breakfast rush and even the doorman. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay. It is ideally located minutes walk to anywhere, the concierge desk is very helpful and will guide you to wherever you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: shamonejackson
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I was booked here during my business trip to Singapore in Mar 2010. I was attending a press junket and the company that invited us booked us here. I haven't really done a lot of business trips alone but somehow I felt comfortable here, much to my surprise. There are some reviews here noting the rooms are small but I did not find that to be the case, certainly not for ONE PERSON. Sure we could have been booked in something bigger than the standard room, I couldn't tell, but I certainly had a big bed... plenty of room enough for me. I had a confortable work space as well. This is a business hotel so most people who stay here are probably out during the day and are working at night before they sleep. So the FREE minibar might have been stocked just as such, which some consider very meager, but I did not mind it at all. There are tons of places to go to should you need anything, and the hotel is certainly within walking distance to a 7-11 even. The hotel is actually on Scotts road, near the Orchard road intersection. It is just walking distance from places like the Wheelock Place (which has a Borders bookstore!) and Ion Orchard and many other malls. Walking around at night, you can enjoy a completely different look to the city, too! Sure there places near the hotel are not the kind for backpackers' type who may prefer less expensive meals, shopping items and street food-type fare (Louis Vuitton, Emporio Armani and other big name brands are also just a few minutes away), but if you want that, then this area isn't what you are looking for. The rooms had Internet (or at least my room did), although it wasn't wireless. It's got a bathtub (excellent for a relaxing night after working the whole day). Carousel, the restaurant at the lobby had good food. The staff was friendly to us, even during peak hours when we ate there. Sure the club on the second floor wasn't that big, but hey, if you want a swinging party place with hundreds of people, you shouldn't go to a hotel club. I like that it doesn't have a lot of room for too many people. The only thing I didn't like much was that their lobby seemed to be crowded. There were people milling around by the entrance (near the restaurant entrance actually) and I wasn't quite sure they were hotel guests. And sure the view is mostly of other buildings and perhaps side streets, but again, this isn't the place you should book if you are on a nature-tripping mood (go Google something else!). While this isn't the type of place I would stay at for a leisure trip (I perhaps would like a more homey hotel, or a resort... or something with a more affordable price range too), but if I'm ever invited to a business trip to these parts again, I would certainly hope the company taking us there would have a mind to book us here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate but anonymous....”
Reviews.Author: Eddie06
Reviews.Content: Given the wide choice of business hotels on and off Orchard Road this is nothing to remember. Well located and perfectly adequate and nothing to fault per se, just a bit anonymous. Staff friendly and helpful but that tends to be the case in Singapore so not enough to make it stand out from the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: teedotTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Plaza for 3 nights in late April and enjoyed our time here. Pros: - Location was great, minutes to the entrance of the malls and Orchard MRT station. Close to street cafes, shops, and restaurants. - Check-in and out was very quick. - Room was clean and comfortable, and the a/c was easy to control and worked at maintaining a nice cool temperature. - Bathroom was a good size and had a separate shower from the tub. - Staff was nice and offered great suggestions at places to try types of cuisine. - Broadband internet was fast and reliable. Cons: - Room was a bit small, perhaps because space is of a premium in Singapore. Storage was a bit lacking. - There was a window between the bathroom and the rest of the room, which wasn't so great when one person had to use the washroom in the middle of the night. There was a roller shade, but it didn't do much to block the light. - Feather pillows are a bit soft and become flat in the middle of the night. - This is minor, but the amenities did not include hair conditioner. For those who have dry hair, perhaps consider bringing your own as the shampoo was quite drying. If in Singapore again, I would definitely stay here because of the location and great deal we found on-line.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that made this place a hotel we'll return to”
Reviews.Author: benedj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RP for 3 nights over the Easter Holidays and can only say we will definitely return. Upon arrival at about 10pm we had a quick check in and provided a late 2pm check out as our flight left late - were very happy about that. The rooms were comfortable and clean and provided all the items you needed for a great stay. Great shower with huge shower head, iron and ironing board and in room safe. The free wifi and minibar made it a place you returned to every night and felt you got a couple of comforts from home. Thumbs up from us. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: DoraDementia
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Located right in the thick of the Orchard Rd shopping area it's next to buses and the MRT with loads of shops and restaurants around it. Rooms are very nice, It's worth paying extra for deluxe room. It gets you access to club lounge which means free food and drinks at different times throughout the day - including breakfast and evening drinks. You also get a free mini bar in the room with a few items. Robes, slippers and very nice toiletries too. Staff were all excellent - super efficient but polite and friendly. Can't fault this place especially as we got upgraded to the Royal suite (wow) when there was a noise issue with our room. The manager personally moved us and let us stay in the suite for our full trip- amazing! Fantastic hotel would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ozziestew1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RP from the 14/4-21/4. Had connecting rooms as we travelled with our children and found the hotel to be a great place to stay. The location is fantastic directly opposite the far east plaza and only a 5 minutes walk from lucky plaza. You have your more upmarket shops ION and TANGS also only 5 minutes away. Starbucks and Maccas out the front. The hotel is great but a little pricey if you want to eat in. Staff were excellent and couldnt do enough for you. The kids loved the pool but do take note of the DEEP end when it says its 2.9meteres deep.( IT IS)

Reviews.Title: “Royal Plaza gets even better: Seventh floor suite”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at Royal Plaza on Scotts when we were in the Orchard/Scotts area, but lately we have become accustomed to staying in the less-expensive Bugis Street area. We had to be in the Orchard Road area, and once again, we found that the best deal in the Orchard-Scotts area was Royal Plaza. It’s more expensive than before, but the price is the most competitive. We booked a superior room (no breakfast) through the website. Booking through booking.com would have been only S$1 cheaper. Wi-and LAN are still free, and now there are even more nearby sidewalk cafes where one can eat breakfast (see photo of the hotel’s “RP” logo taken from Starbucks where they serve a good continental breakfast including fruit). The hotel manager sent a thoughtful e-mail welcoming us back to the Royal Plaza, and check-in was prompt and friendly. We were surprised to be upgraded to a suite on the 7th floor. Room The amenities were so enticing that we can understand why guests are willing to pay the extra amount for two rooms (each with its own TV and air conditioning controls) instead of one. The bed was larger, and it seemed more comfortable, and the bathroom was larger with the bathtub located in the extra-large shower. The refrigerator was good sized, and the two beers, two soft drinks, orange drink, and two bottles of water were replenished daily. There was no night light, but we just opened the curtains a bit for light. The coffee maker was sophisticated. It was easy to operate the air conditioning. The room and bathroom were kept extremely clean. Newspapers are left by the door or they are available at the elevator lobby. Lobby The lobby can get quite crowded at times, but it is large, and it seems to be able to accommodate large groups. We noticed people lining up in the lobby area to take high tea at Carousel coffee shop. To access the elevators one has to pass both the concierge and reception desk. You have to insert your key card in order to use the elevator. Wi-fi The wi-fi signal was good, but it dropped out sometimes, so we used the free LAN which was fast and reliable. We note that most four and five star hotels still charge extra for wi-fi. Quiet enjoyment Our windows faced the Duty Free building, so there was no noise except from the occasional extra-loud motorcycle that even Singapore cannot eradicate completely. Even though there was a connecting door, it was on the working side of the suite, so our room was quiet. Location For guests who use the pedestrian bridge over Scotts Road, the Royal Plaza is almost connected to Far East Plaza’s shops. Even in a rain you can turn right and walk to the Royal Plaza side of Shaw Centre where there are four excellent restaurants right in a row next to each other: Les Amis (maybe too high class for our taste), Aoki Japanese, Bistro du Vin, and La Strada Italian. They are all owned by Les Amis Group. We had dinner at La Strada, and we found the special of the day, lamb shank, especially delicious, but my tortellini stuffed with ricotta and spinach with walnut sauce was also good. They also sold one of our favorite wines by the glass: Moscato d’Asti. The MRT is also at Shaw Centre. You really can’t find a more central location. Service When we arrived, my wife had to unload one suitcase from the back of the taxi while a porter stood by idle. We assume this rarely happens. The reception staff was cheerful, friendly and efficient, and the maids, who seem to be making up rooms constantly, are friendly. Check out was equally efficient and friendly. They froze our ice pack in an area near the reception desk and retrieved it quickly. We are grateful that Royal Plaza at Scotts has maintained their high quality at a comparatively reasonable price. We are members of their Royal Touch loyalty program, and we expect to return frequently.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels to stay”
Reviews.Author: grw1510
Reviews.Content: Again our stay at Royal Plaza on Scotts was a great experience The staff at the Club Lounge have always been pleasant and helpfull greeting us with smiles and passion in there work All staff in the hotel were just as pleasant and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BigFatBudgie
Reviews.Content: The Royal Plaza on Scotts has service which is second to none. Polite and efficient, nothing was too much trouble - even hailing taxis for us! Conveniently located in the heart of the shopping district, most sights were either in walking distance or a short taxi ride away. The rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet, but more 3 than 5 star. However, the free mini bar was appreciated. Not to be missed in Singapore is Chinatown, Little India, Senatosa island, Raffles and the brilliant nightlife around Clarke's Quay. Thank you for making our stay an enjoyable one. We can't wait to revisit magical Singapore again!

Reviews.Title: “Something Very Special”
Reviews.Author: Johnsy
Reviews.Content: Hubbie and I stayed at the Royal Plaza in February 2011. We arrived on a late flight from Darwin and couldn't wait to get to our room and relax. Check in was friendly and efficient, although I thought it strange that they asked to see our passports. The room had everything it promised and was clean and spacious. We were awakened at about 3am by the noise of water running. It was our air conditioner. We called downstairs to report it and maintenance LITERALLY took about 2 minutes to come up and fix it. But wait, there's more.....hubbie left a half full bottle of water in a taxi that dropped him out the front of the hotel and one of the staff not only picked it up but bought it in to reception where it was refrigerated and given to him the next time he came downstairs....and there's more....it was hubbie's birthday the last night that we spent here....a knock on the door at about 6pm....it was a staff member with a beautiful cake from the restaurant downstairs....not only a cake, but a card as well wishing him a happy birthday. We were absolutely speechless.....the staff and management of this place go far out of their way to make sure your stay is a happy one. They all bring new meaning to the word SERVICE. The breakfast had every dish you could possibly wish for and the quality was fantastic. The hotel is located very close to the Orchard MRT and the concierge is only too happy to organise tours/trips for you. The hotel also has a swimming pool which was very refreshing at the end of the day and we made good use of the free internet provided in our room. The re-stocking of the mini bar and the Nespresso machine is a nice touch and was truly appreciated. Singapore is the perfect city, clean, green, organised and friendly. I just wanted to say a huge thank you to Patrick Fiat and the staff of the Royal Plaza on Scotts....you have created something very, very special here and you are all a testament to the friendliness, sincerity and efficiency of the Singapore culture. Hubbie and I both hope to return to your beautiful country one day soon and we won't be looking any further for our accommodation than your amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wendy F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best in Singapore. It is close to orchard Rd and all shopping areas. A 2 min walk to the MRT and a bus stop right out the front. Directly opposite Far East Plaza great for Clothes shopping for the Money conscious. The hotel is very clean and no smoking is a plus++ food and beverages are average for Singapore restaurants. The club rooms that include Breakfast are great value. A must to stay and We are returning in June 2001.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Claire298184
Reviews.Content: First time I have stayed at this hotel and probably not the last. I have stayed in a variety of hotels in Singapore and this definitely had a few advantages. The location is great. So close to the shops and within a great walk along Nissin Road to The Botanical Gardens which is quite divine. Close to MRT. The room itself is fine. No bath which was a little disappointing, but perhaps there were some in other rooms. I liked the free internet as in a number of hotels in Singapore you have to pay. Probably one of the nicest free mini bars I have come across. There were beers, soft drinks and a treat of oreo biscuits. Bed was very comfortable. My only slightly negative point was about the pool. The pool itself was fine, a little small, but okay for swimming. The decoration is not very appealing on the eye. However saying that is suited its purpose. A great, enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Musty smelling but otherwise pleasant business hotel - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: bettiblu
