Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Plaza for two nights. The location is good for shopping - very close to the ION shopping centre and good connection to MRT. The hotel is nice enough - highlights are breakfast at Carousel, the friendly staff and nice bathrooms. The less appealing parts are the terrible musty smell (stagnant like on cruise ship corridors), the slightly ageing rooms facing onto other peoples' aircon units and laundry and the grubby pool with greasy frying smells over it the whole time. They make a big thing of the club level but it's not as good as a BA lounge and always seems to be between offerings - just finished afternoon tea or cocktails or whatever. We didn't dislike it but it is not good value at £190 a night. Watch out for the offer to book you a cab to the airport - it's an unmetered 'limo cab' for a higher price than a metered cab.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Basic but very generous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seahorsee
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the hotel. Every day we would ride the bus or the metro which is just a few minutes walk away. Even if we didnt shop much at Orchard, we loved that RP was just near this very vibrant street. The room looks exactly like the pictures. A little small but clean, comfortable, equipped with the basic amenities. We loved the complimentary drinks, especially the coffee. We appreciated how generous the hotel was and how considerate the managers were of our special requests. Concierge was always helpful and very knowledgeable. Our only complaint would be housekeeping who can be more conscientious. Three out of five days we stayed, our bathroom and minibar items weren't refilled adequately. We're not sure if this had anyhting to do with the fact that we were only in the superior room. All in all, we liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chopeta
Reviews.Content: I've booked a special promo from groupon singapore & stayed there for a night. It was amazing, from the smooth check-in to the premiere room we were given & up to the nespresso, free wifi & mini bar :) i really enjoyed our stay, it was so relaxing. location is excellent, went to shop around orchard. staff are all friendly. next day we went to eat buffet lunch @ carousel, like the whole hotel experience, it was also unforgettable. food was excellent. there's local food, japanese, delicious salad & not to mention the desserts! heaven! would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Za5kar
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and I found the hotel and service to be excellent. The location is spot on for both the business we had to do and then the sites to be seen. Rooms are well furnished and a standard size. Complimentary drinks and wifi are a real plus.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: blondy50
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel location perfect the buffet breakfast very nice and fully halaal. Concierge staff most helpful.Free mini bar and free wifi Highly recommended to all my friends and family. Cheers Nasser and Ferouze

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a stopover on a long haul flight.”
Reviews.Author: Pippped
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time I have stayed at RP and I have yet to find a reason why I should change. This hotel has just picked up the award for the best independant hotel in Singaopre for the 4th year running so I am not alone in my views! The hotel sits just off Orchard Road near the amazing ION shopping complex, has a pool, is totally non-smoking, plenty of room, modern, great breakfast buffet, nice bars and the service is very good. Ask and you shall receive - theese folks do whatever it takes to please. Free high speed internet and a free daily replenished mini bar tips this into the must-return category, I am sick of paying for internet connection in big hotels!! A great night sleep, quiet rooms and clean and tidy - perfect! Good value for money especially if you book 8 weeks out.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best hotel stay of my life”
Reviews.Author: Fabulous_Da
Reviews.Content: I booked a Premier room weekend stay from 27th Feb to 28th Feb at your hotel. I have stayed at numerous hotels all over the world and I only have a few things to say about your hotel: Absolutely World First Class, Mind Blowing, extravagant and worth every cent and so much more!!! To start of, the staff of the hotel definitely live up to the motto: "what can we do for you". Everywhere I went in the hotel, I was greeted with warm smiles, excellent service and the words, "what can I do for you". When I booked for my stay online, I enquired if the hotel could do something special as it was a romantic getaway. When I checked into about 3 plus, the reception staff were really warm, smiley and check in was a breeze. The bell boy standing nearby addressed me by name as he helped me keep the elevator door open and press the correct floor. That was just the start of our adventure. When we arrived at our floor, we were greeted by the sign "premier" and the beautiful carpet stretching down the corridor. Though the air circulation could be improved as it smelled like a horse stable. Stepping into the room, we were blown away by the elegant, beautiful design of the room, that it was exactly the same as the pictures online (some hotel rooms do not look the same as the pictures published). We were excited to discover red rose petals scattered around the bathtub (just a suggestion, would be even better with rose petals in a heart shape on the bed). Thank you for the lovely roses at no extra charge. On the study table, was a hand-written note with a gift of 2 GV movie tickets, and suggestions about 2 movies perfect for couples. The personal touch of hand writing and recommendations of the movies was totally unexpected and deeply appreciated. We totally did not expect the tickets, much less the recommendations. The welcome card by Arthur Chua the Manager only increased our happiness. Before we could recover from shock, Rendi called to ask if he could deliver a cake. He came to our room with the cake and introduced himself by giving me his name card, telling me to call him if I needed anything. In all my hotel stays, I never had any manager doing such a thing, much less a cake. The cake was delicious, though too sweet for our liking and could do without the pink bandung flavour around the cake. During my stay, I requested for 2 pairs of chopsticks and spoons and they were delivered on a tray with napkins too. The bed and pillows were so comfortable that my girlfriend wanted to purchase them, and is curious about the brand and models of the mattress and pillows. When we went down to breakfast, at the carousel cafe, we stuffed ourselves the delicious food and were so extremely that we did not eat lunch. All your staff were excellent, In particular, 2 staff in particular stood out to me; one was the lady at the noodle station who was proud of the the noodles she cooked and boasted it was delicious and famous, she was was not bluffing as it was delicious. The other was Alex at the fruit juice station who was still serving in spite of having cut his finger and had a bandage around it. About 1:20pm before my check out timing, I requested for an extension of another hour and your staff were very friendly and professional. The lady receptionist who answered the phone helped me check with her superior before informing me that my request was approved. My check out was a breeze like my check in. To sum it up, as Arthur Chua quoted Walt Disney in the welcome card, "Do what you do so well that they will want to see it again and bring their friends." Royal Plaza has certainly left a lasting impact on me, and I definitely will be back. Please keep up the excellent standard and raise it even higher with your committed, excellent staff and their strong teamwork.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: johne88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Dec 2010 and stayed over Christmas, we visit this hotel each year, usually for 3 weeks.On arrival our bags were whisked away from the taxi by the friendly staff and were waiting in the room for us. The express check in was smooth and quick as usual The room clean and well appointed this year with the addition of a coffee maker, a nice touch.The breakfast is a buffet with a fantastic array of food catering for most tastes, a great experience to start the day The evening buffet is amazing with a huge choice of all types cuisine . you will be stretched to find better in Singapore All staff are friendly and willing to help with anything, nothing is too much trouble We did have a small problem with housekeeping but it was quickly sorted out in a professional way and the Manager visited the next day to check. Again our stay at the Royal Plaza was most memorable. The only real problem with the Royal Plaza is having to leave, we will be returning at the end of the year

Reviews.Title: “Casino atmosphere with small perks but very little class”
Reviews.Author: estrella49
Reviews.Content: I walked into Royal Plaza expecting a subdued, business hotel type environment - oops. The lobby felt more like a casino/bachelorette preparty than a hotel. Music from an automatic piano blared bad jazz/r&b, and noisy groups poured out of the neighboring coffee shops decked in hawaiian shirts. That would all be fine, but the walls of the rooms are thin - while I didn't hear any partying up in the rooms, you can hear every door bang or drawer close of the guest next door. Rooms provide free minifridge beverages (water, juice and two daily beers), as well as free wifi, but the general decor is cheap motelish.

Reviews.Title: “great location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: geedee1964
Reviews.Content: bus stop right out t he front orchard mrt 300 metres down the road mccafe 50 metres down the road.clean rooms hot showers great air conditioning.i thought they could have a deal for guests at the restaurant.staff couldnt do enough to make our 4 day stay memorable.would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel, location may be a little wanting if you have small kids”
Reviews.Author: tinetan168
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay with friends. I loved the fact that their wifi was fast and free, also their mini-bar items were all free! We did not use the beer they provided, but they placed 2 packs of oreos since we did not drink the beer. Service is always friendly without being annoyingly close. Location is a few blocks away from ion. I highly recommend this hotel, their service and attention is a hands-down winner.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice with bonus for Muslim travellers”
Reviews.Author: Localtourist12
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel. Good points - halal food at the Carousel in the lobby. If it's too expensive there are a couple of halal restaurants across the street in Far East Plaza. There's a direction for prayers in the room, the first time I've seen one in a Singaporean hotel. Other than that free wi fi broadband internet. Not terribly fast (1 Mbps using the LAN in the room) but adequate for email. They have an internet room at Level 2 which you can use the PCs there to print documents for free. Really saved my day when I received late a document in the email and can print it for my work there. The rooms also comes with complimentary drinks and snacks which is refilled everyday. I liked this one, it may not be a feast but enough to grab a bottled orange juice to bring along walking or have a snack before bedtime without worrying paying exorbitant price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Didzis R
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at this hotel, with a 3 year interval. The hotel has gotten a bit "tired" but still very good ( if you can get a decent discout price). Very minor problems: Nespresso machine installed only after 3rd day of stay, if you are over 6 Feet tall, the bed may not be as comfortable. Overall, there are mor +s than -s at this place. We chose this hotel because last time upgrade to club room, which is worth if it fits your budget...

Reviews.Title: “central location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: taipa
Reviews.Content: The main draw here is the location. It is steps from Orchard MRT and close to all the malls. Rooms are typical business quality. No nonsense, clean, and comfortable. The only complaint I have is that the taxi queue was too long a lot of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: PJC953
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts for 3 nights on our journey home to the UK. We arrived late but were made most welcome by the staff and nothing was too much trouble; without even asking they gave us a late check out on our final day. We had booked the Royal Package which provided wi-fi, mini-bar in our room and in the Club Lounge breakfast, afternoon tea, tea/coffee and evening cocktails; we were not disappointed. The staff were very friendly, helpful and efficient. The hotel is ideally situated if you enjoy shopping but most places of interest can be reached by a short taxi ride. The Concierge in the hotel foyer was most obliging and gave us many useful tips including recommending eating at the Boat Quays and taking a short boat ride around the harbour. The only minor quibble we had was concerning the pool; whilst the pool and deck are very smart our enjoyment was spoilt by the continuous and often loud mobile phone calls being made by business people attending the Business Centre; maybe, I just did not like being reminded of the Real World! Overall we would definitely recommend this hotel for a short break in Singapore and we thank the excellent staff for looking after us.

Reviews.Title: “Rather nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gravitycollapse
Reviews.Content: This really is a rather nice place to hang your hat. It's within walking distance of shopping at Orchard Road, the MRT, buses and was easy to find a taxi. Because they include a limited mini-bar and wireless Internet with the room charge, it's great to not feel nickel-and-dimed constantly while you're there. I'm slightly amazed more hotels don't do this. I had only one minor quibble: they advertise that they have medium and firm pillows available if you ask, and we tried that. We couldn't find much difference between medium and soft, and they didn't have a second firm pillow to replace the medium. Maybe if I had asked before 2 AM, there would have been some. Others might be disappointed by the fact that it's not a hotel with a view...if this is what you're after, this ain't your place. On the other hand, the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive. But for my needs, it was a good place to stay for my 3-night trip in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best in SG!”
Reviews.Author: foldie
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Ritz Carlton for five nights recently, I realized it really pales in comparison with Royal Plaza in terms of service! I stayed at the Royal Plaza over last Christmas and had the opportunity to return to familiar faces at the Royal Lounge which was most exceptionally managed by Tony Khoo, the Assistant Manager! Despite the heavy traffic at the Lounge during the Xmas season, Tony and his dedicated team worked hard to keep their guests happy and full. Thank you Tony for making our repeat stay at the Royal Plaza yet again a memorable stay and treating every one of your guests special whether they stayed in a Deluxe or Exec Room. All hotels in SG can learn quite a bit on service excellence from this hotel! The staff here seem to enjoy their work and are proud of their hotel!

Reviews.Title: “There isn't another hotel like this!”
Reviews.Author: Tige28
Reviews.Content: “Six Star Service! The maid actually lines up my shoes in my room and refolds my shawl! Unexpected, unnecessary,but most appreciated. Non-smoking. No drunks in Lobby or restaurant ( a rare and most appreciated feature);Info on file makes it fast. Choices are easily understood and clear.Fast. Clean, comfortable. The international plugs! Thank you! And the hair dryer is MUCH easier to use - Thank you for moving from bedside to desk!”

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: autobrake3
Reviews.Content: For a 5 star Singapore hotel I fail to understand it's relatively high rating on trip advisor. The rooms are very tired and very basically furnished. the hotel is centrally located but hemmed in by other very adjacent buildings making the rooms dark with a miserable view through, in our room anyway, dirty windows. I guess the free wi-fi and basic minibar is offered free to make up for the shortfall in room quality. Breakfast was great with possibly the largest choice of freshly cooked food that I have seen. However the restaurant had a hint of canteen to it rather than a comfortable place to linger.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: sunloverSussex
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8am and thought we would be told to come back later but no ,we were taken to the lounge and served coffee.After a hour our room was ready and we had been up graded! Beautiful Hotel with everthing you need,excellent location and most important the service,friendly,efficent staff.Beautiful breakfast. Couln not fault it,thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong, lots of right”
Reviews.Author: zetlandSydney
Reviews.Content: my wife and i are from Sydney and we stayed there for 8 days this Feb 2011. we stayed on the 13th floor and took advantage of the club benefits (i.e free internet, free minibar,afternoon tea, drinks etc) and it was well worth it. the room was modern and showed no signs of wear and had plenty of space the breakfast buffet was better than some Nth American 5 star hotels i have stayed in and all staff from the cleaners to the concierge were friendly, helpful and polite. it was one of the few hotels that i have been in where i have felt so comfortable that i didn't just feel that i was simply another guest. the pool was great, nice and private, but my only complaint that although the water was very clean, the pool bottom could benefit from a 'creepy crawly/barracuda' to suck up some of the junk on the bottom of the pool

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgurl2011
Reviews.Content: I got a room deal through expedia, and for this i had a view a parking structure. to me, this doesnt matter. though the rooms were not extravagant, the mini bar provides you with water, beer and snacks every day and free internet. for the price, this was great. the cleaning was also excellent and all the staff were helpful and friendly to me. even when i left the hotel at 5 am. orchard road is bustling and the subway is very close and since sinapore is not that big, getting around is not hard. also, the pool area was nice, a bit small but a great way to relax or cool down. overall- this hotel was perfect and i would go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Torquaylyn
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights for the third time at Royal Plaza on Scotts. As usual we had smooth and efficient check ins. The staff are polite and smiling and make you feel special. Quick, efficient doormen. Our deluxe room was large and the bedding was very comfortable and clean. A brighter decor in deluxe rooms would be appreciated. Overall we had another very pleasant and relaxing stay at The Royal Plaza on Scotts. The breakfasts are delicious. We will go back anytime. For excellent position and service it rates tops.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with great deals”
Reviews.Author: Radwon
Reviews.Content: Great place at good value...for Singapore. They offer great deals on their website if you book within 30 days etc. Staff are absolutely fantastic and have their act together as far as customer service goes. Everybody was very friendly and had a smile on their face. Australian hospitality could learn a thing or two from these guys. Everything was fantastic down to the in house bar. Their drinks were great and were more like doubles. Customer was very impressed too. Only thing I can fault them on was laundry prices. It might just be cheaper to buy new clothes or find another place to wash then if you can't hold out. Two things to point out: I stayed in the Premiere room. The only difference between the Premiere and the Deluxe rooms is the bathtub and the Nespresso Machine. If you don't see yourself taking a bath or making a Nespresso, save yourself a bit and get the Deluxe room. My work colleague had the Deluxe room and it was still very nice. Second thing is if you have breakfast included with your room, watch for other people staying in the hotel putting breakfast on your room. I had a guy actually wait and walk in with me then sit at my table!! It was charged to my room because the girl at the desk didn't know he wasn't with me! You may not think or know this is happening so check your bill at the end of your stay. By the way, Singapore shopping isn't nearly as good, price wise, as Bangkok, Hong Kong or Kuala Lumpur. Good variety as there are many towers and malls but this isn't the place to shop anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Good average hotel with friendly staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mnc27
Reviews.Content: I was travelling alone and stayed only for one night. I didn't spend much time in the hotel. The hotel lobby was a little bit crowded but checking in was easy and fast. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean but nothing to write about.. A little bit lacking in details in my opinion... Very clean bathroom, mine only had shower and no bathtub, but it was fine for me as I never like to use a bathtub. Free internet was a big plus, I was able to video call using my iphone but not for long as the connection was a bit slow. Ordered room service for lunch and the beef burger was very nice. Overall I had a very pleasant stay at the hotel and I would really recommend this hotel for those travelling alone or on a quick shopping trip or a business trip. To be honest it was not my kind of hotel but it was really good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whisper11
Reviews.Content: Often I transit through Singapore and believe that Royal Plaza on Scotts is one of the best and most affordable. From the minute you walk into the hotel, the service is impeccable - from the quick check-in to the staff at the breakfast, the hotel is first class on hospitality. The concierge gentlemen when delivering my suitcase to my room provided me with an overview of all the amenities in my room and hotel, and upon discovering that the FREE mini-bar was half-empty, promptly made arrangements to top it up. It's centrally located to Orchard Road and easy to access tours/buses for sightseeing. Alas my stay this time was just overnight, but I will definitely be looking to stay here again soon when transiting through. The hotel has won several awards and has a great scheme where you can also gain reward points through several frequent flyer programmes (eg. Qantas). Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for stop over in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: GerbenAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during our stop-over in Singapore. After a 13 hour flight this hotel was a perfect place to relax and get used to the different time zone. There was a baby bed for our 16 months old son (at no extra charge) and the staff was very friendly and willing to accomodate us in every possible way (e.g. warm up our son's food in the middle of the night in the hotel's restaurant, allow us to stay in the room after offical check-out time so our son could get some sleep before going to the airport again etc.). Add the perfect location, nice beds and ok-size rooms and I would definitely reccomd this hotel to all you travelling with young kids!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: 1)Convenient since its near the MRT and at the corner of Orchard road 2) Package online of about S$300+ already includes free internet and room bar(2 can drinks,2 beer cans, 2 water bottles and coffee and milo drinks) 3) room is average but quite clean

Reviews.Title: “Pricey BUT worth it !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Erding
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic... if you love to shop you are at the right location. The hotel itself is very comfortable, the staff were always pleasent and helpful. The lounge bar was relaxing and the live music was good, BUT like all Singapore the Booze is really expensive, soooo if you like to drink have to look out for the special offers..... (on Sundays 2 glasses of wine will get you the whole bottle). The pool is small just for a paddle, the gym how desperate are you ? , The restaurant have good food but like everything in this part of the world be prepared to pay....

Reviews.Title: “Nice renos”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: I'm just finishing up my stay here at the Royal Plaza on Scotts. I have stayed here a few times before, but at that time it was only because they had really low rates and the location is great. They have since renovated the rooms and improved their customer relations in the lobby/reception area, and I must say this place has vastly improved. Most of the common areas remain the same, but the rooms and hallways are way better than they used to be. No longer dated. It's all fresh and new nicely done up rooms that are very comfortable! Decent sized and very clean. The only think you have to remember is that there are buildings on all sides of the hotel so there's not much of any views. In my case I got nice quiet room upon request, but it faced the apartment building next door, with peeks to the open space at the back. That being said, you have to remember to close either the room's curtains or bath picture window or the neighbors are able to see you do everything in the bathroom! From my experience in the past, some rooms are noisier than others, and some are about 10' away from the building next door, etc. So if you're claustrophobic you should probably try and get a room facing the pool or the back, etc. Otherwise, you should try another hotel if this is a big issue. What I loved about this hotel is that the internet is stable and it's free! Both wifi and wired connections are available in the room and common areas. The gym is small, but adequate for a decent workout....great that they are fixed with monitors to watch TV while you're on the bikes and treadmills. The pool is small, but cozy. The reception is very friendly and helpful, but are manned by a few "foreigners" who's English is so so, so you sometimes have to speak slowly and repeat yourself a couple of times. But overall everyone was very nice here....even the doorman who greeted me every time I came and went. The other thing I thought was really convenient is that new cafes and restaurants have opened nearby, with a supermarket in the basement of Shaw Center next door where you can buy pretty much anything to eat and drink. They also have a movie theater there. Also very convenient is that the Orchard MRT is a minute away. I'd definitely come back to stay provided they keep the rates low. Sometimes they go crazy with their room rates here with up to $200 swings from the lows to highs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Care”
Reviews.Author: G_Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: I personally did not stay in this hotel but parents did. They have the most wonderful stay and thanks to Yvonne Cheng and her colleagues they felt like royalty. I had emailed the hotel explaining my parents were returning to Singapore after 25 years to celebrate a birthday and a special anniversary, asking for the hotel to place a bottle of Champagne in the room and make a cake - the hotel went above and beyond and made my parents stay truely memorable. I cannot thank them enough. From what i have been told the rooms were fantastic and incredibly comfortable and staff were very attentive. The hotel is in the heart of it all so there was never an issue with getting to and from places. This is definitely somewhere i would go to based on the photos and what i have been told

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality that will make you smile”
Reviews.Author: DCarlos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Plaza because our usual hotel was booked during our visit. Although I had mixed feedback prior to the booking, I decided to give it a try. First impression was how nice the location was especially given the heavy rains in Singapore throughout our stay. The hotel is right beside the Shaw Center which connects underground to several malls without getting wet. The rooms are your typical business rooms with a clean room, decent bathroom and comfortable bed. It is very important to mention that the rooms come with free wifi and the minibar is consumable. Awesome deal! What really sets this hotel apart was the great service all around. On our first night, we asked the hotel to book dinner at a very popular resto and they were able to get a reservation. In my conversation with the concierge, I briefly mentioned that it was my wife's birthday the next day and were very touched to find a birthday cake with a candle in our room the next morning with a note from one of the managers. (thanks Melifecent!) That thoughtful gesture alone made my wife's day brighter and will guarantee that Royal Plaza will always be a top choice of hotel to stay when visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room.”
Reviews.Author: jingga18
Reviews.Content: Great location. Within walking distance to major shopping centres. The rooms are very spacious and recently refurbished with modern cosy decor. Huge beds - even the twins ones can fit two people quite comfortably (they're approximately the size of a double bed each). Free mini bar. Breakfast is great with wide selections. If you're like my husband and don't really enjoy shopping, staying at the hotel will not be too boring because of the free internet. If you don't have your own laptop, go to their business centre. Latest Apple computers are free for customers to use for a limited time per person. The only downside is this hotel can be a little bit crowded and noisy sometimes due to high occupancy rate. But we were travelling at Christmas, so maybe that's just peak season and I'm assuming every hotel on Orchard Rd area would've been just as busy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel Service”
Reviews.Author: ktine203
Reviews.Content: Expect the standard features of a 3 star hotel but service is 4 star :-) the staff are very helpful. The pool is not spectacular but then this is not a luxury hotel--- stayed there to be near orchard shopping area. This hotel is good for shoppers :-) Our room was clean and nice. Not impressive but comfortable... just what you need after a long day of walking and shopping along orchard.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay, but don't expect anything out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: vincentinparis
Reviews.Content: I liked the Royal Plaza, but I find some of the reviews here a little effusive when I compare them to my experience during our three-day, two-night stay. We got a great rate on wotif and were able to upgrade to a club floor on arrival - all in all a very good deal. You could spend your day eating and drinking in the club lounge if you were so inclined. Evening snacks in particular were varied and tasty, wines poor and selection of spirits just ordinary. The real reason you'd want to upgrade from the cheapest rate is to get breakfast with your room. You can get a limited selection served in the lounge, but head for the full-on experience and brave the crowds at the buffet in the Carousel restaurant. From an egg station to a noodle soup station, a fresh-squeezed juice bar and very good breads, fresh dim sum and tasty Indian food, the buffet is a reflection of multicultural Singapore. The selection changes daily, so there's no risk of getting bored. On the plus side: the hotel is in a great location if you're headed to the malls on Orchard, and close to MRT if you're going elsewhere. Cabs were easy to get on Scotts. Our club room had a great bathroom, spacious shower and bath, with some nice Occitane toiletries. Beds were fantastic, and we liked the idea that there were dressing gowns, a pillow menu, free internet and a free mini-bar (though with just two bottles of water a day, we found ourselves asking for more in the lounge). Staff when you met them were friendly. Housekeeping, front desk and club staff were all very efficient. Gym was small but pleasant, pool was quite popular despite not being very spacious. As mentioned above, breakfast alone is a good reason to stay here. On the less positive side: the lobby is small and during weekends at least always crowded, chaotic, and noisy, not giving a great first impression. Other reviews have mentioned the absence of front door service. Door staff was helpful when they could be, but they are so overwhelmed by demand that you're much better off carrying your own bags and hailing your own cabs. We saw crowds ten people deep waiting for cabs in the drive when all we needed to do was walk out in the street and hail a cab. Concierge service we can't comment on because when we wanted to make a dinner reservation, we were never able to speak to the lone woman who was besieged by requests at the concierge desk. And when we returned later in the day, there was no one there at all. Asking the friendly, knowledgeable staff in the club lounge for advice was a much better way to go (plus we managed to score a last minute table at André on our own). Decoration in our club room lacked a little personality (I quite liked curling up in the funky armchair, but there was only one). So yes, stay here if you're looking for something practical and convenient (and if you like breakfast buffets). Don't stay here if you're looking for something cozy, stunning, luxurious or boutique-y.

Reviews.Title: “Passed its prime.”
Reviews.Author: 29grapes
Reviews.Content: Although I felt I was paying to stay at a prime hotel property, we were given a dingy, dark room on the the third floor, a floor titled "Primier." It was essentially at street level, looking out on an active delivery driveway. I was allowed to "upgrade," for an additional charge, to get to a higher floor. The room was still "dingy" and old fashion. The rooms need an upgrade. There are little notices about the room concerning conservation and saving the planet, yet the toilet was the only one we found in Singapore that was not a conservation double flush. The huge window in the bathroom (inside) wall is poorly shaded so it becomes a giant nightlight if he facilities are used while some of the occupants are trying to sleep. Sleep is also problamatic when they are vacuuming the hallway before 0800. Even the location of the hotel is losing its lustre as the center of gravity of activity and entertainment in Singapore shifts away from Orchard Road and moves south to the Marina area.

Reviews.Title: “FREE internet AND MINI BAR - great location”
Reviews.Author: MCJULIA
Reviews.Content: It is a five star rating hotel but it is no comparison to other 5 star hotels in Singapore. What it lacks in furnishings and quality of the rooms it definitely delivers a 5 star service. Great breakfast and lunch buffet! free internet and free mini bar which is something other hotels dont offer so thats a nice bonus.. The room we were given was noisy from the street but I guess this is the issue all hotels have in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Staff help to make for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: StephenPerth
Reviews.Content: This our second stay at Royal Plaza and without a doubt I don’t think I’ve ever had better service. We always pay the extra to have access to the club lounge and it’s worth every penny, Tony and the ladies who served us (sorry can’t remember all the names) are very professional making my family feel very welcome and nothing was ever too much trouble. The food was lovely and the hotel choice of wines was excellent. The location is very central for shopping with the MRT approximately 5 minutes walk away. The hotel rooms are starting to look like some refurbishment work maybe needed soon, but over all our stay was pleasant. We will defiantly stay here on our next visit to Singapore and would recommend it to anyone .

Reviews.Title: “RP Scott Hotel member not for nothing”
Reviews.Author: soetantoa
Reviews.Content: I've been with other hotels in Singapore but only satisfied with RP Scott hotel as they offered the most matured service. They offer free internet service, free bar fridge refill, greatservice & quick response staff. Not even Singapore newest hotel can offer this level of service with higher room rates. Dont expect room with a view as there is none, its grey all around. I'm RP Scott hotel member and will only return to this hotel in Singapore, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - hard to find better”
Reviews.Author: Loveagreathotel
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights over Xmas/New Year. Location is fantastic. Just round corner from Orchard Rd, right near MRT. McDonalds, Starbucks next door. Pasta, KFC, 7 Eleven and small asia cafes across road. You would not find a better location for Orchard Rd Hotels. So many shopping centres so close you can shop, go back and rest, go out again and again. Underneath Tangs is a takeaway with foods, fruit/juice stand that was nice. Carousel Breakfast is incredible. Everything and every culture catered for. Normal cost is $38 per person so try to get it included in your rate - well worth it. We had breakfast, then maybe a drink during day and then dinner at night. No need for lunch. The mini bar refill every day consisted of 2 x Tiger cans, 2 x cokes, 2 x water, 1 orange juide & 2 Oreo's. This is a huge saving. Beers cost around $12 each if buying in bar and cokes etc about $5. Alcohol is VERY expensive. Had standard room for 3 of us (1 fold out bed). Room big enough for 3 adults. Bathroom nice with good amenities. Pool area and gym good and although not a resort style, certainly good for a swim in the humid conditions. MRT pass is excellent and you can top up and if dont use at end of stay, get a refund on whats left. So easy to use and get around. Much easier than Melb or Sydney.Taxi's so cheap also. Sun Tec, Vivo Shopping centre incredible - well worth a visit - allow plenty of time. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Need to get down for breakfast before 9.30 as there is a long line to get in after that. Nice bar area upstairs if you dont have Club rooms. Recommend you visit Sentosa, Marina Bay Sands and do spend the $20 and go to top. Universal was booked out for week in advance which we didnt expect so didnt get to go there. Songs of Sea also booked on night we were on Sentosa.We to Night Safari and a little disappointed. Not as many animals as expected and Taronga and Melb zoo is comparable. Take mosquito repellant and do the train tours first to get idea of layout. Expensive to eat there (for what you get). Took a hop on/off bus tour which would recommend early in your stay to get idea of what to see in Singapore. Goes alot of places and need couple of days if want to see everything. Cannot fault this hotel at all and would recommend highly. You may pay a little more than some Orchard Rd hotels but the extra's like mini bar and breakfast save you so much money overall. Staff are incredible friendly and helpful. I cannot imagine you will find a better hotel for price, location, service and would never stay any where else in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Discreet little gem”
Reviews.Author: ririkl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away in a quiet corner of Scotts Road, and is not as bustling and big as some of the other 5-star establishments in the area. However, the Royal Plaza had everything we needed on our shopping holiday -- excellent service, a good sized room with plasma TV and a recently upgraded bathroom (with a fantastic rain shower that offered perfect therapy for weary bodies and tired feet after hours of walking). The location too is perfect -- right in the shopping hub but away from the madding crowd. A quick walk down to all the popular malls and a Starbucks and McDonalds kiosk right outside the main entrance. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Japan Mac”
Reviews.Author: JapnMc
Reviews.Content: I'll NEVER stay in another hotel in Singapore! This hotel is off the chain! Service, from every staffer, from the time you get out your taxi. This is more than a 4star hotel; One could label it such but no doubt they are 5 star quality in every aspect! I HIGHLY recommend this hotel to any and everyone who visits the beautiful city of Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Opps the Royal Plaza did it again!”
Reviews.Author: BromptonSingapore
Reviews.Content: My first stay was in last September. During our second stay during the Christmas weekend, our friends and us stayed in two Club rooms and one suite and thoroughly enjoyed the Royal Club lounge hospitality. The Royal Club Touch is truly exceptional. During our second stay, we noticed many guests knew the names of the Club staff! The staff was always delighted to welcome a regular guest back. During the Xmas evening, the Royal Club was filled with many guests who made merry with their families and friends. Assistant Customer Service Manager Tony Khoo and his earnest team of ladies worked very hard the whole day. We thank them for their hard work in making everyone at the Royal Club feel special and comfortable, despite having a full house! Throughout the weekend, whether it was the morning breakfast, tea or evening cocktails, Tony, Rosnah, Cynthia and Nina made sure that each guest was well attended. Especially Tony who worked throughout the long weekend. I personally thanked him for his excellent service towards our group. The Royal Plaza has once again delighted us! We are now planning a possible CNY stay just to enjoy the kind hospitality at the Club.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Fantastic Staff, Fabulous Country”
Reviews.Author: geishaPerth
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, to the moment we reluctantly checked out, it was outstanding service from everyone in the hotel. Our room was spotless and very fresh, with possibly the only critism being an extra armchair which would be a great addition for extra comfort. The mini bar was much appreciated as was the addition of a Nespresso coffee machine. The breakfast buffet was just incredible and just about the best we have had anywhere, it was great to sit there and watch the world go by. The pool area was not huge, but perfectly adequate. We will most definitely stay at this hotel next time we go to Singapore, the location is perfect for all the shops and the MRT, with plenty of places to dine. The staff are the best thing about the Plaza as they were always freindly and efficient with nothing to much trouble. To sum up in one word our stay there was " Perfect "

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: Lionel W
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night prior to heading to K.L. so can't comment on pool and other facilities that we did not use or even see. The front facade is such that you might miss this hotel if you were unsure of its location. One inside the lobby is what you expect from a 5 star hotel, superb. Internet was included as well as breakfast. The bathroom had a bath and the water was hot and strong. The room was a good size and well laid out. The mattress felt firm however seemed softer to sleep on than most others throughout Asia. With a bad back and neck this was good for me. The breakfast was simply superb. The wife had two cappuccinos which was no extra cost and she states they were the only good coffees she had on the trip (3 locations, 5 different hotel and numerous restaurants etc). The breakfast selection was far greater than anything I have seen anywhere. Lychees stuffed with pineapple, a juice bar making juices to order stand out as a sample of what was here and not other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Kiwi7
Reviews.Content: We booked a perfect seven deal which is seven nights for the price of six. We stayed in a Club room which proved excellent value for money. The inclusions for the club room were: • Buffet breakfast for two which included a great variety of both Western and Asian food. • Afternoon tea for two in the club lounge. This included sandwiches, cakes and Devonshire tea. • Free alcoholic drinks from 5.30pm to 8pm in the Clun lounge. • Free soft drinks at other times. The other standard inclusions were: • Unlimited high speed internet. • Free mini bar of two waters, two cokes, two beers and one orange juice. These where replenished daily. The room was of a standard size for Asia i.e. small by Australian standards. The room was very quiet. The bathroom was nicely appointed and had a rain forest shower head which we enjoyed. Also the hotel is entirely non-smoking which is very unusual for Singapore. The location just off Orchard Road could not have been better. It is a 5 minute walk to Orchard MRT. I have stayed in several hotels in Singapore and this is the best value for money by far. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nofake
Reviews.Content: Everything has been perfect, spacious clean room, good and huge breakfast selection, staff and managment are professional and friendly. Best in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, mean manager”
Reviews.Author: KayJayCalcutta
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel has an excellent location on Orchard but only suitable for those in Singapore on business. Otherwise, the hotel is no good. Very small rooms, no view, crowded lobby, mean hotel manager who did not bother to inform the booking agent that the entire hotel was under renovation and constant nuisance between 9am to 5pm! We were forced to change our hotels before checking in (we were paying close to 300 plus singapore dollars ) and the hotel manager was just so unfair it was not funny. Not recommended at all with family.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, convenience and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: AshleyHolidays
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel in a Premier room at the end of October 2010 for four nights and it was an absolute delight. All staff and patrons that we encountered were friendly and well mannered. The clientele at the hotel are business people travelling alone and some families on holidays. The highlight points are the great shower, complimentary internet and convenience to shops and MRT train station. The shower has a large nozzle and perfect water pressure and temperature. It was just so comfortable and something to look forward to each morning and after a day out in the Singapore humidity. The location is right near Orchard Street and Orchard MRT station. The train system is very organized and reliable in Singapore. The only downside being there are not many seats on the train. Nearby Newton MRT station is ideal for visiting, especially at night for the Seafood Hawker Centre for some cheap, fresh and tasty seafood. We also found the MRT to be reliable for visiting tourist attractions such as the zoos, Bird Park, Singapore Flyer, Universal Studios and Chinatown. The bus system is quite tourist friendly as well. I've also seen tourist attraction coaches stop at the hotel for those who prefer that experience. In terms of TV channels at the hotel it is predominantly news channels and two movie channels. However, you can unwind in the hotel room by utilizing the complimentary wi-fi internet from your laptop or notebook. The buffet breakfast had a lot of variety and was well organized. I loved choosing my own freshly squeezed juice as well as the variety of fresh fruits on offer. What could have made my hotel stay even more enjoyable than it already was is better quality toothbrushes and toothpaste (easily fixed by visiting the nearby malls) and better pillows. I found both the quill and fibre pillows deflated instantly upon laying my head down. The experience was fantastic! I can't wait to return to Singapore and stay at this hotel again. Until then, I have great memories. :)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Ymint
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice and it's my favourite hotel. It's perfectly located, close to everything including the MRT. I was upgraded the second time I went and enjoyed free cocktails in the club lounge in the evening with colleagues. The bar attendent was chatty and friendly and looked after me well. The buffet breakfast was superb and if you couldn't find something you liked, you'd be very hard to please. All said and done, this is a great place to stay if you are planning on visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amazing Service, Perfect Little Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: awbChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right at the center of the shopping district, Orchard Rd so it's very convenient location. When you want to take a break from shopping, you can always enjoy the free minibar and high speed internet or go to the fitness centre and swimming pool to relax. Overall, one of the best places I've ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: qhdesigner
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous reviewers that this is a pleasant hotel. The candle display in the lobby is quite impressive, as are the stained glass domes on the ceiling. Service is very accommodating. Employees seem to go out of their way to assist guests and it is very appreciated. When we checked in we were not given the quality of room we anticipated. We arrived in the wee hours of the morning and were greatly anticipating our visit since we had stayed here before. The first room they tried to have us stay in was very musty and unpleasant. After a call to the desk the porter moved us to another room, but it was again not as we had anticipated. We stayed in the room for a few hours, had breakfast (always a treat in this hotel) and then returned to the room. We were called by a representative from the front desk to say that we were being moved. This last room is like the room we had on our last stay: more spacious with more amenities. The bed is quite comfortable. The only negative is that one can hear noise in the hallway. Doors do not close quietly and conversations can be disruptive. The location of the hotel is ideal. There is public transportation right outside the hotel or within the same block. And, there are wonderful shops all around the area from the very elegant Paris designers to the affordable. There is also a vast array of food outlets--even a McDonald's Cafe (?) in the same block for those who can't leave home with out it.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC ROYAL PLAZA”
Reviews.Author: johne88
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Royal Plaza on many occasions over the last few years and always have a fantastic experience. The staff are friendly and helpful nothing is too much trouble. Check in is quick and easy. The rooms are always very clean and well presented and the complimentary mini bar is stocked daily. Breakfast is excellent and caters for all tastes and the evening buffet cannot be missed, it is THE BEST IN SINGAPORE!!.The Heat Lounge on the first level provides a nice atmosphere with good entertainment, they also provide a great show for CNY. Can't wait to get back soon. John & Selina Ellis

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service in a comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillericayEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and having monitored the Trip Advisor reviews for the past 3 months expected there to be some problems. Upon arrival our bags were whisked away without any expectation of tip, reception was helpful and even escorted us to the lifts and ensured we knew how they operated. Room was comfortable and well cleaned. We requested additional pillows which arrived within 5 minutes of the call. Service in the Club room was impeccable. Breakfast service in the main restaurant was chaotic at times and coffee refills sometimes became a quest to catch someones attention. Concerge service was excellent and we felt they always gave the best advice rather than the options which gave them the best commision. Departure was smooth and again we were escorted to the door and time and trouble taken to ensure that we got a taxi to take us to the airport

Reviews.Title: “great experience but for the entrance !!!”
Reviews.Author: trivedi666
Reviews.Content: Royal plaza on the scotts nice hotel , good service , great experience all in all a fantastic stay for me ,but just one major glich 'the entrance' of the hotel is packed,conjested and a traffic nightmare .Its funny to find hotel on one of the busiest roads in a Singapore having one lane !!!!....I was stuck to get a taxi out of the hotel on a busy evening but great work by the hotel staff to get me out of there in time ....its great to see the hotel staff so helpful even when its not thier fault i guess to have a traffic mess outside!!!...hope this chaos doesn't last long ....cheers Sudeep sharma

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights September 2010 could not fault service. Arrived very early, long before check in time and enquired if it was possible to have room early and this was granted with no fuss and no extra charge. Member of staff who serviced our room was so friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in room rate and was excellent, so much choice and quality was excellent. Excellent locatiion. Would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again or to reccommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good breakfast on ground floor. Room quality varies.”
Reviews.Author: PopeyeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here twice during the past week. Surprisingly the price went up the second time with about 50S$. Apparently the prices will continue to rise until and including the grand-prix. To the point of quality the best thing in this hotel was the breakfast on the ground floor. As for rooms the higher-quality rooms have a nicer bathroom. Then again, the breakfast on the ground floor is much better than in the lounge on the 15th floor. As for lights, the bed illumination is a bit awkward in all rooms, there is no normal sleeping light. Other than all this a good standard business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rejuvenating Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charity85
Reviews.Content: I love the Vanilla aromatheraphy smells from the candles at hotel lobby. The FREE MINIBAR is a plus for this hotel. It consist of; 2 tiger beer, 2 mineral waters, 1 minute maid, 2 cokes. Location is very strategic. But to my surprsie, the standard room does'nt have a bathtub. Another thing is that I think the hotel blanket is not suitable for tropical countries, need to ask another type of blanket. The aircon is working good but inside the blanket you will fell too hot. It makes you can not sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing, a first class experience”
Reviews.Author: Mila00
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful, modern and very comfortable hotel. Our room was very beautiful and trendy with an amazing bathroom. The breakfast was delicious. Sauna and swimming pool were great too. I definitely recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to worry!”
Reviews.Author: ingSiang
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel with free mini bar and internet (plus free access to the business centre), and a pretty decent breakfast buffet. Perfect location - about 3 minutes from Orchard MRT station, if you're here for shopping then you can never go wrong with Royal Plaza on Scotts. A very muslim friendly hotel (I mean halal food). Definitely live up to it's star ratings. =)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great”
Reviews.Author: Ady60
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have chosen a better hotel. Location was great, staff were very helpful and cheerful (especially the concierge desk) and made our stay pleasureable. Our room upgrade, dinner in the Heat Ultra lounge and gifts for my birthday and our wedding anniversary from the hotel were overwhelming. The royal club lounge was great to relax in after a busy day out and the Carousel restaurant for breakfast was the best. We loved the freshly squeezed juices. All in all our stay at Royal Plaza was 'the best' and we will definately stay there when we are in Singapore again. Bernard & Adrienne D Australia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SALPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the end of June and couldn't fault the service. Room was great, breakfast superb and service throughout our stay was excellent. This is the second time I have stayed in this hotel and I would definitely use it again as it so central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gabysue
Reviews.Content: Staff at the hotel were friendly at all times and all aspects of the hotel I saw were very clean. Hotel is well located for those interetsed in shopping. Room size is on the small size but adequate, inclusive minibar is a nice touch ( contains 2 beers, 2 waters, 2 juices and a couple of coke/diet cokes) and is replenished each day. The Club lounge was good with access available all for tea/coffee and evening drinks. Unless you are a fan of buffets I would recommend having breakfast in the Club lounge rather than the buffet restaurant downstairs as it is much quieter and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel serves halal restaurant”
Reviews.Author: suzKL
Reviews.Content: hi, I stayed here during fasting month. They serves 'sahur' (early breakfast) for muslims from 3-5am at Carousel restaurant. It's really recommended to stay here for muslims. Great location, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION, GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: malteser21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and my 13 year old son. We requested a quiet room on a high floor and were not disappointed. The room was on a high floor and was at the end of the hallway. The view wasn't very exciting but the room was quite spacious and very quiet. We had a rollaway bed put in the room for our 13yo son. The rollaway bed was as good as a normal bed. The free mini bar was good, it had 2 beers, orange juice, coke and water which was replenished every day. Free internet was also great. The breakfast buffet was okay not as good as other places we have stayed but it was okay. Staff were always happy to help. The location was great, right in the heart of everything. It had a well equipped gym and a nice pool which we used every day. Overall a fantastic stay and would recommend the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “recommended for shopaholic!”
Reviews.Author: inaorinya
Reviews.Content: very clean and standard hotels, not so special. lobby is not so comfortable for first class hotel. but, i recommended for breakfast in the restaurant, many kinds of international foods, delicious, and change everyday. all staffs was very friendly. a shopaholic must stay in royal plaza on scotts. it near shopping areas, starbucks,mc D, MRT station, just walk :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JohnDPToronto
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Singapore are not cheap and we found a deal for the Royal Plaza on Scotts located just above Orchard Road across the street from the Marriott. This is a great location. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are great. The staff is fantastic and very attentive and there's complimentary drinks in the room. The one comment is that complimentary breakfast is not included automatically - you have to upgrade/pay more to get it but unfortunately this seems to be standard in Singapore. Aside from that - if you want to stay on Orchard, this hotel is a great option at a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday Singapore”
Reviews.Author: family_501960
Reviews.Content: This is a First Class Hotel!!!. From the first day we arrived we have had a great time. It is centrally located . You are able to walk everywhere- restaurants & shopping centres. Staff are extremely polite and helpful. The breakfast service and variety of food is amazing. The room and bathroom facilities are super clean and comfortable. If you ever stay in Singapore give this hotel a try, you will be very happy with value and quality.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel very central for all a girl needs to shop shop shop in SIngapore”
Reviews.Author: BDOWER
Reviews.Content: have been to Singapore 5 times, but this is the first time staying at ROyal Plaza. the hotel is right in the middle of this shoppers paradise. easy walk to all the main shopping centres in Singapore. Hotel is old style lots of marble and glass, very clean and good service. is more of a work travellers hotel, no tour desk as such, but the concierge will book tours for you. Mini bar is stocked with coke, two beers, water and orange juice and replaced each day for FREE, fantastic bonus as food and drink are expensive. would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Fredcyk
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay at RP. I m very impressed with the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall stay”
Reviews.Author: onlythemostawesome
Reviews.Content: Located on the intersection of Scotts and Orchard, it is right next to the Scotts mall and a bunch of 24 hr cafe options. You're one underpass crossing away from all the malls of Orchard. The hotel lobby is nice with a friendly staff. The rooms are new and very comfortable with all amenities. Free wifi in the room is a definite plus. The swimming pool was small but open on request any time of the day or night. We were quite happy with our stay, and will be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: SATSBangalore
Reviews.Content: good location, city centre, close to orchard road the city happening place/shopper's paradise, good service

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon trip made memorable....”
Reviews.Author: Sharmishtha_Mandal
Reviews.Content: We went to Singapore for our honeymoon after our wedding... and the stay was made memorable because of the excellent service and beautiful room at Royal Plaza on Scotts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located hotel, with wonderful staff and food.”
Reviews.Author: nalinDelhi
Reviews.Content: I am a wheelchair bound individual. I requested for a disabled friendly room and they catered to it promptly. The hotel is overall wheelchair accessible except the entrance where there are stairs though they have provided an ambulift . But there is a slight raise before the flight of stairs starts because of which manual asisstance is required. The staff was very helpful and prompt in coming to my asisstance all the times , but I would just like to suggest that if a ramp could be made just before the ambulift, we would be more independant and the access to the hotel would be more comfortable. Overall our stay at Royal Plaza on Scotts was an excellent experience; the staff was extremely polite and helpful.The buffet breakfast was simply a delight with lots of variety. Personally I would recommend this hotel to anybody who visits Singapore and would like to stay at a great place. I would always choose to stay at Royal Plaza on all times that I visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Travellingvictoria
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Club Rooms and whilst the room itself was nothing overly exciting I was VERY impressed with the service, quality and quantity of food and refreshments available in the Club Lounge. The location could not have been better with Orchard Road just steps away and Lucky Plaza (a great place to get bargains) just across the road. I mentioned to the hostess in the Club Lounge that the rooms looked "tired" and she said that they had just been renovated - hmmmmmmm - they should sack the interior decorator - dark wood and furnishings make for dark dreary look. Rooms are on the small side (compared to other club rooms that we have stayed in). Breakfast in the Club Lounge was a relaxed enjoyable experience however we also enjoyed the main buffet breakfast in the Carousel restaurant. I am not a big fan of the big hotel buffet breakfast as usually there are kids running wild and overweight tourists putting too much food on their overladden plates - but this place just seemed to work. There was an amazing array of food from all over the world and the buffet stations were spread out so there never seemed to be a lineup for anything. The staff were also friendly and efficient. Would definitely stay again when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Orchard Rd shopping excursions”
Reviews.Author: RustyStainless
Reviews.Content: Great accommodation in a fantastic location. Right in the heart of the best shopping along the Orchard Rd strip. While the wife shopped I had some quality time in the pool. Great ambience as you enter the foyer. Rooms were great, though our room had the carpark view :( We didn't eat in the Hotel because their prices were a little on the high side compared to all the cheap eateries so close by. Beware - my wife ordered a hamburger through roomservice the first night we got there, as we checked out I found out that it cost $47 Singapore dollars - Ouch!!!! At "the coffee connoiseur" a just around the corner you got breakfast for two for less than $40. Have a look at this link: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iY5uU5UPXEA We got a good deal over the net so all in all we were very happy. I was very impressed with the bathroom, check it out at this link http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ClZDmw7cKbQ

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: fijime44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights - brilliant location - great service. Pool could be better but then again its just a hotel and not a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but not very special”
Reviews.Author: JSA13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for five nights. The rooms were spacious, but dark. The view outside the window was very disappointing. We could only see the next building, just a few metres away, and the busy Scotts Road from the side. The furniture is made off dark wood, what makes the room even darker. However the room was clean, quiet and cool (very important!!). Beds were comfortable. Staff was nice and helpfull. Breakfast was outstanding. If I wanted I coul'd have eaten something different each day. Choice of English breakfast, Chinese, Indian, Danish pastries, Fresh juices made to your wishes and more, more, more. A breakfast here is enough till diner, you can just skip lunch! It's only due to the poor light in the room that I might choose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, good service, decent room”
Reviews.Author: Mal-n-Shiv
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location at a reasonable price... Room was average, pretty decent... Overall, good stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Jmbau
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 1 night on the way back from a recent trip to Europe. Very happy with everything (except the very high drinks prices, but I think that's a Singapore issue, not the hotel). Excellent check-in chappy who took the time to explain various options, eg, advising me to choose the breakfast now, or pay more for it later if I decided to do it later. I was upgraded to a Premiere room on the 12th floor: it was spacious, quiet and very nicely appointed with everything one could wish for, either for leisure or business travel. No view (my room just looked out onto another faceless tall building) but good light. There's free wifi in all rooms + my rate included complimentary minibar, though this didn't really amount to much (2 beers, 1 juice, 2 water), it was a nice touch. Best business-type desk and chair I've seen in a hotel yet - very comfortable and very useful. The hotel gave me a late check-out for free, plus a further extension (paid for, & reasonable). All the staff were charming and lovely to deal with, the breakfast buffet was sumptuous and overall it was a lovely way to break an otherwise lengthy journey. Brilliant location if you want to go shopping in Orchard Road. I'd definitely return, for the great staff as much as anything else. Minor gripes: I could wish the above-bed reading lights were capable of being dimmed, they were rather ferocious (however, I suppose it's better than so dim you can't read). The pool is rather small and has zilch view, but for a quick dip it was fine. Pity there was no spa.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Visitor looking elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JobyNam
Reviews.Content: I actually did not stay here in May 2010 (previous visit was January 2010), I had a booking but decided to cancel it as I had been meaning to take my business elsewhere for some time. The fact that the hotel wanted to charge me SGD300+ for the privilege firmly put the nail in the coffin. I have stayed at the Royal Plaza regularly whenever staying in Singapore for about the last 4 years whether business or Leisure, partly due to it's excellent location and partly because we had become quite attached to the hotel. Unfortunately we have now decided to go elsewhere as the hotel's service seems to have deteriorated somewhat, possibly due to the fact that the hotel always has high occupancy due to it's location (they are always relatively full so possibly believe they do not need to work too hard to keep their regulars happy). I have three main issues: One of the main issues was during the renovations last year, I had family visiting me in Vietnam and we were going over to Singapore for a break. I was a little disappointed that I was not informed prior to arriving at the hotel that there were extensive renovations taking place. The floor our rooms were situated on seemed to be the hub of the operations and the noise and disruption was a little excessive. The hotel were full so offered no other rooms or any sort of reduced rate, even a SINCERE apology (the reception reluctantly apologised after I complained). Secondly, the hotel provides a free car-park at the back for hotel guests however in January 2010 the car-park was being renovated. This resulted in us having to pay in excess of SGD30 per day for our stay to park our hire car. Again we weren't informed of this at the time of booking! Thirdly, the reservations team are either over-worked or under-trained. On 9/10 occasions there are issues when I try to reserve a room. I always tend to book by email as our company has a corporate rate with the Royal Plaza. Unfortunately simple instructions or requests are normally ignored resulting in incorrect bookings being made. The problem is made worse due to the fact that it is near on impossible to speak to them over the phone and they do not answer emails in a timely manner (if I request a reservation by email, I do not expect to wait several days for a reply). The final straw was when the reservations team ignored my emailed request to upgrade our room using loyalty points. The room was not upgraded and when I looked at my account several weeks ago, my points had since expired. This is enough to convince me to not stay at the Royal Plaza again. Other issues: Free "Hi-Speed Internet" couldn't be slower if it tried Fitness Center basic and limited

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NZ_Paul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a short Singapore stopover. The location and general quality of the hotel are excellent and it gave us a good launchpad for shopping and seeing the city. We ended up booking with Expedia for this one as the pricing was excellent. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with service problems”
Reviews.Author: Theodor111
Reviews.Content: The expectations hadn t been fullfilled. The positive aspects: The location is great. But the service was poor: - At arrival noone cared for our luggage (5 pieces), so we had to carry it by ourself to the frontdesk. - the check - in was jsut neutral, the staff was weather friendyl nor unfriendly. But although it was HOT outside and we sweated a lot, they did not offer us a cold towel or a welcome drink. At least they could ask if we like something. - The room faced a parking-house, 5 m away from your window you looked at a wall. So the room was always quite dark. - They advertise with "free minibar". Ok, ok, there had been 2 coke, 2 cheap beer, 2 water, 1 juice. Nothing to eat. It s a nice guesture but 1 juice for 2 people ... not really a minibar. I would call it "few free drinks" - The bed was very nice, we slept very well. - the room wasn t ready as we went inside, some things were missing. i called Concierge, no reaction. Then i went down to the front office and finally got the missing things delivered. - the room is - if u compare with other 5-star - just under average equiped. - The pool is quite small, and close to one of the meeting rooms. If the have a meeting, the have to food and the plates and and and aside the pool and mayn people are buzzling around. sad and stressful athmosphere. - Check-out-day: we opend the room door and put the suitcases out. 2 (!) bellboys walked along, noone greeted, noone asked if he could help us. - Our flight back was in the late evening. so we planned a relaxing day in Singapore. First problem: they could not provide a safety-box for our important documents. Later on we wanted to have a shower before going to the airport: The just offer a shower in the Sauna. It was really funny: there stood some businessmen, waiting for the one shower, crowded in one small room. That s definetely NOT 5-star standard. and there are many flights in the evening. Anyway, if u just want a room and don t care for view or service, it s a nice hotel. If u expect a little bit more - don t go there.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: RRGT
Reviews.Content: Its all about location with the Royal Plaza. Situated near the junction between Orchard and Scotts Road, the Royal Plaza is an ideal base for shopping and dining. I had stayed here before the renovation was carried out and certainly the rooms have improved. Check-in was prompt and I was upgraded to the Club Level room upon arrival. The room size was fairly average and the furnishing was run of the mill. The free minibar as from my previous stay was not really so much of a big deal. A couple of cans of soda and beer were all that was in it along with two bottles of water. One other feature becoming more and more common in hotels I've stayed at recently was likewise present at Royal Plaza. A glass wall separating the bathroom from the bedroom. Blinds were provided to appease the more modest guests I suppose. While the bathroom was not particularly large, it still had a shower stall separate from the bath tub. One feature that I found lacking however was a phone at the bathroom, which I would've thought was a standard feature in most hotels in this category. Breakfast at the Carousel, which apparently is quite a famous buffet restaurant in Singapore, was okay but the lunch and dinner spreads are far better. Our function was held in one of the many meeting rooms available at the hotel. Apart from the seemingly Arctic conditions (which somehow is quite common here in South East Asia to really have the aircon full blast), the facilities and service were certainly adequate. There was quite a queue when I checked out as there were only 2 people at the front desk. As they had previously allowed me to check-out late then I suppose this was forgiveable. One last thing to note about the Royal Plaza is that it is a totally smoke free hotel. So for a non-smoker like me, then it is certainly beneficial, but admittedly can be a turn off for those people who do smoke. Overall, I would say that the Royal Plaza is a very good hotel, albeit at the same price range and location, there are other better hotels available.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: shahida_roxy86
Reviews.Content: I am local and wanted to experience a hotel stay in my country itself. It was the very first time i stayed over in a hotel in my own country. I am very pleased with the services this hotel provide. I was given a few complimentary stuffs and was truly surprised by it. All the staff were friendly and approachable, they're always with a smile very pleasant looking. Singapore is a very busy place especially where the hotel is located, lots of people and very noisy but once I'm inside my room i feel so relax and at times i even felt that I'm not in Singapore but elsewhere. The only thing that the hotel lacks is, the view. Thumbs up to all the hotel crew for making my stay a pleasant one. I'm looking forward for another visit there.

Reviews.Title: “10/10”
Reviews.Author: davval
Reviews.Content: Returned home today after an 8 evening stay and if any one is wondering about where to stay just book this hotel. This was one of the nicest, most efficient and friendliest hotels I have stayed in. Buffett breakfast was great and plentiful, rooms up to date, roomy clean and above all quiet. Love the shower. Net a little bit slow but there is no charge and you get there eventually. Location is brialliant - MRT'd to everywhere. Your hotel could teach many others how a simple smile from staff can make for a pleasant stay. Well done Thankyou to your hotel and staff

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ajtrejo
Reviews.Content: Had a deluxe room with breakfast. Room was nice and clean, the bed was also good. The bathroom was small but had a good size shower. The maid staff was extremely friendly. The rest of the staff was also friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is good and has a good spread of food, if you like breakfast every morning its a good option for the room with breakfast. The Dinner buffet was good but very expensive, I was not told the price upon entering. The hotel is located in a perfect area, the crossing of Orchard and Scotts has a mall on every corner and lots of restaurants. There is free wifi in the hotel, although the signal was very low and I mostly had to use the connection at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dee255068
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights & could not have been happier. On arrival we noticed a light globe was out so we reported this & it was attended to immediatly. The only problem we had was the bar fridge was not restocked each day as advertised, (free of charge) but as soon as we phoned to ask to have it done it was done straight away. The room was very spacious even with the 2 queen size beds which were very comfortable. There was no view out the window only a brick wall but that never bothered us as we were in our room at night only. Breakfast was magnificent but suggest you try to include this in package as we did. Nothing was too much trouble for Concierge. The prices in the Bar were quite expensive. The smoke free environment was very pleasing. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and noisy”
Reviews.Author: AlLeGrand
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the RP many times and am sorry to say that its decline continues. It has recently been refurbished but whoever the designer was seems to have a love affair with brown and drab. Corridors and rooms are uninviting and look shabby. Normally I stay on a club (higher) floor but travel budget cutbacks consigned me to the incredibly noisy 6th floor with a view of the car park wall next door.
