Construction noise 24/7 and an A/C that just wouldn't quit. Check-in was quick and friendly enough but no help with bags offered and no directions to the room or guidance about the facilities. Fair enough I suppose, I have stayed there many times and they had me flagged as a repeat guest. The room was freezing but when I raised the temperature on the thermostat it just got more humid. Very uncomfortable throughout my stay. Bathroom small but functional with very good water pressure in the walk-in rain shower. Bed incredibly uncomfortable and whoever thought of putting halogen reading lights in the ceiling that shone directly in your eyes deserves to be fired. The lobby was a cacophony most nights as loud screeching and wailing emanated from the bar on the mezzanine floor. I don't know if it was karaoke or a "professional" band but the noise permeated the whole of the ground floor and gave me a headache. There was no respite in the restaurant as the canned "contemporary" classical racket competed with the noise from upstairs. Thelarge "international buffet" food quality was terrible and the service worse. Tables are much too close together and the resulting squeeze-pasts made for a very unpleasant dining experience. $76 for the buffet and a coke was poor value and you can do so much better in Singapore for less. Prospective guests should take note, the hotel is 100% smoke-free. No bad thing and it was a pleasant change not to have the smell of stale smoke in the corridors. The hotel rightly touts this as a plus-point but what is less widely advertised is that the menu is entirely halal. Great if you are a muslim but when they start substituting veal bacon and chicken n' cheese suasages for pork products in Italian dishes it makes for some pretty disgusting offerings. Breakfast was a joke, stick to the eggs if you want something hot or go for the Asian food. The "western" menu with halal substitutes for pork was revolting. The hotel has a small pool and a tired-looking gym as well as a busines center and plenty of conference rooms. If I were forced to stay there again I would pay the extra for a club floor and eat out all the time. Checkout was quick and error-free. The RP rubs shoulders with some first division competition on Scotts Road with a Marriott, Sheraton and Hyatt in close proximity. It was formerly a Crowne Plaza until bought out by an independent operator but it could not even punch its weight in that league. Its location right in the heart of the city is about all it has going for it these days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Royal Plaza on Scotts Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeafMacs
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore In December 2004. Love this Royal Plaza on Scotts Hotel. Very Excellent buffets and Luxury bedroom. Service is really more very helpful. Actually, this 4/5 Star of Royal Plaza on Scotts Hotel is good quality. Close to biggest shopping and restaurants. Very enjoyed to spent with it. WONDERFUL!!!! Miss it.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ersser
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay would recommend to everyone very friendly and helpful staff. The room and surroundings are fantastic. Great food and good service. I will stay again. We booked for two nights before our cruise and loved it so much that we booked an extra night after our cruise. It was like coming home and we were upgraded for free as we had stayed there before.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Ashley_Belle
Reviews.Content: Checked in with my spouse for a weekend staycation since its my birthday. I stayed in this hotel a good 5-6 years before and still had good memories of the hotel Checking in was brisk and took less than 10 mins. My spouse had stated in the reservation form that it was my birthday so the hotel took the initative to bring up a small slice of cake with a knife and fork on a plate. That was a nice gesture, thank u very much! Everything went downhill from then. The room was really stuffy and it took at least 3-4 calls to the housekeeping dept before it was answered. (I dont think 4-5pm is a peak time to call?) The aircon repair guy came in, with his shoes on, stomped all over the floor and took a good 15mins fixing the aircon. He then declared that theres nothing much he can do abt the aircon, he went on into some technical terms which i didnt quite understand and to put it quite simply, he simply said the thermostat thingy is spoilt, we could only hv a FIXED TEMP, so would we want LOW, MED OR HIGH? We chose MED since low would be stuffy and HIGH too cold. So thats it. No more temp adjustments for us. I have to tell u, its SUPER COLD in the middle of the night and theres NOTHING i can do abt it becos i cant adjust the temp! Its crazy. W e requested for a complimentary parking coupon from the desk when we headed out at midnite and was handed a ticket that stated: GOOD TO 30/4/10 1159PM. Now, that was weird. The receptionist assured us that we would hv NO PROBLEM going out although we pointed out that the ticket has expired. Guess what. We were stuck at the gantry driving out because as expected, the ticket has expired! The cars were honking behind us and my irritated spouse had to pay the $16+ charges just not to go to the trouble of explaining to security, running back to recption, etc. It was totally TERRIBLE! The next day, a friend came around and brought a birthday cake to me and it took another 8-9 calls before the phone was answered and my request for a clean plate and fork got through. Another 15mins long wait before the plate arrived. Our check out time was at 3pm because we checked in slighly later the day before. Me and my spouse fell asleep after lunch and when we woke up, it was close to 2.45pm. We did a quick call to the reception to apologise and told them we would check out of the room by 3.30pm. The receptionist was VERY UNACCOMODATING! She simply stated curtly that any extension beyond 3pm would be charged at $25 per hour. Now, thats what i call unreasonable. Here we are apologising in a kind manner and she was curt and rude and sounded like we did it on purpose. This is the last time im ever gonna stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ageiola
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed at the Royal plaza on Scotts for a week in May 2009.The location of the hotel is in a great location (Orchard road) and the rates are very good for a hotel in this location.The hotel staff were all very polite and attentive and the room was very clean , modern and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “I was stating in a club room which always...”
Reviews.Author: MuddyBath
Reviews.Content: I was stating in a club room which always makes a difference, but it's a nice hotel. A couple of hundred metres from Orchard Road and Orchard MRT so a good location. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th or 5th visit to RP. I would say it was the worst, compared to my other stays, but still acceptable. I would stay here again if I can get a better rate. S$270 or S$318 after tax is a bit much for the room, the bathroom is tiny and has no bathtub.. It's the same price at Marina Mandarin but the room there is bigger, especially the bathroom. I was disappointed on checking in to be given a room on the 5th room, which I believe is the lowest floor, and is where the pool is. Especially after receiving emails from the hotel before I arrived, like they were eagerly anticipating my arrival. I admit I had gotten spoiled to being upgraded the previous 2 visits and expected the same this time. The room generally was acceptable, it had all that I needed, Internet (albeit slower than before) and free soda and juice in the minibar. There was no view but it wasn't a necessity. The only major annoyance with the room was that I was next to a guest who had 2 or more rooms near me. They liked to go in and out of their rooms, keeping their doors open, so the doors were slamming every couple of minutes. It's not the hotel's fault, but i would have liked it if they could have placed these guests away from my room. It's really annoying if you have to deal with other people's selfishness. One of the best reasons for staying here is the location. It's right off Orchard Road, near to everything, shops, restaurants, things to see. Like I said before, I would stay here again, if I can get a better rate, less than what I paid this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Awesome Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Shafraz
Reviews.Content: This is what I would call a "WOW" hotel!! From the moment you walk into the foyer the holiday begins! Checkin was quick, room was great! We received a Congratulations Cake for our honeymoon also which was really really nice!! And Big!! Thank you so much! The location is perfect!! Orchard Road is right outside...so many malls...the MRT station on Orchard is across the road also...but why use the MRT when the Taxis are so cheap!! The restuarant is amazing!! Give yourself heaps of time as there is so much choice and you dont want to leave before trying them all!! Gym was state of the art and pool was good. Overall the Hotel was perfect!! Set such a great standard!! I will not fault it at all!! The concierge was very unhelpful. The doormen and boys manning the taxi que made up for their inadequacies and we always talked to them rather then the guys at concierge. Maybe the hotel should look at putting the doormen and the taxi que boys on concierge!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: addictedtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Royal Plaza for 4 nights, from the time we arrived to the time we left we experienced exemplary service. One thing I like about the hotel was it was environmentally friendly. Every time we requested for something they were there quickly. The staff always had a smile on their faces, and they were very attentive to our needs. The option of a rain shower or the handheld one in the bathroom was a good touch. Also the pillows were great, they shaped to the form of our heads. Three other added bonuses that we appreciated was the large working table, the free wifi, and the free mini bar that was stalked everyday. Definitely one for the books. I don't question why hotel has the award for best independent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A comfy hotel right in the heart of Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: glyn0220
Reviews.Content: I was happy that our room was ready when we reached there at 12.00 p.m. We checked in right away, and were allowed late check out at 2 p.m. two days later. The room had a king sized bed, but the pillows were too soft, probably worn. They gave us neck ache. My partner was really happy that a work table was available and he could work, with the free wi-fi that was available. I loved the fact that it was smoke-free. There was a shower cubicle with rain shower. The mini bar was also free - there were even 2 cans of Tiger Beer. Plenty of choices for breakfast., served buffet style - there were both western and asian fare, breads and pastries, cereal and fruits. The staff were courteous and friendly, greeting us at corridors, in the lifts and lobby. Needless to say, the location of the hotel was superb. It's a convenient walk to the mrt or to orchard's posh malls.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely quick and friendly service, great quiet rooms and beds!”
Reviews.Author: sjl888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel (and had previously) and experienced its usual friendly polite and efficient service right from the start -- we had missed our flight into Singapore and were 12 hours delayed but staff were totally understanding (inclusive of reservations staff) and sympathetic the moment we arrived. We were almost instantaneously checked in, and up to the room to rest. Pros: 1. Location -- its right near the Scotts Rd / Orchard Rd junction, closest to new shopping centre "Ion". 2. Quiet rooms well decorated, with lovely rain shower with great water pressure 3. Efficient service 4. Free internet 5. Minibar all inclusive in hotel price (basic drinks). Cons (very few but if i could think of some): 1. Price -- it is somewhat pricey but in my opinion worth the stay as you pay for a decent room in a great location. 2. Breakfast --- often large queues, must find a way to streamline this a bit more. 3. Gym -- missing a lot of gear e.g. lat pulldowns, heavier free weights (small selection) Overall well worth it and well recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: BucketandSpade88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights on a tour of Malaysia and Singapore. We found the hotel an elegant and comfortable home in a great location close to shops and public transport. The rooms are a good size and well appointed, free minibar with beer and soft drinks, free in room WiFi and the buffet breakfast was one of the best we have experienced. The staff were all helpful and pleasant. The pool is small but very adequate. This is a city hotel so do not expect great vista's from your room.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Familytravellers08
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I took our mother to Singapore for her 75th birthday in March 2010, and had booked the Royal Plaza on Scotts for the proximity to the MRT. Before arriving, we had emailed the hotel to see if they could arrange something special for Mum and we were not disappointed! They upgraded my sister and mother to a premium room on the 11th floor, which was as good as our superior room on the 4th floor, but had a view and a full sized bath. They arranged a birthday cake on her birthday and delivered it to her room and proceeded to sing "Happy Birthday". The staff were attentive at all times, from the cleaners to the wonderful concierge staff. The rooms were spotless and comfortable. We could not have asked for anything more. A truly memorable stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MuhaiminHamdan
Reviews.Content: Nice ambience, its on scott's road, good and halal food.....

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: joford
Reviews.Content: Very speedy and friendly check despite it being 2:00am. Offered free late check out until 3pm which was appreciated. Free mini bar was very nice - water, juice and a couple of beers - what else do you need? The curtains blocked out the light well so was able to sleep late. The bed was comfortable but needed more pillows. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. For a quick over night stay in Singapore this hotel was just right.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, not real bacon”
Reviews.Author: melaniejane33
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel in a club deluxe room and I was very happy. The check-in was speedy and friendly when we arrived and the staff were friendly for our stay. The room although not large was big enough as we didn't spend much time there. The bed was fantastic and new pillows were supplied the next morning as I requested on my feedback form. The bathroom was mould free (unlike most hotels in Asia) which made me very happy. I preferred the breakfast in the restaurant downstairs as opposed to the club as it was freshly prepared and there was more choice, although upstairs was nice if you would like peace and quiet over breakfast. There was only thing we were really upset about, we did not realize the restaurants are halal. As we are living in KL we were really looking forward to some real bacon and could not believe our eyes when we saw beef bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sportbilly121
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Royal Plaza. Like one other reviewer we were 'upgraded' to a Premier Corner Suite, read a room at the end of the corridor. Having lived in SG for 8 years and being somewhat aware that the Royal Plaza had undergone renovation in recent yearsm having stayed there now I wonder where and how. Low ceilings, very average rooms, less than average fixtures and fittings .. I'm glad my company paid as I wuld have spat the dummy out otherwise. Location is great, on site facilities again very average. I'm actually surprised it's rated as high as it is for SG hotels. Defintely not a 'business' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Janerty
Reviews.Content: Great location, as it takes us only 3 minutes by foot to get into Orchard Road's main shopping belt. The service staff were polite, efficient and accomodating. We booked a superior room online, and were dissapointed to find that it came without a bathtub. Upon checking with the front desk and sharing with them that we really needed a room with a tub to bathe our toddler, we were offered a complimentary upgrade within minutes. As for the rooms, they were clean and comfortable enough, but they're nowhere near the standards of local boutique hotels. Also, the hotel pool was very small.

Reviews.Title: “buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: mickmoe
Reviews.Content: The room you see on vdo. may not be what you really get.Smallest bathroom I have ever seen and not cleaned 100%everyday just a change of towels. Comfortable bed,personel safe &(FREE MINI BAR) maybe ok.But not what you might expect.Food in restaurant ok. if you go for hal hal.Only warm at best & over priced to add to the disappointment.The HEAT LOUNGE again only luke warm and over priced. Beware of HAPPY HOUR. Only some drinks are on 2 for 1 list.& you may not find out until the next day.The staff try their best with the hotel policy.If you want "location" you can't go wrong.Orchard/Scotts is perfect but if you want to avoid the hassles PAY A LITTLE BIT MORE STAY IN A DIFFERENT HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Well located with pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: woodsjc
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Room was quite generous. We were "upgraded" to a corner suite, but couldn't see any difference, no extra window. Black out curtains worked well, and despite being in such a busy area, heard no traffic noise. We found the staff were very friendly through all levels of the hotel, from the cleaning staff to the concierge. On our way back from breakfast the first morning we mentioned that the previous person had locked the safe and one overhead bed light wasn't working. We were told 5 minutes, and we had barely closed our door when 2 staff arrived and attended to both. Breakfast was lovely, lots of choices and again friendly staff. Hotel is well situated for Orchard Rd area and the MRT. Night Zoo pickup is almost at the door. Complimentary drinks were very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay indeed”
Reviews.Author: Blueberry50
Reviews.Content: i arrive very early to the hotel, the reception allowed me to check in early without charge. Very efficient and quick check in.staff was very friendly and they greet and smile even when they are very busy. There is one lady at the reception very helpful and guide me during my stay here. I didnt get her name. Location Very near orchard..just a few steps.Breakfast was good and lot of variety. Next to the hotel is a duty free shop. All i can say is worth of staying when they hv free drinks in minibar even just for 2 cans of beer coke and juice. Internet is free too but the network is too slow. The hotel does not have any good view, room is facing carpark.Overall, i enjoy my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location......”
Reviews.Author: goldseashell
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a room on the 11th floor and given complimentary drink coupons to use in the second floor lounge bar. The staff was friendly and accomodated our requests quickly and courteously. The concierge and doorman were very helpful. The room was bright and clean and the free wifi and free mini bar were bonuses. If we wanted more of an item it was quickly replenished. The bathroom was roomy and filled with amenities and had a huge picture window which overlooked the rest of the room. There was a pull down shade if more privacy was required. The breakfast buffet was extensive and filled with fresh and made to order items. This was a perfect way to fuel up for a busy day of sightseeing in Singapore. So if you have an option to choose a room with breakfast buffet go for it. We loved the hotel location which was close to major shopping centres and the Orchard MRT. We were easily able to travel to all of the sights we wanted to visit by using the MRT or the abundance of taxis. We would definitely stay here again. It was a great experience!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Overpriced building site with unhelpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dazisa
Reviews.Content: What a nightmare our stay here was, I completely agree with previous comment about feeling uncomfortable as soon as arriving here! We arrived at the end of our fabulous honeymoon around Australia, to a shabby hotel, undergoing noisy refurbishment, day and night, only to be talked to like idiots by the reception staff, who tried to argue with us simply because we wanted a room where we could get a bit of sleep! The hotel pool was also booked out to various private parties throughout the day, meaning it was closed to hotel guests! Free Minibar consisted of 2 cans of beer and 2 cartons of orangejuice! Fair enough location was great, but after paying £400 for 2 nights, we felt extremely disappointed! Will not be returning or recommending this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “If you say non-smoking, mean it!”
Reviews.Author: RogerTruffle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was billed as the answer to a non-smokers prayers. I travel regularly throughout Asia for business and pleasure and it is very difficult to have a room that is not in some way affected by cigarette smoke, even if you ask for a NS room on a NS floor. So I was delighted to have a go at staying in a hotel that has great pride in announcing that they are the first 100% non-smoking hotel in Singapore. Now I preface this comment by saying that smokers are selfish, weak and inconsiderate people by nature and the hotel has no control over a smoker who signs at check-in that they will respect this hotel policy (which you are required to do) and then ignores it (which they also do regularly on NS floors in other hotels) but this didn't help me much. Without any consequence for smoking in your room there is little incentive, I suppose, for smokers to honour their word. In the room the linen smelt like cigarettes, as did my clothes and the air carried a constant soft smell of second-hand smoke courtesy of the air-conditioning. In the elevator bay the smell is at its strongest. So, the short story is, if you're a non-smoker trying to get a hotel room that doesn't smell like cigarettes, give this place a miss. They simply failed to meet their commitment. Some other bits of information that you may find useful: Gym: It is very small, with limited free weights (heaviest weight is 10kg dumbbells), some machine weights (chest press, shoulder press, leg extension, hamstring curl (broken when I was there for the length of my 1 week stay) and ab curl. Two running machines and a couple of exercise bikes. In peak periods it is impossible to use the room, period, and there isn’t enough room to turn around, let alone exercise, if you are not on a machine. Pool: Unusually small and positioned (along with the gym) in an extension onto the adjacent building. Because of its size you need to be very quick to get a good spot. It is also not lit in the evenings and frankly pretty creepy (according to my partner). In this area, for the price, there are options that are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Suck! We will never come back again!”
Reviews.Author: mystery_advisor
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st time visit to RP and its going to be our last there. We are definitely not going back to this hotel or recommend anyone to stay there. The size of the club room is very small and it is full of mirrors. The rooms were either facing car park or private condominiums. We observed that the majority of the staffs were not trained to greet guests. They treated us invisible and expected us to greet them 1st. One male employee who was in charge of the inventory of the mini bars in the rooms at the 14th club floor was busying singing away and don’t even bother to greet us. We felt that there was no privacy at this hotel as throughout the whole day, we could see the cleaning staff and their trolley along the corridor all the time. The service at the Club lounge was also very disappointing. We expect that the customer service at club lounge to be better than what we had experienced in RP so far but we were wrong! We had to wait for a long time before the waitress notice our presence and came to attend to us. They do not address guests by their 1st names at all. The quality and quantity of pastries available during the tea time were miserable and we had no choice of selection at all as it was already pre-selected by the chef of the lounge presented in a 3-tier carrier. At the evening cocktail, the finger food available was not fantastic either. Each of the dishes was presented only in a mouth full portion serving. Quality of the food was below par. The “Gossip” red and white wine was of a pretty budget range. This gave us an impression that the club lounge was not as generous as other 5 star hotels lounges found in Hyatt and Swissotel. Breakfast at Carousel was average. The selection was also limited. What freaked me out was that my wife told me a waiter had actually whistled at her while she was taking her food. How could a 5 star hotel employ such rude staff? Where is the professionalism of service that is expected of a 5-star hotel? The complimentary mini bar was the joke of the day! We expec7ted it to be full of beverages but there were only 2 cans of beer, a small bottle of orange juice and 2 cans of soft drinks. When we requested for replenishment of drinks in the early morning prior to our checkout at noon, we were told that their "rules and regulations" do not allow guests that are checking out to replenish the drinks. What a stingy and shrewd management of this 5 star hotel. The management needs to revamp its customer service. We have been to several hotels and RP is the 1st encounter of its kind. It is totally not flexible and strictly follows by its “rules and regulations”. For most of the hotels we have been to, most will either grace a late check out by an hour or 2 or politely reject us if it is fully booked on the day of our checkout. RP strictly do not allow later than 2pm checkout else, it will be chargeable at SGD$25 / hr (subjected to 17% GST tax!). Moreover, there is strictly no replenishment of beverages on day of check out. The club lounge strictly allows only 2 guests per club member and the waitress goes around enforcing this.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Tweety18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at 6:30am and the hotel staff was very nice to allow us to check in early. The hotel is centrally located, only 2 min walk from Orchard MRT station and there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel. We stayed 2 nights at the Deluxe room. The room is clean and modern and offers complimentary drinks/beer. We'll be more than happy to stay in this hotel if we're going to Singapore again and will definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay, as impressed as ever”
Reviews.Author: WorksOnly2Travel
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Royal Plaza for the third time last month, and were as impressed as ever with the hotel. First, the location is excellent. It is a short walk to Orchard Road, which is filled with shops and places to eat. The underground crossing is actually easy to navigate after giving it a couple of goes (and reading the signs...). The underground links you to the MRT, Ion shopping centre, Wheelock Plaza, Wisma Atria and Tangs - everywhere! There are plenty of food options around the Royal Plaza, not all junkfood either. Sure, there is a McDonalds and Starbucks, but there also is Canelle, Food Republic and Tangs and Isetan supermarkets / food courts. I'd recommend getting the hotel breakfast included. It was amazing! So much variety - eggs, bacon, sausages, pasteries, waffles and more. The hotel resturaunt may seem expensive, but is not at all 'snooty' and is value for money - especially when having the buffet. The rooms were nice and clean. We had a problem where out power went out, but a quick call to reception and it was fixed. The only complaint I have from this visit is that on one of the days our room wasn't made up - we put the make up room light on at 930/10am and returned to our room at 4pm to find it hadn't yet been made up and we were anxious to get ready to go out to dinner. After calling housekeeping they dropped round some new towels and were ver apologetic - it seems there was a miscommunication. The free mini bar is great - and exactly that - free. If something is free, it shouldn't be complained about! It had 2 tiger beers, 2 coca colas, an orange juice and two bottles of water, and was replenished daily. The hotel is a short, cheap taxi ride from many of Singapores attractions, including Clarke Quay, the Flyer, Chijmes, the Raffles and Dempsy Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the fact it was a true non smoking hotel”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYAUSSIE_1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot. only a couple of minutes walk to Orchard Road etc.. Lovely room, very polite and professional staff, will definitely stay again. The only fault was a limited room service menu - when you are exhausted like we were it would have been nice to robe up and watch TV to something in the room. Very business orientated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Plaza on Scotts”
Reviews.Author: cheezy59
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here in feb 2009 as part of our honeymoon - was amazing, the staff we very friendly and helpful,,, and OMG the buffet downstairs from the hotel was just amazing, the food was just wonderful... recommend to stay here .... we will be staying here again if we ever go back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: HolidaymakerRS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts hotel several times now. It's our home away from home. The location of the hotel is perfect. It's a stone's throw away from the fantastic malls on Orchard Road, and from the Orchard MRT station. The rooms are very comfortable, and the service is impeccable. We stayed in the Club Deluxe Room on our last trip, which was fantastic! The benefits included complimentary daily breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails. These were served in the Club Lounge on the highest floor of the hotel, with a great view of the city. The service in the Club Lounge was outstanding. We have tried a couple of other hotels in Singapore, but the Royal Plaza on Scotts is still our first choice. With perks like free minibar beverages, as well as free unlimited internet access in all rooms, it really doesn’t get much better!

Reviews.Title: “one concierge spoilt an otherwise perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Lee098
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Very close to Orchard Rd & MRT. Would have been a perfect stay if it was not for an incident when Juliana at the concierge desk told us that we must bring down our lugguage to the lobby to have them weighed when we asked to borrow a scale. We found this very unusual as other hotels do supply scales. When we checked with reception we found out that it was a hotel policy to bring scales to our room for us to weigh our luggage. We considered that an appalling and unacceptable service from Juliana ..how does she expect guests to pack up their suitcases, bring them down to the lobby, have them weighed and take them back to their rooms? If the people at reception knew about “bringing scales to guests’ room” policy then Juliana being at the concierge desk should have been even more aware of that policy. Our advice is not to request any service or information from Juliana at concierge desk as she would definitely mislead hotel guests. Apart from Juliana's poor service we could not fault the hotel..from reception to room service to the taxi concierge (who one occasion actually walked out to the main road to hail us a taxi). Otherwise a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and comfortable, Free Wireless great bonus”
Reviews.Author: Traveller276
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Xmas. Had twin room - beds are nearlly double bed size. Pool and gym great. Buffet lunch on Xmas Day fantastic - book early. Mini bar top up with soft drinks and water great value. Take you own hairdryer - the location and strength will not make drying sholder length hair possible! Wash and blow dry $18-22 sing dollars across the road at Far East Plaza. We have rebooked for next year - great value and hassle free

Reviews.Title: “In a really busy location surrounded by junk food outlets.”
Reviews.Author: mskatie1959
Reviews.Content: My first time in Singapore, it was only to have a couple of days stop-over on the long trip back from Europe. It's a lovely hotel, but a bit over-priced in a very busy area. The facilities are good, the staff were friendly but the hotel just feels cold, stuffy and unfriendly. Sterile maybe is a good description. The Concierge guy was really friendly and welcoming and the cleaning lady was nice and chatty and the room was very clean, but the hotel just felt cold. Website says mini bar drinks are free, ahh yeah, 2 beers and a couple of sugary juices. There was no map or list of hotel facilities in my room. I mentioned this on my Comments Sheet when I checked out and got a letter from the Manager saying it was in a drawer in the room. It wasn't. I looked everywhere, in the end I had to go exploring to find the pool, business centre etc. I certainly wouldn't choose this hotel for location. In 2 days I didn't manage to work out how to cross the road. Looks easy, there's an underpass, that branches out into a five way, multi-level, chaotic paedestrian underground city. I just wanted to cross diagonally to get to a particular shop, tried for hours and ended up in more and more shops that I didn't want to be in, with hawkers trying to sell me things I didn't want. Perhaps the hotel could provide guests with a map showing how to cross the road. I wanted to eat and maybe find a Pub for a couple of drinks and socialise with other tourists. The hotel was way too expensive and snooty to eat or drink at, but around the hotel it's fast food outlet after yet hundreds of more fast food outlets. If you want junk food, obesity and a heart attack, Singapore is the place for you. Finally I got a taxi and asked the driver where I could get REAL food. He took me to China Town which is where I'll stay next time I stopover in Singapore. I loved China Town at night. It bussled with friendly activity, the food was authentic and the beer was cold. I can't say Singapore impressed me, it's just a huge busy shopping centre. If I want to go shopping I have shopping centres near where I live where I can buy anything they sell in Singapore. The hotel was nice, just not my cuppa tea. Maybe it was the area. Maybe that's Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: capetownqueen
Reviews.Content: Very good location but rooms smelt a bit musty and very dark. Breakfast area was too small to fit so many people in it. Staff was very friendly and helpful. All food is halaal but the variety was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “I came back after a first average stay last year and I am glad I did”
Reviews.Author: bambaSydney
Reviews.Content: So the question could be why ? my first stay was average and I found the hotel overatter BUT the location was fantastic. when I had to stop again with my yound children in Singapore I decided to stay elswhere and searched and searched for a good deal in a great location...well the Royal Plaza was my choice again and I am glad I came back. The service was actually much better then durring my first stay. The wi-fi worked first time and the breakfast was great (as it was the first time). The pool could do a bit better i.e service is slow for Singapore but all in all it is still a good hotel, great location and good service. I would recomend again if I had to BUT will be trying somewhere else on my way back...just for a change

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Food and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jagman310
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at the Royal Plaza on every visit that we had to Singapore before we had our little boy. The rooms our a little on the are a decent side and the free mini-bar option is great but has reduced in value over the years as the have reduced the offerings. Staff at the hotel are great and friendly. Free wrieless internt is great and can also be accessed while at breakfast. Buffet breakfast is awsesome, with a huge selection of western and asian delights - probably the best breakfast out of any hotel i have ever stayed at. Same goes for the Buffet dinner - choice galore and the chocalate fondue station is amazing! The pool is a little on the small side but good enough. The only complaint i have is that there is no access for prams at the front of the hotel. As door staff are always too busy getting taxis and unloading luggage for other guests. I have brought this issue up with management and staff on a couple of occassions and recieved a reply of "staff should always be there to help guests"! But being such a busy hotel - the staff rarely have the time to assist us with carrying our pram up and down the few steps. This is my only gripe and is becoming a major as most young families would find that after a busy day of shopping/sight seeing, carrying your own pram is difficult. But, otherwise, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little more choice at breakfast would have been nice”
Reviews.Author: RollyB
Reviews.Content: Such a great hotel with wonderful, friendly staff from the front door to reception and beyond. Our extended family came to Singapore to view the Christmas lights and enjoy some shopping. Perhaps the only slight disappointment of our stay at the Royal Plaza was the buffet breakfast choice. We found it a little limited and the replenishment rate somewhat tardy. As a frequent visitor to Singapore over a number of years staying at different hotels I guess we have become used to much bigger and better breakfast choices than was offered to us by RP. However, this one aspect of our stay in no way diminishes the enjoyable stay we had.

Reviews.Title: “Mystery hotel deal!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyChic
Reviews.Content: I tried my luck on the mystery hotel deal and got this hotel! Great hotel, great location, great service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: marcb1970
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! I chose to stay here after being impressed by them on twitter! (@royalplazatweet). I arrived early (9am) but the hotel was more than happy to let me check in which was great after a long flight. The hotel is well located just off Orchard rd and right on top of the Orchard Rd train station. The reception staff were professional, friendly and very efficient. The whole hotel was spotless and very well presented. The room was spacious, with twin beds, which were close to double bed size. The mini bar was complimentary!! the shower had a rain head which was excellent. The hotel breakfast was incredible, much better than anything I have experienced in Australia. All cultures seemed to be catered for with a variety of local, indian and continental foods. The food alone would be a great reason to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The worst!!”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveler031
Reviews.Content: On our way over to Borneo we stayed at the Regent. It was absolutely fantastic. Unfortunately on the way back the Regent was full and we chose the Royal on Scott. The only good thing about it, is the position. The rooms are small and dark. The bathroom too small for two people to brush teeth at the same time. The staff arogant and unfriendly. The pool VERY small and a thuroughfare for the Convention Centre so you are stared at all the time by people fully dressed on there way to the CC. Well I can only say this...they will certainly NEVER see me again!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: Chris04121977
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Stay,All was willing to do anything you asked for. When we do go back to Singapore again we would gladly stay there. 5 star service

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGermany62
Reviews.Content: This is Hotel is very close to all important places in Singapore. I believe the best value for the price. The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal & Overrated”
Reviews.Author: barbarobin
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in Singapore from Hanoi where we had stayed in a small family hotel we realised this was too imposing & impersonal for us. Although the room was modern and tastefully furnished I found the bed linens to be damp and the room had a distinctive musty smell. Free mini bar was a joke! 2 tins of beer,2 small bottles of water, 1 coke,1 diet coke and a small bottle of orange juice, I think a 5* could do better than that. Breakfast was very good. A complete 100% non smoking hotel. To sum it up I would rather have stayed in my little family hotel than what is supposed to be an award winning hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good-for-money hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Fanifarhani
Reviews.Content: I have always returned to Royal Plaza when I visit Singapore. My family really enjoy staying here and it's our first choice in Singapore. First, its price is quite affordable. Second, when that kind of price, I get to sleep in the middle of Orchard Road (or, intersection??). Maybe it's a bit tiring when you have spent your whole day shopping then the hotel is not located in front of MRT's station (yes, you have to walk about 6 minutes from Orchard MRT) but the ambience of the hotel compensates that. Third, it's in front of Far East Plaza! A really popular shopping center among youngsters (love it!). Fourth, it has surau/mini mosque so for you moslems, it will be easy to know the direction of Kiblat (Mecca). Fifth, Isetan (which I love for the Japanese supermarket & MOS) is just 5 minutes walk. Recommended for family and business traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Orchard Road shopping area”
Reviews.Author: francoda
Reviews.Content: Good quality 4/5 star hotel excellent location just off Orcahrd Road the main shopping area, Plenty of pavement stalls such as Starbucks, food and gift stalls,. Adjacent to metro station and cinema,. Very nice cocktail bar. Restaurant is good qualitiy buffet and well worth a visit especially for breakfast. The pool is not great but that was about the only negative thing. About 30 minute walk or short metro ride to the histroic centre.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel - enjoyable stay in the centre of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: sckc01
Reviews.Content: Purpose of the 4 day visit was to attend the AFL Asian Cup held in Singapore. So requirements were for a comfortable clean airconditioned hotel where an footy playing expat could collapse after a hard day's footy. And his girlfriend could go shopping and entertain herself during his recovery. This hotel met the above requirements. Chose Royal Plaza on Scotts for its value for money and location. I usually stay at the Grand Hyatt across the road, but wanted to try something different which was also a little cheaper. Location is great. A short walk to Orchard Road shops and food. Far East Plaza across the road. Room was a good size - two adults, two carry on cases, wardrobe for storage. Separate bathroom (toiletries were a bit cheap - I went to Watsons to stock up). Bedroom had minibar (free! soft drink and alcohol), desk, executive chair, armchair, comfortable bed, room safe. The best thing is the free minibar. I'm sure you pay for it elsewhere in the rate, but the concept is good. Didn't have time to order room service - so can't comment. Check in/check out was trouble free. Arrived at 6am, they made a room available for me. Housekeeping were very good. Overall, the hotel was extremely comfortable, affordable and well furnished - mid to upper end of the scale.

Reviews.Title: “Location is best point”
Reviews.Author: CambodiaGina
Reviews.Content: The good: brilliant location, amongst the shopping action. Room clean and spacious. Comfy bed and pillows. Free internet and free drinks from minibar. Check in and out quick and easy. The bad: decor is not particularly imaginative - nothing special, room was very dark actually. We stayed during a peak period so rather pricey, compared to usual. No bathrobes. Pool ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: judithcharmers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the club rooms for two nights. First of all, I would highly recommend the club benefits which included the usual breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails along with internet access and pivate check out. The staff in the club lounge offered a great service and were very friendly. The hotel was situated perfectly for shopping on Orchard Road and is close to the MRT underground, which will take you anywhere cheaply and quickly. There are much more luxurious hotels, but they tend to be located away from the 'action'. The club room was not the best I have stayed in - more what I would call 'standard' and I imagine they are no bigger or grander than the normal rooms. Having said this - they were perfectly adequate and modern, if a bit on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping and Orchard Road access, Relaxing Pool”
Reviews.Author: pano
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel with an excellent location at one end of orchard road. This spot is perfect if you want to focus the majority of your time on shopping as there is basically shopping centre after shopping centre along this point. Rooms are large and clean and the breakfast is ok. We slept through the day by accidenet and missed out on the afternoon tea and cocktails so i cant comment on the exectuive lounge. I really enjoyed relaxing by the pool and having lunch delivery to me on my sunchair - after 14 hours from europe it was a welcome change. One thing i would point out is that this hotel requires your to take the train up 3 stops to city hall if you want to change lines. while this is a small issue i prefer to just stay in the city hall area as its closer to little india, arab street, china town and the waterfront. So id recommend this hotel for those who wish to shop and spend time at Orchard road whilst staying at a hotel with a secluded roof top pool that delivers food to your sun lounge.

Reviews.Title: “GOod Location”
Reviews.Author: Miko_Tanabe
Reviews.Content: Room: - deluxe room with standard facilities - wifi free, good signal in the room - free minibar everyday - TV cable but not complete Hotel: - 20 min from Changi Airport - Strategic location, very near MRT and Orchard

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: BirdyAdelaide
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts during August 2009 for 4 nights, which was also our second time to Singapore. The location of the hotel is fantastic, it’s so close to Orchard Road and shopping malls, which makes is so easy to get around and quick to get to places when doing tours, etc. The rooms were always cleaned thoroughly and the beds very comfy! The mini bar was topped up daily, which is for free as well as the as use of the computers/internet in the business centre, which is an added bonus. The bathroom was neat and tidy and the shower head was fantastic, so much water pressure!! The rooms are also fitted with lots of mirrors which I found handy as most hotels you cannot find a mirror big or long enough, which I appreciated. The breakfasts were always very nice with so much variety. The only criticism I would have would be that during our stay the floor above ours was being renovated and the noise from time to time was quite loud, however they did try to keep this to a minimum. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and enjoyed the location and our time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheDeanofStJudes
Reviews.Content: The not so good. Arrived Singapore 3am, Had to wrangle cases up front stairs without assistance, offered room with beds made up as double after specific request for two singles. Offered new room, no assistance offered with move to one floor down. Room nice size but room old and tired, stained carpets. Lighting poor. Only a view of a large Car Park visable from room window. Poor service with bags at check in and check out. Carried bags up hotel front steps on arrival and down on departure. The Good. Great location for shopping in Orchard Road. Fast & free internet connection. Spent more time talking to family on Skype than on do at home. Free Tiger beer and daily soft drinks in bar fridge. Great buffet breakfast with huge range from cereals to fried and everything in between served til 10.00am daily. Beds very confortable. AC converter provided by Engineering Department at no charge. Good service from the inhouse phone operator who offered fantastic help and advice at all hours. Reception & check out ok. Had a minor problem with overbooking and paying for extra night but very happy with Hotels.com who refunded the extra night without question as well as giving a great discounted rate not available from hotel website. Would I stay at Royal Plaza again? probably not, as I believe for the money better room facilities are available with nicer views. I would miss the free Broadband connection and helpful staff. Dean from Perth

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: HornchurchPop
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this lovely hotel. We upgraded to club class- it was superb. We had a lovely room and the shower was the best we have ever used anywhere! Free mini-bar with beer and soft drinks.Use of the the club lounge was well worth the extra with and excellent breakfast,evening cocktails and superb friendly service. The Carousell resturant is more than worth a visit. We found the overall friendliness and service provided by all staff exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel & location for seeing the attractions of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: 50SomethingPOM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights in the hotel. Check-in & check-out was smooth and a late check-out was provided free of charge. The room was quiet, comfortable and reasonably sized. The hotel provided complimentary non-alcoholic drinks. Buffet breakfast was good. We can not comment on other facilities offered by the hotel as we spent each day sight seeing returning only to sleep. Renovation were in progress but these didn't impact on us. The hotel is well situated & close to a MRT station, supermarket , bakery & numerous malls.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star hotel with a few important perks”
Reviews.Author: sr913
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a very good hotel with 3 perks that pushed it over the top. - FREE INTERNET: I searched quite a few Singapore hotels on hotels.com and this was the only one that offered free Internet. If you happen to have your laptop with you (which is quite likely unless it's a pure leisure trip) there's a huge difference between being able to go online at your leisure vs. cramming it into 15 minutes. - FREE MINIBAR: In case you haven't noticed, Singapore is hot. As in, all the time. Staying hydrated is kind of a good idea, and 2 free bottles of water helps (not so much with making it cheap as making it easy). And if drinking free beer in your room is your thing, you can do that too. - LIVELY LOCATION: Quite a few Singapore hotels seem to be surrounded by offices or dead neighborhoods. Here, you're steps from Orchard Road which is bustling day and night, and Scotts Road picks up a lot of that too. It won't keep you from sleeping (I was on the 4th floor on the side closest the street) but it's great to be able to walk out the door, grab a seat at the open-air Starbucks or McCafe, and watch crowds pass by. Other than that, the hotel is solidly in the 4-star category, but I'd even pick it over a 5-star unless the latter were cheaper (unlikely) just for the above.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Janulik
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this hotel. The lobby is lovely with lovely "floating" candles in the middle, check in is quick and friendly. The rooms are being renovated and our room was lovely, brand new bathroom which overlooked the room throught a glass window...there is a blind which you can pull down for privacy.....beds are very comfy.It's really nice to have a bath and watch the LCD TV from it:) The minibar has two water bottles, Coke and Diet Coke, 2 orange juices and 2 Tiger beers replenished daily free of charge. We had free breakfast every morning either at the Carousel or the Royal Club lounge on the 15th floor. The Carousel is amazing with huge selection of Asian, continental cooked and cold meals, fruits and juices. After you have a breakfast there you won't be needing any food until evening :) The Royal Club breakfast is on a smaller scale but still all you can eat with more personal service and views of the city. If you have access to the Royal Club do not miss the afternoon tea with sandwiches, cakes and scones, the staff will fuss over you. The location is perfect, just next to Orchard MRT. We have stayed in Singapore before in two other hotels but none of them was as good as the Royal Plaza on Scotts. We will go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with good price”
Reviews.Author: SrDisco
Reviews.Content: Great location to Orchard, easy access to MRT but a bit of a walk, Mc Donald's and other cheap eats nearby, key access elevators, nice size rooms

Reviews.Title: “solid 4* business hotel and a haven for non-smokers”
Reviews.Author: bimdonesia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights recently with my partner. After a miserable day spent on a broken down bus on the way from KL, it was so nice to finally come to this comfortable hotel. The first thing I noticed when I entered was the delightful smell from the big candle display in the lobby. One smell you will not encounter in this hotel is cigarette smoke, as it is a completely non-smoking hotel. Lovely! Another nice surprise was being upgraded to a room that included complimentary mini bar. Room was spacious and tastefully appointed. Nice flat screen TV with good cable channels, comfortable bed, reliable free internet supply. Bathroom good with decent, but not overly extensive, amenities. Other room amenities included a good iron and ironing board, and we received a newspaper daily. Our room faced onto the DFS Duty Free shopping centre next door. This is a great hotel if your objective in Singapore is shopping! I used the business centre to send a fax and the staff member was extremely polite and helpful, invited me to take a seat and read the newspaper while she sent my fax for me. We didn't eat in the hotel as Singapore has just too much variety elsewhere, at such cheap prices. In all my many visits to Singapore, this was my first time staying around Orchard Road. As nice as this hotel is, I think I would choose somewhere else next time as Orchard Rd doesn't feel like the 'real' Singapore, but if you are looking for a good 4 star, non-smoking hotel in this area, I would recommend Royal Plaza on Scotts.

Reviews.Title: “Like going back home!”
Reviews.Author: RyanColombo
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel this is. It was my second stay here, and it was like coming home. The staff are so professional and polite. Politeness in Singapore can be given its weight in gold. No other hotel staff in Singapore speak to you as well as these guys do. We take politeness for granted in other countries but in Singapore it is extremely valuable! The breakfast buffet had a good variety of dishes. The free wifi did not work this time, but the Lan connection on the desk was free as well. Checked out at 5pm and was not charged extra. Wish staff from other hotels were sent here for training (on how to talk to customers). Had a free shuttle bus for the formula 1 races, this was great as taxi's were hard to come by.

Reviews.Title: “MY STAY WAS EXCELLENT, LOVED IT SO MUCH, WILL BE GOING BACK!!”
Reviews.Author: OlaS4
Reviews.Content: Great place, went with my wife on a second honeymoon, for me, Royal Plaza on Scotts was just ideal for everything. Close to the shops, easy transport, fantastic ambience, good security, good value, try it and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Can't find a single fault even during the refurb”
Reviews.Author: nelb
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here from the 24th Sept. We were not informed of the refurb works when we booked in June but I noticed they were detailed on the hotel website later. We did wonder if we would rather stay elsewhere and could have cancelled but didnt due to all the good reviews on here. When we arrived the reception staff did tell us there would be some works between 9am and 6 pm on some floors. They also had a sing up on the desk re the refurb. Must say if they hadn't told us we would not have known there was any works giong on. The hotel was perfect for us. We walked up to the door and our bags were taken from us - the staff really could not do enough for us from arrival to departure we felt looked after. Our room was large with a huge comfy bed. The shower was amazing! The free mini bar went down well - water, beer, juice, coke, diet coke - re stocked every day. The room was serviced every day - even the day we slept in till gone 1. It was the perfect room for us. We found the Hotel to be a perfect location just two stops from the City Hall MRT station(at the Orchard MRT follow signs to Orchard Road not Scotts as Scotts road signs take you up to street level on the other side of Scots Road to the hotel there is a footbridge to cross the road but its quicker to exit the MRT on the same side as the hotel). Breakfast is a huge affair! Loads to choose from, coffee or tea the second you sit down, used plates taken away quickly. We didn't get the chance to use the pool - too busy seeing as much as we could of Singapore and the F1 tho we did wander to check it out and we did intend to spend an afternoon at least there - just didn't fit it in! I think there were about 10 sun beds and the gym was to the side. There were staff around - so I am sure the pool area was as well managed as the rest of the Hotel. We used the business centre to pre book our flights home - free 15 minutes. So if your looking for the perfect base to explore Singapore you really cant go wrong here. Just ask and they are happy to help. We ate out and never went to Heat so I cant review either but we went 'did' most of the sights in SIngapore. We took our mini bar water out with us everyday which helped while we made our way to where we were going. We also brought sprite from McDondals near the hotel on the way back n the evening so I oculd have shandy with the mini bar beer! :-) Theres an Ice ream place on the corner of when you come out of the MRT which we found refreshing on the way back.....we ate chilli crab at Jumbos in Boat Quay....the prawns are fab there too WOW Singapore really was a fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: marshga
Reviews.Content: This was a rurn visit to stay at this hotel and whilst the majority of aspects of the stay were excellent (particularly the excellent rooms and breakfasts) there were 3 issues with the stay: Hotel refurbishment - we were not advised of this when booking and found rooms were ebing refurbished on the floor we were alocated to. This involved the normally plush carpets being covered, doors and doorways were taped over / covered in cardboard The pool was closed on two days of our 6 day stay due to "hotel functions" - not good when travelling with kids We had two issues where one of our rooms door locks would not work, apparently due to a failed battery in the mechanism? All in all a spoilt stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,great buffet,excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nairajay10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the 'Royal Plaza on Scotts' for two nights in March.The hotel is placed right in the middle of Orchard Road and easy to find as it's right there in front of the station,you would not want to go anywher because you have everything around the hotel from supermarkets to restaurants to malls.The room was a bit dissapointing allthough it was big with a confortable bed and a nice LCD the view was miserable all I could see was the wall of another building but apart from that it was good.There is a MCCafe just outside the hotel to the right which is excellent if you want to grab a quick breakfast before heading out.The pool though is a bit small.I also had the opportunity to try their buffet lunch which was excellent as they have food for all tastes be it European,Asian and everything tasted excellent.The staff at the reception on check in and out were very efficient.Overall I was very impressed and will stay again if I get a chance

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: carebearfan
Reviews.Content: My fiance and i had stayed in Royal Plaza for 8 days. Throughout our stay we truly had a wonderful time and was happy with what the hotel was offering to us. Our room was clean with good king sized bed, a free mini bar, free internet, a 42" inch plasma tv mounted on the wall, an armchair, huge table with a nice chair besides few cute paintings hanging on the walls. There was one huge closet facing the bathroom. The toilet was a little small but it was clean with a nice marble sink and huge mirror on the walls. They even have a bidet installed which is good. The shower was great. You can eaither switch to handheld shower or a rain shower which one of the things really impressed me. Its like giving me the impression that im having a shower nearby the waterfall. I especially love the bed so much. The mattress was soft, the blanket was thick which is good for me since i couldnt stand the cold air conditioned sometimes and the pillows are huge and very comfortable to sleep on. I had a great night sleep all the time i been staying in Royal Plaza. They also have different kind of channels for you to watch. The staff was very friendly even the housekeeper. They will always be around to help you out. When we first checked into the hotel the bellboy even nicely give us a tour around the room and explain few things. The doorman always waiting outside the front hotel to hail a taxi for you and having a friendly chat while we both waiting for the cab. We were allowed to check out late at 2pm since our flight is at 6pm. Above all the great services, wonderful amenities and warm friendly staff we also love the food. The breakfast buffet was great with so much to choose from and the Ultralounge bar was cozy enough with plush setting that we kept coming back for more than once all throughout our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Central Location!”
Reviews.Author: EnjoysToTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner and we both loved it! The staff were so nice the whole time, very friendly. The hotel has free mini bar, free internet access (wi-fi and business centre has computers to use) The breakfast is a huge buffet with lots of different choices, all very nice! The reception/lobby area is stunning, big spiral marble staircases with a beautiful big candle display. The hotel is nicely decorated throughout, with marble and chandeleirs. Our room was comfortable and practical. The shower was great! Nice big head wuth great pressure and you can flick the switch to operate the hand held shower head if you want. Big lcd tv on mounted on the wall was good, the air con was nice and strong too. The free mini bar is stocked daily when they service the room. Not much of a view from the room, its all building tops. But its in a great, convenient loaction, close to the underground trains (mrt) and shopping areas. Also has pool, gym and sauna. The gym is excellent, air con, modern eqipment in good working condiion, tv, towels, water. Pool is nice area aswell (gym overlooks pool and poolside bar) Loved our time spent here and will return again, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money! Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: FussyLilPrincess
Reviews.Content: Location is best. No complain on food. Room is cozy, clean and nice. No view to ask for somehow. Price is not too expensive. Very convenient especially for shoppers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel at a good price. Great Location, near Orchard Rd!”
Reviews.Author: Lals_79
Reviews.Content: Amazing - really great hotel. Staff are really friendly, professional and warm. We arrived and were greeted by a luxurious candle-filled lobby with spiral stair cases on either side, and marbled floors. Just gorgeous. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The mini bar is FREE and the hotel is 100% smoke-free. There is a safe in the room. The shower is so awesome as you can either have the normal shower head or the big rainforest-style one which we opted for. The bed is incredibly comfortable, for those who like a softer mattress. The restaurant is pricey so we never went (approx. SD $35-40 per meal) so for breakfast we headed to Starbucks (approx. SD $ 16 for 2 coffees and 2 croissants), just right of the hotel - or you could go to TCC's which is slightly further down and they offer amazing and creative coffees there as well. The hotel has a nice swimming pool and nearby gym. Location - could not have done better. The hotel is literally on the corner of Orchard Rd (Shopping!) and opposed ION, which is the brand new shopping mall which has all designer brands. Overall, amazing stay - would DEFINITELY stay in this hotel if I ever go back to Singapore; no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “top location”
Reviews.Author: OskarandSunny
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a non smoking policy. All guests are required to sign a paper confirming they understand the rule. the hotel is very well located just 50 metres fro Orchard Road and all the huge shopping centres are close by.the hotel was being renovated at the time but this didn't affect us in any way. all work was completed by 6pm. as compensation we were upgraded to a delux room but on opening the door this was a little dissapointing. the rooms are quite small and no view whatsoever. However the rest of the hotel is fine with free internet available. the staff like all of Asia are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for more”
Reviews.Author: jdmexx
Reviews.Content: Its a true value for money 5 star hotel. Rooms are of a good size, Beds are very comfortable, Breakfast is superb, Location is perfect - around the corner from the center of orchard road but the hotel is still very quiet. Try the lunch buffet if you have the chance - its excellent. +ves: Breakfast, Rooms, Free Wifi, Free Minibar, Location -ves: No views from the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Ausroamer
Reviews.Content: We have just recently stayed here for four nights and could not fault anything about the hotel. The room was a decent size, beautiful modern bathroom. They are renovating rooms in the hotel, but only from about 9am -4pm, so that didn't bother us. We were on a deal which included full buffet breakfast which was excellent, good choices and plenty of it. The hotel staff were friendly and generally enjoyed assisting. We booked various tours from the Concierge desk and they were helpful and well informed, advised us what buses to take, MRT info etc. The Chief Concierge Mohamed Ibrahim was exceptional and made our stay easy and hassle-free! This hotel is ideally situated almost on the corner of Scotts and Orchard, with the MRT station only a few steps away, as well as buses that go wherever you need. Taxis are also in plentiful supply around here. I have stayed in a few different hotels in Singapore over the last couple of years, and this is definitely the best, I would re-book here without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Good Location with Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: walzholz
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Royal Plaza on Scotts in May 2007. The hotel is in a very good location. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but I would not say luxurious. The public areas of the hotel are nice, but not opulent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool small but nice. I would recommend and stay again. Overall, a 4 star hotel with a reasonable price in a city with very expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: oddlyweds
Reviews.Content: Service was great, free wi-fi access (though sometimes a bit slow), free drinks in the minibar replenished daily, excellent location right next to a metro stop and tons of shopping. They had some construction going on in the hotel, we were warned at checkin about that. Most of the time we were out and about, there was absolutely no problems in the evening hours or night. Overall a very pleasant experience. My only complaint is that there were not enough lights in the room and roomservice and the restaurants in the hotel were way too overpriced. So, we ate out everytime (not hard to do in Singapore). Definitely recommended for all types of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, convenience and class”
Reviews.Author: Judy2233
Reviews.Content: RP on S was a great experience, the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms comfortable, clean and sylish, and the location excellent. Having two rooms, the staff went to some lengths to find us adjoining rooms. The only meals we had were the buffet breakfast - it was great value, delicious and the staff were so attentive. The pool was great (2.9 m deep, cool and roomy}. The location was great - close to the very convenient, fast and efficient Orchard MRT and to Isetan department store which has a food hall/supermarket/pharmacy. Being in the midst of Orchard Rd, it's a stone's throw (maybe a stroll through an underpass) to Tangs, Far East Plaza, Wheelock Place and Wisma Atria (which has the bustling food court called Food Republic). It was a great value, as well as being so convenient and comfortable - would recommend to anyone looking for a base to explore Singapore during a shortish (3-4 day) stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, good location, but a little overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LesMary
Reviews.Content: Introduction: We stayed at the Royal Plaza on nights of 9,10 July 2009, as a stop over London to Syndey. Booked it online for around AU$300 a night. The Hotel: Very good location on Scotts Road near Orchard Rd in the shopping/entertainment hub of Singapore. Very good reception by porters and reception staff. Very large hallway into hotel, well fitted out. Very large restaurant which served a very hot and cold breakfast which was included in our price, normally S$38 ! hotel had a nice pool as well on upper floors. Also we could use internet in busines centre for 15 minutes, good for airline check in. The Room: Quite spacious and comfortable but not quite as luxurious as I would have thought. Good bed and seating, good bathroom. Hotel undergoing refurbish and a lot of work noise from other rooms. Had a few complimentary drinks in fridge - beer, coke, water, oj, very welcoming. Conclusion: Good hotel, but a little overated and overpriced in my opinion. But then you pay for location. Probably will be nicer and quiter after refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with the best breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: PJ_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our stay at the Royal Plaza on Scotts, which we booked because of the reviews on Tripadvisor. We arrived in the early hours of the morning for a three night stay. Staff were professional and friendly. On arrival, our room was upgraded and we were given a 3pm late checkout on our final day. The location of this hotel is very convenient, right on Orchard Road, 5 min walk to the MRT, and with a very busy bus stop right out front. There is a huge department store opposite, as well as a large shopping plaza. There are also a large range of affordable food stores within 5 mins walk, including major chains. Our room was what we expected, a large bed, desk, desk chair and lounge chair. The room was extraordinarily quiet and we were able to block out all light if we wanted. We appreciated the free beer, soft drinks and water, and enjoyed swimming in the large pool. The only problem we experienced was the strength of the free wireless broadband connection which was not strong enough in our room to be reliable. Unusually, I booked a package with breakfast and was blown away with its size and quality. There was appropriate breakfast food for almost every country, which even included different specialities on different days. In fact, the buffet breakfast at The Royal Plaza on Scotts has ruined us and we will always use hold it up as the gold standard. What I did not know when I booked it was that the restaurant at the Royal Plaza on Scotts has won 'Singapore's Best Buffet Restaurant' category for several years running. I didn't try the other buffets (which included afternoon/high tea and seafood) but I did notice that the restaurant was always packed with people each afternoon and especially in the evenings. The hotel also offers a very affordable three course meal deal in the upstairs bar/restaurant that was also well attended. If you are ever going to book buffet breakfast with your accommodation, this is the hotel to do it. The public transport system in Singapore is fantastic. We bought a rail pass and put $20 Singapore on it. We then used it for our whole stay to catch trains and buses, including our return train trip to the International Airport. In total we only spent $10 and, because we arrived at the airport before 7.30 pm, were able to retrieve all the money we hadn't yet spent. The only problem with the system is that it is not really accessible for people with disabilities. Stairs are used as flood barriers to the rail system and the Singapore people do not stand for people with disabilities despite having specially allocated seats. However, I have found this also to be the case in most of Europe and sometimes even in ustralia. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a very affordable and reliable option, even without the fantastic buffet breakfast. With the buffet breakfast, it is unbeatable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the centre of the city.”
Reviews.Author: TheBences
Reviews.Content: We spent the first three nights of our holiday in this super hotel just a stone's throw from Orchard Road. Our room was lovely, The bed was huge and utterly comfortable, the bathroom had a bath and separate huge shower. Monday night is half price cocktail night and there was a good singer entertaining us in the lounge. Excellent! The restaurant had a fantastic buffet on the night we stayed in to eat. We got an excellent rate booking five months before we travelled.All in all a very nice place to stay in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “good location, ok rooms, bad view”
Reviews.Author: jains_ny
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week, hardly 5 star by global standards, but no issues either. view was very poor looking out to some parking zone. they provided free baby cot which was excellent help. the room seemed bit small - wifi/minibar is free. breakfast spread is good but way too expensive at 20 SGD/person. Location is excellent, shopping is good at far east plaza across, and MRT station is just across.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jessie001
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a Shopping Holiday in Singapore. I travelled with my 67 year mother and we had a fantastic time. We stayed at the Plaza Club Rooms and were treated like Royalty. There was such a small difference between the Club Rooms and the other rooms in price but the value was out of this world. We would start every morning in the gym for 1hr then shower and head to a leisurely breakfast. We alternated between the restaurant breakfast and the Club Room Breakfast just for variation. The choices are incredible and beautifully presented. In the evening we headed back to Club Room for our complimentary drinks (alcholic) and appartiffes. The food provided was of First Class Restaurant quality but plenty of it. We didn't go out for dinner once the food was so good at the Club Room and complimentary. We never made it to the Complimentary Afternoon Tea we were too busy during the day and didn't need it anyway. The staff were exceptional, nothing was any trouble and service was always with a warm friendly smile. We would stay again at this hotel without any question and definately the Club Rooms best value for Money I have come across in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, superb location.”
Reviews.Author: cumi
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Royal Plaza on Scotts. The main reason I chose this hotel was because of the "Halal" food served in the Hotel. Very convenient for my family and I. The location off Orchard Road is excellent. Shops are literally 2 minutes(or less)away!! Excellent choice if you want to do lots of shopping. You have the DFS mall connected next door to the hotel, Far East Plaza opposite, Tangs, Takashimaya etc all within 5 minutes walking distance! Room was nice and comfortable. Absolutey loved the rain shower!! The breakfast buffet was good, with a decent selection of local and western dishes. The high- tea buffet is a must-try! Royal Plaza is an execellent hotel. I highly recommend it. Will definately stay at the Royal Plaza again! Concierge esp Mr. Ibrahim was extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: mumbai9
Reviews.Content: The hotel Royal Plaza is AMAZING!!!! Its location is awesome!! It is situated just off Orchard Road, right in the heart of all the biggest shopping malls in Singapore-Tangs, Takashimaya, Wisma Atria etc. The rooms were very luxourious and extremely comfortable. The hotel lobby is very tastefully decorated and is beautiful. The service and staff were excellent. It was conventiently located close to the Orchard MRT station. All the eateries were within walking distance. Great place to stay in Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sujata_ranjana
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful. Services are too good. The location, food, services, everything is good. And best thing is that it’s non-smoking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: billthoo
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is wonderful, which always makes a stay more relaxing. Check in and check out was efficient and hassle free. The concierge service is exemplary. A very professional staff. It is about 2 minutes from the Orchard MRT (metro) station, just half a block down Scotts Road off the Orchard Road shopping strip. The Galleries duty free shopping centre is attached to it, Far East Plaza is across the road, and the Shaw centre is next to it. Unfortunately, getting from the MRT to the hotel with luggage is not completely straightforward due to stairs, even when there is an escalator. It's not easy in that heat.
