Definitely taking the taxi next time. When not lugging luggage the proximity to the MRT is a dream. A taxi to the airport on a Sunday night only cost $15.00 Singaporean, truly a bargain. The rooms are standard, but seem very large compared to our recent stays in London and Prague. Needless to say they were spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was very large, but I am not so sure a window wall between the bathroom / toilet and the main room is necessary (call me a prude!). There is a room safe, and the air conditioning was incrediby effective. All drinks in the bar fridge are complimentary and replenished daily. Regardless that there were only two tiger beers, two bottles of water, a juice, a coke, and a diet coke, that still ticked the right boxes. Wifi is complimentary throughout the hotel, and effective. Breakfast was standard continental, American, and there was a limited local spread. The food was good, but not spectacular. The breakfast froom was full, but not over crowded, and the service was excellent. In Singapore, though, you could find many other local options too. The hotels right on Orchard Road / Scotts Road are not cheap, but the location is difficult to beat. RPOS stood out for it's service, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not appropriate for holiday/kids”
Reviews.Author: yahooHk
Reviews.Content: After a few initial check-in hiccups, we were upgraded. However the upgraded room did not look much different to the regular rooms. We also felt that the king sized bed was more like a queen-size and the room is quite small. The breakfast is very crowded and the spread is not very interesting. The location is great, but I think that's the only thing we enjoyed about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Privateman
Reviews.Content: A Hotel in midst of the shopping area.... orchard road. Has all the amenities, value for money and great location. Its Chinese restaurant is amazing but has little else in terms of choice of eatery. but being in midst of Orchard road, this should be less of a concern. The Hotel says that it has smoker free floors but you cant miss the smell. The rooms are great and service is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Expat on vacation -- Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goliva26
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It was in a great spot. Orchard Road is just 2 minutes away. Easily walkable. I would stay at this hotel again. On the First friday of each month, Scotts Road has new musicians to come out and play which is right across the street from the Royal Plaza. Convenient. Across the street, you have Convenience stores, exchange rate counter, and eateries. Great Italian eatery across the street to the left next to 7 Eleven store. I travelled alone and felt safe. The Marriot is very close to this hotel in which the Hippo Tour bus stops in front every hour and the MRT station to take the subway is located here as well. Perfect location. The inside of this hotel looks nothing like the outside. Beautiful entrance.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY Expensive”
Reviews.Author: coroexcel
Reviews.Content: This was once a very good hotel hover in recent times they appear to have been caught up in the "rip of the guest" approach. The rooms are pretty jaded and need updating. very old fashioned. The bar and restaurant prices have to be seen to ne believed - they are VERY expensive even before adding the service charge and governement tax

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca0210
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon, on our way back to Melbourne from a week in the Maldives. After a week of relaxing in 5 star style and doing nothing, we wanted a hotel that was not too expensive and in a good location - we wanted shops and restaurants on our doorstep. We arrived early in the morning (about 8am) having booked a Deluxe Club Room through Expedia. I had previously emailed the hotel to enquire about an early check in and was advised that this shouldn't be a problem. Despite the fact that our room wasn't ready when we arrived, we were quickly ushered upstairs to the Club Lounge to have some breakfast (which, despite not really being included on that first day, we were given at no cost) whilst we waited for our room. We only waited about an hour before our room was ready, which was perfectly acceptable. The room itself was a pretty standard hotel room, nothing spectacular and not overly large, but it was comfortable and exactly what we were after as we weren't planning on spending a huge amount of time there. A couple of huge bonuses - no smoking ANYWHERE in the hotel, free WIFI throughout (which was easily accessed with a login and password supplied with our room key) and a free mini bar. In fairness, this was pretty limited but did include a couple of Tiger beers, bottles of water, soft drink and orange juice - and was replenished daily. The best thing about RPOS is the location - it's on Scotts Road (obviously) which is right around the corner from Orchard Road and a perfect location to walk straight out your door to all the great shopping that Singapore has to offer. This is exactly why we booked this hotel and we weren't disappointed. All the staff were friendly and it was easy to get a taxi at the hotel anytime of the day - even in the pouring tropical rain! We had the choice of breakfast in the club lounge or restaurant and opted for the club lounge each day - mainly out of convenience. The choice wasn't overly extensive and certainly not as grand as the breakfast spreads at some of the big hotels, but it was fine for us. We had cereal, fruit and some pastries most days. All in all our stay at RPOS was great and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for decent value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and polite service at all times.”
Reviews.Author: venusbathstravel
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely, spotlessly clean property with incredibly polite staff. Nothing was any trouble. The room was spacious and everything was perfect for us; the fittings were all as new. The entry foyer was enormous, and at the time we stayed, there was an equally large chocolate (of the edible variety) car parked in there. Just across the road via an over-the-street walkway was a great shopping centre. The nearby Seven-Eleven stocks alcohol (expect to pay huge prices for wine here in Singapore). There is a MacDonalds close by. We found a couple of fantastic restaurants nearby and ate with the locals, very inexpensive, the food was beautiful, but they do not serve alcohol. We ate one night in the hotel restaurant; it was OK but not great food, and it came to a shocking total - we each had two drinks and I think that did the damage. So eat elsewhere. The pool was rather disappointing but we're used to Ausralian resort pools. Get a taxi to and from the airport as they are cheap. When we were departing it was pouring rain and we were in a line in the taxi rank at the door of the hotel; one of the hotel staff plucked us out of the line and deposited us in the next cab, they really do look after their patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affodable but....”
Reviews.Author: Hotmama81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is having a promotion for Sporean/PR at an affordable rate,is a non smoking hotel and offer free minibar,therefore I decided to book a room here to celebrate my hubby's birthday.We were greeted by a friendly and cheerful front desk staff.She was very efficient in doing her job and it only took 15mins for us to check in.I just booked a superior room but to our surprise,we were given a room at the Royal Club 13th Floor.Everything was perfect but until at 3 in the morning,there's a sudden leaking from the ceiling and it woke us up.The bed was directly under the ceiling that is leaking.My hubby quickly make a call and the technician came up in 5 mins time.He made a quick check and told us that we need to change to another room.And imagine at 3am in the morning,my hubby and I had to packed all our stuffs and change to another room.It really annoyed us and our sleep was disturbed.We even had to work the next day.As our sleep was disturbed,we did not managed to wake up for our breakfast .We really had a sleepless night.Because of that night incident,we were given a complimentary late check out til 6pm.Is that the best they can offer?But still,to us,it really don't benefit us at all,afterall,we have to work at 3pm dat day.We check out at 12 noon.We are very sad that it is not enjoyable til the end of our stay especially it is my hubby's birthday.And cos of that sleepless nite,we had to go to work looking very sleepy and tired.I regret choosing this hotel and definitely would not recommend this to any of my friends.At first,I really had a very good impression for this hotel but everything change because of that nite incident.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: NOT-Stuck-in-India
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Scotts for one week while on vacation. I absolutely loved the front desk and concierge staff! They were VERY helpful especially when we ended up with an airline booking that was non-existent (thanks Travelocity.com INDIA) on the day that we thought we were supposed to be flying out of Singapore. When we arrived back at the hotel to check back in for one more night -- they provided us with a room at a great rate, late check-out the next day, and complementary breakfast -- even though we hadn't actually booked the room w/breakfast! I definitely recommend this hotel if you want something simple, in a great location, and with outstanding service!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenicol
Reviews.Content: from the arrival greeting on the Sunday through to my checkout on the Thursday I was made to feel like an important guest. Amongst the best service in the world. To be greeted by name after two days in the Royal Club exemplified the feeling that you were very welcome. my room and the hotel were in great condition. We had free internet and free mini-bar - great perks that just made the stay that bit more memorable. The Carousel buffet it wonderful and needs to be sampled when in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is good if you can get a good deal, however!!!”
Reviews.Author: cassijo2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my daughter booked this hotel for 3 nights after going to Melbourne on holiday. We arrived in the hotel at 2 am due to our flights from OZ but had to book the hotel for the whole of the previous day. We were extremely tired by the time we arrived only to be taken to our room and found it wasn't twin beds but a double bed. We phoned reception and they moved us to another room only to find it was a double again, but assured us that it was 2 beds but they were joined together, and a porter seperated the beds and then made them up. By the time the beds were ready it was nearly 4 am and I found this unacceptable for a hotel of this calibre, to get a booking wrong, , not once but twice. Later on that day we complained to the front desk and they apologised and offered us a 3 hr late checkout when we were leaving. Rooms were small, but ok otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great position and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carole53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great easy for shopping and near a MRT. All the staff a good and they really went out of there way for us on a couple of things. If you can I think the upgrade to a room that you can use the "Royal Club" is worth it. Also the mini bar with free beer and water is a nice treat. Free internet is also a bonus

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Singhjee
Reviews.Content: Good hotel at a good location. Free minbar containing 2 beers, 2 bottles of mineral water, and 2 cans of Coke per day were a welcome feature. Only 1 restaurant with a wide selection, though somewhat expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for tourists and avid shoppers”
Reviews.Author: Bulgarian_travels
Reviews.Content: I was debating with myself as to whether I want to give the hotel an overall rating of 3 or as a 4, but I decided in favor of 4 because of how inexpensive the nightly rate was and the good value provided in return of my money. the positives: location - it is situated just around the corner of Scotts Rd and Orchard Rd in a busy area with multiple great shopping centers. Right accross the street there is a Hyatt and a few steps down, there is the Marriott. There is also an iSetai mall right next to the hotel with a supermarket on the underground level. The drive time from the airport with little traffic is about 20 min and costed roughly around 20SGD (about 10EUR), which I thought was decent. Its also about within a one hour fast walk to Chinatown and Clarke Quay. service: like anywhere in Southeast Asia, service was just perfect. Check in was brisk, the attendant was very polite, the luggage was delivered to our room in no time, all in all - we didnt deal with staff extensively, but in the events that we did, it went as smooth as possible. the rooms have free wi-fi and minibar (2 waters, 2 beers and 2 soft drinks) restaurant: we were there at Easter and took advantage of the Easter brunch buffet (60SGD per person) which was amazing - there was a great selection of fresh seafood including lobster and crab, mussels, sushi, sashimi as well as a huge selection of other appetizers, main courses and desserts - everything I tried was incredibly fresh - you couldnt tell it was a buffet. I think the same buffet is offered every Fri and Sat evening for the same price and I recommend trying it. Value: I paid about 130USD per night (rate thru Expedia 50 bucks cheaper than the hotel website) which I consider to be a great price for a hotel in Singapore, especially at this location. the negative: rooms and interior: the hotel is not quite new and you can tell by the carpeting and the overall interior 'look'. Everything is perfectly clean and modern (key card elevator access, Plasma TV in room, marble bathroom, soft bedding etc., but the room we were in had this unpleasant hint of a moldy smell due to the incredible humidity that is so common in Singapore. The AC seemed to work fine, but it still felt damp, even the bedding felt a little wet. Additionally, the room we had was pretty dark and overlooking the side of another building - not very nice. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for the value it provided.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, smoke-free and free internet”
Reviews.Author: gangav
Reviews.Content: Good for a business traveller The internet is free. The hotel is totally smoke-free. The restaurant is convenient and is totally Halal. The shower is fantastic - don't bother upgrading to a room with a bath. If you're like Asian-style toilet facilities then this hotel caters for you. The service is friendly. The location is convenient, near Orchard road. There is a noisy CD store nearby, but it can't be heard from the hotel. Only complaints: The business centre has just 2 seats. There are no meeting rooms. There is no view from the hotel - just more bricks and office windows.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: AbdullahAltamimi
Reviews.Content: great hotel, amazing staff, very good location, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great Orchard Road location”
Reviews.Author: aussie_h
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in Feb 09. When we arrived we were upgraded to a Premier room, a nice suprise, which included a free minibar each day. The room was nice, as was the bathroom. The hotel is on Scotts road, on the corner of Orchard road. Just about the best possible location for a hotel in Singapore, especially for shopping. There would have to be a dozen major shopping centres within a 5 minute walk. The Orchard road MRT is about a 2 minute walk also. You can even walk to the Newton Circus hawker centre - just keep going up Scotts Road, or just catch the MRT for one stop if you are feeling particularly lazy. While at this hotel I would strongly recommend a trip to the bar - Heat Ultralounge, on the second floor of the hotel. We've been here before when we used to live in Singapore on waygu beef night - waygu beef burgers for all patrons. This time it was ladies night, a band was playing and it was great drinks deals and a chocolate fondue for ladies - my wife made good use of this! Another great thing about this hotel is that it is completely non smoking. I've been to other hotels where the person in the next room smoked and the air travelled through the aircon system and stunk up all the rooms around it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankM_9
Reviews.Content: Very good city hotel near to MRT station. No dislikes.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location........rooms below average.....definately not 5*”
Reviews.Author: Tigger-lover1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, on Scotts Road & a 2 minute walk from Orchard Road. Lots of shops, restaurants & Starbucks everywhere! I had joined the IPrefer membership club for hotel before we went, so when we arrived they upgraded us to a Deluxe Room (I had booked a Superior Room through asiarooms.com). I dread to think what the standard Superior Room was like, because our Deluxe Room was small, drab and really below average. Room was not cheap either so expected more. How they class this as a 5* hotel is beyond me. Really annoying thing was that you had a card key for your room that you also needed to operate the lifts. The card system is useless so you end up having to swipe your card about 20 times just to make the lift work, then another 20 times to actually get into your room! Breakfast buffet was also quite poor, mainly halal food, nothing 'English' .....not that we expected a fry up but lots of peculiar food that you would not contemplate eating for breakfast. Pancakes & maple syrup, croissants or omelette were the only safe option!! Singapore itself is great, but MEGA expensive with exchange rate being so bad. Fantastic shopping if you have money to burn!! Highly recommend Raffles for High Tea in the Tiffin Room. It was SG$39 each (approx £20) but so worth it. You get treated like royalty, actually more informal than you would expect although you have to get quite dressed up, no sandals, shorts, vests, etc. They come round with cake tiers with finger sandwiches, scones & cream cakes on. As many cups of tea as you can possibly drink.....there is also a hot buffet (mainly Chinese food), but then there are more sandwiches, scones & cream cakes laid out and you can just keep helping yourself to as much as you want. Really great value for money and a true experience! Singapore is a beautiful, extremely clean and safe place......but if you want culture it is not for you ...... has an almost 'clinical' feeling about it.........

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: dr_amjad
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Royal Plaza this february on a speedy leisure trip on my way back home from Kuala Lumpur. This hotel is at a great location on Scotts road. Just a stones throw away from the Marriott. This allows you quick access into Orchard Road. I had booked 2 months prior through the hotel's website and got a decent rate. Hotels on and around Orchard Road are higher priced than most in Singapore. The rates I got were the best I could find in the vicinity. The front facade doesnt look very big and it isnt a very large hotel. Check in was speedy. They were nice enough to upgrade my room when I checked in. The room was nothing to scream about though. I'm still quite undecided about it. Mostly contemporary. Still, it was clean and comfortable. The upgrade also came with free wireless internet access and the free mini bar. Not much in the minibar.. just a couple of beers n juice. Other attractions of the room were a flat screen tv, safe, queen size bed, and a window that looked into the parking lot. The lock to the bathroom door was broken. I didnt report it though as I was staying alone and couldn't be bothered by that. I didnt sample the restaurants at the hotel. There is a Carls Jr burger joint opposite the hotel and I enjoyed most of my meals there! Overall... not outstanding, but pretty good. Mainly because of the location and the price. Like i've said before, if you're visiting singapore, you just need a place to sleep. Don't bother too much on the luxuries of the hotel because you are not gonna be spending much time in it anyway! I will definitely stay in this hotel again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: sunnyj1279
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. It is very close to transport and the Orchard Road shops. Checking in was very quick and efficient. The rooms are a fairly basic, brown in colour. Had a room at the back of the hotel, which overlooked a multi-storey car park, but the room was quiet most of the time (the exception being when housekeeping staff were moving furniture out of rooms at 8am on two mornings, so there was a lot of door banging!!) The bed & pillow were very comfortable. Concierge were not very helpful when giving directions, this resulted in a 20 minute walk to the Botanical Gardens taking 45 minutes. Housekeeping staff were inconsistent.. (coffee & milk were not replaced, didn't get face cloths for 3 days, only 1 bath towel on the last day and when we looked under the bed we found a hair band and food apron!) This is one of the cheaper "top" hotels, as listed on Tripadvisor, so perhaps you get what you pay for! I would probably try a different hotel next time

Reviews.Title: “Tiger beer over priced in Bar”
Reviews.Author: gdlgal
Reviews.Content: I had a Tiger draft beer in the bar and the bill came to $14 sgd. I noticed on a display screen inside the elevator that the bar served a glass Tiger beer for $7 sgd "all day long". Went back to the bar the next day asked the Bar tender what the price of Tiger beer was, he quoted $14 sgd. I told him about the elevator sign and he commented that it was currently "Happy hour" and you could get two for one. The elevator says nothing about it and they don't tell you in the Bar when you order the first beer and get disgusted with the high price and leave. So ask about the "two for the price of one" Tiger beer.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel added 200 USD to the bill”
Reviews.Author: mixnov
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore around the end of last year and I stayed in this hotel. I've stayed in many hotels in Singapore in the past, including the Ritz Carlton, Mandarin Oriental and the Regent. This is my experience with Royal Plaza on Scotts. As I was checking out, the hotel staff said that they were adding 300 singapore dollars more to the bill (approximately 200 USD). When asked why, they said that I had been "caught" smoking in the non smoking room, and this was the penalty which they are going to impose on me. I stared incredulously at the staff for a few seconds at this accusation. Now I travel a lot for business, averaging 3 trips a month and have stayed in hotels in dozens of countries. I have never been accused of smoking in a non smoking room. I think the fact that I am a non smoker has helped in this aspect! I asked the staff how they had come to such a conclusion. The reply was a smoky smell had been detected in the room by the cleaning personnel. And, a manager had been sent up into the room when I was not there to confirm this. Aside from the privacy issues which we shall not even get into by that revelation, I told the staff that I was a non smoker. At this, they immediately went to Plan B, which was to say, they asked me if I had had company in my room? Another first for me in any hotel, being quizzed on check out whether I had invited someone to my hotel room. I said no, I did not, not that it was any business of theirs. I tried to be reasonable and calm but I got angry when one of the staff snorted in derision whenever I said that I had NOT smoked in the room. He said that "everyone says that" When I said I had not had anyone to the room, they said "Just so you know, we can check the CCTV footage". After a heated 20 min discussion, to which they refused to budge despite my protestations of innocence, I gave up and left as I had a plane to catch. When I checked my credit card bill a few weeks later, I saw that they did in fact tack on this extra charge, despite the fact that I had not smoked in the room. These are the disturbing questions: (1) How they can say with 100 percent certainty that someone had smoked in the room? Could not the smoky smell have been there before I arrived? (2) The fact that the staff has said "everyone says that" tells me I am not the first one accused of smoking - how many other guests have also been slapped with this extra charge despite not smoking in the room? I welcome management's response.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Stay at”
Reviews.Author: aljudeh
Reviews.Content: This hotel will provide you with an unforgetable moments nothing to spoil your stay. Staff was friendly and helpful with a nice smile drawn on their faces all times,Check-in was immediate and efficient, our room was clean, elegant and well-equiped, and the overall stay was luxurious. The location is excelent, with plenty of nearby shops, restaurants and easy access to different types of transportation. Taxis were plentiful both at the hotel and on the streets, very close to orchard road, the shopping road of singapore, nice for walking at night with variety of resturants. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “only if you come for a one shopping day as a stop over”
Reviews.Author: camok
Reviews.Content: apparently some partial renovation was undertaken there (when?); it is a very old decoration, even sad. lobby is old. "so called superior rooms" are really below average. hotel is just few meters away the Orchard Road (you may choose other area places than this shopping street). so it might be good only if you come for a shopping stop over; but not few nights there. in addition, the service is below average. well, nothing special to mention to choose that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for a Hotel in Orchard”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithSuying
Reviews.Content: The Royal Plaza on Scotts is situated nicely along the dazzling lights of the Orchard shopping malls. Within minutes of walk, one would be able to access the top shopping malls in Singapore. A definite good choice for the shoppers. Amongst the top hotels such as the Marriot hotel, the Goodwoodpark hotel, the Hilton, the Hyatt and the Four Seasons Hotel, the Royal Plaza on Scotts would be the one with the best value. I got a good deal at S$188++ a night, breakfast inclusive, from the hotel promotion. As for the room, albeit it wasnt as spacious as I would like, the size is still comfortable to move around, the furnitures pretty decent, clean toilet with a bath tub... elegantly decorated. One of the disappointment I had was that the bed, although clean and white, had gathered quite a bit of dust. Not sure if it was because I had checked in during their off-peak season. Another disappointment was that the pillow arent very comfortable. A little too soft and fluffy and doesnt provide much neck/head support. However, the bed was reasonably comfortable. My breakfast at the Carousel Restaurant in the hotel was quite good. Though the spread was not alot, the quality of the food is quite good. I thought it tasted better than that of the Pan Pacific! The Swimming pool was also another disappointment as it is a bit small. It's at most a 3 meter by 3.5 metre pool and doesnt look alluring... On the overall, if you are just looking for an affordable stay along the bustling orchard road for your resting place at night, the Royal on Scotts would be good enough for you. Cheers, Suying

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: BDA2
Reviews.Content: I agree with most reviewers that this is a nice hotel and the lobby was certainly better than expected. Big negativ was the ultrathin doors to the rooms that made any sound in the hallway travel freely into the room.

Reviews.Title: “The RP is alright!”
Reviews.Author: hotelfanaticHK
Reviews.Content: I heard about the Royal Plaza through TripAdvisor and picked it as my hotel of choice when booking my vacation through Zuji. Arriving at the hotel, just walking across the wonderfully-designed lobby made me feel like royalty. Check-in was very efficient and I was in my room with my bags in under 10 minutes. The property is ideally located on Scotts Roads, running perpendicular to Orchard Road, the shopping mecca of Singapore. There are many outlets and restaurants in the area, so you won't ever run out of places to shop or eat. Carousel, the restaurant in the lobby, arguably has one of the best halal buffets ever (the Sultan of Brunei owns this hotel and the Hyatt across the road). As for rooms, I was booked into a Superior. The room was minimally appointed, but the bathroom was nice and the bed was comfortable. There was a strange stench in the mini-bar, which was due to spilled milk and coffee that had not been cleaned before my arrival. The desk chair was also very uncomfortable due to an uneven seat. When I entered the room, the toilet seat was loose, so I had maintenance fix that immediately. All in all, it is a comfortable hotel, but I'm just a little picky about the quality of the rooms I stay in. Highly recommended =)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeyaraj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Plaza on Scotts for 7 nights between Dec 21 to Dec 28, 2008. I booked a Superior Room thought travelocity.com at an average of $156 per night - including taxes. I picked this hotel for its location (and price) compared to other hotels on Orchard Road. I will try someother hotel for the same price next time. Pros: 1. Ideal Location - Close to MRT, McDonalds, Starbucks, Orchard Sheet 2. Free Wifi - Since i had my iPhone, i was able to post query and get quick answers on tripadvisor forums. I was also able to do a search on tripadvisor places to see and users feedback. 3. Food - The in-room dinning was good (expensive but good) Cons 1. Sleeps staff - i checked in at 7am and the staff were sleep and looked uninterested 2. The bathroom did not have shower curtains - the entrier bathroom became wet after a shower 3. The water in the shower was not hot enough. It was luke warm to cold (between 9 to 11am - other times it was fine) 4. I need to request for towels and a couple of times, since it was replaced for more than 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Forgetable for all the right reasons”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_and_Wendy
Reviews.Content: This is the type of hotel that is forgetable for all the right reasons - there is simply nothing to spoil your stay. Checkin was immediate and efficient, our room was clean, elegant and well-equiped, the staff were genuinely warm and helpful, and the overall ambience was quietly luxurious. The location is excelent, with plenty of nearby shops, restaurants and MRTstation. Taxis were plentiful both at the hotel and on the streets, and transfer to and from the airport was about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: catherinalove
Reviews.Content: great hotel. not on orchard road, but a few steps away from it-- near enough to be almost part of orchard road, but distant enough to avoid excessive noise. we went on a december when orchard road was all lighted up and very pretty. near the hotel, there is a 24-hour mccafe if you get tired of local cuisine or need something familiar. orchard road is full of malls and shopping is good. the mrt is also very near, which is ideal and very convenient. the room was very nice. we got a club room. the bathroom was very modernly fitted and very nice--one of the nicest i've experienced so far. you can watch tv from the spacious tub while you're soaking. the toiletries are also complete and well packaged. sheets are very soft and bed comfortable. plus, the minibar, which is restocked daily with softdrinks, juices, water and beer, is free! the breakfast buffet is complete with both western and local food. choices were abundant. you can get samplings of singaporean food there. there is also a vegetarian menu. the bar and the musical entertainment is also nice. downside is that the entire hotel is non-smoking. but then, most of singapore have strict smoking policies. i love this hotel and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a fab start to the honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Wayne-Gemma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Plaza as a stopover on the first night of our honeymoon. The location is great, right on the corner of Orchard Rd, the main shopping street, and easy access to whereever else you need to go. Highlights: - Fantastic breakfast including chinese delicacies (we'd recommend paying a bit more for a Royal Club room so this is included) - Free interenet access - Very friendly staff, who recommended we went to the Newton Hawker Centre for food, which was excellent Only slight downside was the free cocktails (as they didn't really know how to make cocktails, so the most exotic we got was vodka and orange!!) Overall a great hotel which we'd definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravFiend
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located off Orchard Rd (main shopping strip), which means if you're into shopping, then it's an awesome location. We found the Orchard Rd area terribly congested and tedious to maneuver around as a result (probably tolerable had the climate been less hot and humid). The hotel itself is well appointed and bed is extremely comfortable. Gym is small with 2 treadmills and a smattering of other equipments.

Reviews.Title: “had a good weeks stay”
Reviews.Author: u07ch
Reviews.Content: This is a well loctated hotel if you are in town to shop as its close to the main shopping centres. If you are in town for work there are possibly better hotels for you - though the north-south mrt station is about 10 minutes walk away (in 34c heat.) Conveniently outside was a Starbucks if you want something better than the nescafe they provide in the room though the hotel has a rather nice looking coffee shop too. There were two issues that let my stay down; before i get to them the most important things with a singapore hotel (for me anyway): the bed was really comfortable, the shower was great and the air conditioning worked really well (though the controls are baffling all red and green lights.) Its a hotel well designed for business travelers with power sockets on the top of a large desk and internet access is included with the room rate. There were 3 easily accessibly power sockets in the room; one by the desk, one under the large tv and one under the bedside table. The first downside of my stay was that the internet access was terribly slow even something like uploading a couple of photos to flickr repeatedly failed; and the wireless disappeared completely for the last two days of my stay. The biggest upset was when i dropped something under the bed and had to look under it. There was room service food, pills and general mess which suggests that the cleanliness was more about appearance than substance. That surprised me because to that point I was impressed - the mains even folded my clothes into tidy piles when i left them on top of the desk chair.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: JulzE
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice, well located place to stay to break our journey home from Paris. The hotel definitely lived up to its promise of luxury and charm. The staff were very friendly and our check in was friendly, fast and seamless. And we had been upgraded to a suite. So the only shame was that we were only here one night for a stopover. The grand bedroom, spacious living room, enormous bathroom with huge bath and separate shower - I could have moved in. We overlooked the pool which was inviting but we didn't get to use it during our short stay. The location is good, on Scott St and a short walk to Orchard Rd. It was Orchard Road that was a little disappointing this visit since it is being redeveloped. This work is meant to be finished Feb 09 but until its completed its a bit messy and hectic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but it can be a hit and miss!”
Reviews.Author: atheniancat
Reviews.Content: I travel to Singapore many atimes and only once stayed at another hotel I will give its pluses first, before giving the negative This year (2008) I stayed there 3 times in the space of the first 6 months of the year. (I travel Tiger Air - from Perth to Singapore I find deals for about 300 return inc taxes - as an aside I love travelling Tiger, small planes but very efficent ground service) Overall, I am very happy with the Hotel. Location is great - mostly why I stay here. Not much else I can say on that matter. But top stars! Food is well we usually only have breakfast, but highly recommend it, although sometimse it can be very busy especially on the weekend Heat bar is nice to sit over the window stools and enjoy the world passing by. Go for happy hour. But the best singapore sling is at the Marriott near by. The have a highest alcohol level! Its our tradion to have one there before we leave singapore. (And so much cheaper than the Long Bar at the RAffles - but you must go to the Raffles fro one singapore sling at least once! T^he High Tea at the Royal Plaza is good, but we usually have only gone to the Raffles High tea. The rooms are clean and tidy. The house keepers very friendly when we pass them at the corridor The concierges are excellent. I have never had a problem with any requests I may have. Eg carrying my bags, calling for taxis or whatever Sadly its the front desk staff that always let me down. At all times that i have stayed there, I have had a battle with my checkins. I have to brace myself to approach them. (eg I was travelling wtih my elderly mum, we arrvied late at night and I had emailed them earlier to ensure that we were going to have triple share, so please have a bed ready. They said they would, they even quoted me triple share rate. But wehn wearrived - no third bed was ready and we had to wait for a bed to be made up for us. We told them we were going to come again the following weeknd very late at night and please have athird bed ready! But when we arrived - no triple bed was ready nor a notation to that request!! (I had told the concierge and the front desk staff the previous week but to no avail) The front desk tend to not have any friendliness about them Apart form the front desk staff, everything is faultless Although, now we dont include breakfast, nice as it is. We like to eat out like a local. The breakfasts are so good, you eat too much to go out and about to eat outside. Having said all this, we have booked ourselves in the hotel again, when we go to Singapore mid January next year (2009) I am mostly curious as to how the front desk will take us!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: carrache
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel is a top notch place. I felt comfortable and well taken care of when staying here. Of course, being a top notch place you are paying for it all. Honestly I don't know if I could afford to return, but if I found a good deal I would certainly make this place my first choice in the Orchard Road area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overrated”
Reviews.Author: karabatraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights. Problems at check in, they hadn't included our ten year old and wanted to charge an additional SD70 per night for a trundle bed. Lucky we had printed ALL email conversations. ***Make sure you take all email conversations!!!*** In the end they said they wouldn't charge us for the extra bed "this time". Room was tidy and well decorated. Free minibar was not stocked with beer, had to ask for it. Was not used much anyway so was not real advantage, as it only consisted of 4 cans per day. Coke, Diet Coke, Tiger, Milo. The main advantage of this hotel is the enormous and very high quality breakfast. Usually SD32 a person if not included in the room price. However, food is very cheap and easily obtainable just a few steps in any direction out the door of the hotel. The problem with the breakfast is that we ate so much that we were not that hungry to eat all the other beautiful food available in Singapore - Hiannese Chicken Rice, Satay, etc etc etc. So overall, if the breakfast is the best thing about this hotel, you are better off saving your money and getting something a little cheaper, as this is a VERY expensive hotel for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute experience !”
Reviews.Author: gt1955
Reviews.Content: I spend over 70 nights a year on business travel and I have rarely been so impressed ! From check-in to check-out I experienced superlative services and exceptionally competent and friendly staff.The location is perfect for shopping,business as well as food and entertainment. The overall experience far outclasses the major 5 star chains...No question about it,RP has got it right. It's worth the upgrade to Club Level !

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: fatboyonadiet
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered to the moment we left we had a brilliant experience here, couldn't fault it at all. ALL staff were friendly and helpful, we were given a gorgeous free cake as it was our honeymoon and also took advantage of the free mini-bar (choice of drinks). We had breakfast included and had it every day, there was plenty of choice. It was all Halal too. We did eat an evening meal there too which was buffet style and was lovely. We also took advantage of the daily 15 minutes free internet time for all guests in the business centre, if it was empty, as it often was, staff didn't mind you staying on the PCs for a little longer. The pool area isn't massive but is very clean and nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheba31
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights via their website for Premier (room only) and we were upgraded to the Royal Club floor - presumably bigger room, with buffet breakfast for 2 thrown in. Receptionist was very efficient, friendly and informative. Prompted us for our flight details for departure and recommended that we book a taxi for our early morning pick-up. Checkout was a breeze. Room decor is contemporary but I think the hallway to the rooms is getting a little tired. Have to bear in mind that this is a refurbished building. Bed was comfortable and blockout curtains a Godsend. Walls are a bit thin - I could hear people walking/talking in the hallway outside. Flatscreen tv, free wi-fi. Complimentary drinks in the mini bar is a nice touch but don't get too excited as it isn't stocked to the brim - 2 beers, 2 cans of softdrink, juice and water, restocked everyday. In-house restaurant, Carousel, is reknown for their sumptious high tea buffets on the weekends so do try. We did not get a chance to but it comes highly recommended from our local but the breakfast buffet had a nice spread. Great location. On the corner of Scotts and Orchard so you have the shopping and MRT station at your doorstep. Isetan shopping centre is next door with a grocery store if you need anything else. Heaps of fastfood restaurants nearby - some even 24 hours. Concierge was helpful in booking an early morning taxi for our departure. Rate a little expensive but it is hard to find a cheaper hotel without compromising location and rating. Would stay again if the rates don't creep up.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: ctandsn
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for the royal plaza, I decided to book it for my family and I for three nights. I was quite disappointed. For a four star hotel, there wasn't even anybody to come out to help us with our luggage when we arrived until everything was moved out from our bus (and for a family of 8, we had 15 luggages/bags to move out). The check in service was time consuming as the service lady had to write down EIGHT sheets of registration form, and she didn't have a very welcoming personally-- no smiles, no 'have a good night', no "can I help you with anything else", nothing-- it was strict business with checking us in and off we go. the people at the check in counter aren't very helpful with tourisy questions as well. we had one room that was suppose to fit two adults and two child (one four year old, the other nine), i ordered a double bed room but it turned out to be a single person, very tiny twin beds. so i had to add an extra bed for $70 (SGD) each night. the room overall was just mediocare although the beds are comfy. the bathroom was stocked with exactly two bath towel , ONE shampoo bottle, and ONE body gel bottle. the refrigerator was stocked with two bottles, one orange juice, one coke and two tiger beers--all complimentary. internet was free also. the location is conveniently close to the MRT and busy shopping areas and restaurants. Overall, the stay wasn't work the the amount of money i paid. this hotel is more of a 3 star to me as far as it's facilities and services, not the 4-5 star that it claims. i could have stayed at better hotels for the money that I had paid. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ally11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, recently refurbished and very good value for money. The Saturday afternoon buffet looked excellent value, but we didn’t get chance to eat there as we already had dinner arranged for the evening. It seemed hugely popular though, so book ahead if you want a table. The metro is very close and there’s a taxi rank outside the front door with priority given to hotel customers. It’s also surrounded by bars, restaurants and shopping malls. New ton Circus Hawker Market is within walking distance (about 1 mile), which is great fun. Be wary of getting a connecting room, the noise travels between the doors. We asked to move because it felt almost like the crying baby next door was in our room. The pool area is quite small but pleasant and nice to relax after a busy day sightseeing. Very good quality for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing, Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Awarnach
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights here on our holiday in singapore. What a top class brilliant hotel, everything was superb from checkin to checkout. On arrival we never had to touch our bags from the moment we arrived in the taxi, checkin staff were extremely polite, welcoming and helpful, we got a free upgrade to a suite!. Our suite room was spectacular, 5 star luxury, spacious with seperate living area. Huge shower and bathroom, plenty of room to move about. This hotel was the best, can't wait to goto singapore to stay here again. The only disadvantage is the food at the hotel restaurants is extremely expensive, room service aswell, which is no problem since you are located in the middle of town and have dozens of restaurants at your fingertips!. Wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy123Northampton
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel a little after 9am Sunday morning, not really expecting to be able to check in. Not only could we in fact check in, we were upgraded to a club room thanks to us joining ‘I prefer’ before we left the UK. The room itself was great, nice comfortable bed, large flat screen TV, nice bathroom facilities and it was clean and quiet. The view from the room wasn’t great, but since we didn’t plan to spend much time there that was OK. There was also a very convenient in room safe. The club lounge was very good, free drinks and snacks-cheese, bread, cakes etc as well as a few hot items. (As well as breakfast there if you wanted it) also free internet access. Breakfast was very extensive (we ate in the Carousel restaurant downstairs), lots of choices such as cereals, fruit, toast and an egg station, lots of cooked stuff too. You could easily set yourself up for the day here-we had read a few reviews about overcrowding etc but we saw none of this, there were always lots of tables available, maybe it was a quiet time. The location of the Royal Plaza is excellent, just off the northern end of Orchard Road, with lots of restaurants around the area. The subway was just over the street, very clean and cheap The staff in the hotel were always very friendly and helpful, and the hotel is very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: dalton1skiing
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 week as it was the only accomodation we could find. Our holiday coincided with the first ever Formula 1 in Singapore when hotel prices went through the roof. Although we had a terrific holiday, this hotel was not my 1st choise, actually my 5th, but the others were booked out for the F1. The outside is unimpressive and looks nothing like a hotel. Right next to a DFS deparment store which looked grander. The entrance area looks impressive, but has no baring on the rooms appearance or rest of the hotel. Reception was efficient & had our booking, all went smoothly. The entire hotel is smoke free. It must also be owned by Muslims as the menus had only 'turkey ham' and 'beef bacon'. There is also a Qaran in the bedside desk. Other than these, there were no other obvious indicators that is was owned/run by muslims. The room was smaller than expected. We got the standard (i think they call it the deluxe!) which doesnt include the free mini-bar and breakfast. That was an option when booking, but the added amount to have breakfast included was ridiculous. When we checked in, we were given the option again of adding breakfast each day at $28 singapore dollars +++. The +++ adds an extra 17% to the total bill for tax and service charge. You cant just have it 1 or 2 days of the breakfast, you must have it the entire stay. If you only want a few days breakfast there, its $32 +++. I do love the all you can eat style breakfast, but I certainly dont eat $37 worth. Esp when nearby local food halls have terrific food for $3! I had forgoten how expensive Singapore is when compared to say Thailand or Malaysia. Our room had 2 large (almost double sized) twin beds with very comfy, thick mattresses and extra long pillows. A large, flat screen TV and small fridge. Hairdryer, safe, iron and ironing board and plenty of mirrors including a full length one. The bathroom was very small too with just a shower. There was a normal sized shower head, and an absolutely enormous one too. Hot water was no problem. We occasionally could hear a door closing nearby, but never heard noise, tv or voices from either neighbouring rooms. The reading lights actually face down from the roof so blind your eyes. Very uncomfortable to read with. The TV has several English channels including 2 movie channels, several sports, BBC, CNN, Discovery, a few in Mandarin, 1 french, 1 Italian, 1 German, 1 from Brunei and a few from Malaysia. There was an adaptor for free internet, although we didnt bring out lap tops. Also a multi-plug adaptor fitted into the wall which was handy. I dont think any of the rooms have a particularity good view. We could see Scotts road by peering out. The windows didnt open and there is no balcony. There is a kettle with tea/coffee facilities of sorts. 2 tea bags, 2 sachets of coffee, 2 sugar sachets and only 1 mini-milk sachet in the fridge. The milk was only topped up on the 4th day and the others bits randomly. I had bought a small carton of milk at a 7 eleven by that stage. They also supplied 2x 600ml water bottles, but again these were random and not supplied every day like I suspect they are supposed to be. They weren't there initially and only turned up on day 2. The room was kept very clean whilst there. Sheets and towels changed when requested. Staff were always curtious, helpful and smiled. There is a buisiness lounge on the 2nd floor. Reception advised us (on day 5 of our stay!) that we were entiltled to 15mins free internet useage each. I ended up using it several times and was told that as long as no one was waiting, I could stay on using it and not restricted to just 15mins. The location of the hotel is very good. 2mins to orchard road & the MRT. Lots of local restaurants and shops to choose from. Room service and restaurant prices were terrible though. The pool was small for a so called 5 star hotel and the surrounding decked area became very full during the day. We requested late check out as our flight wasnt till 9pm. This wasnt granted, even though we offered to pay extra. (Due to the F1 booking out the hotel). We were able to shower in the pool showers, but this had no chair in the shower area, & not any room to relax and wait. We were told that they were considering adding some sort of comfort area for this in the future, as other customers had complained. When or if such a room will be provided, who knows. I woud stay there again if the room prices were good, but there are more reasonably priced hotels which include breakfast and have better facilities in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay and close to Orchard Road.”
Reviews.Author: teqp
Reviews.Content: This is our first stop for our Singapore/Indonesia trip. After a LONG 18 hour flight from Los Angeles (transit at Taipei), we arrived at Singapore. We only stayed there for one night before heading to our Indonesia diving/snorkeling trip. We were both tired and just wanted to check-in the hotel and rest. We told the receptionist that we want a quiet room and were given an upgrade to their deluxe room with see-through window connecting the bathroom and bedroom. The room is nice with all the 4 star hotel amenities (plasma TV, 320-thread-count Egyptian cotton comforter), but the real standout is the free mini-bar and nice bathtub with separate shower. My girlfriend enjoyed her bubble bath especially after a long flight. The bath tub is decent size, and you can watch TV from the tub (through see-through glass), but can’t hear it too well or change the channel because the TV is not in the bathroom. If you want some privacy in the bathroom, no problem, there is a blind you can pull down in the bathroom to cover the glass. The separate shower is decent size too, you have plenty of room in the shower (compared to Hilton, which is a separate report), and the best is the huge overhead shower head. It’s the size of basketball which has really good water pressure too (very relaxing after a long flight). The free mini bar consists of roughly 10 bottles of drinks (2 tiger bears, 2 water, 2 juices, coke, diet coke, Milo), sorry memory is fading, should’ve taken a picture of it. It is a very nice touch and most hotels would probably charge you $30 for all those drinks. Oh, forgot to mention, you can use their computer at business center for free the first 15 minutes. The only thing I don’t like about Royal Plaza is they charge you $5.20 Singapore dollars for advance booking a taxi for you. Our flight next morning was at 9:25am, so we need a taxi 7am in the morning and was afraid that we couldn’t get a taxi that early in the morning if we don’t book in advance. But I think you can just call the concierge early in the morning and have them call a taxi for you, and that’s free of charge. For the price we paid for on expedia.com: $150 including tax, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average, not great”
Reviews.Author: dan55
Reviews.Content: Lovely foyer & location hides an average hotel. On the whole, this place wasn't really that bad. However, a combination of a lot of little things put us off going back. Have a read of my pluses/minuses and see what you think. Good things about the hotel 1. Location is awesome: Close to MRT (subway), major shops, food, taxi 2. The free broadband was excellent. Fast, low latency. I was using the supplied Ethernet cable which I would recommend over wireless. 3. The taxi guy out the front was good. 4. 'What can I do for you' service was OK, fairly prompt when requesting ice. 5. The king size bed was super comfy (pillows were not heaven for me or my wife). 6. Was upgraded to the Deluxe Corner room which is slightly larger than Deluxe (thank you for that). Bad things about the hotel 1. Fair is fair, the free minibar is actually free, no catches when it comes to paying. However, there is still a catch! A normal minibar depending where you stay would contain: 2 to 8 snacks 4 to 10 mini spirit bottles 2 to 4 juices 2 to 6 beers (usually 2-3 different types) This absolutely free minibar contains: 0 Snacks 0 mini spirit bottles 2 juices 2 small cans of Tiger beer Altogether that is about 8 SGD worth of drinks. It is NOT false advertising, but definitely deceptive. 2. To top off the free mini-bar being a dud, it wasn't even stocked consistently. I drank my juice the first two days and was then hooked on having a nice morning juice, the next 7 days after that it was never restocked. Poor. 3. The lighting in the room we stayed in (Deluxe Corner) was poor, they need reading lights so you can set the mood for reading/tv/etc. You turn on the overhead bed lights are you blinded by giant Halogen floodlights. 4. Let's face it, even though you don't go on holiday to watch TV, sometimes you end up watching it while you wait for a place to open or while relaxing in the room. Free to air offerings were fine. Pay movies were non-existent even though we wanted to watch something. 5. Hotel has those giant 'king sized' pillows. I asked for foam instead, they took two goes for them to bring something that was actually foam. Still huge, however sufficient to let me and my wife to get some sleep. Could have been a better experience. 6. Shower, we didn't enjoy, needle spray, needs a shower curtain or door, water went all over the floor. 7. An ice machine would be nice so I don't have to call up when I run out, proper drinking glasses rather than toothbrush holder glasses also. 8. The maid forgot to give us a spare toilet roll on more than one occasion (we did run out and had to phone them). 9. Room service isn't just expensive like most hotels, it is insanely expensive. Especially for Singapore where you can get a nice meal from a hawker centre for $3.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve Tripadvisor rating”
Reviews.Author: miltonmao
Reviews.Content: How is it possible for this former Holiday Inn to be rated so highly on Tripadvisor? I have stayed in hundred of hotels around Asia and although it is not appalling, it is unimpressive. I stayed here on 3 occasions in one trip (the rooms were paid in advance, otherwise I would have cancelled after the first stay). The lobby is impressive, if that’s important to you. The rooms are refurbished, but there’s no getting away from the small size, about the size of a 3 star in Hong Kong and frankly smaller than anywhere I’ve stayed in KL, Singapore, Tokyo, Jakarta, Seoul etc. The bathroom was about 2metres by 1.5 metres and all night long we were kept awake by construction noise. A previous Tripadvisor complemented the hotel on their toiletries. Seriously you could buy better at a $2 discount store. Finally the concierge staff are the laziest in Asia, far more interested in gossiping than helping with the bags. On each of the 3 occasions I had to lug my own bags up the stairs before someone reluctantly agreed to take it to our room. Note, there is no ramp from where you get off the taxi. I guess if you need to be on Orchard then the location is good but I’m finding it hard to be positive about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Place”
Reviews.Author: Expectation123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Royal Plaza on Scotts recently.It's a good solution for the business traveller. The rooms are excellent and have the added bonus of FREE internet access unlike many of the big providers. Highly impressed by initative shown by staff who left a spare pillowcase cover when they saw the ironing board left out- that's customer focus!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel who go the extra mile.”
Reviews.Author: ITIK-ITIK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RP last Friday night on the last night of our 4 wk travels around Singapore & Malaysia. We picked the hotel due to location & good reviews on TA. The rating I would have given would have been very good as it is a lovely hotel in a excellent location with extremely comfy beds & pleasant staff. However, they now get an A1 gold star rating from us due to going the extra mile for us. When checking in at the airport, my husband realised that he had left his reading glasses at the hotel & even with a flight delay, we would not have time to go & retrieve them ourselves. I rang the hotel, explained the situation & the excellent housekeeping staff found his glasses & put them in a taxi to us at the airport. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone & would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, super lunch buffet and room service”
Reviews.Author: YagaTanzania
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, quick check-in and out. Very friendly staff. Comfortable and elegent rooms. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: papeetee
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. The hotel itself is ok, our room was a bit small and had no view at al (parking house). The bathroom was quite small too. Overall it's a bit overpriced in my opinion. There was one really annoying thing though, we took the room without breakfast and wanted to buy it additionally over there already. We wanted it only during one day. During checkin we were told it was no problem but at checkout we were charged for breakfast for 2 days, while we requested only one. That was the reason why we booked the hotel without breakfast in first place, because we knew that we were leaving very early in the morning on the second day. The staff wasn't very friendly while dealing with this problem. We were just told it wasn't possible to take breakfast for one day and not the second day, which is one of the most stupid things you can hear after booking a room without breakfast. It is a minor thing but ended up being really annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back.”
Reviews.Author: tei1988
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RP for 6 nights: was back in Singapore to attend a reunion and visit family. Location was my primary reason: it's close to all the activity of Orchard Road, but also just outside the restricted zone of Orchard Road (i.e. the restricted zone taxes vehicles at certain times which will affect taxi prices). Staff were friendly and helpful. I stayed on the 8th floor; no view, but I didn't need it. Room was of a decent size. My king size bed was actually two twins put together, and I could feel the "dent" between the two. But since I was there alone, this wasn't an issue. Pool and gym are open at a 6.00am: all of us suffering from jetlag were there. Pool is small but refreshing. Gym's treadmills had tv screens on them, which was a novelty for me! RP is within walking distance to the trains (MRT) and buses. Starbucks is just outside, to your right. Shopping is everywhere! If you want to give local food a go, head towards Wisma Atria (big blue building, to your right on Orchard Road). There's a food court on the 4th floor at reasonable prices called "The Food Republic". RP is also known for its High Tea on weekends, and the locals will line up for it. The room was clean but it wasn't pristine. I had no complaints though, and overall: would go back for the price offered. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Plaza is perfect for me!”
Reviews.Author: Irdina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights during the weekend. Check-in was fast. Service, food & facilities were good. The staff were friendly & really helpful. In fact, Mr Ali at the concierge, did help us to book the ticket for ducktours! Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at Royal Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Panaché”
Reviews.Author: cluntks
Reviews.Content: First of all, I think it's a brilliant location if you indulge in shopping and having amnities right at your doorstep - which was my case since I was only in Singapore for the weekend and did not want to lose too much time in transport. We had a normal room with shower, facing the DFS store - no direct exposure though hope!). The room was good, nice size, comfortable bed, and a big desk for working if needed. The front dresk staff was all right. The young lady at check in was lovely and very helpful. However the one we had to deal with at check out could've been less expeditive and smilier - Service doesn't end at check out pls. The wifi connection worked well, with the odd hiccups; the free mini bar was a nice touch; there's a starbucks and a 24h mc donalds two steps away from the lobby.... it would be great if they could change the toiletries in the bathroom (shampoo, shower gel) with better quality ones. Overall I'm quite pleased with our stay. A bit of mixed feelings with the front desk staff though, and might consider other hotels I've stayed at previously when I pop by Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so positive about the plaza”
Reviews.Author: SueinNZ
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my Singapore stay as the location seemed good (near Orchard Road) and there was a possibility of a reasonably-priced club room, with a lounge offering free internet access. I'm not sure if I made the right decision on either count. Firstly, I think I was wrong about the location- Singapore tourist life seems to be moving nearer to the harbour nowadays and so, if you wanted to do anything, you had to take the MRT or a taxi. Secondly, I have mixed feelings about the club room. On the plus side- the view was fine, despite what previous reviewers have said; the room was a decent size and there were very good in-room amenities; the club lounge offered a good breakfast and even afternoon tea, which was impressive on the one occasion I could try it. On the negative side- I had chosen a club room specifically so that I would be able to check in to my flight at 10.55pm, the 24 hours advance notice that BA seems to need if you are going to get a decent seat. When I turned up at the lounge at 10.45pm, I was immediately told somewhat curtly by no fewer than two members of staff that they were about to close-even though no mention of a closing time had been made earlier. I enquired further and found that the lounge in fact shut at 11pm. When I said that I would be finished and out by then, this did not seem to go down well. I was as good as my word and left by 11pm but the episode left a bad taste. I said as much in my customer survey. When the Duty manager wanted to see me after I had checked out, I thought that it might be to express some regret for the previous night. Not at all- it was to ask me if I had taken a bath robe, as house keeping had reported one missing fron my room! (I had assumed that I was meant to have only been given one robe, as I was staying on my own). As you can imagine, the various benefits which I've mentioned above don't quite make up for the feeling that I was given of being a) an inconvenience and b) a thief!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: murray_maccoll
Reviews.Content: We were returning to Australia from the UK and decided to stop over in Singapore for three days to do some exploration. With a three year old and a six month old my wife and I were desperate to ensure that the hotel we stayed at was set up for the unique requirements of a family eg fridge for baby food, friendly and understanding staff, cots etc. At the Royal Plaza on Scotts we found everything we needed and more. The staff were outstanding and very friendly. The room was very spacious and they provided a real cot as opposed to a travel cot for our youngest child. The room was very clean and the food at breakfast was perfect for fussy little ones. The pool was a great way to cool off after a muggy day of shopping and exploring and my daughter loved it. What's more we never once felt like having children was an inconvenience to either the other guests or the staff. The location is ideal for access to Orchard road and the bus that goes directly to the Singapore Zoo (highly recommended) stops right outside twice a day. If we ever find ourselves back in Singapore for even the shortest stay we will definitely be returning to the Royal Plaza on Scotts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_8
Reviews.Content: Nice location next to Orchard Road (Shops, Shops, Shops!) Free Wi-Fi and free mini-bar which they replace each day. Faultless hotel and would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Where is Rhein?”
Reviews.Author: CrownePlazaAFOM
Reviews.Content: I returned to Royal Plaza on Scotts thinking of the same service I had last January when I was in Singapore. But apparently, i was disappointed to know that one of your staff or manager already resigned. I think i remember his name, Rhein. He was indeed an asset to your hotel. For my latest stay, just plain. Nothing extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: water_lili_88
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two days. Booked a deluxe room and was upgraded to Premier room. Although the view is not great (facing car park), this is true of Singapore city hotels generally. The hotel service was fantastic. The free internet and free minibar (only offered drinks, no snacks) is also a plus. However, at times the internet connection kept on dropping out. The location is great, a few minutes walk to MTR station and Orchard Road shopping. Across the road is the Hyatt which has a pretty good restaurant serving hawker style food. Nearby is also Food Republic food court which has a wide offering. The room was not very big but the amenities were great. Housekeeping service is very efficient. The bathroom has a shower with a seat and a separate bath. From the bathroom there is a large clear window into the bedroom. The pool was great. There is no spa but there is a sauna. The ambience at reception was really good, in the afternoon the piano is played. A great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: loan
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel july 4 to 8 th 2008 Airport transfer: good,on time,(no water but it is a minor issue) Location: excellent,corner of Scott and Orchard,lot of eating places and shopping very nearby,subway very close Room:very good,marble bathroom with shower rain,no bathtube,only if you stay at club floor(we were upgrade) Staff: very good,helpful, Check in ,out: smooth,easy Taxi;easy to catch at hotel but can be a little difficult when you try to catch in a middle of nowhere over all,love love Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great price”
Reviews.Author: devineelle
Reviews.Content: Just come back form a four night stay at Royal plaza on Scotts. Location – the location is perfect, it’s very central and great if you like to shop. It’s about a 5 min walk to the tube station. There are shopping malls, shops, places to eat as soon as you step out of the hotel lobby. Rooms – for the first two nights we stayed on the 11th floor, the room was nice but did not have a bath. That was not an issue. The room was very clean and drinks were free in the mini bar. The bed was a good size and comfortable. Stayed in a club room for the next tow nights and the room was more or less the same with a larger bath room that consisted of a bath tub. Price – very good for location, the hotel is located infront of the hyatt and about ½ the price. Staff – the staff were friendly and helpful. Check-in/out – did not have any issues with check in, would advise you to check your booking and see what it includes prior to check in as we were initially told that the room rate did not include breakfast/meal but then told it was by another member of staff. Room service – breakfast was 25 mins late and cold on arrival. Hotel restaurant – wow, had dinner there one night, buffet……fresh lobster, crab, sushi, roast meats, Thai food, Italian food, Indonesian dishes…..the list goes on. Could not fault it what so ever. For the price that you pay (150 SGD for two people), the quality was great. Just as good as an a la cart menu. Breakfast, was nice, nothing special really.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: North_Queenslander
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Singapore for 3 nights on the way to Phuket. Firstly the foyer is just stunning from the moment you walk in the hotel theres a lovely fresh floral smell, we checked in smoothly headed up to our room, lovely big bed, a nice desk to set up the laptop, good sized bathroom and lots of tolietries! The free mini bar was ideal a couple of beers, juices, water and soft drinks. The free wireless internet seemed to freeze up our laptop. Breakfast was yummy lots to choose from and well spread out the onyl thing missing was real bacon they only had turkey bacon.. we also had cocktails each night at Heat they do a happy hour of two for the price of one for pre dinner drinks, really good service and atmosphere. Location was very central. Went for a swim, pool wasnt too big but did the job. Another funny little thing all the towels and linen had the same fresh floral smell as the foyer....just lovely Was very happy with this hotel and it was a great start to our holiday - each time we had breakfast in Phuket we wished we where back at Royal Plaza for the Brekkie!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for a few nights while in Singapore on business, it is in a great location just off Orchard Road across the road from the Hilton. I got a reasonable rate from there website it was there Bed Breakfast and broadband in a club room. The free internet access was a Big plus for any Hotel and is a nice touch, also they have a Free drink bar in your room, it only has 4 or 5 soft drinks and 2 beers but all the same its great. The room has been renovated and was nice but are on the small side, LCD TV and great marble bathroom with great shower was really nice. If I can get a good rate I would have not problems staying here again, give it ago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: sikesna
Reviews.Content: What a true pleasure it was to stay at this hotel. Yes, the hotel is beautiful, super clean and very modern. But what made our stay so exceptional, was the staff. Everyone was extremely polite and helpful. They truly made our trip a pleasure. We were so sad to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel in a central location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: stillwaters11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Plaza for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel is very well located on Scotts Road, just a few mins walk to the Orchard Rd MRT station and all the shops/amenities that Orchard Rd offers. It is essentially a very “business” style hotel, but this isn’t a bad thing! Rates are reasonable by central Singapore standards and the service/standards at the hotel are excellent. There is a complimentary mini-bar in all rooms (OK, so we know they take that into account when setting the room rates, but it FEELS like something for nothing!), which we found very useful! Every day it is stocked with 2 cans of beer, some water, orange juice, Coke/Diet Coke, and another juice drink – if nothing else, with the heat and humidity in Singapore, we took the water out with us every day and then had a beer upon our return! There is also free Wi-fi access, and they give you a password when you 1st check-in – I tried to use it on my PSP, which admittedly is NOT ideal for this sort of service, and got access to the network but found response times very slow. Likely to be far better on a laptop, but I wouldn’t bet on it being mega-speedy. But for free access, it’s a very good service. The bed was very large and comfy and, as you would expect, standards of cleanliness were excellent. There was also a good range of complimentary toiletries in the bathroom. We didn’t eat at the restaurant there as it was quite expensive (but not more so than all the other good hotel restaurants in that area) and, in the limited time we had, we wanted to try some of the Hawker Markets and go down for a meal to Clarke Quay. There was also entertainment at the 1st floor bar every night, and the resident band were very good. Again, bar prices were quite expensive but not more so than anywhere else on Scotts/Orchard – we had a couple of cocktails, and at least you could taste what you were paying for, they were pretty lethal!! Some general tips for Singapore: It’s pretty easy to see a good deal and do everything you want to in 3 days, maybe even 2. The tourist travel passes are brilliant – 3 day use of buses and trains for about £10. The MRT system is very easy to navigate and is clean, safe & reliable – you simply tap your pass on the pad at all the entrance/exit barriers and it lets you through. Same on the buses – you tap your card against the pads as you enter AND leave the bus. Singapore is probably the cleanest, safest city I’ve ever visited. We didn’t see one instance of graffiti anywhere, and very little litter. One of the best things we did was the Jurong Bird Park – you take the MRT and bus to get there (plenty of directions/signs available), which is a lot easier than you may think. The bird park is very well laid out, with multiple different ‘areas’ and places to sit and have a picnic. Don’t forget to buy a tub of food for $2 (about 80p) and feed the lorikeets! A visit over on the cable car to Sentosa is a nice trip out, especially for those with children as there are beaches/activities over there. The botanic gardens are lovely for a walk round/chill out, especially as entry is free. Bars/restaurants around the Boat Quay/Clarke Quay areas are great – and you can take boat tours along the river from there, which are good value. The newly-opened Singapore Flyer is a big tourist attraction – beware the queues!!!! My husband booked online before we travelled and paid an extra £5 each to go “Express”, which gave us a guaranteed time slot and an escort to the front of the queue, via the back corridors! We weren’t sure if it would be worth it until we got there and saw the queue!!!! This was at 7.30pm on a Sat evening and the queue was somewhere between 2 and 3 hours…. Be warned… Everyone has to make at least a fleeting visit to Raffles Hotel whilst in Singapore – the Long Bar is well signed and is where you can get a Singapore Sling in the place it was invented!! Be warned, it is NOT cheap, but it’s kinda one of those things you “have” to do… Oh, and expect it to rain at some point, because you won’t go more than 2 or 3 days at the most without a torrential downpour!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Place”
Reviews.Author: Globe-spanner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite simply very good. Smallish but well equipped rooms with internet access, clean, good bathroom and a free mini bar. Couple of beers at night, OJ in the morning and water to take out was a nice touch The breakfast buffet was fantastic with eggs/omelettes done to your liking. A wide selection of fruit, hot food to suit every taste. All of a high standard. The personal butler was a nice touch but over the top for a couple of holiday makers. Staff were great and could not do enough for you. Nice bar lounge and restaurants. It was an upmarket place where we felt at ease. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, Ambience...stay there often”
Reviews.Author: sss1970t
