Reviews.Content: From the time you enter the hotel, it smells and feels fresh and clean. Its a non-smoking hotel, but has about a 150 tea-lights in the lobby! ironic! The check in is very fast, and with a smile. The rooms have everything you need. Clean, good size by Singapore standards, but the view is that of a car-park. Personally, i preferred the rooms before the make over of the hotel. Where this hotel really scores is the free inroom internet, free minibar, and the absolutely fantastic location. You can walk most places, to the MRT as well. Further, there is a covered escalator bridge between the hotel and Far East Plaza across the road. Hence, you have the flexibility to hire a taxi from either direction. Given the Singapore rain and traffic, this itself saves 10 minutes per trip, and is great if you're on work like i was and had many meetings. The check out process was a bit erratic. Please confirm the rate you book at as well as other booking details, as there could be confusion at check out. My friends too experienced the same problem. Staff is polite and efficient, room service and breakfast is good. Didn't try any restaurant, as there are many better cheaper ones in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, Very Central”
Reviews.Author: Malaysian_suzie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in May and was pleasant surprised. Rooms are recently renovated, hotel very busy but staff still pleasant, free minibar, good amenities in the room, free wireless. Wish I could have stayed longer. Decently priced from the hotel website, given the rising prices of Singapore hotels these days. The hotel restaurant looked good and well patronised. Will definitely try to stay here next time I'm back in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Well worth staying at this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: julie072
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. If I were to return to Singapore - this would be my pick again. This was the 10th trip to Singapore and this hotel was probably the best I have stayed, especially the location. Scotts Road is a buzz of activity and so convenient. I had good intentions to travel via the MRT, but in the end travelled everywhere via taxi. Too convenient when there is one waiting right at the front door for you everytime you step out. The staff were very unintrusive, and I did not have a lot to do with them apart from the 2 minute check in and out. The room was small but roomy enough especially since we didnt spend that much time there. We had twin beds which are equivalent to a small double bed. I left a list for housekeeping ( a long list mind you) and they accommodated and gave us everything on the list. Now the little gripes - The kettle in our room was terrible and had to be boiled twice and there was no clock which was a bit of a pain. Take your own hairdryer as the one supplied is attached inside the bedside drawer and the on button had to be held down constantly.... this was very annoying. The curtains are great though - block out which keeps the room nice and dark. I cant rave about the buffet breakfast.... very very ordinary compared to other hotel buffets I have had, but ample enough. I would not pay extra for the breakfast (we had it included in our rate) as there is food very close by. I loved the fact that MCDonalds - MCCafe was right next door as I could get my coffee fix regularly. The buffet finishes at 10am which I think is too early - especially when you are in no rush to get up in the morning as the shops dont open till 10-11am. The free water and drinks was a great bonus as there is not really a supermarket that close to buy these things. There is a shopping centre across the road - Far East Plaza which was very convenient and had great shopping-- better than the expense of Orchard Road. So, I would definately return and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cold shower in the morning!”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for shopping and entertainment around Orchard Road so good for tourists. I stayed here on a one night stopover whilst on business. Check-in was ok, I was repeatedly advised that the hotel is strictly non-smoking (which I wouldn't have known becuase I couldn't have seen the half dozen signs in reception telling me and the declaration of a $300 per day "fee" for cleaning the room in the event that I did smoke on the check-in form). Despite this I was asked to sign an acceptance of this condition despite it not being mentioned at the time of booking. Regardless I was happy to sign as I do not smoke and hate being in a non-smoking room where somebody has smoked so this was all very acceptable if not unorthodox. The room was pleasant enough, modern furnishing, a bit of a dank smell (combination of aircon and lack of ventilation of fresh air). Window faced onto another building so no sunlight. Internet connection was free so this was a real plus as I was on business. The free minibar is ok (not quite a minibar, more of a mini-minibar but hey it was free so I'll leave it there). The bathroom is quite small and poorly laid out (don't expect to use the bidet as there is no water pressure). The whole bathroom thing got worse the following morning. I rose early to catch my onward flight (6am) to discover that there was no hot water. I thought at first that it would just get warmer and I hopped in. Alas it was freezing for the entire shower so I woke up very quickly. When checking out I mentioned this and was told that I was in a corner room so it takes a while to heat up. There was no apology, no response to "how long does it take to heat up" unlike the repeated references to smoking at check-in. I therefore decided to give this hotel a miss for future trips as I like a hot (even a warm) shower in the mornings. Whilst the hotel was quite modern, it appears to lack soul. The service is a bit perfunctory and there was little or no personal touch even when problems occur. Better than some and if you like a cold shower then highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: sueaustralia_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value. The minibar is stocked daily and it is free, there is free internet access and the staff were most helpful. At night there is a magnificent buffet with heaps of seafood and it is very reasonable in price. Overall a great hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: ExeterHector
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Plaza for 3 nights while on a tour around south east asia. 20 minute drive from the airport (don't know where all the traffic went). Royal Plaza is ideally located about 100 yards from Orchard road and 200yds from the Orchard MRT station. This is perfect for either getting around town or checking out all the shoping malls on Orchard road (there are dozenzs of these). Lots of places to eat nearby, including the mandatory MacDonalds. Check in was very efficient and the rooms are of a good size and standard. Overall service was very good, but the view from the room wasn't up to much. There was a comprehensive buffet breakfast which kept me going for most of the day. Never tried the restaurant, but there was a very impressive display of fancy cakes that did temp me. Overall a very nice stay in a convienent location

Reviews.Title: “great place to base your Singapore trip”
Reviews.Author: TravellersHobart
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here before moving on to Indonesia. We arrived at about 10pm to be told the hotel was fully booked so they had upgraded us to a Club Room - "did we mind". Of course we didn't mind and had a great room and enjoyed all the facilities of the Club floor. The hotel is in a great location - very close to Orchard Road. Staff were courteous and friendly - there was nothing we could fault during our stay. We used the swimming pool and it was refreshing after a morning shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on Orchard Road in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith47
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay directly with the hotel. I got a much better rate than the big travel sites, and it included an enormous breakfast buffet. The room was well furnished with a roomy and well equipped bath. It had a separate shower stall, but it had a waterfall showerhead and a hand held head. The hotel was quiet. The staff was great, especially Ibrahim at the concierge desk. The location was perfect. The MTR subway stop was a block away. There is an amazing amount of shopping and dining on Orchard Road. Taxis are very cheap, about S$16 from the airport to the hotel. The taxi drivers put the pedal to the metal, so hold on. The MTR line will take you to the downtown area. The hotel bar has a live band most of the nights. The lobby was was nicely decorate. There is free internet access at the business center for 15 minutes, if you need a pc to check email. There is also somone to help you with faxes and other things.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: mickact
Reviews.Content: Had five days six night staying at the Royal Plaza. Whilst the room was basic it was well furnished, the view from our window was of a building next door but we just kept the blinds closed and didn't worry about it. The bar fridge is stocked daily with FREE ! small cans of softdrinks & beer (total of four ) and bottled water ( 2 or 3 if I recall ) Used the swimming pool & gym which are open from about 6.30am most mornings before going out into the humidity. Always used the pool upon our return in the afternoon to cool off.Great buffet breakfast kept us going until well in the afternoon.Looked in on the nightclub on the 1st floor but found drink prices were rather expensive, There is plenty of other entertainment within a two minute walk We visited the Multiplex cinema at the corner of Orchard Road on two occasions prices were Aust $ 5 each, a third of the price of cinemas in Australia. Borders Books and most other shops stay open to very late at night so it was not unusual to be shopping at close to midnight literally next door to the hotel There was an MRT station about 5 mins walk away to speed tyou away in clean comfort to get to see some of the sites. The Singapore Botanical Gdns are a gentle though sweaty 20 minute walk. to the west . Great shopping nearby and countless restaurants would especially recommend the very clean and cheap food Court shops in the Tang Shopping Centre. Hotel staff were very attentive and cheerful always willing to assist with any enquires, check in was prompt and un-complicated especially after a long flight. Didn't use the wireless internet but the hotel has a small business centre with internet access although guests are restricted to 15mins useage, which was sufficient to check and send e-mails and arrange internet check in for the return flights. All in all a very memorable stay in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: everytimeyougoaway
Reviews.Content: This is a well run extremely clean hotel with very friendly personalised staff. Would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Royal Plaza on Scotts, even with teenagers!”
Reviews.Author: JP724
Reviews.Content: A family holiday for us (family of 5) normally means staying in budget-priced motels/resorts. The kids are getting older and probably won't be holidaying with us much longer, so this year we splashed out with a 10-day stay in Singapore and chose the Royal Plaza on Scotts. Despite booking 7 months in advance, this was the only hotel that I could find that had two rooms available on the same dates for such a long stay. I ended up booking directly through their website, which was easy and straightforward. A few weeks before our stay they emailed me, asking if we had any special requirements. I reminded them that we required adjoining rooms and an extra bed in one of the rooms and they confirmed that this had been noted. Upon arrival, check-in was quick and easy. We were put on the 5th floor, handy for the swimming pool. Rooms were adjoining and a reasonable size with king-size beds. Previous experience (on other holidays) led us to expect the kids to argue over who was going to sleep in the crappy, tiny rollaway bed - but no, here in this hotel the bed has a proper mattress and was a standard size single bed, so all children were able to sleep comfortably. The bed was made up ready for our late arrival but we had to remind them to bring an extra set of towels, this was done within minutes of our request. The suitcases were brought up quickly too. The rooms only had showers, not a problem with our older children, but might be if you had little ones to bath each night. The rooms were very clean, bathrooms were always clean, all-in-all we couldn't fault the housekeeping service. The kids loved the way their pj's were folded up neatly for them and teddies placed on pillows! The mini-bars were topped up daily (complimentary beer and soft drinks). On the first day I left a note asking that no beer be put in the kids fridge, instead they replenished the fridge with extra soft drinks. We always had plenty of soft drinks/water bottles to take out with us on our sightseeing trips, so this was very handy. The staff noticed that we were big tea drinkers and always left extra tea bags and milks. We only needed to ring down to reception with one small problem during our stay; the remote control wasn't working and needed new batteries and this was fixed straightaway. There was no view from the window but we were never in the room long enough to worry about that. To use the lifts and to get back to your room from the swimming pool, you have to remember to carry your keycard with you at all times, but they do give you 2 for each room. The swimming pool was about 15metres long, so ok for lap-swimming, ideal for kids cooling off, plenty of sunloungers and towels available. Clean changing rooms and toilets, and a sauna available. A function room is located on the other side of the pool and this was often in use, but for the staff and business people to get to it, they had to walk along the edge of the pool, which seems to me poor planning and could be dangerous due to the permanently wet floor, especially with the waiters walking back and forth with food and crockery. It was a little off-putting sun-bathing in a bikini with gents in business suits walking back and forth during breaks. The hotel rooms were pricey, but no more than other similar hotels in Singapore, and it's a fact of life for those families with 3 children that you always have to fork out for 2 rooms. So to pay $30+ per person for breakfast each morning, wasn't going to happen! We're not fast-food people, but on this occasion it was very handy that there is a McDonald's and a McCafe located just a few metres up the street. Just a bit further up is the entrance to the MRT, very handy. Outside the hotel, getting a taxi was never a problem, with porters always ready to wave one in for you. Going back into the lobby after a day's sightseeing was always welcoming, it looks so bright and clean with very cool air-conditioning and it always looked lovely at night with the candles lit up. Upon check-out there were no discrepancies with the bill, no extra charges to query which is always a relief. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to family and friends and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: globugPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend have just come back from Singapore. We stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts on the way out to New Zealand and on the way back. Absolutely beautiful hotel. Rooms are very comfortable. Complimentary drinks in fridge. Gorgeous swimming pool on 5th floor. Business centre free to use to check in on line for your flights and any other needs. Location on Scotts Road, in the Orchard Road area, so central for the shops. Taxis are cheap and you can get one outside the hotel really quickly. Well worth having the breakfast, so much to choose from and sets you up for the day. Staff are very helpful friendly and courteous. No hesitation in recommending this hotel. Will definitely stay there again if I go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ryleeh
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon, we decided to splash out for our 2 night stop over in Singapore and we were so glad we chose Royal Plaza on Scotts. First impressions was that the lobby looked gorgeous with the massive candle display in the middle. The professionalism of the staff is to be commended, from the porters to the check-in staff, to the concierge to the housekeepers. We got upgraded to an deluxe executive room - though we had no need for a desk, we think it might have been bigger than the deluxe room we had originally booked. The first night they delivered a Happy honeymoon cake. It might be a local cake as I have not tasted anything quite like it. But it was absolutely delicious! I loved the crunchy poppyseed layer inside - yum! The bathroom was ultra modern and the range of toiletries great. Robes were comfy as were the slippers. Not sure if all hotels have it, but there was a universal powerpoint in the wall, which came in handy as we didn't realise Singapore had a different plug to Thailand. Big plasma screen TV on the wall. The mini bar was a nice touch - took the bottles of water out whilst exploring/shopping, and then a cold Tiger beer each once we got home :) The best thing about the hotel is the location. A short stroll down to Orchard Rd and you are ready to hit the shops! I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others who would like to be in the heart of he shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jinz
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for outstanding service, convenience to everything topped with beautiful rooms then this is the hotel. We treated oursel ves to the club room and this was well worth it. The staff are outstanding. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: prettygis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RP March 25-29 '08 with my husband and 3 yr old. It's a half an hour drive from the airport with traffic. Right now, their driveway is being renovated so the front looks messy. However, the location is great (Orchard MRT is near and DFS is adjacent) with 7eleven across the street as well as a McDonald's 50 meters away. Check in was quick and we were upgraded to a Club Room (yey!) We appreciated the free drinks (soda, milo, water, juice, beer) at the minibar as well as the clean sheets and rainwater shower and flat screen. There was also an iron and ironing board. The pool is nice enough and the lobby is great because it smells really good (i think Jean Paul Gaultier). My only problem would be the price, seeing that our total bill reached 2,300 S$ I was shocked since the hotel website quoted it as about 1500S$ without taxes. Other than that, although the room is a little small, we enjoyed our stay and liked the breakfast buffet in Carousel, their restaurant. If money is no issue, we will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Large, spacious, modern luxury corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: melcart
Reviews.Content: In general can't fault this hotel. Centrally situated to shopping area and Metro (MRT). Large spacious modern room (on request - so don't asume all are!) with free mini bar and Wifi flat screen air con and plenty of power points . Our bathroom was shower only so check for bath option if this is important to you! Large self service buffet resaurant with amazing choice of asian european food. Service - polite efficient all round especially concierge. The pool and gym are small but adaquate. However be aware that the pool is next to the conference centre and delegates were spilling out near us during their seminar breaks making it a little hard to relax at times. But the conference room was not occupied daily and it has to be born in mind that Singapore is a city not a resort break.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: grumblebums
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel close to shopping and good places to eat. The check-in was efficient and friendly, the lobby warm and interesting, the room spacious and comfortable including a great bed! One negative was the bathroom was somewhat unclean when we arrived there and unfortunately continued not to be cleaned properly during our stay. It was annoying but didn't seem bad enough to complain about. The staff were always very friendly and always keen to assist with our sightseeing plans. Excellent facilities including free wi-fi, free mini-bar replenished daily - although we found the temperature of the beer was no where near the Aussie standard (ie not cold enough!!), nice pool area, buffet breakfast was excellent and newspaper delivered daily. We loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but good location”
Reviews.Author: Happytiler
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is the location. It is right near to Orchard Road and the plentiful shopping, also near to the MRT station and right by a bus stop. Having said that, the hotel is nothing special at all. The rooms are small and have no view although there is free Wifi and mini bar (soft drinks and Tiger beer). The breakfast was costly although the selection was quite good. However since there is a MacDonalds right outside, it is worth nipping out for a coffee and Breakfast muffin there if that's all you need! Prices for hotels in Singapore are getting out of hand so this did represent some value for money but I would sooner pay a little bit more for a bit more luxury and a nicer view.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loeane
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at Royal Plaza on Scotts, and there is no doubt I will stay here again. The prices of Singapore hotels had increased substantially over the years, and if only Royal Plaza on Scotts would maintain its price, this would be a good hotel to stay. Great location, moderate breakfast and wonderful service. Rooms are clean and adequate though nothing luxurious. Do consider this hotel for its location, good service and quality rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Large City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HavanaMan
Reviews.Content: Large and quite impersonal busines city centre hotel. What it lacked in personal touch was made up by quite relaxed policy on wifi access and free use of mini-bar content. We were upgraded to a larger 'corner room' which still felt quite cramped. Good location in the heart of Orchard Rd. - but somehow nothing really felt memorable.

Reviews.Title: “great four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: srh10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in perfect Orchard Road location. Lovely spacious rooms, free wi-fi and minibar. Good pool and gym area. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: exspat
Reviews.Content: After searching many websites and contacting the hotel direct, I booked the Royal Plaza for 2 nights on Zuji - rate included standard room (10th floor), Wireless Internet access and Mini Bar. The hotel is extremely well located for all that you would need in Singapore. Mini bar - rate allows one top of the mini bar contents per day. It included 2 cans beer, 2 cokes, 2 juices and 2 waters. Wireless Internet - a great feature to have this for free, as so many hotels charge ridiculous prices for this. Room - very comfy bed, dark furninshings, no view as such (overlooked carpark), small ensuite - with a great shower. Good desk, flat screen tv etc. Hotel seemed busy, but very quiet at night. This hotel is a great option for tourists and business people alike. It has such a good location, and whilst not as flash as the Hyatt across the road, it's rates make it hard to beat. I have stayed at many Singapore hotels and would have to say that the Royal Plaza offers very good value for moey

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrottersUK
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is located right in the centre of the main shopping area, Orchard Road. despite the location it is very very quiet inside with no road noise etc We booked a club deluxe room as that was all that was available. it was well worth the extra few dollars. they offered breakfast, all day drinks and snacks, afternoon tea and evening cocktails, beers and nibbles. I am sure it is possible to spend all day in the private lounge and not spend any money on food or drinks. The room was not overly big but was very confortable. the bathroom was quite large with separate walk-in shower and jet tub. Everything was very clean. The service was great, we arrived after an overnight flight from London. We managed to oversleep and miss breakfast the next mornng, we ordered room service expecting to pay but the staff arranged for there to be no charge as we had missed the complimentary breakfast. We did not use the pool but it looked adequate. We would definately stay there again and would not hesistate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss with rooms”
Reviews.Author: atayah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my own in December and was given the "singles" room at the end of the hallway opposite the service entrance facing a brickwall. bathroom was tiny but beds are to die for comfortable. Organised late check out which was handy to catch a midnight flight. On return, stayed here with my boyfriend and was given a MASSIVE room (next to the lifts which could be heard slightly through the walls) with an amazing bathroom. We arrived very early (7am) and our room wasn't ready until 10am. We were told we weren't allowed to have breakfast as this was for the next day only - Singapore doesn't really get going until after 9.30am so Starbucks and McDonalds are really the only options for food at that time. Was a bit disappointed that they didn't offer us breakfast while we waited, especially since we had just flown in from Rome. Pool terrace is great with comfy sofas and a nice pool. Location is very handy to the shops on Orchard road, and the no smoking policy is great. I have never been to a hotel that smells so nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RyanS73
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent hotel located very close to Orchard Road, only about a hundred metres from Orchard Road junction. Our check in and check out are handled fast, and the room is clean and neat. Mattress are very comfy. Wifi access is included for free and minibar contents is free and replenished once daily. We only need to pay if we need the minibar topped up more than once a day. The hotel felt luxurious, price reflects it as it's quite up there on the scale but still affordable. will definitely consider staying here again if I ever need a good transit hotel for business travellers or someone who is looking for a good rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lounge”
Reviews.Author: Garthy_2
Reviews.Content: This is a great value four-star hotel. We opted for the Club floor which was great value. The rooms were modern and functional with free wireless internet. Air con was good but slightly noisy. Free brekky in the lounge and also free evening cocktails with great food-you can even skip dinner esp if you also attend the afternoon tea! There were desserts and fresh fruits and hot canapes with free drinks-great value. Free beer and soft drinks in mini bar was great for a day of exploring and shopping. The rate was one of the cheapest in the Orchard Rd area - beautiful X'mas lights. None of the rooms have great views but ours with the pool view was among the best I suspect as the building faces up Scotts Rd rather than fronts it. Breakfast downstairs was really busy but not bad variety of local and usual food. Fresh fruits were great. There was a noodle bar as well. Hotel is smoke free completely and pork free as well! Taxis were at the door and Singapore has world's best practice and greatest value. Cost about S$17 to get the four of us to the Zoo! Easy to cross overhead pedestrian bridge to FarEast Shopping Centre and on to Orchard Rd rather than battle the underground passage or breathe the air at the lights- just turn left at the front door. Recommend Straits Kitchen at the Grand Hyatt for upmarket local and pan-Asianfood, all you can eat for less than S$50 done in superb fashion and surroundings. Tang's Dept Store has great value esp. of sales items.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: StrawberryFrangipani
Reviews.Content: The hotel couples a convenient central location with decent rooms - a winning combination for a short stay in Singapore. The only fault I found concerned the service; primarily the receptionist's dull disinterested attitude. ROOMS Rooms are decent-sized and surprisingly quiet given the hotel's central location. The room was equipped with modern furnishings - plasma tv, chic black marble bathroom with a separate bath and shower, and nice beds. There is free broadband and wireless internet access and free daily minibar consisting of 6 cans of drinks in each room. LOCATION The hotel is centrally located around the corner (a 2 minute walk) from Singapore's main road, Orchard Road, where a bevy of shopping centres and food outlets may be found. Taxi to other famous landmarks is cheap, at around $3-4SGD per 10 minutes. There is also a train station around 3 minutes' walk from the hotel, perfect for more distant attractions such as Sentosa Island. SERVICE On the whole, staff were polite and had friendly smiles, however, I encountered a receptionist during check-in who was short-tempered and uninterested in her job. Albeit, the other staff were polite and greeted everyone with friendly smiles.

Reviews.Title: “great location, affordable”
Reviews.Author: khanna
Reviews.Content: Location is right where you want to be in Singapore. A comfortable walk to all the shops on orchard, and close to some great restaurants. For trips some distance away, cabs in Singapore are quite affordable. Room was a little small, but immaculate. The pool was also a little small, but outdoor on a terrace, and quite nice. Was the best deal in terms of cost, in the Orchard street area.

Reviews.Title: “Club room represents great value for drinkers!”
Reviews.Author: FussyGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from inside my room - using the free internet provided and getting ready for the cocktail hour starting shortly. Because I'm already here and don't need to worry about getting a booking I feel I can let you in on a great deal in Singapore.(Can be tough to make a reservation here, as since the recent renovations and their 'Carousel' restaurant winning the best newcomer buffet for 2007 award, this hotel is quickly growing in popularity) I travel with my husband a lot for work, and between us we have visited many other hotels in Singapore before finding this one including: The Meritus Mandarin (incredibly noisy and appalling service) Copthorne Kings (simply awful) Novotel Clarke Quay (OK, but just another hotel nothing special) Marina Mandarin (was OK, but have not gone back) Hilton (needs serious refurbishment and quickly) and many others that I can't even remember now.... So, on with the story. The Royal Plaza on Scotts keeps drawing us back as it represents good value for money (talking about club room deal), is in the centre of town right near Orchard Road for shopping and keeps us both happy. It has recently been refurbished, so all of the rooms feel clean and new with flat screen TV's, king sized beds, a comfy blue velour chair in the corner to throw your clothes over. lol. and the bathrooms feel clean and have a separate bath and shower (a must in my books. I do not take showers in a bath). There is a glass wall between the bedroom and bathroom so the room feels bigger (can pull down a blind don't worry) and everything just works. You get free internet throughout the entire hotel at all hours (wi-fi or cable, with cables provided in the room if you're not up with the latest technology). This level of service is great and means I can relax by the pool with my laptop if I want to. The pool is pretty basic as is the gym, but that's not why we stay here. We come here for the club room food and drinks deal. We always upgrade to the club room for an extra $60 per day for two of us which gets us the following: 6.30am - 10am - Full breakfast either served in the club room upstairs (if you want to avoid the rif-raff) or downstairs in the public breakfast lobby if you want slightly more choices, as the buffet is huge. There is a full cooked section with eggs any way you like, pancakes, waffles, curries, fish, mash potato, noodles, chinese dumplings, congee... you get the picture. A cold section with fruits, cereal, yoghurt and a bakery section with pastries. Coffee and tea is free flowing as are the many juices. 3pm-5pm - Afternoon tea served upstairs in the club room (no rif-raff). More hot food selections like noodles, prawns, fried dumplings as well as cakes, scones, cream, jams, lemon butter, desserts, fruit, water, tea and coffee. BTW, when I say water we're talking bubbly Perrier served in a glass with ice and a slice of lime, not tap. This is the best bit... 5.30pm-8pm - Cocktail time!!! Served in the club room, with all of the other happy guests. Fab hot and cold canapes served on spoons and mini dishes just like at a nice function - all alongside a table of breads, cheeses and desserts. The menu changes every night and for example last night some of the cold spoons were smoked salmon rolls topped with sour cream and chives,thai influenced beef rolls, chicken breast with tomato salsa dressing and the hot dishes were sauteed fish with lemon butter sauce and capers, mini lasagnes and prawn skewers wrapped in turkey bacon with a triad of sauces. AND ALL OF THIS IS SERVED WITH FREE FLOW SPARKLING WINE, WHITE WINE, RED WINE, BEER and BASIC SPIRITS for the 2.5 hour duration. Ths is very exciting to drinkers like us who pay a minimum of AUS$60 for a bottle of wine out at dinner in Singapore. Between the two of us we easily make our club room money back on drinks during cocktail hour and we can't recommend this deal enough for drinkers visiting Singapore. (If you haven't been to Singapore before and you're a foodie from Melbourne, prepare to die at the price of wine and 'high end' food BTW) In fact, we often make reservations for dinner and come 8pm, we cancel because we are completely stuffed from the canapes.... So there you have it. The club room deal just keeps us coming back again and again! Hope this review has helped!

Reviews.Title: “New Years at the Royal Plaza - Average experience”
Reviews.Author: Suz_Cols
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a late evening flight so lobby looked nice with candles lit and the lobby had the nicest freshest smell -most be in part due to its strict no smoking policy Receptionist was not the friendliest (which surprised us as we were looking forward to the hotels claims of great service), her colleague seemed lovely though so we may just have been unlucky Our king size bed turned out to be 2 twin beds disguised and we found ourselves falling between the cracks during the night which was uncomfortable. the location was great, Singapore street decorations for Xmas were lovely and like Hong Kong felt very christmassy Other encounters with staff were fine, but nothing special Overall, the hotel was fine, feel quite neutral about it so I would try another hotel the next time

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and very reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: Bandi07
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Royal Plaza in Singapore, and it has grown better over time. Recently the rooms have been refurbished and now have flat-screen TVs and new furnishings. Internet is free, and minibar is free too (2 beers and a few soft drinks). That's like slicing $30 off the price. The breakfast buffet is excellent, staff are very friendly and helpful, and security is good (you need to use your room key to access the guest floors in the elevator). The location is also great, as it is just 100m from the corner of Orchard and Scotts Roads. Lots of shopping centers all around. The view from the room is not so great if you are on a low floor, as you only see the building next door. Higher floors may be better, I've never paid the higher rate to find out. I much prefer the Royal Plaza over the Orchard or Orchard Parade hotels, which are in the same area and similar in price. The Hilton and the Negara hotels are also in the same area, and are better but considerably more expensive. I've stayed in all of them, and Royal Plaza is my top pick.

Reviews.Title: “Small but fine.”
Reviews.Author: avevers
Reviews.Content: Central location, complimentary minibar, room was OK - clean but small and a very small bathroom. Good breakfast (good range) and all in all happy enough.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience at Royal Plaza on Scotts”
Reviews.Author: KPS92-5
Reviews.Content: Great room, terriffic customer service by the entire staff, perfectly located just ~100 meters off Orchard road will continue keeping our family of 5 with 3 small children keep coming back to this Singapore hotel. The rooms are not huge but very well appointed with flatscreen TVs, large desk, complimentary soft drink mini bar, all marble bathroom, and very comfortable bed and pillows. While the exterior of this hotel in nothing special once inside the lobby, buffet restaurant and rooms are all first rate. Staying just meters off the heart of Orchard road (cross the street from the Hyatt & Marriott) during Christmas time with all the decorations and lights of Orchard road made for short fun ourings after coming back at the end of the day. It's a $5-$12 taxi ride to lots of popular locations like the night Safari / Zoo, Sentosa Island cable car, the Science Center (great for kids & adults alike), Clarke Quay / Boat Quay....Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: dselvan
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation and searching, based on reviews on trip advisor, decided to stay at RP on Scotts for 7 nights. Booked it through asiarooms.com since they were providing the best price although the hotel website price wasnt too far off. The hotel is situated on Scotts Road at the junction with Orchard Road which is fantastic location. You can shop till you drop on Orchard road which is literally a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Also Orchard MRT (underground trains) station is less than 5 minute walk. From the swift check in which was smooth, went up to our room on the 10th floor. The room was a deluxe room and it was spacious enough with wall mounted flat screen TV, queen size bed, table and chair, wardrobe with bathrobesand free minibar which was replinished daily. The mini bar contained 2 beers, 2 small bottles of water and 4 cans of non-alcoholic drinks. Bathroom was ok size with walk-in shower and free toiletries. You need the room keycard to access your floor as well as your room and also to turn on the electricity in your room. You also got complimentary newspaper every morning. Breakfast was included in our price and this was excellent with lots of fruit, cold meats, western style cooked breakfast as well as continental type breakfast as well as asian type breakfast.Since it was all buffet style you can pick and choose what you wanted. One thing to note is that there is no pork served so you have to eat chicken or turkey sausages! If you have your own laptop, wi-fi is free anywhere in the hotel but if not you can use the busines centre computers for 15 minutes a day free after which they charge you. Did not use the pool, so can't comment. Since our flight was late in the evening, we asked for late checkout but they could give us only a few more hours than normal checkout but they did let us use the concierge service to leave the bags during the day and also the shower facilities next to the pool after we had checked out. Overall great hotel and would thoroughly recommend for leisure and business travellers to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: simone211
Reviews.Content: Royal plaza on scotts was luxury, the price was very good, when we went in june it was about $140 AUS a night with breakfast and the best was the free mini bar and internet access. The staff were lovley and were always there to help out and always had a smile on their faces. Only had breakfast there but it was yummy as i am a vegatarian there was more than enough food that i could eat. The pool is very small but only went in it once. Very close to everything , 2 min walk to the main trian station and have great shops just across the road where i did most of my shopping. The bathroom was small but worth it cause the shower was amazing, it had a rainwater shower head and it was great!!!! Overalll it was a great holiday and the hotel made it all that better, for the two day we stayed at santosa island at the rasa shangra-li and this was no were near as clear or friendly as royal plaza it did not even compary even though it is much more expensive. I would stay at royal plaza again and encourage all of my friends to stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nellica
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel a few days ago for 5 days in September 2008 during the period of the Singapore Grand Prix. The price per room was roughly triple the usual price but I accepted this in good faith as it will be a busy time. I gave my credit card details as required to secure the booking. I noted that it was stated on the on-line booking confirmation "cancellations and/or amendments made within 21 days prior to arrival date will be subject to full charge." I felt that this was reasonable again given the busy time for visitors. You can imagine my shock when I received an email from the hotel (yesterday) asking for FULL, NON-REFUNDABLE payment for the whole amount 4,320 SGD by 24th December 2007. THis is for a booking in September 2008. I rang the hotel and expressed my disappointment and told them it was immoral to expect full non-refundable payment some 9 nine months in advance. I think that this is because hotels in Singapore want to deal directly with the big operators who will book the whole hotel in advance. They are not interested in the small fry like us during a big event like the grand prix. Sorry, had to put in a fake date for staying in this hotel as I couldn't submit this without one.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: inna76
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent location. Very nice food. Been there for a business trip and enjoyed every moment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: pinkhoshi
Reviews.Content: Got a really good deal for this hotel on Expedia. Stayed for 7 nights in a 'Premiere' type room. Room was very nice - decor is very plush. Free minibar, whilst not extensive, is a nice plus. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic, it's just off Orchard Road and is very close to the Orchard MRT station. Had breakfast every morning in the restaurant in the lobby, very nice. It's a buffet with a mix of Western and Asian foods. They don't serve any pork products, I assume that's because it is a Muslim-owned hotel. I would definitely stay here again. There's not a single negative point I can think of, and loads to love about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business Travellers”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveller07
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel on previous visits to Singapore. This time I arrived fairly late in the evening (11pm) and after the lady on check in tried to put me into a room with single beds it was agreed that it really wasn't my problem if they had given someone else my room and that they would upgrade me to a Superior room. The check in process was actually quite painless and handled well. The room was great (especially as it was an upgrade), well appointed, very clean and very comfortable. The Hotel is in great shape and combined with it's location it makes for a great place for a business travel. The free mini-bar, free broadband and breakfast deal is good and makes everything that much easier. Finally, if you have a later flight out of Singapore ask the Hotel about extending the late check outs. They have always been happy to do it if they aren't fully booked and they only charge around S$20 per extra hour for check outs past 2 or 3 pm - well worth it if you have a long flight ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Royal Plaza on Scotts for a long weekend break in November. This hotel is outstanding for the price. The location is excellent and the service is great. The rooms are sufficient in size and more than comfortable. Mini Bar is complementary and the hotel has free wi-fi for guests. In terms of cost this hotel is highly competitive for SIngapore. Cannot recommend more highly.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with great price!”
Reviews.Author: a_gypsy_at_heart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RP from nov. 15 to 18,2007. we chose it because of the nice comments from friends.. Upon arrival at 10am, we were immediately led to our room which was cozy and clean. i was expecting a smaller room for the price we paid, but was unexpectedly delighted when the room was quite big with a king sized bed. breakfast was quite wonderful with lots of choices.the service was fast and efficient (i asked for a band aid and less than 5 minutes, someone was bringing me one!) the internet was free, as was the mini bar which was replenished daily. the hotel was a few meters away from the mtr, shopping was just steps away ( the DFS is just right next door!) and the buffet exceeded our expectation! truly a great hotel and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: Dr_JRJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights on business, great location in downtown Singapore just off Orchard Road and near to a MRT station. Was upgraded to a premium room on arrival. Mini bar free and re stocked daily, beds luxuriously comfortable and great shower. Staff are friendly and efficient. Breakfast is a good buffet choice daily, room service choice isn't particularly good. Overall enjoyed the stay and would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: agarwalUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on our journey back from NZ. Very welcoming, good rooms - very clean. Staff very courteous and helpful. Free minibar is a bit of a farce as it only has water, soft drinks and beer. Overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LUXXX
Reviews.Content: Didn't want to be surprised with dissapointment with hotels of similar rates of Sin$250++, I went back to RP for my last 2 trips in October 07. I have to give RP the credit of being the best in it's class after staying in a few others of similarly priced hotels. At this point in time, I am pretty happy to continue to make it my preferred hotel in Singapore until they start increasing their rates. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Good breakfast Selection”
Reviews.Author: kipperfletcher
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel Directly through their website. At the time was cheaper than rates2go and asiarooms. Executive corner wing suite. On arrival was treated like royalty. Got taken to our room to book in and was upgraded to allowing us access to the club lounge. Each room has complimentary drinks bar 2 x soda, 2 x beer and 2 x water. A good little bonus. Good breakfast selection asian and western food, fruit, cereal breads, cakes etc. Standard swimming pool which we didn't use as we were too busy sightseeing. Didn't see anyone else in their when we went to view it. Main benefit of this hotel is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Comfortable beds with soft pillows. Flat screen tv and funky bathroom area. would stay here again if i went to singapore. Have travelled many times to asia and this is up with the best and offer great value for the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, good value!”
Reviews.Author: coxfamily3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Plaza for 8 nights and stayed in the Executive Suite as we travelled with a 3yo and 7month old. Our room was on the 10th floor, these suite go from the 10th to 15th floors. Our room entailed a separate lounge (which is where we put the cot and rollaway bed for the children) which had a large screen TV, a lounge suite and 2 tub chairs, writing desk and coffee table and also a dining table. Our bedroom was very roomy with an iron and ironing board and his/hers wardrobes. It had a king bed with large marble ensuite with bath and separate shower and also a bidet. The turn down service is great in the evenings as they replenish all used towels and fill your ice bucket, empty bins and even tidy your bed etc The views were of surrounding buildings but was a very quiet room with good natural light. We had tea/coffee making facilities and free mini bar which has 2 Tiger beers, 3 cans of Soft Drink, an orange juice and 4 bottles of water daily, which was great. We also got a complimentary choice of buffet meal daily at Carousel and entry to the Royal Club lounge. We chose breakfast and dinners on alternating days, then mid week decided on dinners instead and they happily complied! The range of buffet food was fantastic from sushi, to seafood including prawns and crayfish to Wagyu beef , Duck and Quail- also various roasted meats and a large asian choice. The desserts were fantastic- there really was something for everyone and breakfast just as amazing in choice. We didnt use the Royal Club until a few days before we left as we had the kids, but that was a mistake as we had free breakfast , afternoon tea, all day tea/coffee/soft drinks and evening cocktails which run from 5.30 to 8pm (my husband really enjoyed the cognac!) it was a great place to go together or separately for a bit of quiet!. It is on the 15th floor and the lifts are very fast, so not a problem to get to. We didnt try the wifi but used the complimentary computers. The Pool was a typical hotel pool, but the gym was small but is going to be upgraded this year. Was absolutely a first class, 5 star hotel, but saying that ,we had a mix of business people and families and didnt feel out of place with 2 young children. The staff were friendly and courteous, check in was fast, the door men were knowledgable in everything we asked them, from laundromats to directions! Hotel is very well placed for MRT access and in the heart of Orchard Rd. Also has a supermarket within 100metres. We hired a babysitter for our children for 2hrs in the evening and they are from the hotel- from housekeeping etc so this was organised through the hotel and was $9 per hour (3hr min) for however many children. We will definately stay here again and would recommend the Club Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: rica1012
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2nd week of October for 2 nights. We got the Deluxe Room. The room had been refurbished, bathrooms was roomy and clean. The room had a flat screen TV. This hotel isnt a 5star hotel but the service and cleanliness was excellent. The lobby & hallways had a wondeful scent to it, smelled very fresh. The buffet breakfast was not bad, lots of fruits and cereal. Then your usual omelletes, pancakes, bacon sausage. I would recommend this to everyone at this price range but if you can afford a bit more Grand Hyatt is very ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: FeedTheFishMayo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the first 3 nights of a 5 night stay, as the last 2 nights were paid for at the Pan Pacific. I selected this hotel based on the review sbut when I arrived I was initially disappointed. The lobby looked great in the photos but was a bit dated when inspected in person. Staff were very helpful but when I got to the room I thought it was a bit small. The room had been recently renovated and all the fittings were good. The bathroom was spacious but the room had a very strange feature. There was a huge window from the bathroom into the main room. There is a blind that you can pull down for privacy but the issue is a night, if one person goes to the bathroom and turns on the light then the entire room is filled with light. If you want a room with a view, good luck. I would check when you book your room as the only room with a view are the front rooms that face Scott St. Internet access was free, which was great and the hotel is well located for people planning to shop around Orchard Road as it can be hard to grab a cab in the area on the weekend but you can walk back to your hotel. Also the free mini bar was a nice feature. If you want to base yourself near restaurants then I would pick somewhere else. This place is a good location for shopping and bars/nighclubbing. An interesting point is that this hotel is owned by the Sultan of Brunei, so it tends to have a large percentage of Muslim guests. You will find a copy of the Qur'an instead of a bible. This is not a criticism - just an observation. I moved from this hotel to the Pan Pacific where the rooms were much bigger, with great views, but were far more dated and they charged for internet access, etc. If I was going back I would probably choose Royal Plaza for value over the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “happy to stay again”
Reviews.Author: its_beaver
Reviews.Content: I was travelling alone on trip to St Petersburg and used this place as a stop over for a couple of nights. It is excellent value. This hotel is located very close to the MRT which makes it a breeze to get to virtually anywhere. The staff were very polite and provided good promtp service. I had to get a shirt washed and they did a great job and had it back to me within the 8 hours. my room was comfortable and and had plenty of space to move around. the bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet enough for me to forget that I was on a busy strip. The cocktail bar was a lot of fun, I met some very nice people. The breakfast (you should try the Asian) was a bit expensive, but hey I was able to skip lunch because of the open buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sedgley
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed here and now have a better overall view of the hotel. There is no doubt the hotel is well placed and the fact that it is 100% non-smoking is a big plus. Dinner in the Carousel is expensive and althought he choice is excellent the food was on the cool side. There appeared little or no effort to keep the food warm. The staff are very, very good. But overall, taking into consideration the cost and location, this remains my prefered hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and good value”
Reviews.Author: shining_light
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was well worth the price. It is in such an excellent location - close to shops, food and transport. I cannot fault the service. Staff were always polite and helpful. The doormen were fantastic - always ready to open a door or hail a taxi or greet you as you return from a full day of sight-seeing. I have to say the lobby was impressive and it was nice to wander through the paintings on display. We had a small problem on arrival as we had requested a room with twin beds but were given a room with two beds made up as a king bed. The housekeeping staff were efficient in re-making the beds as we had requested. Our room was on the 7th floor facing a multistorey carpark and the back of another building however since we didn't spend much time in our room, the lack of view wasn't an issue. The free minibar was appreciated at the end of a hot day and having free access to internet service (even for just 15 minutes) was great. We found the room clean and enjoyed the comforts of modern furnishings and bathroom. I would probably have put the hairdryer in a more convenient location - not tucked into a tight spot in the room. It was great to be able to step out of the hotel and be within metres of shops. It's good to learn the underground routes around the Scotts and Orchard Rds area as it keeps you out of the heat and the tropical rain. These tunnels keep you connected to many of the major shopping centres and food courts in the area. If i go back to Singapore I would definitely go back to Royal Plaza and I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great location for shopaholics”
Reviews.Author: Philosann
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Royal Plaza 3 times this year and there's no doubt that overall it's very good value for money, having been refurbished in early 07 means that the rooms are efficient, clean and modern if a little on the small side in the bathroom - watch out those of you who like a bath as the de-luxe only had a shower but the première had both and separately, the shower is of good size and has a choice of small shower head or enormous. Good choice of toileteries and proper bath sized towels. The staff were very friendly and helpful, reception has good staffing levels so check in/out is speedy and efficient. Overall the hotel is well appointed and is in a great location for the professional shopper and tourist but perhaps not the best spot for the "City Slickers" as the financial area is about 10 - 15 mins away by cab depending on traffic. As to the downside, I personally prefer a lounge/bar area close to the entrance foyer not on the 1st floor, not only for all we people watchers but to spot friends on arrival. However I reserve my main beef for the restaurant, not because it is buffet only, but because it is Halal. ( It does have a wine list howebver). So all of us who like a great English or American breakfast or just a Continental get used to Turkey or Beef "Bacon" not streaky/Canadian and no cold ham, prosciuttio etc either- for obvious reasons the owner, The Sultan of Brunei, is not a fan of these products. Regrettably you'll be hard pressed to find any mention of this on their website and there's me thinking that Singapore is a great example of transparency for SE Asia. In fact under "Dining", the hotel maintains that it caters to every taste - some less than others maybe!! Apart from these it's got my vote.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Malingshu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RoyalPlaza for a week on business . The room was a little on the small side - okay for one person but would have got a bit crowded with two. For example, the tea and coffee making facilities are inside the wardrobe (!) and you need to have the door open to boil the kettle, but the door opens to the edge of the bed and there's no way to get past to the bathroom. The 'free minibar' is a bit of a joke - bottled water, a can each of coke and sprite, and 2 tiger beers. I was on the 8th floor and all the windows up to about the 9th floor look straight into a multi-storey carpark less than 10 metres away. The hotel is centrally located but this also means that the street outside it is extremely busy day and night. If you want to stay in Orchard Road keep in mind that there aren't many cheap eateries in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty sheets,clump of hairl in shower!”
Reviews.Author: CKinSF
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Royal Plaza on Scotts on a stopover on my way back from Bali. We checked in at 1:30 am. The front desk was very efficient, and we got into our room (525) quickly. Then it all went downhill...the room at first glance appeared to be clean, with the beds nicely turned down. But the longer we stayed the more gross it got. First, we had no toiletries, just the empty boxes that say toothbrush, etc, etc. There was an enormous clump of someone's hair on the shower floor. Then when my sister peeled the covers off her bed, she discovered a huge yellow stain on her pillowcase with a piece of tissue that had obviously been wet and dried on the pillowcase!! We called housekeeping immediately to change the sheets, bring us the toiletries, and oh yes, another bathrobe because there was only one. Housekeeping came twice to remedy the problems we uncovered. By the time I was ready for bed it was 3 :30 am and I peeled back the covers on my bed, only to discover that my bed had obviously not been changed either as there were short black hairs all over the bed. But at that point I was so tired I didn't have the energy to call housekeeping for a THIRD time. Housekeeping had been in the room but just to make it look as if it were clean! Disgusting. Especially considering how much this hotel charges. Unacceptable. With all of the choices in Singapore, stay elsewhere. I wish I took pictures, the clump of hair would be enough to say it all.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: StuMoz
Reviews.Content: Described as a 5 star business hotel, the Royal Plaza on Scotts (RPS) is owned by the Sultan of Brunei. We stayed for two nights in September 2007 and were delighted with all aspects of our stay. Location: The hotel is on Scotts Road, about 200m down from the crossroads with Orchard Road. As such, the hotel is in a perfect location. We arrived at the hotel by taxi from the airport ($25). The MRT (metro) station at Orchard is 5 mins walk away and the efficiency and cleanliness of this system makes getting anywhere in the City from RPS a breeze. Orchard road is shopping heaven and most of the malls are easily reached on foot from RPS. Welcome: We were met at the door by the porters who immediately whisked our bags away and directed us towards the reception desk. Check in was easy and the staff were friendly and efficient. We were given our keys (cards), told about the hotel facilities and offered an upgrade (at a price of $50/night) to a higher standard of room. The fee would also allow us to have breakfast. We declined, and kept our standard room. The Room: Access to the lifts is controlled by your key card, which stops people being able to access the floors they have no business accessing! This is a good security measure. Our room was on the 6th floor. It was spacious and clean with modern decor. We considered the bed there to be one of the most comfortable we have ever slept in. The air conditioning worked well (essential in Singapore!) and the room had a 32" LCD television mounted on the wall in front of the bed. There was a LAN cable for laptop internet connectivity. The shower room contained a lovely 'rain' shower and was luxuriously appointed. You get shampoo, shower gel and body moisturiser, as well as cotton wool etc. Towels were white, soft and clean. The toilet was clean and there was a modern bowl-style basin. All in all, we were delighted. There is a complimentary mini-bar in every room - our contained juice, soft drinks, water and beer.. and this was replenished daily - a nice touch. Facilities: We didn't use the hotel facilities, but did have a look at the swimming pool. This was fine, but at the time we wanted to use it was full of boisterous American guys splashing around, so we gave it a miss - not the hotel's fault and the pool looked fine. Any problems? Only one, very slight issue... we weren't leaving Singapore until the evening, so checked out in the morning and left our bags. We did a load of shopping and wanted to pack some of the items into our luggage before heading to the airport. The concierge got us the bags, but then asked if we were needing a cab to the airport. We had chosen to get the MRT (quicker during peak times and miles cheaper!) so declined. He would not allow us to sit in reception with our bags and certainly wouldn't let us open them to put our shopping in. I can appreciate that they don't want people opening their stuff up all over the lobby, but all we wanted was to unlock the bag and slip stuff in the top! He did offer to let us go into a room out the back and do it, but we declined and went outside and did it on the pavement instead! Overall: Despite our issue at the end, we loved the hotel and would happily stay there again, and recommend this to anyone. The location is fantastic, the room extremely comfortable and the overall impression was one of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: AA21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts for 4 nights. I booked though expedia.com.au, who gave us an excellent rate. Check in was quick and easy. Room was excellent, room was large with heaps of space. Huge TV with excellent channels, free internet and mini bar was also free and replenished everyday (except ours was not on our last day). Pool was awesome and gym was standard. Hotel also has a funky bar on level 2. Location was awesome right next to Orchard rd, close to heaps of shopping centres and places to eat. I also requested a late checkout of 2pm and they gave it to us for free. Loved this hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely marveous”
Reviews.Author: amysa
Reviews.Content: We booked directly through the hotel website where we found a better rate compared to other asian hotel reservation websites (although there are times you can catch great deals on wotif or asiatravel). We arrived late as we were only on transit in Singapore. We were surprised to be upgraded to what appeared like the presidential suite. It was a huuggeeee suite! The bathroom had a jacuzzi and a separate rain-shower. The sink was as wide as the reception counter in the lobby (no kidding). Walk-in wardrobe, 2 huge lcd tvs (one in living room one in bedroom), a kitchen, a 10-seater dining table, a separate living room, a separate office/work room, a huge foyer, etc etc etc. Needless to say, it was impressive. Too bad we were booked for only a night. Free broadband internet, free drinks from the minibar. Hotel located on scotts road which is perpendicular to orchard road, Next door is dfs, a few buildings down is isetan department store, diagonally across is tangs department store. Centrally located hotel. We have been back to the hotel a few more times after, and it has always been a pleasant stay, even without the upgrade. Recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zippy10k
Reviews.Content: We picked the Royal Plaza for it’s location at the top end of Orchard Road and proximity to the shops and MRT. Check was pretty quick and our bags arrived in the room promptly, although the bell boy looked slightly flummoxed by what to do with two scruffy rucksacks! The concierge was very helpful. Our room was on the 10th floor and overlooked the swimming pool which is actually on top of the shopping mall next door. There was no real street noise, surprising given how busy it is just there. The room wasn’t huge but was big enough. Free mini bar was a nice touch, especially given how much beer costs in Singapore. Everything was very clean. The shower was superb. Breakfast was the best I’ve had in a hotel, there was a large selection which was both local and western and a constant flow of tea and coffee. The swimming pool wasn’t very big, when we used it there was no one else there, but was pleasant if a little overlooked. We had a really lovely 4 nights at the Royal Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Berylina
Reviews.Content: Royal Plaza on Scotts in centrally located to everything you need in Singapore. Orchard Road is about a 2 minute walk, and most shopping centres are within walking distance. When we arrived the receptionist asked us if we wanted to upgrade our room for an extra S$30 per night, which included a bigger suite, free mini bar, and breakfast. We went for the upgrade and weren't disappointed. The suite was a good size, the breakfast was excellent, and the free mini bar was well utilized! The concierge were really helpful. They responded to our every request, no matter how obscure. Nothing was a problem for these guys. We saw an advertisement for a theatre production of The King & I, and asked concierge if they could give us some information about it. No problem at all, they downloaded all the info from the internet, then gave me exact instructions on where the nearest booking agent was located. One day we even asked them where a pet shop was so we could buy a goldfish for our friends fish pond, and they gave us a number of pet shop locations. One word of warning for smokers though - the Royal Plaza is a 100% non-smoking hotel. If you light up inside the hotel they will give you a S$300 cleaning bill. This was not an issue for us as we are non-smokers, however this was not pointed out to us when we made the booking. I would highly recommend the Royal Plaza on Scotts, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved singers”
Reviews.Author: Janice77
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in singapore at the royal plaza, very impressed. fantastic lobby , including art display changed twice while we stayed, huge display of tea lights candles light at sunset each night quite spectacular great photo op. No view from room just building next door but that was ok, rooms good size , the mini bar stocked every day and free! Pool on 5th floor used every day not used by many people we always managed to get sun lounges but we only stayed for a hour each time had sightseeing to do. We didn't eat in the dining room as we felt is was too expensive but it was full every night. We chose to eat at any one of the restaurants in local streets around the plaza. Your door key also operated the lifts and we were given two per couple which was handy as we did go out seperately a couple of times. Able to use internet free for 15 mins in business centre on 2nd floor. Handy to check your credit card balance after shopping . Easy walking distance to MRT station, quick and easy transport to everywhere you wish to go in Singapore. Very close to Orchard Road shops although they were too expensive for us. we stuck to the cheaper shops like Far East just across the road , four floors with huge array of clothing, footwear, souvenir, tailors, nic nac shops.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience and great value”
Reviews.Author: malolava
Reviews.Content: Taking a long time to choose between the myriad of Singapore hotels, we werent at all convinced we had made the best choice. On arrival at Royal Scotts however, we were thrilled with what we found in terms of service, value, and style. Check in was personalised and very friendly, and there was no problem with our checking in 4 hours too early. The room was small but newly renovated and decorated beautifully, had a fantastic bathtub and free internet connection. But best of all were the extras - a free all day mini bar including soft drinks and beer; free breakfast, afternoon tea and happy hour! We nearly didnt need to leave the hotel for food, although that would have been a shame as Singapore has some delicious hawker markets and restaurants. The breakfast buffet was only average, but the afternoon tea and happy hour offered lovely apertifs and finger food. The pool was nicely renovated but small, and our only complaint was that the poolside was booked out for a function on 2 of the nights we were there so we couldnt make as much use of it as we would have liked. I would definately stay here again for special and luxurious experience.

Reviews.Title: “So, So...”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located, but the rooms are not up to standard. The bathrooms are small, though you can see they have been recently refurbished. The rooms are not that grand. The dine-in menu is depressing.....lucky the location makes up for alot of the defaults as long as you dont intend spending too much time at the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotels and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: musaffir
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, the service is excellent. But the rooms were pretty small.The location was very good too. I would say it was good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and Best Service in SIngapore”
Reviews.Author: youngelvis
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th visit to the Royal Plaza, and the first since it's recent renovation. All I can say is that the hotel and it's staff just keep getting better and better! The rooms are newly renovated, comfortable and well thought out. The hotel foyer is amazing, a true sight to see! The hotel is completely non-smoking with free wi-fi access all around the hotel for guests. Probably the main reason I will continue to go back to the hotel time and time again is the staff. They are it's biggest asset! Ibrahim at concierge is a real bank of knowledge, and a genuine, friendly guy. The housekeeping staff are always very friendly and polite, wishing you good day every time you see them. The jewel in the crown is the the Heat Ultralounge! The staff in there are probably the best service staff I have encountered anywhere. A special thanks to Bibi and Vera from Heat who made our stay special by being so friendly to us evey time we came in. These 2 staff are real gems. All up, I would recommend the Royal Plaza to leisure and business travellers alike. I was there on holiday, even though the hotel is marketed more towards corporate travellers. I would give it 10/10!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: DoktorCB
Reviews.Content: I stood 4 nights at the Royal Plaza on Scotts in end July 2007. I'm coming since quite some years to Singapore and I have found my favorite hotel here already (and I didn't change my mind after this stay) - but this time I thought its time to try somthing else. The Royal Plaza location is very good, more or less in the center of Orchard road - just a few steps out of the hotel and you are in the middle of this shopping street. Even though after years I have discovered that nothing is cheap here. At least there are probably few places in the world where you have such a high rate of premium brand stores. Walking on Orchard is simply a good entertainment, even if you buy nothing. So this I consider as a big plus. Food: of course the hotel has a restaurant but on Orchard you find many more. I prefer Hawker food - which are these nice little boothes where you can order many dishes and share with your friends - and the best of it: outside with no aircondition! That Hawker food is typically less expensive and quite original is the other plus. So staying in Scotts you can easily walk either to a newly built Hawker center on Orchard - just follow the road down to the center of Singapore and you find it shortly after the visitor center on the left or you simply follow Scotts road down to Newton Circle - there is one of the most famous Hawker places in SG - but typically very crowded with tourists. For more original good food you better sit in a taxi and ask the taxi driver for more locations. I also like the Old Market very much which is in the business district. An old market hall from the early 1900's. Now lets talk about the hotel: checkin and the service are excellent and much above the standard. Very friendly and competent. The hotel itself looks every time I go there like just been build. I guess constant renovation is the key. The rooms itself are very tiny. The bathroom was my highlight: I don't like having a shower in the bathtub - I want a real shower and this is what you get here. Even the bathroom is very small, it has a nice and big shower with a real glas door to it where you can simply enjoy the morning. The rest of the room by the way is unspectacular. Nicely equipped to a high standard, with plat panel screen attached to the wall. But the most important: a high speed internet access for free. The free minibar you can forget about: 2 little water, 2 beer, 4 soft drinks. I only had water and 2 is in a location like SG simply too less. So I still have to buy it outside and carry it in the hotel. The pool and the gym: I didn't use both, because I had too less time. But I checked the pool area and I have to admid that it is ok, but much bejond my favorite hotel in SG. The pool is small, the pooldeck is even smaller and you have no view over Singapore. For just a bit of swimming ok, but not for spending there a full day. The breakfast: this is really good and can compete with my favorite one. But one big disadvantage: no pork! I like to have bacon in the morning, but here they either serve beef or turkey bacon - both not my tast. Beside this the food is excellent! Lots of egg choises and they make that fresh for you. The best waffles and pancakes I ever had in a hotel (of course at home that's better ;-). Fruits, salats, bread, cerials etc - as much as you like. And not to forget the asian bar with stuff what we consider as dinner. I can eat that for breakfast as well and it was so good! Most obvious I put on some weight :-) Finally I was very pleased with this hotel and by sure I will come back here. But even with this wonderful experience I do not change my favorite hotel in Singapore because of the nicer pool. But for just being there over the week where I have to work most of the time anyhow, this will be my clear choise in the future.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Singapore hotels we have stayed”
Reviews.Author: ARJAY69
Reviews.Content: We have been regular visitors to Singapore over the years and have stayed at a number of different hotels. We stopped over for 3 nights at the Royal Plaza on Scots on our return from 4 weeks cruise holiday out of Athens and 3 weeks in UK. We had prebooked the hotel online prior to departure at a rate which was by far one of the lowest for this quality. To say we were greatly impressed is an understatement. The location can not be more convenient to shopping and Metro stations. Reception,porters and all staff were at all times very friendly and courteous. Our room was spacious,modern,spotless with every modern facility including widescreen plasma satellite connected tv.Free internet access and believe it or not, free daily cans of beer and cool drink from the mini bar. We usually eat out in Singapore but lunch at RP's Carousel is a gastronomic experience which cannot be missed.At under $40S per head,this venue offers fantastic smorgasboard selections including sushi,sashimi,seafoods,salads,asian dishes, roast meats and vegetables,curries,deserts,cheeses ,icecream and more.The place is absolutely packed out daily.You need to book and arrive at opening time! Another thing is you can BYO wine and drink it corkage free. Rating 120/100 We will certainly stay here again whenever we visit Singapore and will make the Carousel our lunch venue.

Reviews.Title: “Location, value, comfort and service! Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TanyaMumOfTwo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 10 day family trip to gorgeous Singapore. (Plese see review for first four days at Raffles The Plaza and a Trip Report is still to come). The last two nights of our trip were spent at Royal Plaza on Scotts (RPS), July 11 and July 12. The excellent customer service began before we even left Australia when, after directly booking their best price for two Premiere rooms (1 X King and 1 X Twin, connecting) on the website, we received both confirmation and welcome emails. Then, within a couple of hours, I happened to stumble upon a significantly cheaper rate on another website (all others I'd seen previously had been more expensive than RPS own website offer) and contacted the hotel asking for their policy on Best Rate Guarantee.
