Whilst the cheaper price did not fully qualify (as it was not instantly confirmed) the hotel came back to me the next business day and said they would match the rate - this actually saved me about AU$300 as we had booked two rooms for two nights so I was very pleased and had a great feeling about the hotel right from the start. I was already aware that RPS was an "inner city" type of hotel which is what we needed for our two days of shopping. No views, but an excellent location near Orchard MRT and across the road from Far East Plaza and the Grand Hyatt with Tangs and Lucky Plaza just around the corner. The hotel is easy to miss from the outside but it is right next to DFS Galleria which has a large shop front. The lobby is very special and one very quickly leaves the bustling feel of the city behind within a few steps. Michelle checked us in and she was very helpful. Initially though the rate she had us booked at was not the cheaper one confirmed days earlier by email so luckily I had a copy of the email with me which she took to confirm the lower rate. Also our connecting room was not going to be vacant until closer to 10pm (it was 5pm at this stage as we had just arrived via ferry from Bintan - another review on this part of trip will follow). She did her best to see if anything else was available but as the hotel was full this was not possible. So we happily checked into one of our rooms and then went off to explore - upon our return just after 9pm our other room was ready and the rate had been sorted out. Michelle was still on duty and handled the situation very well. The hotel has recently been fully refurbished and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. Quite small (enough room to walk around beds, plus built-in good-sized desk and one arm chair) but we were expecting this so were not disappointed. As we had booked Premiere Rooms we had rooms on the 12th floor and each bathroom had a bath. The rain shower was the best shower I have ever had in my life! It was sensational! Much better than the one at Raffles The Plaza! The beds were comfy and pillows great. The flat screen TV was fantastic. The complimentary mini bar - beer, soft drink and water - was the best thing when you're travelling with two teenagers! Loved it! I never did see the pool so can't comment - although I understand it is more of a lap style. The buffet breakfast in The Carousel was very good but not excellent. Service was a bit erratic and toaster did not work well, but the tea (when it eventually arrived) was hot! I suppose we were spoiled by the breakfast at Raffles The Plaza and for many people The Carousel would seem first class. Our second day at RPS was actually my husband's birthday and at 9pm that evening there was a knock on the door and a tray with a spray of singapore orchids and a truly divine cake from the chocolate shop downstairs was delivered as a gift from the Hotel. It was accompanied by a handwritten birthday card. How special was that!! We organised a late check out on one of the rooms from 12 noon - 4pm @ S$20 per hour as our flight did not leave until the evening. This was easily organised when we checked in. Our check out was efficient and friendly without a hitch. All in all a wonderful choice and I will return there on my next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jkiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on each leg of our tri[p to New Zealand. The staff were very helpful and let us check in in the morning so we could sleep. The rooms are very clean and well equipped. The rooms did not have any view so to speak of. The hotel is in an excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: MDTraveller1
Reviews.Content: This hotel fits a great niche--the premier rooms are wonderful with large marble bathrooms, a nice business desk and luxurious bedding, the buffet breakfast is great, the service is outstanding, the location is perfect for Orchard Road people watching and shopping, near the botanical garden, etc, and yet is only a quick $5 taxi ride to downtown. The on-line prices were a good value--$200 a night for a first rate hotel including breakfast and the high Singapore hotel taxes in a nice location. Direct international dialing was a bargain. It is best suited for those who don't want the ambience of the massive five-star atrium hotels like the Pan-Pacific, which are set aside in sterile plazas. My only complaint is that they need an additional concierge with better restaurant and shopping advice. One strong suggestion is to avoid the dark, hemmed in lower floors--I moved from a depressing 3rd floor room to the 12 th floor and was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in central Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Frqnt-trvller
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to Singapore from Europe and have stayed at all the major hotels along Orchard Road and Scotts Road. This was our first time at the Royal Plaza; we were so impressed that this hotel just might become our regular! Location is unbeatable, minutes away from THE main shopping area of Singapore. Rooms were very clean, tidy, and felt fresh and new. A little on the minimal side perhaps, but nonetheless very comfortable with all the usual amenities. The bathrooms only have showers, so if that is a problem, then look elsewhere. There were also no railings to hang wet towels on. Breakfast was above average, but by no means excellent - good choice of fresh fruits, cereals, pastries (the croissants were exceptionally tasty!), and warm food (Western and Asian). All in all, a very good choice for a Singapore hotel - best value for money. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Finally a non-smoking hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: qprjames
Reviews.Content: What can i say apart from spot on! And finally a hotel where i dont have to breath in peoples second hand smoke!! Location is as good as you could want. nearby to all the major branded hotels but the cost here is a lot less! Rooms are great....a little masculine perhaps. no bath just a shower. Great tv. shame really as the tv channels are very limited. gym is adequate but not anything special. pool area is nice, especially at night when they flick on the pool area nights. Breakfast was not particularly great as far as cooked food goes, but the croisants, cerals, fruit etc were fine. All the staff i encoutered were oustanding. very friendly bunch. i will definately be staying here next time. (the only thing i didnt agree on was their policy on giving locals and residents discounted rates, but charging foreginers higher rates, but i am told that is normal in singapore). Highly recommended none the less!

Reviews.Title: “Looks deceive”
Reviews.Author: varaderoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4th June 2007 for a few days. Hotel excellent, service is first class. Situation - in the thick of things, ideal for everything from shopping to subway. Hot and humid but enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant overall”
Reviews.Author: mollygolightly7
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a five day stay at the Royal Plaza on Scotts. The hotel is located on Scott just off Orchard so it's very close to many conveniences like shopping, food, The Coffee Bean and Tealeaf/Starbuck's location war, and the MRT. Check in was quick and the curb staff was very attentive. Our first impression of our room was that it was tiny so we were disappointed at that. It contained a king bed, a desk with a chair, a sitting chair, a bathroom with a shower, and a walk in closet with mini bar. The mini bar consisted of coffee/tea service and beverages (sodas and bottled water) which was replenished daily. The staff was happy to accomodate us with just water since we don't drink sodas (we left a note with the sodas and they were changed out the next day). The room had a mounted wide screen tv opposite the bed and the usual nice hotel things like iron/board, hairdryer, bathrobes/slippers, daily newspaper, laundry service, daily maid/turndown service. The room was comfortable despite it's size and it was very clean. The nice details were the bed (which had a down comforter, mattress pad, and pillows) and the shower (which was roomy with a handheld and a big rainfall showerhead). It was nice to have the walk in to stow away our luggage and the car seat and the front hall was large enough to keep our stroller handy. One of the disadvantages was that there wasn't a table other than the desk. We have a toddler so when we needed to eat in there was no place to really feed her. And the obvious with a small room was that there was no place for her to roam aside from the closet. Also, when you used the faucet in the bathroom, the drain was really loud and there was a mere 1/2 " clearance from the toilet and the bathroom door when it was opened so there's some maneuvering to be done to open/close the door depending on where you are in the room. The hotel has a couple of restaurants but we chose to eat outside of the hotel for a couple of reasons. The prices were high and there were better options for us nearby (we are vegetarian). There is also a pool and gym that we never got around to seeing or using. Overall our stay was pleasant. The staff couldn't be more attentive and the location was excellent. Although our room wasn't the best choice for our family, I imagine it would be great for a single person on business. We got a fair deal online so it made the whole experience fine. Some pointers: *the key card is needed to use the elevators. *the key card is needed to keep everything on in the room: There is a holder by the door that powers the lights and tv. *check out the shower knob before you turn it on. There is a midline for off and turning one way gives you the handheld and turning the opposite gives you the showerhead. You can't really feel when you've hit the midline and a few times, while trying to rinse off my child's feet, we walked out of the bathroom with our clothes soaking wet. *there is a charge for local calls (although not much) *internet is free *the building is non smoking

Reviews.Title: “Loved ROYAL PLAZA ON SCOTTS. Location ++ and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: zedmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Plaza On Scotts in May 2007. We booked a room for 2 adults and 2 kids under 10 years of age through our travel agent. The rooms were fantastic but they definitey were not suitable for 2 adults and 2 kids which was not the fault of the hotel as they advised us that the wholesaler should not have sold the room for 4 occupants. No views from the rooms but it was nice and quiet which was important for us. The hotel upgraded us to a larger corner room at no charge and were very friendly and professional. The check-in was quick and the concierge was fantastic. They were always waiting out the front of the beautiful lobby ready to get you a taxi or to greet you on your return. Rooms were very modern with small but very nice bathrooms. Free daily bar fridge and the breakfast was the best I have ever had anywhere. Abosultely everything available. Excellent location right around the corner from Orchard Road and right near the MRT train station. I really cant rave about the staff more. The hotel has been recently renovated and is spectacular at night with the lobby lit with hundreds of candles. Look at their website for photos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shopaholicsPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, check in fast and efficient even at 3.30 am. We went to Singapore to shop during the Great Singapore sales. Hotel is walking distance to all the major shopping centres in Orchard Rd. Concierge was extremely helpful when we needed them. Free internet was a huge bonus, you need to ask for an adaptor for Aus laptops. Did not eat in the hotel as buffet meals quite expensive. SO many cheap eating choices within walking distance. Would definitely stay here again for the location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: expatchick
Reviews.Content: My family ( 2 kids - 3 & 4 yrs old) and I spent a long weekend in Singapore staying at the Royal Plaza on Scotts and we were very pleased with the whole experience. Check-in was quick, rooms were lovely; it has just been renovated and felt very modern and clean. The rooms are not huge - but hopefully you are not spending your days indoors whilst in Singapore as there is so much to see and do there! The pool is great - perhaps not entirely child-friendly but lovely none-the-less. Best of all was the price - it was about half the price of most hotels in the area and it is in such a good location - moments to all the shops and restaurants on Orchard Road. There is also a complimentary mini-bar - includes some standard drinks - which is a very nice touch!! Only thing I would have liked is to have had a clock in the room - but apart from that - totally perfect hotel for a weekend away if you dont want to spend a fortune!!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated but issues”
Reviews.Author: JulesAnne
Reviews.Content: Hi There have been some great reviews about the renovated Royal Plaza on Scotts. I asked my TA to book me there. She got a rate of AUD 640 for 3 nights with a late check out. BTW RPS charges by the hour for late check outs. I joined IPrefer beforehand as it is their loyalty plan and the website says members receive an upgrade if possible. I was planning on staying again in October. I arrived at 11.00pm and initially they told me that I had to pay for the late check. I showed them the booking details. Then I asked them for the upgrade for IPrefer. That was definitely not forthcoming but they gave me a S$20 voucher for lunch or dinner. You need to ask. However, the restaurant will be closed on Monday as it was their Grand Opening. When I arrived in the room, it was tiny!!. Nothing like the pictures in reviews. By this time it was midnight. I immediately got wireless connection which was great. I then curled up in bed to read my book. Turned the overhead ceiling bed light on and all the lights in room, including the spotlight opposite the bed over the mirror. There are no bedside lamps. There was no way to read without feeling like you were in an interrogation room. Called front desk. They told me to move to other side of the bed and turn that light on. It is impossible to turn that light on unless the master on the other side is on which turns every light in the room on again. If you had a partner sleeping with you, he/she could not turn the light on to go to the bathroom. He would have to wake you to get you to turn the master on. The hotel engineer came up and checked it. He said that was how all the rooms in the hotel were wired. Duty manager phoned and apologised. Agreed this was a OHS issue. Turned lights off - the noise from trucks below and service kept me awake. Complained the next morning and they moved me up a couple of floors to a regular room. Realised that the initial room abutted the service lift and was two/thirds size of reg. room. Therefore the wardrobe was at the back of the bathroom and pushed the bed right down to the window. Still have lighting problem. Hotel provided me with a bed lamp which was perfect, but the wiring for the rooms need to be reconfigured. When I checked in they offered me breakfast at S$20 per day (net net) if bought upfront, otherwise it would be S$37.00. I bought the 3 breakfasts which were OK. However, the restaurant is Halal and the last morning I brought my tube of vegemite (Vegetarian yeast extract) and a waiter told me I couldn't eat it as it was Halal. Next time I will eat outside. I had a lot of appointments on the Monday and went across the street for dinner at the Far East Plaza. After doing a bit of shopping I was buggered. Arrived back at the hotel at 7.00pm to be told I couldn't enter as it was the Grand Opening. (Hotel) Guests arrived from the airport, joggers were waiting, A family had a baby who needed to be fed and changed, I needed to call my daughter before she went to bed in Australia. We all had to wait for half an hour while the festivities went on. Finally, the jogger rebelled and they were forced to let us into the hotel so we could get to our rooms. I think it would have been nice to have in someway included the hotel guests in the opening. On the positive side, the minibar is nice, staff tried to resolve issues and the beds are nice. Just insist you are not give Rm 516 or equivalent. I don't think you should get the worst room in the house because you are checking at a late time. I was always able to get a taxi. I ate in the restaurant on the Tuesday night and the food/buffet was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Pepperoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Royal Plaza on Scotts last May 2007 and got really a good deal on [--](thanks for your advice, guys!) for it. This hotel is considered between 4 to 5 star and the price of SG$210 for one night for a deluxe room was well worth it. It included complementary buffet breakfast for two, complementary minibar (minibar was a bit of a disappointment as it just included some basic drinks) and free broadband or wi-fi. The hotel was recently renovated (wasn't sure if my room was renovated but it certainly looked new). Service was excellent. I had requested for early check-in thru asiabesthotel but the website couldn't confirm. I arrived around 11am and they gave me a room right away without my even asking. Then when I got to my room, the wi-fi/broadband wasn't working so I had to call for help. Their IT guy game up right away and configured my laptop. On the day when we were checking out, we requested for late check-out and they allowed us to stay till 2pm (should have been 12pm). All in all, the hotel has the usual modern facilities (32" plasma tv, rain-head shower -- you tweak it up when you want to use the rainhead and you move it down when you want to use the regular showerhead) but the most important thing going for the hotel is its service. The staff's accommodation of little requests like early/late check-in, changing of some drinks in mini-bar from beer to cola, etc. sure made me feel at home and important. The only disadvantage I can see is that for those who are into heavy shopping, a little walking is required. I usually used the underpass to get from Scotts to Orchard where most of the big stores are (e.g. Takashimaya). One big plus is that I wanted to join the night safari and since I was alone, it would have been too expensive for me to take a cab to go there. Saw on the web [--] that there was a bus that picks up passengers right beside the hotel (at DFS Galleria) for only SG$4.00 per way so that was a big help. Would enjoy staying here again especially if the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Short but sweet”
Reviews.Author: cosmicsultana
Reviews.Content: While I was in Singapore for only 1 night on a quick business trip, I was pleasently delighted by the hotel the company chose! I checked in quite late in the evening, and checked out very early in the morning, but the night shift staff were excellent and had smiles all round. I was pleasently surprised by some hamburger shaped macaroons in the room waiting for me, and the complimentary mini bar. However, there were only 2 beers, 2 bottles of water and some orange juice in there! Trendy room with velvet couch, big LCD TV, rain water shower (great fun for someone who lives on water restrictions), comfortable beds, and spotlessly clean - very happy with the room. I was in an executive room so had complimentary breakfast in the lounge upstairs which was very difficult to find - no signs on the top floor to point to the room. Great breakfast - better than the average hotel breakfast buffet. Non smoking was a plus too! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: marcstrauch
Reviews.Content: The Royal Plaza on Scotts (Road) stands in a series of hotel close to the Orchard Road. The five star hotel offers weekend specials including breakfast. Coming to a five star hotel, our expectations where high and could only partly fulfilled. Where the room where only a good four star standard, the breakfast and serve where fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: loopymum
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights. Arrived early so upgraded to premiere room. The rooms were great. The view wasn't fantastic but were told all the rooms looked out to other buildings. Breakfast was fantastic. We have never seen such choices in all the hotels we have stayed in. On inquiring we were told lunch was complimentary. I was a little disappointed that no-one had mentioned it to us, until we had inquired. On checking out we were charged for our lunch and were told lunch is not free on the first day as we had arrived early. I explained that I had phoned and spoke to someone who assured me that it would be. We hadn't eaten on the second day as we were out so they let us off. So please enquire about any meals to see what is complimentary and what is charged. The staff were all very pleasant. The business centre staff were fantastic and allowed my daughter to use the computer and did not charge even though she had gone over her time. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smokers haven!”
Reviews.Author: DtotheC7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts only one night but was glad I did. First of all, the location is excellent, 2 minutes from Orchard Road and the MRT station. When I walked in, the lobby was beautiful with murals on the ceiling and comfortable sofas to sit on for a moment. Check in and out was quick (less than 5 minutes.) We were given a room on the 10th floor. The elevators in this hotel are so smooth and quick. The room itself had almost no view which I think is the same for most rooms in this hotel but since it was recently renovated, the room had a brand new feeling. The mini bar is complimentary and everything is very comfortable and stylishly decorated. No bathtub in the bathroom but the rainshower was pretty refreshing. I would highly recommend this hotel for people looking to escape secondhand smoke or who want a hotel close to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NinArizona
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a no-brainer if your a non-smoker. They take their non smoking rule seriously. The hotel is immaculately clean – both the public areas and the rooms. My room was spacious by Asian standards (adequate by US standards) but very well decorated and supplied. The bathroom amenities were excellent and included a razor, toothbrush as well as all the “usual” shampoos and lotions. The room included both robe and slippers as well as an iron and board. Bedding was quite nice, and the room included both down and foam pillows already in the room. The only negative about this hotel was the restaurant. While the food was very good, all meals are buffet only. If you’re a light eater, the value is not very good (S$23 for breakfast S$65 for dinner). I would have appreciated a menu option a well but they don’t offer it. All in all, this is an excellent hotel – a great value with a staff that seems to enjoy their jobs and take their responsibility to serve their guest seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Bad Food!”
Reviews.Author: crispypata
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Easter Week. My bestfriend and had planned the trip months before and heavily relied on tripadvisor. We finally selected this hotel since it's newly renovated plus its located at Scotts Road which is adjacent or across Orchard Road. I believe it was a great stay. When I was dropped by the Taxi at the lobby, I thought I was staying at a Mall (well like most of the hotels if you stay in this area have shopping malls on their lobbies). It never felt like a home hotel. Check-in was a breeze.We were given a room on the 5th Floor and we had a wall as our view. It's okay since we had this hotel at a very cheap price (booked at Asiabesthotel.com) and we got it at only S$210/night which I believe is reasonable enough. The rooms were very clean. Very new and smells really fresh. The air-conditioning was really really really cold which was really great for me! It has great location and is walking distance to many food establishments and the shopping. It was also near the ORCHARD MRT Station, like around 5 minute walk. What I don;t like is the breakfast. Though you have many things to eat in the hotel.. I really miss the pork. The hotel I heard is owned by the Sultan of Brunei making it a haven for our Muslim brothers.. hence the food. Over-all I like it. But I will prefer another hotel just to have that home-like feel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MickiAustralia
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. We were upgraded to a premier room - very nice - big comfy bed - husband loved the plasma TV. I liked the complimentary mini bar :) The bathroom was fabulous but kept the blind down - very disconcerting using the loo in front of anyone I think - not sure why they have a huge window between the bedroom and the bathroom really - kinky :) Included in our rate was either breakfast or lunch at Carousel - we did both. Breakky the usaul 5 star selection but lunch was unbelievable. We have eaten in some wonderful restaurants over the years but the quality and selection of the buffet was truly exceptional. I would highly recommend the lunch even if it's not included. I think it cost S$ 35 ++ worth every cent. Yes we will be back. Great position just off Orchard Road. Nice little pool - stunning foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: umbongo73
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. I stayed here for a few days during a company conference also held in the hotel. I can not find fault with anything. I had a club level room and found the standard, service , facilities, value for money and location all to be excellent. I believe the rate was S$300/night including breakfast at club level. The buffet restaurant and small bar located in the hotel were of an excellent standard and I loved the sushi in particular. Reading previous reviews, I had a room next to the elevator shaft and never heard a thing, day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sue020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 13 nights at the end of March/beginning of April. I cannot recommend it too highly. It is a good hotel made a great one by the staff, who are all, without exception, the friendliest, most pleasant and helpful people I have encountered in any hotel worldwide. They all deserve an immediate pay rise! The hotel is nearing the end of a complete renovation, although we saw no sign at all of this going on during our stay. Our room was of ample size and exceptionally clean and comfortable. We had a club room on the 15th floor, which meant the bathroom contained a bath tub as well as large separate (rain) shower. It was well stocked with toiletries which were replenished daily. One oddity is the large plate glass window between the bathroom and the sleeping area - but it has a blind which can be drawn for privacy. There was a good sized desk in the room, a huge bed, a flat screen TV mounted on the wall and a mini bar which is stocked with complimentary soft drinks, water and beer, replenished daily. There were tea and coffee making facilities in the room. There was a hairdryer, ironing board and iron and a safe, but no clock. Although the room was occupied by two people, there was only one bath robe provided (but two pairs of slippers). I have no idea why one bathrobe in a double occupied room seems to be the norm in so many hotels. A club room entitles you to use the club lounge on the 15th floor, where complimentary breakfast (a very wide choice of hot and cold, local and western dishes) and afternoon tea (again hot and cold, local and western dishes) is served. Between 6.00pm and 8.00pm complimentary alcoholic drinks and hot and cold food is available. This is advertised as cocktails and canapes, but in fact you can have any alcoholic drink you want, and the food is more substantial than you might expect. Unless you have a very hearty appetite you could easily survive on the complimentary food provided. There are two PCs in the lounge for guests to use. A word of warning to smokers - this really is a 100% non smoking hotel. There was an ashtray situated outside the hotel for guests to use when we arrived, but it had been removed by the end of our stay. It is not illegal to smoke in the street in Singapore, but it is clearly disliked by many Singaporeans, who make their distaste very clear. The hotel has a bus stop right outside and the MRT underground rail system is just a few minutes walk away. If I am lucky enough to visit Singapore again I will certainly stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Brian66
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a perfect hotel (except maybe the Peninsula in Bangkok), but this one does it's best. We stayed for 11 days which is a fair test. Check in was around midnight and the service was excellent. The entire hotel is non-smoking, which for us was a bonus. The room was a little small but most adequate, with a flat panel TV on the wall, a good work station, bar fridge, coffee and tea kettle and a very comfortable king sized bed. Try to get the odd numbered rooms as they have much better exposure to pool and view. (such as it is in Singapore.) We noticed a small amount of water on the marble floor when we first entered the bathroom. Next morning we called and they sent someone up to repair the leak. This hotel had just finished a major remodel, so you can expect the odd problem. In the end they moved us to the room next door, which had the same bathroom without the leak. I rank a lot of hotels by the shower and the rain shower head in these bathrooms was one of the best I've ever used. The rate included an excellent breakfast buffet, which catered to all the different ethnic meal choices very well. In addition they restocked the bar in our room every day and supplied high speed internet access (that worked) both at no additional charge. One little tip...they are demolishing a building located between the Hyatt and Marriot, which are across the street from the Royal Plaza. Although the noise was considerable 12 hours a day, it was not apparent in our hotel, but must have been terrible in the those two hotels.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC PLACE! 5* +++++ service!!!! 11 out of 10!!”
Reviews.Author: ktmack89
Reviews.Content: Royal Plaza on Scotts!!! Well i havent been to singapore in years and before my daughter started uni, and started back at work- we decided to take a trip to singapore. We were searching through the places- and we saw that this hotel had just undergone major major renovations. THis place is great value!!! Nice rooms- make sure you get the view towards the pool- in singapore the view is always mainly buildings but its better this side. THe staff were brilliant! I would say that they are defintely 5 star +++. They are always lovely- helpful! very helpful!!! The food from the restraurant there- carousel is great- the food and especially the breakfast is fantastic- like you are full for the entire day. THere is just so much to say about this place- its great.... its fantastic. The location was great too- its right near orchard road- and there is the bus stop practically outside, and royal plaza books you taxis when required, there is also the MRT right near by. So if you considering staying in singapore- in a lovely, smoke free hotel- go there- the broadband internet access is great. It is one of Singapores best business hotels- but i truly recommend this for all- it was great. Value for money!!!! VERY HAPPY! 11 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Don648
Reviews.Content: Great staff, excellent room and service. Well placed for all shops and underground. I'm going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Swell Singapore Property”
Reviews.Author: Chris J
Reviews.Content: Coming in around midnight from Bali, i was impressed with the swift check-in. Room was a bit dated but quite nice, plus an included mini bar was, honestly, one of the reasons for booking. Breakfast was a good spread of hot dishes, salads and fruits. The real draw is the location, location, location (at a great price to boot!) with more expensive cousins as neighbors (grand hyatt in front)! Wouldnt mind parking my bags here again with the right rates!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, but very average overall.”
Reviews.Author: aputty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on a long week-end away. The hotel is in the centre of Singapore’s shopping district and within minutes’ walking distance of several other big name hotels like Marriott, Grand Hyatt and Hilton, but a fraction of the price. This, together with its decent reviews, was one of the main reasons why I booked the hotel. The room was on the old and small side. The carpet was quite stained and tired, and could do with a good shampoo. The TV was small and old, and could do with being replaced. The shower curtain also could have done with being replaced. I wasn’t really expecting that much more for the price, which was GBP 72 per night. I booked a non smoking room with a king bed through Expedia weeks in advance, and for some reason they could only provide us with a non smoking room with 2 twin beds. This was quite annoying. The pool area was a bit small, but quite good though. It looked a lot newer than the actual rooms, and had some very nice touches to it like the finishing around the pool, and the matching pool furniture. The gym equipment looked very high tech and modern as well. I was not a big fan of sitting by the pool though, because there were far too many screaming annoying little children. Location is very good, just minutes walk away from all the major shopping malls on Orchard Rd. There are some bars/clubs that are very close by, like Bar None at Marriott and Brix at the Grand Hyatt, but nightlife in Singapore is scattered around everywhere. Apart from Clarke Quay, it isn’t really concentrated anywhere. To be honest there is nothing to do in Singapore besides go shopping. I would highly recommend Crossroads Cafe at the Marriott. It is a 5 min walk, and I liked it so much that I went everyday. The food was so delicious, and its fun to watch passers by walk up and down Orchard Rd. The lamb chops with mashed potato were the best I’ve tasted in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel with Top service”
Reviews.Author: paulpowell
Reviews.Content: Royal Plaza on Scotts is due for some refurbishment in September 2006 which will update its apperance. We stayed in August 2006 for 4 nights prior to a cruise and one night after. We found it to be first class and the only two faults we could find was that there was sometimes a queue at breakfast for the buffet (sometimes LONG and up to 20 mins) and the prices in the hotel bar are quite high ($S15 for a can of Killkenny beer). The seafoof buffett on Friday nights is excellent but at $S48 (plus taxes and service charges) its a far more expensibve opton than what is available outside the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service all round”
Reviews.Author: hopsing
Reviews.Content: Fourth stay at this hotel and it never disapoints. Great personal service from all staff from front door to management.. Everyone goes out of their way to may sure that you are comfortable and enjoying your stay. In terms of service, one of the best hotels I have stayed at. Excellent breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Free mini-bar, internet and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid, I wasn't expecting much from this hotel. But I was pleasantly surprised at what I received. The location is fantastic - all the shopping delights of Orchard Rd is right outside your door - the lobby was pretty special, and the staff were helpful. I found the porters particularly accommodating. The rooms have been well maintained and are clean and modern, and the free in-room broadband internet access and free mini-bar are major advantages. Sure, the mini-bar only has a selection of drinks, but it's a lot better than you would receive elsewhere. When I stayed, the hotel also had World Cup coverage, which other, more expensive hotels did not subscribe to. There were a few leftover items in one of the hotel drawers, the hairdryer was standard motel fare, and the shower was difficult to operate, but it was otherwise a fantastic hotel that I would return to and recommend!

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Plaza on Scotts
HotelInfo.Address: 25 Scotts Rd, Singapore 228220, Singapore
